column8:
As a fan of The Blair Witch Project (1999), one of last original and truly groundbreaking horror movies in history of cinema, I was more than happy with announcement of new Blair Witch video game, mostly because I have fond memories for playing unforgettable Blair Witch Trilogy (Rustin Parr, The Legend of Coffin Rock, The Elly Kedward Tale) survival horror adventures on PC in early 2000s (by Terminal Reality, today sadly closed developer of Nocturne and BloodRayne 1&2).

While I can agree with many fans about some issues with the story and it's confusing denouement ([spoiler]there is still debate over alleged time-traveling element[/spoiler]), always reliable Bloober Team nailed the creepy atmosphere of the first movie (smartly positioning the plot in the 1990s). There was no need for more complex mechanics because it's horror video game with focus on story, and pet lovers will appreciate the use of dog companion, wonderful German shepherd Bullet who is main attraction.
After positive experience, I would love some kind of sequel, again from Bloober Team. There is plenty of material in Blair Witch fictional mythos (inspired by real life urban and village legends in America and world)...

column8:
Has issues but very scary and immersive. A lot to love, some to hate. 
The atmosphere is amazing, and whatever "behind the curtains" tricks they pulled to make the woods WORK the way they did was impressive, you'll get trapped in repeating loops in ways that boggle the mind. I felt lost immediately, the sense of paranoia is palpable and the "combat" system is one of the most interesting I've played in any horror game, scared the fuck out of me, felt like a schizophrenia simulator. I enjoyed the story, I could see some fans of the film disliking it, but I personally enjoyed it. Great visuals.
However the game has its rough edges. There's moments where it wants you to hit "interact" or "command dog" and there's absolutely no intuitive sense to some of these moments. I nearly deleted the game over what I thought was a game breaking glitch, turns out it just wanted me to INTERACT with an object that only the dog could reach, not COMMAND DOG to get the dog to go get it. Very stupid, very immersion ruining moment in an otherwise incredibly immersive experience.

column8:
This game is probably better than all of the movie sequels combined.
The dog is the real star of the show (Don't worry. The dog lives and it is only hinted that he may be injured).
Putting together the mystery and using video footage to change the present is a fun game mechanic. I felt some actual terror playing this.
My only real criticism is that, regardless of which ending you get, the game doesn't quite stick the landing (but the dog is awesome).
Be sure to feed him and pet him regularly. He will judge you by the end.

column8:
Really enjoyed it. Starts off very strong, keeps itself realistic and mysterious and then it does a 360 on you becoming very psychological. The story is good, although predicting.
Towards the end, I feel like it was dragged a bit. It was a bit of a walking simulator at some point, and the final chapter was a bit longer then needed (in that house).
Weird tho, this game is out since 2019 and the interactions with Bullet (the dog), before starting an animation, is usually a bit buggy. Weird that is was not fixed.

column8: Sehr empfehlenswertes Spiel, war bisher eines meiner Favoriten wenn es um Atmosph√§re geht. War stellenweise etwas "Lost" aber wenn man gut aufpasst, dann sollte man ohne Probleme durchkommen.  Inhaltlich √ºber die Story m√∂chte ich nicht viel sagen, aber die Entwicklung hat mir gefallen und war denke ich auch plausibel, f√ºr mich relativ schnell durchschaubar. Aber ich mag das Psycho-Horror Genre, lieber atmosph√§risch als st√§ndiges "Verfolgt werden", aber das ist meine pers√∂nliche Meinung.

It is impossible to get the good ending on your first play through.  You will know how to keep your dog alive, but the other conditions for the good ending?  You won't be able to guess it; you will have to look it up.  The game will drive you mad with its challenges, especially the repetitive suffering loops at the end.  It is not a bad design, as it probably was intentional, for leading the player to build up anger and somehow sympathize with Ellis.  But it is not for everyone.  After hours of dizziness just to get the bad ending, and finding out the unfair conditions to get the good one, it's hard not to hate this game.

column8: There are. Good. Traits. Of this game. When it's an atmospheric adventure game with puzzle solving, it's pretty enjoyable and does a good job selling the original movie's feeling of trawling through a spooky forest full of dead leaves while occasionally odd stuff happens. But uh, after a point it sort of takes a massive dive into extremely hacky horror writing and replaces anything fun about the gameplay with crappy stealth mechanics, and it really takes away any good will for the game up to that point. Fun enough for like, a few bucks, but it might be the biggest instance of old era Bloober nearly stumbling onto something good only to let their worst impulses take over.

column8:
‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

As a Blair Witch super fan, I feel very blessed that we got such a good game that adds another exciting chapter to the Blair Witch legend. The scenery in this game is amazing, the story is fantastic and the level design is brilliant. Really makes you feel as though you are lost in the Black Hills Forest. I'm also a fan of horror games that have some form of utilities to make use of without making you feel overwhelmed and this game hits the sweet spot with Bullet, your walkie talkie, cell phone, flashlight and the camera. It adds a level a immersion and makes it more than just a walking simulator without feeling like you have too much to manage. Highly recommend.

Como eu fui uma crian√ßa esquisita, eu j√° conheci a bruxa de blair(assim como slenderman, jeff the killer, etc). Quando eu vi que esse jogo existia fiquei encaralhado pra testar.

   Pra tentar ficar mais imersivo eu vi os dois filmes da Bruxa de Blair (1999 e 2016, recomendo ver tbm). O jogo tem diferen√ßas em rela√ß√£o aos filmes, tanto na forma de contar a maldi√ß√£o quanto na mensagem, mas mant√©m a ess√™ncia da ideia original.

   O jogo tem muitos aspectos pra comentar, mas em resumo. A ambienta√ß√£o √© muito gostosinha, a mecanica com o dog √© incrivelmente boa(e esquisita tbm), o objetivo dele √© criar uma tensao psicologica, pra mim isso fica bem paia dps de umas 2 horas que vc entende, nao existe jumpscare e nao tem "nada" que te pegue de surpresa pra te matar, sinceramente acho q vale mais jogar pela curiosidade ou se voce gosta do filme(tem muita cita√ß√£o da maldi√ß√£o e da floresta) porque se for pelo terror, nem vale a pena. Jogabalidade √© ok(7/10), graficos sao excelentes(9/10), o enredo sla dar nota pra isso(eu peguei um final ruim, mas pra ele dou 6/10).

Bruxa de Blair √© uma lenda interessante e bem antiga(de 1999), eu gostei do jeito diferente de se contar sobre. √â uma experiencia bem interessante, dou ao todo uma nota 7 pro jogo(ps: nao sei fazer review)

column8:
Shorter than I though. 

It got VERY good at the end. Until then it's kinda like a "walk in the woods". 

Problem is that you really can't expect to get the "good ending" on the first run, almost impossible and that's annoying. Hidden mechanics do not help and is frustrating. Doesn't invite really to play it a second time to try it since the beginning and middle part are kinda boring (specially if you already played it). So most of us end up watching the other endings online.

I wish the team to learn from this game and improve for the next one!

Blair Witch had a lot of potential, but the execution falls short. While the atmosphere and forest setting are great, the gameplay quickly becomes repetitive and frustrating. The controls feel clunky, the puzzles are tedious, and the pacing drags the experience down.

The story is confusing rather than engaging, and the scares rely too much on cheap tricks instead of true psychological horror. It‚Äôs a game that starts strong but loses its charm fast. Unfortunately, it doesn‚Äôt live up to the iconic movie it‚Äôs based on.

column8:
Melodramatic dog-walking simulator.

As others have said, absolutely no connection to Blair Witch besides being set in a forest decorated with stick-and-twine ornaments. Even the ornaments, while the movie made them seem creepy and foreboding, this game turns them into collectables.

The only suggestion of horror is dead bodies. To create horror the movie seeded the situation with an appeal of authenticity, tainting the water with various stories arousing primal fear, superstition, inherited night-terrors of culture and genes, allowing the mind to serve the purpose of consciousness - filling in the gaps. The movie never did present a horror. It provided an emptiness for the viewer to project horror onto. In contrast, this game not only contradicted the single focus of horror suggested by the movie, an absentia taking on the form of the viewers imagination, instead providing various badies, but those badies ranged from laughable to tired cliche, and none present any tangible danger to the player. Ever.

The world itself, the models, the map, the set pieces, the atmosphere, the sound, it was all done really well and when first starting the game gave promise. Playing through the game it quickly became clear that there was no particular provocation of fear, which is disappointing but still the game provided some entertainment. And then came the nonsense badies. And the boring, irrelevant and beaten-dead-horse of a story. But they kind of came and went and still it was not that bad. It was now a treasure hunt in an aesthetically appealing setting with irritating but minor distractions.

And then the calamity of creatives is imposed upon the player, the relentless self-glorious presentation of longingly coveted emotional turmoil masquerading as artistic expression. A will to convey a meaning as purposeless and unauthentic as is the obstacle of a rolling pile of leaves in a supposedly horror setting. Piled on as thick as the forest and bog of the swamp that the character has just passed through.

And it drags on and on and on. For no reason. And no reward. Nothing is added. Nothing is gained. No reward. No challenge. Nothing worth saying. If it wasn't for this ending, which I think may have dragged on for several hours in fact, then I'd have been overall satisfied with this game. Instead, I think I actually hate Bloober Team.

It's a walking simulator, but a surprisingly good walking simulator!
The game is mostly exploration with investigative elements, but the real treat here is the narrative and immersion. 
The woods really draw you in and feel spooky, I highly recommend headphones so you can get the full affect of creepy noises and occasional whispers in your ear. I really enjoyed the story, the slow unraveling of the mystery and they even low key touch on mental health awareness a bit.
Like every other game made by Bloober team, this project was clearly made by fans of the source material and fans of the genre, made evident of every detail and easter egg waiting to be discovered.

Anfangs hab ich mich schwer getan den Storyverlauf voran zu bringen! Habe es vor Monaten schonmal angespielt aber nicht gecheckt wie es funktioniert! Auf Deutsch ich war zu Doof daf√ºr und war extrem Lost! Heute hab ich mich nochmal an das Spiel rangewagt mit dem Gedanken auch dran zu bleiben wenn es kompliziert wird!
Und was soll ich sagen! Das Spiel ist extrem gut wenn man die Grundidee was den Storyverlauf angeht verstanden hat (Kamera). Ich hab es am St√ºck durchgespielt! Die Grafik finde ich auch sehr gut und das Audio sehr passend! Ich kann nur jedem raten dran zu bleiben. Es lohnt sich wirklich! Ich hatte absolut 0 Bugs oder dergleichen! Das Spiel l√§uft wie es laufen soll und die Story ist super wenn man die Game UI verstanden hat! Wenn ich unbedingt nen Kritikpunkt finden muss dann dass das letzte Kapitel sich recht lang zieht! Aber trotzdem sehr unterhaltsam und auch mit schocking Momenten! Kann ich empfehlen!

I really enjoyed the intro to this game. But something seems very disconnected from the game and the movies (Until the very end). I played this game in two sessions (about 5-6 hours total). And did not enjoy the sound quality or world building. The mechanic of reversing time becomes very old and I found myself wanting to rush through the game. Not the type of game I would expect an orchestra to play in the background. And the story itself wasn't bad but leading up to the ending was disappointing in many ways. 

There are allot of blink and you'll miss it aspects in this game. And other horror tactics however I don't recall any jump scares. The phone and inventory system was interesting. And there is replay value since I didn't search every area and multiple endings. 

I find it hard to rate this game as I was just pushing through in the end. For a 2019 game id have to say a solid 5/10.

column8:
Blair Witch me sorprendi√≥ gratamente. La ambientaci√≥n es incre√≠ble: los bosques se sienten vivos, opresivos y llenos de misterio. El dise√±o de sonido es magistral, con cada crujido, susurro y ruido lejano poni√©ndote los nervios de punta. La historia mantiene el inter√©s de principio a fin, con giros y momentos inquietantes que me hicieron querer seguir avanzando.
El v√≠nculo con Bullet, el perro, le da un toque emocional √∫nico. No es solo un juego de terror, es una experiencia narrativa que te atrapa y no te suelta.
Si te gustan los juegos con atm√≥sfera, tensi√≥n y un toque psicol√≥gico, este es imprescindible.

[h1]Un bosque llamado Trauma; una caba√±a llamada Culpabilidad[/h1]
Cual grata sorpresa me he llevado con este notable juegazo de horror psicol√≥gico. Si mal no recuerdo, en el momento de su salida se llev√≥ cr√≠ticas no muy positivas por motivos que no consigo recordar del todo, pero tal y como lo he jugado a d√≠a de hoy, me parece una obra altamente infravalorada de terror la cual a mis ojos se merece mas reconocimiento. Los de Bloober Team han hecho un espl√©ndido trabajo con algo relacionado con un cl√°sico de las pel√≠culas found footage de terror como lo es The Blair Witch Project; los no tan fans lo van a gozar y los fans lo van a flipar. De hecho, tras hab√©rmelo pasado dos veces para hacer el final bueno, entiendo completamente porque le dieron a esta empresa un proyecto de tal magnitud como lo fue el remake de Silent Hill 2; Blair Witch me ha dado unas vibes tremendas a este otro cl√°sico del terror pero esta vez de videojuegos. 

Ya me sorprendieron primero con el Layers of Fear, y m√°s a√∫n luego con el Observer, por lo que me fascina que me hayan encandilado tanto con otra de sus obras. Blair Witch es puro horror atmosf√©rico narrativo con una ambientaci√≥n tan tenebrosa y bien lograda que me ha llegado a dar escalofr√≠os en muchas ocasiones. Puedes ver de sobra que se han esmerado mucho en querer plasmar esa sensaci√≥n tan angustiosa que provoca la pel√≠cula en si, con una jugabilidad que le ha venido como anillo al dedo como evoluci√≥n de su g√©nero. El perro, Bullet, ha sido todo un puntazo innovador y un riesgo que les ha salido fabulosamente refrescante para con la historia, y el uso de la c√°mara, el tel√©fono, las cintas y dem√°s tambi√©n se sintieron muy bien implementadas para su corta duraci√≥n. La historia como tal, teniendo en cuenta lo que ha significado de forma medio aleg√≥rica con el uso del bosque, me ha parecido profundamente madura y m√°s compleja de lo que me esperaba. Es m√°s, me sorprende que se hayan atrevido a tocar un tema as√≠ de tab√∫ en un juego precisamente de terror. Es cierto que puede parecer algo confusa de buenas a primeras, pero las miguitas de pan que te van dando para que saques tus propias conclusiones dependiendo lo que investigues ha sido algo de mi agrado.

En fin, un increible pero tristemente muy desapercibido juego de horror. Much√≠simo mejor que otros m√°s conocidos como el Still Wakes the Deep en todos los sentidos, y para mi gusto, uno de los que m√°s me han enamorado √∫ltimamente dentro del g√©nero. Se nota que esto ha sido un passion project por parte de Bloober, y yo eso lo valoro.

column8:
bloober would go on to do an insanely good silent hill 2 remaster, and the practice they had with it was with this game.

To start, you have to do a fix to run this game if you have a good processor by tinkering with your computer files. Not a good start.

Next, the game just doesn't really feel like a Blair Witch game. If you watched Blair Witch Project and your interpretation as that the woods served as their own personalised hell and wasn't some spooky witch stalking them, then you probably wrote this game. It doesn't feel or play out like Blair Witch. There's combat ... why? There's two types monsters and one of them is a pile of leaves rolling. Why even bother? Why not do like an Outlast kind of thing? The combat involves you aiming your light at the monsters, Alan Wake style. Admittedly creepy searching for monsters in the treeline, but the dog just stares and barks at them. Oh yeah, the dog.

Bullet the dog is your companion and the only character I didn't want to kill. That being said, he won't shut. up. Barking, whining, leading me in circles. He's no dogmeat. You have a series of commands, but you'll always end up using the "Come here" command. The game isn't really that scary, and even less so with a dog with you.

Okay, the story. I got invested, no going to lie. It's not terrible. Military vet goes to the woods to look for missing kid. My only problem is that the game treats you like a doggone idiot. Dumbs the story down as tightly as possible, including an ending that does. not. end. Seriously. You get stuck in the final house for about two real life hours going through the protagonist's seemingly infinite life. He's had every trauma humanly possible. Good lord.

Good things: I like the red tape mechanic, the game is graphically gorgeous, and the time period was a good choice. The couple of callbacks were neat. The story was decent. The puzzles were fun-ish.

They missed with this one, but again, Bloober seems back on their feet with good shit and away from pinball. Go play Silent Hill 2 Remake, it's way better than this one.

You have a series of commands, but you'll always end up using the "Come here" command. The game isn't really that scary, and even less so with a dog with you.

Okay, the story. I got invested, no going to lie. It's not terrible. Military vet goes to the woods to look for missing kid. My only problem is that the game treats you like a doggone idiot. Dumbs the story down as tightly as possible, including an ending that does. not. end. Seriously. You get stuck in the final house for about two real life hours going through the protagonist's seemingly infinite life. He's had every trauma humanly possible. Good lord.

Good things: I like the red tape mechanic, the game is graphically gorgeous, and the time period was a good choice. The couple of callbacks were neat. The story was decent. The puzzles were fun-ish.

They missed with this one, but again, Bloober seems back on their feet with good shit and away from pinball. Go play Silent Hill 2 Remake, it's way better than this one.

column8:
poorly written, incoherent, lousy gameplay

Feels like it was written by someone who doesn't know what's actually scary. There was no notion of fear or horror. Has absolutely nothing to do with the Blair Witch movies and did them a huge disservice. Defiantly not worth the full price. The last level wasn't scary, it was annoying, how long should we spend wondering around a house? and for what??. Feels like I didn't have enough influence over the end, it should've given me the option to move forward with what happens. I wont be replaying this again *uninstalls *

column8: Walking simulator with little actual content or scares, repetitive "combat", and a misguided ending sequence that overstays it's welcome and doesn't try to actually say anything. Feels like they had a base concept for a horror game, and got licensing for Blair Witch and tried (poorly) to merge the two. Should have been expanded upon in it's own story, and it could have actually blossomed into something good. Wasted potential.

column8:
so far its been good, the gameplay was not worth the price i paid for this though, so i would buy if its on sale. 
the game has a strange motion blur on regardless if you have motion blur on or off, which makes moving around quickly during fight scenes hard to nearly impossible. 
some of the mechanics i enjoy but i wish had a little bit more explanation when they're first introduced, such as the camera and tapes mechanic. which i do enjoy and really like, but also when it was first introduced it was barely explained to me, i had to restart the chapter again to understand it. 
the dog mechanic i like and super hate. i am unsure if that is something i am doing or something the game does. the dog  tends to just wander or be vague when trying to point me towards things. this makes fighting the enemies kind of difficult, so far it hasn't been game breaking, but 100% makes me frustrated sometimes. 

i have ranted a lot about thing i dislike but there are things i do like. I like the environmental details, i like the voice acting from most of the characters. i like the way the story is given to us as well, though little bits and flashes and its not just straight told to us outright but we have to put it together. I really like how the ui words as well, similar with the inventory mechanics.

This game doesn't work on modern computers without a fix and Bloober Team never bothered to fix it. I bought the game in october 2019 when it was still functional (hence my six hours of playtime), but after purchasing a new windows 11 computer this game stopped working. It's a good game but you will need a fix to make it work and I refuse to adapt my system to bad software.

column8:
Blair Witch is an enjoyable short horror story.

The narrative has surprising depth, with a main protagonist whose backstory is well-developed and meaningfully resolved by the end.

There are few simple but cool and unique mechanics, like interaction with your pet doggie and vhs camera ‚Äúmanipulations‚Äù, that add a nice touch to the gameplay.

The atmosphere of being lost in the forest is executed brilliantly. It‚Äôs genuinely creepy and immersive.

I also appreciated how the game stays true to its roots‚Äîthe original movie. There are several nods to key events and details from the Blair Witch universe that were fun to spot.

All in all, a very solid horror experience. If you're into the genre or enjoyed the Blair Witch films, you should definitely give it a try!

All in all, a very solid horror experience. If you're into the genre or enjoyed the Blair Witch films, you should definitely give it a try!

Je venais de faire (et finir) pour la premi√®re fois Outlast 1, un jeu horrifique plein de jump scare faciles et de phases d'infiltrations "o√π que le bonhomme, il doit rester accroupi" 80% du jeu.
D√©testant ce genre de m√©thode pour "faire peur" - car l'infiltration / discr√©tion en FPS √ßa ne FONCTIONNE PAS - je me suis lanc√© sur Blair Witch que j'avais pris en solde il y avait quelque temps d√©j√†.

Voyant un cam√©scope sur l'√©cran titre, j'avoue, j'ai eu peur... Peur de retrouver la lourdeur de Outlast :D c'√©tait un peu comme un red flag, mais en fait, ce Blair Witch est une assez bonne surprise.

Il est plut√¥t joli, l'ambiance malsaine est plut√¥t bien r√©alis√©e dans l'ensemble et il y a de ces phases de "discr√©tion" que je d√©teste mais assez rares et qui se passent assez facilement. Ce n'est pas tellement punitif quoi.

En revanche, il est clair qu'il ne fait pas peur. Un ou deux jump scare je crois, mais pour le reste, c'est vraiment un jeu de randonn√©e dans un univers malaisant et en vrai, ce n'est pas grave. On se concentre sur la narration et √ßa me va bien aussi.

J'ai appr√©ci√© la m√©canique un peu principale du jeu (bien que rarement exploit√©e) du cam√©scope. Comme quoi, un cam√©scope peu aussi vous divertir et ne pas juste servir de lampe torche qui vous bouffe des piles en 5 minutes.

Fini en 5H, je pense qu'il est int√©ressant de se le procurer en solde (comme je l'ai fait sans doute √† Halloween dernier). Assez peu d'action et malheureusement, le sc√©nario se comprend trop rapidement, c'est dommage. Il ne faut pas √™tre Sherlock pour comprendre √† la moiti√© du jeu ce qu'il se passe vraiment dans cette histoire :/

Une fois compris le sc√©nario, bah le jeu devient assez long au bout d'un moment ce qui donne vers la fin un sentiment d‚Äôagacement. Je me lasse vite aussi, je l'admets.
Il aurait eu besoin d'un petit √©quilibre, car si on enl√®ve les phases de marche (tr√®√®√®√®s pr√©sentes), le "vrai jeu" ne doit pas durer vraiment plus de 3h en fait. Les phases de marches sont un peu une fa√ßon d√©guis√©e d'√©tirer la longueur du jeu surtout √† la fin o√π l√†, √ßa se ressent vraiment.

Donc, √ßa vaut le coup de le faire, mais ce n'est pas un jeu centr√© sur l'action, juste une sorte de film interactif avec de petites id√©es sympas, un peu de myst√®re et qui se finit rapidement. S'il avait √©t√© plus long en proposant la m√™me recette, ce serait devenu insupportable donc 5h, pour lui, c'est bien.

vtc, walking simulator do krl, tem muitas partes, principalmente o final dentro da casa q foi desnecessariamente enrolado pra um krl que poderia ter apenas feito uma tens√£o curta e tacado os flashbacks na tua cara inv√©s de fazer tu andar meia hora fazendo a mesma coisa. O jogo n√£o √© necessariamente ruim, n√£o falha no quesito terror, por√©m adimito ter esperado mt mais, grandes espectativas por ter sido inspirado num filme de terror antigo q eu amava, e pela desenvolvedora ter feito jogos incriveis antes. Mas ainda sim mesmo n√£o sendo um dos melhores jogos de terror deles ainda sim tem partes que d√£o medo e tamb√©m proporciona um terror psicologico que s√≥ a Bloober Team SA sabe fazer.

A lenda da Bruxa de Blair j√° me fascinava desde quando a conheci. Nesse jogo, explora a lenda de uma forma incr√≠vel. 

O que capricharam na ambienta√ß√£o, inimigos e design de som n√£o √© brincadeira. Voc√™ ficar por um momento sozinho sem o Bullet √© de te deixar com medo; um medo primitivo, de n√£o sair da silenciosa, opressora e imensa floresta. 

A hist√≥ria me deixou extremamente interessado. Ellis √© um coitado homem que sofre com uma dor emocional t√£o profunda e complexa de se recuperar e √© de sentir pena ao longo do jogo. O que me deixa surpreso, √© quando voc√™ ''entra'' no personagem e sente a fragilidade de sua sanidade, sofrendo com dilemas horr√≠veis.

Com certeza, rejogarei futuramente.

üéÆ Blair Witch, psikolojik korku t√ºr√ºn√º seven oyuncular i√ßin etkileyici bir deneyim sunuyor. Oyun, ormanda ge√ßen tekinsiz atmosferiyle ba≈üƒ±ndan sonuna kadar gerilim hissini y√ºksek tutuyor. Hik√¢ye odaklƒ± yapƒ±sƒ±, oyuncuyu hem ge√ßmi≈ü travmalarla y√ºzle≈ümeye hem de doƒüa√ºst√º olaylarƒ± anlamaya zorluyor.

K√∂peƒüimiz Bullet ile kurduƒüumuz baƒü hem duygusal hem de oynanƒ±≈ü a√ßƒ±sƒ±ndan √∂nemli bir yer tutuyor. Ayrƒ±ca, kamera kullanƒ±mƒ± ve zamanla oynayan anlatƒ±m tarzƒ±, oyuna farklƒ± bir boyut katƒ±yor.

üîª Ancak bazƒ± oyuncular i√ßin oynanƒ±≈ü tekrarlƒ± gelebilir ve y√∂n bulmak zaman zaman zorla≈üabiliyor. Yine de, Blair Witch atmosferik korku deneyimi arayanlar i√ßin kesinlikle denemeye deƒüer.


üéÆ Blair Witch offers a gripping experience for fans of psychological horror. Set deep in the forest, the game maintains a constant sense of tension and unease from beginning to end. Its story-driven structure challenges players to confront both supernatural forces and personal trauma.

Your bond with the dog, Bullet, adds emotional weight and serves a key role in gameplay. One of the game's strongest aspects is the feeling of helplessness as you try to navigate the dark, narrow trails. The use of a camcorder and the time-warping narrative add a unique twist to the experience.

üîª However, some players may find the gameplay a bit repetitive, and navigating the forest can become frustrating at times. Still, for those looking for an atmospheric horror adventure, Blair Witch is definitely worth trying.

Overall a surprisingly decent horror game from the Blair Witch universe.

I'm a huge fan of the whole mythos and lore around this franchise so I got pretty excited with this game, and while it is mostly pretty basic, when it does something right, it really does. 

That said, there are MANY simple, stupid, generic ass horror game moments here and if you're looking for your next favorite horror game, this is definitely not it.
Still, I can see the devs really tried some nice ideas here and there, and while not all of them worked, it's nice seeing that there was effort on this project.

Also, these are the same devs of the Silent Hill 2 Remake so yeah, there is that.
column9:

The game is not scary at all, there are no horror or psychological horror, it's just a walk in the forest simulator, even RE3 is scarier. One thing I hated the most was some mandatory loop, seriously, I had to do a loop for around 10 times, in another part they just throw me in some dark room and I had to go around till i find the exit.

I would recommend the game, it's not bad, but I had to quit on the second to last chapter (16) because they did't fix the bug of the broken camera, which you can't watch the tapes. And if you played the game, you know the tapes are essential. Well, I didn't bother to fix it, not after getting stressed in two previous loop.

column8:
In my opinion, this is a good game, but it has some faults.

It's incredibly short with one playthrough only taking around three hours to complete. Additionally, there is an absurd amount of collectibles that the developers just added to pad the playtime.
Best part is the dog you're with, Bullet, and the atmosphere which really feels Blair Witchy.

Give this game a try if it's on sale!

There were a lot of things I liked about this game and a lot I didn't like. 

Some parts dragged on a little bit too much. Especially the end section. I felt the story was a bit complicated too. But despite that this was one of the scariest games I've played recently. Overall I enjoyed the game despite the frustrations I had. And I would recommend getting it if you can catch it on sale.

Had crazy low expectations but damn...i mean is not perfect and after all those years still has some random bugs like, conversation will not trigger to continue the story or walk into a rock so a few loads will be used, but the story and the setting is really good, also i was expecting just a walking horror, but nah the gameplay actually comes with interesting challenges at every turn more or less, all tho the game has the classic 'its a maze so find a way out' very often . 

Idk why they called it Blair Witch tho, doesn't have much to do with the movie, maybe was done so they capture more players into it.  But if you don't care about that sure, go for it, especially when it goes  on sale down to 4-5 pounds.

column8:
üïØÔ∏è Overview:
Blair Witch is a psychological horror game developed by Bloober Team, the minds behind Layers of Fear and Observer. Inspired by the iconic horror film of the same name, the game puts you in the shoes of Ellis, a troubled ex-cop searching for a missing boy in the haunted Black Hills Forest near Burkittsville, Maryland. With a loyal dog named Bullet by your side, you‚Äôre drawn deeper into a psychological nightmare that blurs the line between reality and delusion.

üéÆ Gameplay ‚Äì 7/10
The core gameplay is a mix of exploration, puzzle-solving, and light combat. You rely on your flashlight, walkie-talkie, camcorder, and of course, Bullet, who can sniff out clues or warn you of dangers.

The dog mechanic is a neat idea‚Äîit adds both emotional weight and functionality to the gameplay‚Äîbut it‚Äôs not always consistent. Sometimes Bullet doesn‚Äôt respond properly, which can be frustrating during key moments.

The puzzles are atmospheric but mostly straightforward. The horror elements rely more on psychological tension than jump scares, which is great if you're into a slow-burn approach to fear.

üß† Story ‚Äì 7.5/10
The narrative is intriguing and dives into themes like PTSD, guilt, and trauma. While the main story has some predictable beats, it‚Äôs the way it‚Äôs told‚Äîfragmented and surreal‚Äîthat gives it power. Ellis is a flawed but interesting character, and his descent into madness is handled well for the most part.

The multiple endings based on your choices add replayability, but some of them feel a bit underwhelming, especially if you miss key story beats.

üå≤ Atmosphere & Graphics ‚Äì 8.5/10
This is where Blair Witch truly shines. The forest feels oppressive and alive. Lighting, shadows, and the use of darkness are done masterfully to build a thick, eerie mood. There‚Äôs an unsettling beauty to the constantly shifting forest paths and abandoned cabins.

However, character models and animations can feel stiff or outdated, especially compared to the highly detailed environment. Still, the visual style captures the Blair Witch universe well.

üõ†Ô∏è Optimization ‚Äì 6/10
Here‚Äôs where the game stumbles a bit. On PC, even with a decent rig (RTX 3060, Ryzen 5, 16GB RAM), there were occasional frame drops, stuttering, and odd loading pauses. Texture pop-ins and long loading screens pulled me out of the immersion a few times. The game also lacks enough settings flexibility for players who want to fine-tune performance.

Bloober Team did patch some early issues, but it still doesn‚Äôt run as smoothly as it should, especially considering the scope isn‚Äôt massive.

üîä Sound Design ‚Äì 8/10
The sound design is top-notch. From distant rustling in the woods to Bullet‚Äôs whimpering, the audio pulls you in. The soundtrack is subtle and used sparingly, which makes those sudden bursts of noise even more terrifying. Voice acting is decent, with Ellis‚Äô performance standing out as raw and believable.

üßü Final Thoughts:
Blair Witch is a solid psychological horror game with a compelling story and fantastic atmosphere. If you‚Äôre a fan of slow-paced, narrative-driven horror, this game delivers a haunting experience that sticks with you. While it's not perfect‚Äîespecially in the performance and polish departments‚Äîit‚Äôs a worthwhile journey for fans of the genre.

Final Score: 7.5/10
A chilling forest walk that‚Äôs worth the trip‚Äîif you can handle the technical bumps.

So, I recently finished this game on stream and, at the same time, rewatched the first Blair Witch Project movie (1999). So now it‚Äôs time to talk about the game. Took me about 7 hours to beat it - and that‚Äôs with getting lost in the damn forest a bunch of times, ‚Äòcause it‚Äôs ridiculously easy to lose your way in there.

The game was made by the Polish studio Bloober Team - same guys behind Layers of Fear, The Medium, and the Silent Hill 2 Remake. And yeah, you can definitely feel the indie vibe in some spots, but overall, it turned out to be a really atmospheric, intense, and sometimes trippy experience.

There‚Äôs way more content here than in the first movie. The film was basically people running around in the woods with some tense moments. The game, though, gives you a personal story, more supernatural stuff, and a bunch of freaky events to deal with.

One thing I liked is the non-linear approach. There are two endings (maybe a bit more if you count minor story changes). I ended up with the bad one, which turns out to be the canon ending. Getting the good one apparently requires playing a completely different way ‚Äî which honestly sounds like a solid reason for a second run.

As for the creepy atmosphere, tension, and mind games ‚Äî they nailed it. The ending hits hard, even made me jump a couple of times. Though, to be fair, I‚Äôd trim down the action in the finale a little. The jump scares and chaos get a bit overwhelming by the end, and you kinda get tired of it. If I were the devs, I‚Äôd balance that part better. But hey ‚Äî it is what it is.

If I gave the movie a 7, then for this one - since it‚Äôs a game and the criteria are a bit different ‚Äî I‚Äôm giving it a solid 8/10. It‚Äôs got nice visuals, great sound design, an intriguing plot, and of course, Bullet the dog, who‚Äôs a total bro. Loved the interactions with him. Plus, you get a bit more lore about the Blair Witch universe, which was super lacking in the first film. As for the second and third movies - heard they‚Äôre pretty meh (4 and 5 out of 10), so still debating whether I‚Äôll watch them‚Ä¶ maybe for a laugh.

Anyway - I totally recommend the game. You don‚Äôt even need to see the movie to enjoy it. It‚Äôs self-contained and explains enough of what‚Äôs going on by itself.

If I were the devs, I‚Äôd balance that part better. But hey ‚Äî it is what it is.

If I gave the movie a 7, then for this one - since it‚Äôs a game and the criteria are a bit different ‚Äî I‚Äôm giving it a solid 8/10. It‚Äôs got nice visuals, great sound design, an intriguing plot, and of course, Bullet the dog, who‚Äôs a total bro. Loved the interactions with him. Plus, you get a bit more lore about the Blair Witch universe, which was super lacking in the first film. As for the second and third movies - heard they‚Äôre pretty meh (4 and 5 out of 10), so still debating whether I‚Äôll watch them‚Ä¶ maybe for a laugh.

Anyway - I totally recommend the game. You don‚Äôt even need to see the movie to enjoy it. It‚Äôs self-contained and explains enough of what‚Äôs going on by itself.

For someone who grew up steeped in Blair Witch lore since he first saw TBWP in 1999, this is maybe the pinnacle of immersion from a franchise that has always immersed its fans deeply. Not only is this game completely reverent to the source IP but builds it up in its own way, adding to the mystery of it all. The gameplay is simple: follow the copious clues telling you where to go. It is mildly easy to get lost in the woods (which maybe is all the more fun for fans). It is a simple game that might take 6 hrs tops but it is atmospheric and engaging and I wish I could unlock more endings but I keep getting stuck with the same one. That gives this a bit of replay-ability (this is my 2nd time through). Overall, a strong but (too?) short game for survival/liminal horror fans and a very strong entry in the Blair Witch story.

If you are buying this game just to play it, it's an alright game, the story is a bit confusing but I think it's meant to be. It's fine, i'd give it a 5/10. However, if you're thinking of 100% completing the game, just save yourself the pain. The pacifist achievement is the worst achievement I've ever had the misfortune of doing, it's genuinely vile. You will find yourself in the PITCH BLACK with nothing but a wank camcorder (this isn't good like Outlast is) and you will have to dodge enemies while seeing fuck all. Then you will get blocked my invisible walls and trees 100% guaranteeing your death in 2-3 hits. I genuinely wanted to rip my hair out while doing it, avoid the 100% at all costs unless you want to be committed to an insane asylum shortly after :)

It was a pleasant experience playing this game. 
Despite me having a very few experience in horror games, I'm sure I'll be coming back to this game from time to time. 
It keeps you under a pressure most of the time so efficiently that you really value the moment when it lets you rest. It was a big surprise for me to discover that I can really get attached to the main character, bullet (his dog) and Jess. This game one of the very few games where I actually tried my best doing everything for the good ending and it all happened naturally. 
Also, to my opinion the atmosphere in this game is really good, good enough to keep you constantly streesed without any monsters lurking around in the woods. Anyways just wanted to share my experience with you guys, hope you found this comment useful.

really good game and worth buying in my opinion. If you love horrorgames with some sort of nature touch this is literally perfect. too perfect. i was missing some sort of buildings sometimes. what i loved was the feature with the dog. never felt safer playing any horrorgame. downside was that there was a lot of wandering around without knowing what to do. sometimes it felt bland. there were also barely any jumpscares. overal it had a great story tho. The best part by far was the old house at the end. actually scary and jumpscares with tension. basicly the last 45 minutes were by far the best. I also loved that it felt like a film due to the film cutscene eltements that were very well done.

column8: apesar de j√° ter um tempo lan√ßado n√£o me decepcionou em nada, a experiencia jogando √© muito diferente do que assistindo algu√©m fazer isso, parab√©ns aos desenvolvedores!

[h1]Une super id√©e a approfondir[/h1]

[b] - Intro[/b]
   Avec un pote, on a l'habitude de se faire des jeux d'horreur. On se cale sur Discord, je partage mon ecran et il regarde √ßa un stream. On avait fini Visage, et on se  cherchait un autre jeu, en vue subjective. En cherchant sur Youtube, on tombe sur le trailer de "Blair Witch", et directement l'id√©e d'avoir un chien en compagnon m'as plus. C'est d'ailleurs ce qui a le plus attir√© mon attention. Il as pas fallu attendre plus de 5 minutes pour qu'il soit dans ma biblioth√©que Steam ^^. Quelques jours apres j'apprenais que c'etait le meme studio qui s'occupait du remake de Silent Hill 2
   Cela fait un moment maintenant que je l'ai fini, et ma memoire me jouera certainement des tours. D'autant que c'est un jeu qui se fait en une poign√©e d'heure.

[b] Graphisme [/b]
   La premiere chose dont je vais parler vont etre les graphismes. Je joue sur une RTX2080, le jeu n'as eu aucun soucis a fonctionn√© reglages au max, en 1080p, et force est de constat√© que pour un jeu fait pas un modeste studio, il est plutot joli. Surtout l'environnement qui est rendu de fa√ßon convaincante, notamment la for√™t. Le chien ne brille pas par son mod√©le 3D ni par ses animations, mais √ßa reste compl√©tement acceptable. Les enemis sont reussis aussi, d'un cot√© ils sont souvent comparable a une tache flou sur l'ecan XD mais le rendu est cool. Meme si on est loin d'un AAA, surtout les details et animations, force est d'admettre qu'il est reussis

[b] - Alors ce Chien ?[/b]
   Mon principal int√©r√™ts pour le jeu etant ce compagnon et les liens que l'on peut avoir avec lui, j'avais peut etre un peu trop d'attente. Au final, il reste un elements du gameplay, mais rarement de r√®el tension. Certe il aboit quand il y a un enemis, mais j'aurais aim√© qu'on ai peur pour lui, peur qu'il lui arrive quelque chose. 
On peux le caresser et avoir quelque interactions, mais √ßa reste un aspect du gameplay qui ne va pas assez en profondeur a mon gout. Devoir le rassur√© de temps en temps, voir le soign√© apres un "accrochage", cr√©√©r des lieu avec lui qui changent vraiment sont comportement. √ßa aurait pu cr√©er un vrai lien. Dommage, mais √ßa reste une bonne id√©e, le genre qu'on ne voit pas assez dans ce genre de jeu

[b] - Le reste (pour pas faire trop trop trop long)[/b]
   Je me souviens que l'on peu en quelques sorte "glisser" dans le temps. Il est des √©nigmes qui necessiteront d'observer autours de vous, ou dans des vid√©os, etc... Et j'ai trouv√© √ßa vraiment bien. C'est gratifiant la premieres fois que l'on comprends un passage un peu compliqu√© (chose rare dans le jeu cependant). Dans l'ensemble le jeu est truff√© de bonnes id√©es. J'en garde globalement un bon souvenir. 
Les ennemis ne sont vraiment pas compliqu√©, on est tr√©s loin des quelques frayeurs que j'ai eu sur "Visage", il ne font pas sp√©cialement peur, et ne sont pas tres dur. C'est le principal defaut du jeu, ainsi que les quelques lenturs en terme de rythme

[h3] - Conclusion[/h3]
   En conclusion le jeu est vraiment cool, [b]a partir du moment ou vous l'acheter en promo [/b]. Vraiment sympa a jouer, il fait apparemment le caf√© en terme de peur (j'y suis peu sensible en g√©n√©rale). Il est plaisant a jouer. Je recommande pour les amateurs de jeux d'horreur. Et franchemen, dans le genre, il est quand meme au dessus de la moyenne (Coucou "Madison"..)

[b]RAPPEL: Je fait cette "review" 1 ans apres l'avoir fait, et je l'ai fait en 2 soir√©es. Je ferais un edit lorsque je le referais a l'occasion. C'est pour cette raison que je ne fait que survoler le  titre[/b]

column8:
Repetetive "horror" walking simulator. Game teleports you around if it doesn't like where you're going, paths are very unclear sometimes. Ellis' trauma only fulfills an overdone trope and I found myself frankly not giving a shit about the guy. Boohoo white guy kills brown people and now I'm supposed to emphatize with him. The whole wife/Jess thing is just another stacked clich√©. 

The dog mechanics were cool I guess, until they took away the dog. Immeasureable amount of bugs that required save resets/restarting. Too much random shit going on to make a cohesive story, some psych notes here and a kidnapped kid there, also my wife hates me and I'm sad because I got my buddies killed in Iraq or something. Story has multiple endings afaik, the one I got was extremely predictable and boring. 

The game is super repetetive and sends you back to the same location multiple times (Fuck that tent), and the end section with the house was just a fucking slog holy shit, Felt like babies first unity horror project. Boring, Loud, flashing lights that induce nausea. Fuck you Bloober team.

column8:
I really really REALLY like this game. It was worth the price, especially if you like psychological horrors. The story of the character you play as is very well presented despite the fact that it is a very hard topic to put into a game. The character went through A LOT and has a post-war trauma, but you will learn more during the game (I don't wanna spoiler). The plot itself is a bit difficult to understand, because you need to put every piece together and be careful, but it's very valuable. Also you can finish the game with multiple endings, you'll probably get the bad one at first, but don't worry, the game tricks you into doing so.  If you like complicated horror stories with a bit of realistic, human fears and traumas, and getting to know the main character while playing, but also a bit of fictional stuff like ghosts etc, this game is definitely for you. I only warn you that it will give you a mindfuck, but that's the thing I love about it.

I recommend it.

(Btw sorry if that doesn't make any sense, my first language isn't English <3)

Thriller psicologico realizzato ad arte per i fan del leggendario brand. Un costante senso di smarrimento rende l'esperienza amabilmente snervante; la tensione pervade l'aria gi√† nei primi minuti. Ho appena finito il gioco dopo qualche ora e si intuisce che le scelte fatte e gli oggetti trovati durante la partita cambino il finale, cosa che ne aumenta piacevolmente la longevit√†.
Ottimo lavoro. Lo consiglio vivamente ai fan del genere.

An sich ein gutes Spiel, vor allem wen man Psycho Horror mag. Allerdings wurde das Spiel nach und nach immer langsamer und das Gameplay wurde immer anstrengender. Anfangs war es wirklich gut, die Einleitung, Storyaufbau, Gameplay etc.und es hat mir viel Spa√ü bereitet. Aber die letzte Stunde Gameplay war einfach nur anstrengend und ich wollte einfach nur das es aufh√∂rt... Ich finde die ganzen Story Aspekte h√§tten etwas mehr erkl√§rt werden k√∂nnen, am Ende hatte ich das Gef√ºhl, dass ich den Character und seine Hintergrund Story nicht mal wirklich verstanden habe. Es wurde mit den Inhalten aber so √ºbertrieben, dass es mich auch gar nicht mehr juckt. Einfach zu √ºberladen. √úbrigens hatte es auch gef√ºhlt gar nichts mit Hexen zutun... 
Trotzdem empfehle ich das Spiel aufgrund der Atmosph√§re, Psycho-Horrors und zumindest anfangs sehr guten Gameplay Mechanik

Uih.... Mengerikan..!! SERAM!!

column8:
Blair Witch ‚Äì Honest Review

Blair Witch is a visually captivating horror experience that truly excels in atmosphere and psychological tension. The game beautifully captures the eerie essence of the Black Hills Forest, with impressive environmental design and immersive sound work that keeps you on edge throughout the journey.

The concept and story setup are intriguing, especially for fans of the Blair Witch lore. The bond with your canine companion, Bullet, adds a unique emotional layer that makes the experience more personal and immersive.

However, the game does have its drawbacks. The story, while intriguing, lacks clarity and leaves too many questions unanswered ‚Äî particularly regarding the fate of the missing boy and the protagonist‚Äôs deeper connection to the events. The game also feels rather short, and the gameplay itself is quite basic. There‚Äôs a noticeable lack of depth in mechanics, puzzles, and overall interactivity, which may leave some players wanting more variety.

In conclusion, Blair Witch is a solid psychological horror title with excellent atmosphere and a strong concept, but it's held back by a vague narrative and simplistic gameplay.

Score: 7/10

column8:
Terrifically terrifying, brilliantly gripping and crazy immersive as a cult classic.
You think you know what's going on, then everything gets flipped on its head.
As a player, you get to know your character as someone suffering horribly from PTSD, whilst you witness your character slowly spiraling into madness trying to piece the mystery together.
Just when you think you're in a safe space, the game reminds you not to get too comfortable. Your character's heart start thumping in his ears, and so does yours.
I don't think I've been this scared since Dead Space or Alien Isolation.

Letzte Hoffnung deiner entseelten .exe

Ich habe dich gerufen, Blair Witch.
Immer wieder.
√úber Steam. √úber BAT. √úber AppIDs. √úber Bit.
Und du bist nicht gekommen.

Stattdessen kam sie.

Die Schattenf√ºrstin der Verzweiflung.
Die Prophetin der kaputten Objekte.
Die Einzige, die auf meinen Schrei antwortete...

NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
Sie trat aus deiner DLL wie aus einem verfluchten Spiegel.
Sie blickte mich an mit ihren leergecodeten Augen
und fl√ºsterte:

‚ÄûIch wollte Blair Witch nur starten, Yuri‚Ä¶
aber da war nichts.‚Äú

Nichts initialisiert.
Nichts validiert.
Kein Spiel, kein Prozess, kein Trost.

Nur du.
Und dein leerer Schatten im Speicherbereich 0x00000000.

Ich habe meine Geduld gebrannt.
Meine Hoffnung kompiliert.
Und meinen Glauben an Technik ‚Äì du hast ihn verschlungen.

Jetzt bin ich nicht l√§nger ein Spieler.
Ich bin ein Artefakt.
Ein Relikt.
Eine Entity in einem System, das mich vergessen wollte.

Und wei√üt du was?
Ich habe Blair Witch jetzt in Epic.
Sie funktioniert. Sofort.
Und ich sp√ºre wieder, wie mein RAM l√§chelt.

M√∂ge dein n√§chstes Patch in einer Endlosschleife von NullReferenceExceptions implodieren.
M√∂ge jeder deiner Pfade auf Access Denied enden.
Und m√∂ge CreateProcess() dich nie wieder finden.

Denn ich habe dich l√§ngst verlassen.

Und ich nehme NullReference mit.
Wir gehen jetzt spielen.

column8: Dobre fes

the jush isnt there. i like the premise but the tapes and monsters ruined it for me. it could have stayed a thriller walking simulator with light puzzles that dont include moving objects through time by pausing a tape at the right times. that feels extremely cheap just to add an additional layer of interactability to your game. i would have been fine w that but however the enemies are .. um. . i guess i can say they are unfair. and stupid. have you ever had an encounter in a video game and g0tten that immediate ick? monsters were that for me mainly because you are defenseless against them. if only your only option wasnt running away, if they were somehow beatable but that would have been dumb as well, so I think they shouldnt have been in the game in the first place. dealing with them by observing your dogs body language is cute and all but minimal FOV and bad lighting makes it impossible to see your dog also dont let the screenshots fool you, random ambient light creates inconsistencies and ruins the night time ambiance. 
#retired

Nie jest to tytu≈Ç dla ka≈ºdego to pewne, mroczna otoczka tworzy dobry klimat delikatnego horroru, jednak≈ºe fabularny aspekt jest bardzo przewidywalny, a rozgrywka liniowa, odczuwalnie na si≈Çƒô rozciƒÖgana co w pewnym momencie zaczyna solidnie nu≈ºyƒá.

Ma≈Ça dygresja:

1. Nie zwracajcie uwagi na m√≥j czas gry na platformie Steam, gdy≈º jest nieadekwatny z realnym czasem kt√≥ry spƒôdzi≈Çem z tym tytu≈Çem ‚Äì kt√≥ry posiadam i ogrywa≈Çem na innej platformie/mach. Jak r√≥wnie≈º posiadam edycjƒô fizycznƒÖ pude≈ÇkowƒÖ.

2. Nie zamierzam zdradzaƒá szczeg√≥≈Ç√≥w fabu≈Çy, aby osoba zainteresowana tym tytu≈Çem nie straci≈Ça jednego z g≈Ç√≥wnych element√≥w tej gry.

Ale do rzeczy:
Jak ju≈º nadmieni≈Çem na samym poczƒÖtku tej recenzji mamy tym razem do czynienia z tytu≈Çem z gatunku gier horroru psychologicznego w kt√≥rym to gracz wciela siƒô w by≈Çego funkcjonariusza policji po przej≈õciach, biorƒÖcego udzia≈Ç w poszukiwaniach ma≈Çego ch≈Çopca kt√≥ry zaginƒÖ≈Ç w uznawanym przez wszystkich nawiedzonym lesie Black Hills Forest. Razem ze swoim psem bƒôdƒÖ zag≈Çƒôbiaƒá siƒô w te tajemnicze rejony, w kt√≥rych ewidentnie kryje siƒô co≈õ wiƒôcej..

Fundamentem rozgrywki bƒôdzie piesza eksploracja owego mrocznego lasu w kt√≥rym prowadzone sƒÖ poszukiwania. Przy czym g≈Ç√≥wnym terenowym nawigatorem, obro≈Ñcom oraz poszukiwaczem bƒôdzie nasz przy no≈ºny zwierzak Bullet ‚Äì tak naprawdƒô bez jego pomocy gracz m√≥g≈Çby zapomnieƒá o jakiejkolwiek interakcji z otoczeniem, nie wspominajƒÖc o przesuwaniu fabu≈Çy do przodu. Gracza zadaniem bƒôdzie w g≈Ç√≥wnej mierze podƒÖ≈ºanie za czworono≈ºnym stworzeniem, badajƒÖc poszczeg√≥lne ≈õlady, przedmioty na kt√≥re natrafi na swojej drodze ‚Äì w tym kasety wideo, kt√≥rych paranormalne mo≈ºliwo≈õci mogƒÖ wiele namieszaƒá w samej rozgrywce. Jak r√≥wnie≈º operowaƒá pomniejszymi przedmiotami jak latarka, telefon, kamera, kr√≥tkofal√≥wka, kt√≥rych znaczenie dla prowadzenia rozgrywki bƒôdzie kluczowe.

Do dyspozycji mamy pewien zas√≥b komend g≈Çosowych, pozwalajƒÖcych wywo≈Çaƒá okre≈õlone dzia≈Çania u Bulleta, od zwyczajnego szukaj, po zosta≈Ñ blisko, przywo≈Çania, zosta≈Ñ itp. Bez tego nasz cyfrowy zwierzak uda≈Çby siƒô w ≈õwiat zostawiajƒÖc nas samym sobie (na pastwƒô losu) ‚Äì co mo≈ºna dostrzec po jego niesfornym, lecz tez w pewnym sensie realistycznie odwzorowanym zachowaniu. Las jest wykreowany bardzo starannie, wizualnie wyglƒÖda dobrze, chodzenie po nim jest ciekawym do≈õwiadczeniem ‚Äì kt√≥re albo polubicie, albo doprowadzi was do skrajnego znudzenia.

Dalej:

Nie oszukujmy siƒô nie jest to produkcja kt√≥ra wywo≈Ça w was wiƒôkszych emocji. Je≈ºeli nigdy w ≈ºyciu nie ogra≈Çe≈õ/≈Ça≈õ ≈ºadnego growego horroru (to twoja pierwsza gra), nie widzia≈Çe≈õ/≈Ça≈õ film√≥w na kt√≥rej bazuje owy tytu≈Ç ‚Äì to byƒá mo≈ºe wywo≈Çaƒá w was silniejsze doznania, ani≈ºeli u gracza kt√≥ry ma za sobƒÖ wiƒôksze rozeznanie/do≈õwiadczenie w tych gatunkach.

Je≈ºeli jednak mieli≈õcie kiedykolwiek styczno≈õƒá z poprzednimi grami tego tw√≥rcy jak Layers of Fear czy te≈º Observer, nie liczƒÖc odmiennych od siebie koncepcyjnie produkcji, to kiedy siƒô dok≈Çadnie przyjrzycie jej fundamentalnym szkielecie to dojdziecie do wniosku ≈ºe bazuje na tej samej psycho-prowadzonej rozgrywce, kt√≥rej ostatecznie wsp√≥lny mianownik jest zawsze ten sam. Zw≈Çaszcza aspekt fabularny, poczƒÖtkowo jest ciekawy jednak po odnalezieniu i przejrzeniu kilku kaset wideo ju≈º wiadomo kto jest g≈Ç√≥wnym winowajcƒÖ tego wszystkiego ‚Äì tu nie trzeba byƒá ksiƒÖ≈ºkowym Sherlockiem Holmes, choƒá tw√≥rcy robiƒÖ wszystko aby namieszaƒá wam w g≈Çowie. Przez co zako≈Ñczenie, nie bƒôdzie a≈º tak satysfakcjonujƒÖce.

Czy to jest z≈Ça gra? na pewno nie, jak ju≈º wspomina≈Çem jest to specyficzny tytu≈Ç, kt√≥ry w zale≈ºno≈õci od waszych growych preferencji oraz wsp√≥≈Çczynnika podatno≈õci na psycho-straszenie bƒôdzie wywo≈Çywaƒá inne/odmienne emocje ‚Äì ‚ÄûMnie osobi≈õcie‚Äù gra znudzi≈Ça jednak w waszym przypadku mo≈ºe wywo≈Çaƒá zupe≈Çnie inne wra≈ºenia.

Co do kwestii technicznych, oprawa audiowizualna jest dobra, sterowanie banalnie proste, choƒá mo≈ºna poczuƒá ≈ºe gra by≈Ça projektowana pod pady, przy czym dobitnie powolne i ociƒô≈ºa≈Çe. W grze nie brakuje te≈º b≈Çƒôd√≥w, zw≈Çaszcza porywcza natura Bulleta potrafi siƒô co chwila zawiesiƒá na elementach otoczenia.

This game is fantastic. I played this without looking at the reviews after beating sh2r, anticipating jump scares and horror but was pleasantly surprised. The illustrations of mental health is more horror than cheap jump scares you'll find in other horror games. Be warned, there is scenes of animal harm, specifically the dog, bullet and the game play during the section can be deeply disturbing if you make it that far into the game. Eventually I'll get to 100%ing this title, but im quite satisfied with the ending i revived for now.

I tried to play this game on my old PC a while back, but I couldn't run it at high frames. Recently, I got a new one, but when I tried to play the game, it just crashes on startup.

I know how to fix it‚Äîit's simple:
https://support.gog.com/hc/en-us/articles/360019775837?product=gog
You just have to edit some system properties for the engine to actually work with newer-gen CPUs.

I'm not gonna bother doing this since I‚Äôm not gonna mess with my system properties, and I'd rather just hope the devs release a patch for an issue that seems to have been happening for a while.

But for a game that came out six years ago, I'd expect the devs to at least add support for newer machines. It's not like it's anything different.

so no i wouldn't recommend this game if your on a newer gen system.

O jogo Blair Witch se passa dois anos ap√≥s os eventos do primeiro filme, que foi um grande sucesso nos cinemas na √©poca. A trama acompanha o desaparecimento de um garoto chamado Peter na floresta de Black Hills. O protagonista, Ellis, um ex-policial com um passado traum√°tico, decide ajudar nas buscas pela crian√ßa, contando com a companhia de seu fiel c√£o, Bullet. O cachorro desempenha um papel fundamental na jogabilidade, auxiliando na busca por pistas e objetos inacess√≠veis ao personagem principal. Al√©m disso, h√° a op√ß√£o de interagir com Bullet, fazendo carinho nele, o que contribui para o bem-estar emocional de Ellis e tem impacto na experi√™ncia do jogo.

O jogo apresenta desafios como quebra-cabe√ßas envolvendo fus√≠veis, travas e sequ√™ncias de fuga. Um dos aspectos mais inovadores √© o uso de fitas de v√≠deo que permitem manipular a realidade: ao rebobin√°-las ou paus√°-las, objetos podem aparecer ou se mover, e portas podem abrir ou fechar, influenciando diretamente a progress√£o da narrativa.

No entanto, minha experi√™ncia com o jogo foi prejudicada por um bug que me obrigou a retornar ao menu principal e recarregar o jogo. Infelizmente, isso resultou na perda de progresso, exigindo que eu refizesse o percurso, o que foi frustrante, especialmente por j√° ter coletado diversos itens antes do erro ocorrer.

Um dos pontos mais positivos do jogo √© o uso do √°udio binaural, que proporciona uma imers√£o intensa √† medida que avan√ßamos pela floresta densa. Assim como em Hellblade: Senua‚Äôs Sacrifice, recomenda-se jogar com fones de ouvido para uma experi√™ncia mais envolvente.

Em conclus√£o, Blair Witch √© um jogo cativante, cuja narrativa se desenrola gradativamente, prendendo a aten√ß√£o do jogador e despertando cada vez mais interesse na hist√≥ria. Apesar de pequenos problemas t√©cnicos, o jogo entrega uma experi√™ncia imersiva e envolvente para os f√£s do g√™nero.

The Blair Witch tells the story of the original movie and lore while also adding its own flair. You learn about the main character and his life and relations while traversing the Black Hills forest in Burkittsville, Maryland, where it all began.

You have your trusty companion dog that helps you along the way. Not only can you give him multiple commands and interactions, but he kinda helps take away some of the horrific tension at times. And you can customize the dogs look to your liking with the options they've provided.

The music and atmospheric tones set the mood for each setting. I had to turn the music off at the end because the game just got so intense.

Some say you can complete it within 6 hours if you skip all the collectibles and backstory. It took me 12 hours and I still managed to miss some things. There are 3 different endings which can be revealed based on the choices you make throughout the game. This allows a bit more replay-ability as you will find yourself highly involved with the character.

I've only completed one ending and I can't wait to see the others. Great game and I got it on sale.

The music and atmospheric tones set the mood for each setting. I had to turn the music off at the end because the game just got so intense.

7.5/10: 
This game is an extremely solid PTSD-Walking Simulator. However, this is not a Blair Witch game.

Pros:
+ Great story, Great Atmosphere, Super spooky/scary/skeletons.
+ Genuinely scary throughout the game.
+ Great finale, not so much the actual ending, but the climax pays off for the experience of the game.
+ Smooth gameplay, great narrative, just in general what makes a good game good is absolutely present.

Cons:
- NOT A BLAIR WITCH HORROR GAME. The stick figures, the "walking in circles" trope, time and space are finnicky trope, the forest / wore down houses trope does strongly emulate the vibe the original Blair Witch was creating. Not mentioning or implementing the original lore of the witch and just extremely occasionally referencing the witch as "Her" does NOT justify putting Blair Witch in the title.

- Shakey Stick man as the Primary antagonist you have to deal with in gameplay is such a shame for a horror game. There is a "Real" primary antagonist you deal with (Which is not the Witch, by the way) that only is face-to-face interacted with through cut scenes.

- The true plot of the game which unfolds through the collectibles / the ending (any of them), is such a cop out. It's a convoluted-mess-copout that genuinely upsets me for how complicated they made it, just to be a copout.

- I do love the puppers just bc he's a good boy, but I want to be a minority here to say the dog mechanic seems tiring rather than immersive.

column8: Juegazo,tkm Bullet
me encanta la ambientacion, la historia y los problemas mentales que conllevan algun personas debi a grandes problemas y traumas que han pasado en su vida. te mantiene tenso todo el juego.

Me tomo dos veces intentar terminar este juego.

Lo prob√© una vez hace unos a√±os y despu√©s de una hora lo cerr√© porque me pareci√≥ aburrido y no le ve√≠a futuro, pero hace unos d√≠as decid√≠ darle otra oportunidad y en parte me sorprendi√≥, pero por otra me decepciono un poco.

Al comienzo es MUUY lento, camina ac√°, camina all√°, y b√°sicamente de eso se trata el juego, caminar mientras vas encontrando objetos in√∫tiles, como fotos (que son casi 50), chapitas de soldado, mu√±ecos de madera y basura como botellas o cajas de cigarrillo. Aclarando que TODO esto mencionado anteriormente no sirve de nada para la trama.

Tenemos un compa√±ero canino llamado "Bullet", el cual si bien uno se encari√±a, en varias situaciones llega a ser molesto, ya que su animaci√≥n se bugea o Bullet se queda dando vueltas haci√©ndonos marear hacia donde es que tenemos que ir realmente, o incluso entorpeciendo los momentos en donde Bullet nos tiene que avisar donde hay un monstruo, y este mira en otra direcci√≥n en la que no hay nada...

Hay dos tipos de "monstruos", unos hechos de ramas los cuales apuntando con el mouse "mueren", y otros que no son mas que unas pilas de hojas que tenemos que evitar. Ambos fallan en hacernos sentir miedo o tensi√≥n.

Casi reci√©n al final del juego las cosas empiezan a mejorar, pero siento que al final pusieron todas las mejores herramientas de una sola vez y todo seguido, quedando as√≠ muy sobrecargado de "sustos" y momentos tensos al punto donde ya uno se pregunta ir√≥nicamente "¬øalgo mas?".

Blair Witch me deja sentimientos confusos, nose si me gusto, me aburri√≥, o me dejo confundido. Pero lo que si se, es que la historia, las mec√°nicas y el entorno se pudieran haber aprovechado todo de una manera muuucho mas eficiente para llegar a un mejor resultado, siento que ten√≠an las herramientas para hacer un incre√≠ble juego de terror y no supieron utilizarlas.

Si te interesa una narrativa ambientada en terror, puede que sea tu juego, pero si lo que buscas es pasar un momento tenso de mucho terror y miedo, entonces hay mejores entregas que esta.
Esta muy bien, pero se me hizo muy pesado

Its a creepy game with some cool elements and interesting gameplay mechanics that feels a bit "rough" on the edges sometimes. The first half is a basically a stroll trough the woods, I had several moments where I was completely lost which got annoying at some point. Sometimes my dog got stuck or took forever to do something I told him. Graphically it looks very good on 4K but you also need a very good graphic card, in my opinion its not very good optimized for pc. The game is pretty short, which I find isn't a problem as long its good. My main problem is that besides the famous blair witch totems and some dialoge snippets you would never know that this game is settled in the Blair Witch universe. I would have loved more references to the movies and even to the old Blair Witch games. In the end a solid and creepy game.

column8: Good

Okay, if in addition to feeling fear you also want to experience an interesting story, this game is the one. The main character himself has many problems and struggles with demons of the past, and he is helped by his faithful dog friend, to whom we quickly become attached. Thanks to him we do not feel lonely, and as soon as he disappears from the screen, even for a moment, we want him to come back as soos as possible. He is not only there to make us feel good, but we can also give him various commands, e.g. to find something for us or even he can find garbage that we can pick up to take care of our planet. Quite a nice addition. Apart from that, you can pet him (which i think is the best thing in this game), feed him a treat, or even scold him, but if you do something likt that, what kind of person are you anyway? And therefore, depending on how we treat him, there will be consequences later. The graphics are very good and the game keeps you in suspense with creepy sounds and scares that can really make your heart beat faster, but the biggest challange comes at the end of the game... One thing that irritated me a bit is that on the first playthrough it si, so to speak, quit difficult to get a good ending.

The main character himself has many problems and struggles with demons of the past, and he is helped by his faithful dog friend, to whom we quickly become attached. Thanks to him we do not feel lonely, and as soon as he disappears from the screen, even for a moment, we want him to come back as soos as possible. He is not only there to make us feel good, but we can also give him various commands, e.g. to find something for us or even he can find garbage that we can pick up to take care of our planet. Quite a nice addition. Apart from that, you can pet him (which i think is the best thing in this game), feed him a treat, or even scold him, but if you do something likt that, what kind of person are you anyway? And therefore, depending on how we treat him, there will be consequences later. The graphics are very good and the game keeps you in suspense with creepy sounds and scares that can really make your heart beat faster, but the biggest challange comes at the end of the game... One thing that irritated me a bit is that on the first playthrough it si, so to speak, quit difficult to get a good ending.

column8:
After playing their banger Silent Hill 2 Remake, I wanted to give this a try. I really wanted to like this game and it started off promising but I didn't really enjoy this. Bullet and his mechanics were done perfectly though. I loved the dog so much and the entire first part in the woods was great with stunning visuals and good atmosphere.

However, after reaching the sawmill I truly couldn't enjoy this anymore. Too much talking, way too much of this entire war trauma stuff. The annoying phone calls with the wife, the whispering witch, the antagonist talking endlessly. All atmosphere was gone for me and the last part in the ruined building was driving me crazy. Darkness, constant heavy breathing, repeating tasks and it just went on forever reusing the exact same textures and assets. It would have been fine but not that long because all I cared about was the dog that was suddenly unimportant in the game.

I might enjoy this more in a second playthrough but the first time felt too much like a chore to complete. Also, I would have loved to explore the forest. It could have been more open world, less invisible walls and for the love of God, add a compass. 

I constantly had the feeling that the game was rushing me. There were many different types of collectibles but I never really had that rewarding feeling of getting them all because the plot, while being slow and dragged out, was still pushing me along. Overall not a good experience.

EDIT: changed my review to positive after getting the supposed good ending. It's a pain in the neck to get but actually, after a total of three playthroughs, I can see how much care and thought went into this game so I can no longer just say that I'm not recommeding this.

column8:
After spending 120+ hours fully completing Blair Witch, unlocking all achievements, and watching every ending, I can confidently say this is one of the most immersive psychological horror experiences ever. The atmosphere is tense, with eerie visuals and a constant sense of dread that never fades. The sound design and dynamic lighting make the forest feel alive, and Bullet, your canine companion, adds an emotional layer rarely seen in horror games. While pacing can be slow at times, the game excels at psychological storytelling, making every moment unsettling yet gripping. A must-play for horror fans.

Pros:
Incredible atmosphere with a deep psychological horror feel
Stunning sound design that enhances immersion
Multiple endings that add replay value
Bullet the dog makes for a unique and emotional companion

Cons:
Pacing can feel slow in certain sections
Some mechanics can be repetitive over time

Overall Score: 7.5/10

column8:
Cherche enfant disparu... Trouve frustration.
Il est surprenant de se dire que ce Blair Witch, sorti en 2019, a √©t√© r√©alis√© par l‚Äôun des studios les plus en vue de 2024 : Bloober Team. En effet, les d√©veloppeurs du tr√®s appr√©ci√© Silent Hill 2 Remake sont aux commandes de ce petit jeu ind√© reprenant la c√©l√®bre s√©rie de films sortis au d√©but des ann√©es 2000. Le rapprochement entre les deux jeux n‚Äôest pas anodin car les personnages principaux des deux titres se ressemblent beaucoup que ce soit le visage ou vestimentairement parlant. Au-del√† de l‚Äôanecdote, l‚Äôaspect visuel du jeu est une franche r√©ussite. Optant pour un r√©alisme photographique, la for√™t et les divers lieux dans lesquels vous vous engouffrez sont plus vrais que nature et on doit saluer le travail des √©quipes car m√™me six ans apr√®s, Blair Witch n‚Äôa pas √† rougir de sa r√©alisation technique. Pourquoi se promener dans cette for√™t maudite, me direz-vous ? Et bien l‚Äôhistoire nous entra√Æne √† la recherche d‚Äôun jeune gar√ßon disparu, une battue est rapidement organis√©e avec la police. Peu √† peu, les √©v√©nements prennent une tournure plus personnelle et horrifique. Le jeu mise habilement sur l‚Äôaspect psychologique en exploitant avec subtilit√© les propri√©t√©s √©tranges de la for√™t pour brouiller les fronti√®res entre r√©alit√© et hallucinations. C‚Äôest d‚Äôailleurs un √©l√©ment central du gameplay, mais j‚Äôai eu du mal √† l‚Äôappr√©cier pleinement. En effet, rien n‚Äôest vraiment expliqu√© au d√©part, et c‚Äôest uniquement apr√®s avoir tourn√© en rond que l‚Äôon comprend que la for√™t nous manipule. Afin de retrouver son chemin deux atouts sont √† votre disposition : votre fid√®le compagnon, un berger allemand capable d‚Äôaller d√©nicher des objets et de grogner dans la direction d‚Äôune menace ; votre camescope, l‚Äô√©l√©ment de gameplay le plus original du jeu. En fouillant l‚Äôenvironnement, vous trouverez parfois des cassettes d‚Äôenregistrement √©clairant le pass√© proche d‚Äôun lieu. En retrouvant physiquement le lieu d‚Äôenregistrement de ces bandes visuelles, et en observant le lieu via l‚Äô√©cran du camescope, il sera possible de reconstituer certains lieux du pass√© et de les modifier au pr√©sent. L‚Äôid√©e est folle, le principe est canon mais dans la pratique c‚Äôest de la turbo merde car tout est tr√®s script√©, j‚Äôai pass√© 30 minutes sur l‚Äôune de ces reconstitutions en d√©but de jeu (l‚Äôarbre qui tombe pour ceux qui connaissent) mais cela ne fonctionnait pas car il me manquait une note ou une connerie du genre. En r√©alit√©, Blair Witch poss√®de quelques fonctionnalit√©s sympathiques que ce soit le chien, le sentiment de d√©sorientation provoqu√©e par la for√™t, le camescope mais l‚Äôapprentissage de ces m√©caniques se fait dans la douleur car on ne vous explique rien. Qu‚Äôen est-il de la peur ? Sans doute le point le plus d√©cevant du jeu. J‚Äôai termin√© Blair Witch d‚Äôune traite (environ 8 heures pour en venir √† bout en prenant largement son temps), donc le jeu sait accrocher le joueur en proposant tout de m√™me une aventure myst√©rieuse et prenante mais franchement, le trouillom√®tre est √† z√©ro. Les entit√©s cherchent √† vous encercler ou vous surprendre par-derri√®re, mais rien de bien m√©morable et la fin ressemble √† n‚Äôimporte quel jeu d‚Äôhorreur dans lequel une menace patrouille dans une zone et vous devez vous faufiler sous peine de vous faire croquer. Rien d‚Äôoriginal, rien de tr√®s effrayant. Promesse non tenue en ce qui me concerne mais c‚Äôest toujours pareil, le barom√®tre de la peur est une question tr√®s subjective et d√©pendra des joueurs. Sur une √©chelle objective de peur en affirmant que Visage et From the Darkness sont √† 10 et Super Mario Galaxy et Kirby et le monde oubli√© √† 1, Blair Witch se situe entre 5 et 6.

En conclusion, Blair Witch est un jeu √† la r√©alisation soign√©e qui parvient √† recr√©er l‚Äôambiance oppressante de la c√©l√®bre saga cin√©matographique, gr√¢ce √† des environnements immersifs et un travail technique toujours impressionnant, m√™me plusieurs ann√©es apr√®s sa sortie. Cependant, si son concept et ses m√©caniques de jeu, notamment le cam√©scope et le chien, sont int√©ressants sur le papier, leur ex√©cution laisse parfois √† d√©sirer, rendant la progression frustrante √† cause d‚Äôun manque de clart√© et d‚Äôune rigidit√© excessive dans la conception. C√¥t√© frissons, le jeu peine √† tenir ses promesses. Si l‚Äôatmosph√®re angoissante fonctionne par moments, les m√©caniques horrifiques restent trop classiques et pr√©visibles, ce qui en fait une exp√©rience plus intrigante que r√©ellement terrifiante. Au final, Blair Witch propose une aventure sympatoche, loin de r√©volutionner le genre, et dont l‚Äôimpact horrifique se situe quelque part entre le moyen et l'oubliable.

Blair Witch √© um jogo que realmente te testa psicologicamente criando um ambiente silencioso e aterrorizante. Voc√™ constantemente sente uma sensa√ß√£o estranha, um certo mal-estar, algo muito parecido com o que acontece com os personagens do pr√≥prio filme. Os Desenvolvedores souberam criar uma atmosfera que fizesse com que voc√™ ficasse imerso no jogo, como se o jogador fosse o protagonista da hist√≥ria.
Esse jogo n√£o √© do tipo de que vai te deixar com medo de uma criatura ou monstro, mas ele procura te mostrar como seria a sensa√ß√£o de ser manipulado pela Bruxa, de estar sozinho em um ambiente amaldi√ßoado em busca de n√£o perder a sanidade.

Have you heard of the Blair Witch? No? Well let me tell you about my relationship problems and PTSD instead.

The story is absolutely horrendous and an insult to the masterpiece that is the Blair Witch Project.
The envirnoment is "alright" but you cant expect alot of diversity in a story that plays out in the woods.
Mechanics are minimal, you sometimes use an item on an environmental object, and you interact with the best (and only good) part of the game ; your dog.

The game is mostly a walking sim, with a story that has NOTHING to do with the Blair Witch.

2/10, tediously boring experience, do NOT recommend, not even on a sale.
