column8:
A beautiful nothing burger.

The graphics look great, the atmosphere and "lost in the woods" vibe is really cool. I even thought the the concept of the dog mechanics was really cool, and the tapes changing the world around you was another cool idea. The menus were even a cut above all the other boring grid inventories. Unfortunately, those are the only real upsides to this game.

The story is disjointed and confusing. I don't find this game scary at all. The first half is pretty decent, but somewhere in the second half i remember thinking "can this just be over already..." countless times. walking down the same corridor 9 times DOES NOTHING to enhance the story that already cant decide if its a rescue, murder mystery, or ghost story. The house is a nightmare, less of a fear based nightmare and more of a stuck at the DMV for 4 hours kind of nightmare. It's a fucking shame because layers of fear was an absolute banger. Also save yourself some trouble and quit before the ending, its so anticlimactic. ALSO, Outlast already did the camcorder thing and they did it WAY better than you guys, if you are gonna use that trope please shake things up a bit. It made the monsters LESS SCARY by turning them into vibrating red sticks on screen. Also *potential spoiler* wtf is up with the tumbleweed monsters, yall really couldnt come up with a better monster than a rolling ball of leaves??? Also theres only 2 bullet commands you will ever really use, heel or (stay close) and search, the rest arent needed at all in the story. The story was just TOO open ended. its not clear what voices are jess and what is the witch, its unclear if WE the player commited all these crimes or if it was carver. they used the same voice actor for some of carvers lines as they did the main character. I thought this was some setup to reveal that WE were carver but we were just his replacement. None of the story made enough sense for you to care about it. Like i said, first half was a pleasant experience and the second half left me annoyed exhausted and bored.

column8:
Buy on sale.  This game is short, 4-5 hours short.  The gameplay is barely existent as it's a walking and call for your dog simulator... that being said it relies heavily on atmosphere, from the visual and audio department, and it excels at that.  You can feel the PTSD that the main character is going through, and the panic he feels when alone feels genuine as well.  

Of course, how you are expected to play through it hurts it in my opinion.  The typical ending one gets while playing the first time definitely fits as a horror title, at least.

column8: Estava procurando um jogo de terror para jogar, e esse me surpreendeu e muito. Tudo nele √© bom, a trilha sonora, jogabilidade, hist√≥ria, e entre outros. A √∫nica coisa que me incomodou um pouco foi o final, no qual fiquei at√© com dor de cabe√ßa kkkkkk (e voc√™ vai entender o porqu√™), mas tirando isso o jogo √© perfeito. Enfim, se voc√™ ta procurando um jogo de terror pra jogar, d√™ uma chance para esse pois ele n√£o vai te decepcionar. Um abra√ßo!

Potreste cagarvi sotto come potreste pensare che faccia cagare, √® un horror psicologico come dice quindi tenta di incutere pi√π ansia e timore e non gioca molto sul fattore jumpscare; che dire, ci avevo gi√† giocato su xbox quindi alcune cose le ricordavo ma la trama abbastanza intricata l'ho praticamente riscoperta; mi piace come tiene conto delle tue azioni con Bullet (il nostro accompagnatore canino nella foresta) e addirittura le scene finali cambiano a seconda di come lo abbiamo trattato, si ho detto scene perch√® ci sono 4 finali, 2 buoni e 2; non ho ancora fatto il playtrough per ottenere un finale buono anche perch√® ho visto un tutorial tempo fa ed √® abbastanza un casino per√≤ ne varr√† sicuramente la pena, quindi a tempo perso lo far√≤.
Paura 8/10 Ansia 9/10 Storia 9/10 Plot twist sul finale 10/10 (sono soggettive quindi magari per voi non sar√† cos√¨)
Se non volete sapere nulla della storia non leggete la prossima parte.
SPOILER
SPOILER
SPOILER
Giochiamo come Ellis un ex marine (immagino, non √® specificato) che ha guidato i suoi uomini in un imboscata e ha ottenuto una sindrome post-traumatica da stress che sar√† MOLTO e dico MOLTO ricorrente nel gioco, tornato a casa si separa con la moglie o ragazza (anche questo non specificato) di nome Jess proprio a causa del PTSD, entra a far parte della polizia di Burkittsville (una cosa del genere comunque dove si trova la foresta di Blair anche nei film) e gli viene affidato dallo sceriffo Bullet, un cane che ha anche lui una storia abbastanza traumatica a detta dello sceriffo ma che a noi √® sconosciuta, con Bullet, Ellis sembra avere un miglioramento con il PTSD ma in assenza di Bullet potrebbe prendere il sopravvento (quindi Bullet tenetelo vicino, non succede nulla per√≤ comincia ad ansimare e vedete tutto offuscato), il nostro obbiettivo nella foresta √® quello di trovare un bambino scomparso di nome Peter; la foresta sembra essere divisa quasi a livelli dove se non completi l'enigma girerai sempre in cerchio finendo per trovarti sempre nelle stesse zone, in aiuto arriva una telecamera che riproducendo dei nastri con poteri sovrannaturali riavvolge il tempo di determinati oggetti intorno a voi o addirittura fa comparire oggetti che prima non c'erano. 
Bene, questo mi pare sia tutto.

Um detalhe que me chamou muito a aten√ß√£o no jogo, foi o final (√© um pouco prolongado demais) que se passou na constru√ß√£o que aparece no filme remake. No filme, a ultima sobrevivente busca ajuda ali e acaba por morrer. Mas o motivo da constru√ß√£o simplesmente n√£o √© explicado no filme. E a explica√ß√£o do jogo √© super compr√°vel. 
Gostei da mec√¢nica do cachorro (spoiler) poder trazer um final secreto caso voc√™ o trate bem durante todo o jogo. Me senti "recompensado" pelo meu carinho. 
Voltando ao jogo em si, ele possui algo que eu considero a melhor coisa dentro do universo de A Bruxa de Blair, que √©: A demonstra√ß√£o de poder da bruxa. No filme, ela n√£o √© simplesmente uma bruxa, ela √© uma entidade poderosa, capaz de distorcer a ralidade e o tempo. E isso √© mostrado com maestria no jogo. Trazendo uma sensa√ß√£o de estar lidando com algum tipo de deus dimensional. E a forma como √© mostrada a insignific√¢ncia do protagonista contra ela s√≥ melhora a experi√™ncia.
Enfim, me satisfiz com o jogo e fiquei contente com o final secreto que liberei de primeira. Recomendo para quem busca um jogo de terror que n√£o seja t√£o gen√©rico e claro, recomendo para os f√£s de filmes de terror/horror psicol√≥gico.

column8:
Pretty good horror without annoying screamers and with oppressive atmosphere of the forest.
The Forest. The Forest here is dark, creepy and ... alive.
The dog, in my opinion, was unnecessary. You need often distract by it, which disturb from immersing yourself in the game.
Also, I think the last level is quite playing for time.
So, I recommend Blair Witch to make perfect a couple of evenings.

column8:
Solid horror game and would recommend to anyone considering purchasing. Good atmosphere, solid jump-scares, and an engaging story.

I think the only complaint I could have about the game is the audio for the voice lines was inconsistent at times, but definitely a tiny complaint in comparison to how good the game is.
Oh and having scold right next to seek on bullet commands :( treats and praise were given when accidentally selecting it.

column8:
So the game was ok, not the worst game I've played but still a little meh. Mainly because of it's shortness and linear gameplay (played it through in one sitting under 5 hours), the forest looked like it could be roamed more openly. I still liked the forest how it looked and the ambience, also having the dog as a companion reminded me slightly of Haunting Ground and Rule of Rose. The worst part was the house at the final chapter, it was too long and frustrating.
Fighting against monsters using flashlights to kill them reminded me of Alan Wake, but I heard devs took inspiration from AW.

There's 2 endings so you have to play again to see the second one (and I'm pretty sure all players get the same ending as their first one, because some of the requirements for the another ending seems weird and make no sense at all) + you get an optional item in the final parts of the game and you can only use that item on your 2nd playthrough (I heard it carries with you on the next playthrough you do). There's also lots of collectibles and you won't probably find all of them in the first playthrough (if you even want to collect all the collectible items) and some points in the plot have a different outcome in the end depending how you interacted in the situations (the game doesn't tell you this though, you have to figure it out yourself so this is another thing people don't do on their first playthrough and miss them).
So probably this game is 100% completed after 2 or 3 playthroughs.

There were some references to the Blair Witch lore seen on the movies and in the older pc games from 2000, not many but enough for who is familiar with the franchise. Most people recognize the town name Burkittsville and of course the stick figures or twanas (like they were called in the old Blair Witch games) and the house which looks same as Rustin Parr's house in the movie and old games.

I probably recommend to play this at least once if you're interested in the theme of Blair Witch or horror games placed in a forest. I got this as a gift from a friend, but I still think you should buy this game from a sale.

um jogo que mexe com o seu psicol√≥gico at√© demais!! Aii se o protagonista n tivesse o bullet para fazer companhia..

Sobre o jogo:

A hist√≥ria √© bem interessante e de tirar o folego! Infelizmente quando c√™ chega na parte da casa, fica INSUPORT√ÅVEL de t√£o escasso e repet√≠vo! De longe um dos jogos que vai conseguir mexer com o psicol√≥gico do jogador facilmente!

ai vai uma frase cl√°ssica em q eu soltei ao fim do game - "pq e como eu n tinha descoberto esse jogo bem antes?"

Depois de 21 horas de gameplay para completar a platina venho aqui deixar a minha an√°lise.

Inicialmente esque√ßa as poucas an√°lises negativas que viu por ai. De in√≠cio, tamb√©m n√£o esperava muito do t√≠tulo, afinal d√° a entender que se trata de um game baseado no fraqu√≠ssimo filme de 1999. Por sorte eu estava terrivelmente enganado.

O jogo √© excelente na hist√≥ria bem como nas mec√¢nicas. O terror √© impec√°vel, ainda que care√ßa de persegui√ß√µes ala Resident Evil e outros do g√™nero. A companhia do doguinho bullet vem como a cereja do bolo, uma vez que ele acaba sendo um guia espiritual e fiel escudeiro do Ellis no decorrer da jornada.

Outro ponto a se destacar √© que nos 17 cap√≠tulos os cen√°rios conseguem nos surpreender pela variedade e possibilidades de explora√ß√£o, inclusive com itens bem escondidos na floresta (que √© um verdadeiro labirinto) em meio a sua escurid√£o.

Como pontos fracos pode-se destacar dois pontos: a dura√ß√£o que gira em torno de 5-6 horas para os mais exploradores e talvez (bem talvez) care√ßa de uma explora√ß√£o mais detalhada da rela√ß√£o Ellis-Bullet.

Sem d√∫vidas um dos melhores t√≠tulos de terror dos √∫ltimos 10 anos. 9/10.
Em poucas horas aderi estresse p√≥s traum√°tico, eu e o protagonista n√£o somos mais o mesmo.

Kurzweiliger Horror mit dichter Atmosph√§re und coolen Gameplay!

J'ai voulu me lancer dans l'aventure parce que ce jeu a √©t√© fait par la Bloober Team et que j'ai vraiment ador√© les Layers of Fear, mais pour celui-ci, malgr√© diff√©rents aspects tr√®s positifs, je dois dire que je m'ennuie ferme et qu'il y a plus d'aspects frustrants que d'√©l√©ments agr√©ables √† mes yeux.

C√¥t√© visuel c'est tr√®s bien, les environnements sont bien r√©alis√©s, le voice acting est bon et les cin√©matiques qui ponctuent le tout tr√®s bien. On a en plus un toutou avec nous et le syst√®me d'interaction avec le chien est vraiment original et tr√®s cool. Mais bien trop souvent, je me suis retrouv√©e √† tourner en rond et √† ne pas savoir quoi faire. M√™me en faisant bien attention au chien et en utilisant les fonctionnalit√©s propos√©es, on peut facilement passer √† c√¥t√© de certains √©l√©ments permettant d'avancer dans l'histoire et se retrouver l√† comme des cons √† se demander quoi faire et √† errer dans la for√™t pendant des plombes.

M√™me chose avec le syst√®me de vid√©os. [spoiler]Certaines permettent de modifier quelque chose dans ce qui se passe pour notre perso [/spoiler], le probl√®me c'est que ce n'est vraiment pas √©vident de trouver √† quoi pr√™ter attention sur certaines cassettes et on doit y aller au pif plut√¥t qu'en suivant une logique. 

Il faut dire aussi que passer autant de temps √† tourner dans une for√™t de nuit n'a rien de fun √† mes yeux, et encore moins de flippant. Le jeu ne fait vraiment pas peur, sauf peut-√™tre si vous n'avez jamais jou√© √† un jeu d'horreur de votre vie. 

Autre b√©mol : Le fait que notre t√©l√©phone sonne r√©guli√®rement m'a vraiment cass√© les couilles. Je comprends que certains √©l√©ments soient n√©cessaires √† la progression de l'histoire, mais quand m√™me. √áa aurait √©t√© tr√®s sympa d'avoir une option pour d√©sactiver le t√©l√©phone au moins pour tout ce qui n'est pas essentiel √† l'histoire. J'ai trouv√© que √ßa venait casser l'immersion en nous ramenant √† notre r√©alit√© quotidienne plus qu'autre chose et c'√©tait p√©nible.

Je n'ai pas termin√© le jeu, mais je ne sais vraiment pas si je vais y retourner pour finir. Disons que ce que j'ai vu jusque l√† ne vient pas assez me chercher pour me permettre de passer au dessus des aspects frustrants du jeu. A ce moment l√† autant regarder quelqu'un d'autre jouer et arr√™ter de se prendre la t√™te. 

En bref pour ceux qui cherchent du vrai jeu d'horreur avec du rythme, des jumpscares, etc. ce titre ne sera sans doute pas fait pour vous. L'aspect narratif est tr√®s bien, mais il y a trop d'√©l√©ments lourdingues pour que l'exp√©rience globale soit vraiment appr√©ciable.

column8:
Je ressors satisfait de cette aventure. Blair Witch est une exp√©rience vid√©o-ludique immersive dans laquelle je me suis senti pleinement impliqu√©. Le jeu est plut√¥t court mais ne donne pas l'impression de rester sur sa faim tant il joue sur votre perception de l'espace et du temps, dans un sc√©nario finalement plus Thriller psychologique qu'Horreur au pied de la lettre. J'ai appr√©ci√© les effets graphiques li√©s √† notre √©tat psy, et les id√©es de gameplay mis en place [spoiler]LE CHIENG![/spoiler], bien qu'on pourrait parler d'un walking simulator et que l'aspect "je tourne en rond inlassablement" ne plaira pas √† tout le monde. J'ai lu avant d'y jouer que l'histoire √©tait vite pr√©visible, et c'est vrai, donc passez votre chemin si vous √™tes l√† pour voir un vrai plot twist digne de ce nom. Et pour ceux qui veulent simplement vivre une exp√©rience le temps d'une [longue] balade en for√™t, foncez !

C√¥t√© n√©gatif, j'ai tout de m√™me rencontr√© quelques points de frustration : une fois √† cause d'un soucis de game design (√† mon sens) qui m'a fait tourner en rond un bon moment alors que la solution √©tait compl√®tement stupide [spoiler]CETTE SATAN√âE VALVE QU'IL FALLAIT REGARDER D'UN BON ANGLE DE VUE[/spoiler].
Et 2 gros bugs m'ont √©galement fait perdre du temps car je n'ai pas tout de suite compris qu'il s'agissait de bugs.
[spoiler]- Les ennemies qui n'apparaissaient pas dans la camera lors de la travers√©e dans le brouillard[/spoiler]
[spoiler]- Apr√®s √™tre mort au "reste dans le coin", j'ai respawn dans un couloir sans issue (aucune interaction possible avec les portes pr√©sentes)[/spoiler]
Je trouve que le jeu vaut vraiment le coup d'√™tre jou√© malgr√© cela !

Blair Witch turned out to be pretty good walking simulator. 
It isn't really scary but is very interesting, with unique ptsd theme and gameplay mechanics.
I was somewhat  pessimistic about the game at first because most of it take place in the wood, difficult ground to make it interesting, but graphics is so fantastic in this title that I was captivated!
I've never seen forest so detailed and realistic in video game, it's amazing! 
Our  protagonist is very sick man with traumatic memories, constantly phasing in and out of psychosis, and great visuals emphasize on that, mixing forest with arabic cities and battlefields, whole game feels like one, big, bad narcotic trip and it's fantastic!
I also really liked camera mechanics, being able to bend time and twist reality worked really well, and also dog companion, although I have to admit it felt only half-cooked, I found only two commands for dog useful, which were search and stay close, occasionally to pet but overall mechanics of dog could be bettter, with more use for other commands and some agressive options...
Most of the time game worked great, but there were few minor glitches with items not working properly or being uninteractivable, but quickloading always resolved those problems...
I wholeheartedly recommend!

A hidden gem for sure! There's gonna be a few points where you have no idea what the hell is going on, hardly grasping the story, and feeling like you're trapped in a loop. But, that is very much what the game wants (and it succeeds), it makes you feel lost in the woods, unsure of what's real and what's fake. In this way, you can become surprisingly immersed and invested, any hint of progress feels great. If you are at all interested in the Blair Witch lore/world, pick this game up! It is an enthralling and exciting environment with several seamless and cinematic moments in game that physically sent chills down my spine. I will forever adore this game and suggest it to anyone with a passing interest, Bloober Team has done a fantastic job here.

column8: It was not a bad game. If you are a veteran horror gamer or watcher, you most likely will not find this game scary, but more eerie. They did a great job with the soundtracks and audio cues giving you chills at certain points in the game. What made me stay throughout the game was the wonderful story line which was engaging and creating, and the developers brought it all full circle at the end. This game has alternate endings, (I only played one of them), but I'm not sure how much that changes the play through depending on the choices you make. My biggest critic and ultimate let down of this game was the utter lack of jump scares throughout the game. I think I recall only 2 of them. There were many points in the game where a jump scare felt appropriate and I was simply left disappointed at the end. If you are thinking that this game will have actually jumpy content that will make you scream, than you will be disappointed. That being said, if you are novice horror player, or simply get scared easily, than this would be a great game for you.

Bien que "Blair Witch" ait suscit√© des opinions mitig√©es lors de sa sortie, il y a plusieurs aspects du jeu qui m√©ritent d'√™tre salu√©s, notamment :

Atmosph√®re immersive : Le jeu parvient √† capturer l'atmosph√®re oppressante et angoissante de l'univers de Blair Witch. Les environnements sombres et forestiers, accompagn√©s d'une bande-son immersive, plongent le joueur dans une exp√©rience vraiment immersive.

Narration et intrigue : "Blair Witch" offre une histoire intrigante qui explore des th√®mes sombres et psychologiques. Les indices subtils et les √©l√©ments de narration diss√©min√©s dans le jeu incitent les joueurs √† rester engag√©s et curieux tout au long de l'aventure.

Interaction avec le chien : Bullet, le fid√®le compagnon canin du protagoniste, est un √©l√©ment remarquable du jeu. La relation entre le joueur et le chien est bien d√©velopp√©e, offrant des moments de tension et de r√©confort tout au long de l'exp√©rience de jeu.

Gameplay innovant : "Blair Witch" propose des m√©caniques de gameplay int√©ressantes, notamment l'utilisation d'une cam√©ra pour r√©soudre des √©nigmes et explorer l'environnement. Cette approche novatrice ajoute une dimension suppl√©mentaire √† l'exp√©rience de jeu et contribue √† maintenir l'int√©r√™t du joueur.

Rejouabilit√© : Avec plusieurs fins possibles et des choix qui influencent le d√©roulement de l'histoire, "Blair Witch" offre une certaine rejouabilit√©. Les joueurs peuvent √™tre incit√©s √† explorer diff√©rentes voies narratives pour d√©couvrir toutes les subtilit√©s de l'intrigue.

En somme, "Blair Witch" r√©ussit √† capturer l'essence de l'horreur psychologique du film original tout en offrant une exp√©rience de jeu interactive et immersive. Malgr√© quelques d√©fauts, notamment des probl√®mes techniques parfois rencontr√©s, le jeu parvient √† fournir une exp√©rience inqui√©tante et m√©morable pour les amateurs d'horreur.

column8:
Blair Witch ist f√ºr mich ein zweischneidiges Schwert. Einerseits bin ich absolut empf√§nglich f√ºr Horrorspiele die sich in W√§ldern abspielen, andererseits ist das Ende von dem Spiel einfach nicht gut. 

Aber erstmal von Vorne. 

Der Wald ist sehr schick inszeniert, der Begleiter in Form von Komissar Rex ist nicht nur s√ºss, sondern auch n√ºtzlich. Wir suchen Hinweise, wir erleben Flashbacks, der "Wald" will uns zunehmend verr√ºckt machen. Das klappt auch alles bis Mitte des Games noch ganz gut, aber um so weiter wir uns dem Ende n√§hern, um so repetitiver wird der Horror. Man wirft dem Spieler gegen Ende alles vor die F√º√üe, was das Szenario so hergibt, leider viel zu lange und zu oft. Die letzte Spielstunde (das Spiel ist ohnehin nur sehr kurz, etwa 7h) wollte ich einfach nur endlich zu einem Ende kommen. Ich denke h√§tte man die letzte Spielstunde deutlich k√ºrzer gestaltet, w√ºrde ich dieses Spiel uneingeschr√§nkt empfehlen. Aber so bleibt immer ein kleiner Beigeschmack. Bis Spielmitte allerdings, wei√ü das game aber wie guter dezenter Grusel funktioniert.

Ich bewerte es trotzdem noch positiv, weil es mich insgesamt gut unterhalten hat. Die geringe Wertung von 53% Spielspass von 4Players kann ich nicht nachvollziehen, auch wenn ich sonst die eher kritischen Bewertungen teile. Die 78% von der Gamepro finde ich allerdings ein paar Prozentpunkte zu hoch. 

F√ºr ein paar Euro im Sale ist es durchaus ein Blick wert. Wer W√§lder tags√ºber liebt, und sich nachts darin f√ºrchtet, der wird mit Blair Witch nichts falsch machen.

[h2]Explorando la Oscuridad[/h2]

Blair Witch te sumerge en una experiencia inquietante inspirada en la conocida franquicia de pel√≠culas de terror. Desarrollado por Bloober Team, el juego adopta una perspectiva en primera persona mientras te aventuras en los bosques embrujados de Burkittsville, Maryland. Con una narrativa intrigante, mec√°nicas de juego envolventes y una atm√≥sfera tensa, ofrece una experiencia que desaf√≠a tus nervios.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3192880596

[b]Narrativa y Personajes:[/b]
La historia sigue a Ellis, un exoficial de polic√≠a en busca de un ni√±o desaparecido en los bosques. Con un pasado turbio y una relaci√≥n complicada con la verdad, Ellis es un protagonista intrigante. A medida que avanza el juego, la l√≠nea entre la realidad y la locura se difumina, lo que agrega capas de misterio y suspenso a la trama.

[b]Atm√≥sfera y Ambientaci√≥n:[/b]
La ambientaci√≥n es uno de los puntos m√°s fuertes del juego. Los densos bosques, los sonidos inquietantes y la iluminaci√≥n opresiva crean una atm√≥sfera claustrof√≥bica y llena de tensi√≥n. Los gr√°ficos y el dise√±o de sonido est√°n bien ejecutados, sumergi√©ndote completamente en el mundo oscuro y desconcertante de la Bruja de Blair.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3191114290

[b]Jugabilidad y Mec√°nicas:[/b]
El juego se centra en la exploraci√≥n y la resoluci√≥n de acertijos, con elementos de terror psicol√≥gico. La mec√°nica principal es el uso de una linterna y una c√°mara para navegar por el entorno oscuro y descubrir pistas. Sin embargo, la sensaci√≥n de vulnerabilidad se intensifica con la presencia constante de la oscuridad y la amenaza de la bruja. Adem√°s, tu relaci√≥n con tu fiel compa√±ero canino, Bullet, a√±ade una capa emocional a la jugabilidad. El cual nos ayudara durante todo el camino. Posee cierta rejugabilidad al contar con varios finales.

[b]Desarrollo del Suspense:[/b]
Es experto en construir y mantener el suspense. A trav√©s de encuentros inquietantes, efectos visuales perturbadores y cambios en el entorno, el juego constantemente te mantiene en vilo. La sensaci√≥n de paranoia y desorientaci√≥n es palpable, lo que hace que cada paso que das sea una experiencia tensa y emocionante.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3189598140

Un juego que logra capturar la esencia de la franquicia cinematogr√°fica mientras ofrece una historia interactiva bien lograda. Con una atm√≥sfera inquietante y mec√°nicas de juego envolventes, es una experiencia que seguramente deleitar√° a los amantes de aventuras psicol√≥gicas.

column8:
A ver... es un walking simulator con muy buena gr√°fica, banda sonora normalita, una optimizaci√≥n bastante decente y terror muy cercano al nulo.

El problema radica que el juego te presenta sus "innovaciones" para decirte "¬øcopado, no?" y luego te hace repetir una y otra y otra y otra y otra vez la misma mec√°nica hasta aburrirla...

Es f√°cil bugearte dentro del juego y rehacer todo de nuevo porque encima el auto grabado y el guardado manual son una mierda que te obliga a jugar desde el principio del capitulo... Ademas hay un bug donde puede desaparecer la partida... de pasarte tenes que cerrar y abrir el juego m√∫ltiples veces hasta que se arregle...

La historia es de lo mas mediocre y cliche, queriendo tener un giro al final pero solo logra llevarte al hartazgo y terminas pidiendo  por favor que el juego termine de una buena vez, el nivel final esta absolutamente alargado innecesariamente porque tampoco aprovecha para ponerte en situaci√≥n... es y "mira esta mec√°nica"... "ahora repetila durante 2 horas"...

El juego tiene m√∫ltiples finales, entiendo que por l√≥gica tiene por lo menos 4 finales... y que la idea de los desarolladores es que por lo menos lo juegues 2 veces.... pero la verdad que si quieren hacer eso el juego no tiene que ser cansino, la historia tiene que levantarte alg√∫n tipo de inter√©s/curiosidad... no podes agarrar un conjunto de mapas lindos, ponerle una historia mediocre, repetir las mismas mec√°nicas una y otra vez, aunque en cierto punto son mecanicas innovadoras, repetirlas hasta el cansancio para despu√©s decirle al jugador "AH Y ESTAR√çA BUENO QUE VUELVAS A JUGAR EL JUEGO" encima que en las 6 horas del juego no logras empatizar con el protagonista, que me da igual lo que le pase, con el ni√±o perdido tambi√©n me da igual, con el elenco de personajes secundarios y terciarios lo mismo, solo quiero que el perro tenga un final feliz, si lo logro ya me da igual el juego y paso de el.

El juego deber√≠a ser solo el nivel final, valer 0,5 dolares como mucho y hubiera sido la demo mas interesante que jugue... si igualmente queres jugarlo espera que lo regale Epic o compralo con un 95% de descuento...
Enche√ß√£o de linguica do caramba, depois que entra na casa √© so ladeira abaixo, se perde 1h naquela casa sem necessidade. Melhorem

Gonna have to give this a thumbs down because the devs ruined the game at the last 1/4 of it. I was enjoying the game up to the point you meet carver. After that the game just went downhill, the devs artificially tried to extend gameplay by stretching way too much looping corridors and levels. Don't even get me started when you reach the ruined house. that was one of the most exasperating and boring gaming I ever did. They over did it, you spend way way way too much time trying to find your way using only the camera, in complete darkness, in a house that never ends, doing the same thing over and over. I almost rage quit and uninstalled the game, not because it was difficult, but because it just would not end and I could not takee that crap anymore. The first 3/4 of the game were actually good, nice gameplay, awesome graphics...

[b]Blair Witch[/b] to specyficzny tytu≈Ç z gatunku horroru psychologicznego w kt√≥rym to gracz wciela siƒô w by≈Çego funkcjonariusza policji po przej≈õciach, biorƒÖcego udzia≈Ç w poszukiwaniach ma≈Çego ch≈Çopca kt√≥ry zaginƒÖ≈Ç w uznawanym przez wszystkich nawiedzonym lesie Black Hills Forest. Razem ze swoim psem bƒôdƒÖ zag≈Çƒôbiaƒá siƒô w te tajemnicze rejony, w kt√≥rych ewidentnie kryje siƒô co≈õ wiƒôcej..

Nie jest to tytu≈Ç dla ka≈ºdego to pewne, mroczna otoczka tworzy dobry klimat delikatnego horroru, jednak≈ºe fabularny aspekt jest bardzo przewidywalny, a rozgrywka liniowa, odczuwalnie na si≈Çƒô rozciƒÖgana co w pewnym momencie zaczyna solidnie nu≈ºyƒá.

[i]Ma≈Ça dygresja:[/i]

1. Nie zwracajcie uwagi na m√≥j czas gry na platformie Steam, gdy≈º jest nieadekwatny z realnym czasem kt√≥ry spƒôdzi≈Çem z tym tytu≈Çem ‚Äì kt√≥ry posiadam i ogrywa≈Çem na innej platformie/mach. Jak r√≥wnie≈º posiadam edycjƒô fizycznƒÖ pude≈ÇkowƒÖ. 

2. Nie zamierzam zdradzaƒá szczeg√≥≈Ç√≥w fabu≈Çy, aby osoba zainteresowana tym tytu≈Çem nie straci≈Ça jednego z g≈Ç√≥wnych element√≥w tej gry.

[h1]Ale do rzeczy:[/h1]
Jak ju≈º nadmieni≈Çem na samym poczƒÖtku tej recenzji mamy tym razem do czynienia z tytu≈Çem z gatunku gier horroru psychologicznego w kt√≥rym to gracz wciela siƒô w by≈Çego funkcjonariusza policji po przej≈õciach, biorƒÖcego udzia≈Ç w poszukiwaniach ma≈Çego ch≈Çopca kt√≥ry zaginƒÖ≈Ç w uznawanym przez wszystkich nawiedzonym lesie Black Hills Forest. Razem ze swoim psem bƒôdƒÖ zag≈Çƒôbiaƒá siƒô w te tajemnicze rejony, w kt√≥rych ewidentnie kryje siƒô co≈õ wiƒôcej..

Fundamentem rozgrywki bƒôdzie piesza eksploracja owego mrocznego lasu w kt√≥rym prowadzone sƒÖ poszukiwania. Przy czym g≈Ç√≥wnym terenowym nawigatorem, obro≈Ñcom oraz poszukiwaczem bƒôdzie nasz przy no≈ºny zwierzak Bullet ‚Äì tak naprawdƒô bez jego pomocy gracz m√≥g≈Çby zapomnieƒá o jakiejkolwiek interakcji z otoczeniem, nie wspominajƒÖc o przesuwaniu fabu≈Çy do przodu. Gracza zadaniem bƒôdzie w g≈Ç√≥wnej mierze podƒÖ≈ºanie za czworono≈ºnym stworzeniem, badajƒÖc poszczeg√≥lne ≈õlady, przedmioty na kt√≥re natrafi na swojej drodze ‚Äì w tym kasety wideo, kt√≥rych paranormalne mo≈ºliwo≈õci mogƒÖ wiele namieszaƒá w samej rozgrywce.  Jak r√≥wnie≈º operowaƒá pomniejszymi przedmiotami jak latarka, telefon, kamera, kr√≥tkofal√≥wka, kt√≥rych znaczenie dla prowadzenia rozgrywki bƒôdzie kluczowe.

Do dyspozycji mamy pewien zas√≥b komend g≈Çosowych, pozwalajƒÖcych wywo≈Çaƒá okre≈õlone dzia≈Çania u Bulleta, od zwyczajnego szukaj, po zosta≈Ñ blisko, przywo≈Çania, zosta≈Ñ itp. Bez tego nasz cyfrowy zwierzak uda≈Çby siƒô w ≈õwiat zostawiajƒÖc nas samym sobie (na pastwƒô losu) ‚Äì co mo≈ºna dostrzec po jego niesfornym, lecz tez w pewnym sensie realistycznie odwzorowanym zachowaniu.  Las jest wykreowany bardzo starannie, wizualnie wyglƒÖda dobrze, chodzenie po nim jest ciekawym do≈õwiadczeniem ‚Äì kt√≥re albo polubicie, albo doprowadzi was do skrajnego znudzenia. 

[h1]Dalej:[/h1]

Nie oszukujmy siƒô nie jest to produkcja kt√≥ra wywo≈Ça w was wiƒôkszych emocji. Je≈ºeli nigdy w ≈ºyciu nie ogra≈Çe≈õ/≈Ça≈õ ≈ºadnego growego horroru (to twoja pierwsza gra), nie widzia≈Çe≈õ/≈Ça≈õ film√≥w na kt√≥rej bazuje owy tytu≈Ç  ‚Äì to byƒá mo≈ºe wywo≈Çaƒá w was silniejsze doznania, ani≈ºeli u gracza kt√≥ry ma za sobƒÖ wiƒôksze rozeznanie/do≈õwiadczenie w tych gatunkach.

Je≈ºeli jednak mieli≈õcie kiedykolwiek styczno≈õƒá z poprzednimi grami tego tw√≥rcy jak Layers of Fear czy te≈º Observer, nie liczƒÖc odmiennych od siebie koncepcyjnie produkcji, to kiedy siƒô dok≈Çadnie przyjrzycie jej fundamentalnym szkielecie to dojdziecie do wniosku ≈ºe bazuje na tej samej psycho-prowadzonej rozgrywce, kt√≥rej ostatecznie wsp√≥lny mianownik jest zawsze ten sam. Zw≈Çaszcza aspekt fabularny, poczƒÖtkowo jest ciekawy jednak po odnalezieniu i przejrzeniu kilku kaset wideo ju≈º wiadomo kto jest g≈Ç√≥wnym winowajcƒÖ tego wszystkiego ‚Äì tu nie trzeba byƒá ksiƒÖ≈ºkowym Sherlockiem Holmes, choƒá tw√≥rcy robiƒÖ wszystko aby namieszaƒá wam w g≈Çowie. Przez co zako≈Ñczenie, nie bƒôdzie a≈º tak satysfakcjonujƒÖce.

Czy to jest z≈Ça gra? na pewno nie, jak ju≈º wspomina≈Çem jest to specyficzny tytu≈Ç, kt√≥ry w zale≈ºno≈õci od waszych growych preferencji oraz wsp√≥≈Çczynnika podatno≈õci na psycho-straszenie bƒôdzie wywo≈Çywaƒá inne/odmienne emocje ‚Äì ‚ÄûMnie osobi≈õcie‚Äù gra znudzi≈Ça jednak w waszym przypadku mo≈ºe wywo≈Çaƒá zupe≈Çnie inne wra≈ºenia.

Co do kwestii technicznych, oprawa audiowizualna jest dobra, sterowanie banalnie proste, choƒá mo≈ºna poczuƒá ≈ºe gra by≈Ça projektowana pod pady, przy czym dobitnie powolne i ociƒô≈ºa≈Çe. W grze nie brakuje te≈º b≈Çƒôd√≥w, zw≈Çaszcza porywcza natura Bulleta potrafi siƒô co chwila zawiesiƒá na elementach otoczenia. 

[h1]Podsumowanie:[/h1]

Blair Witch to specyficzny tytu≈Ç z gatunku horroru psychologicznego w kt√≥rym to gracz wciela siƒô w by≈Çego funkcjonariusza policji po przej≈õciach, biorƒÖcego udzia≈Ç w poszukiwaniach ma≈Çego ch≈Çopca.

A an√°lise do jogo "Blair Witch" envolve diversos aspectos, desde a narrativa at√© os elementos de jogabilidade e a atmosfera geral. Lan√ßado em 2019, o jogo foi desenvolvido pela Bloober Team, conhecida por seus t√≠tulos de terror psicol√≥gico, como "Layers of Fear" e "Observer". Aqui est√£o alguns pontos a serem considerados na an√°lise:

Narrativa:

O jogo se passa no universo da famosa franquia de filmes "A Bruxa de Blair". A hist√≥ria segue Ellis, um ex-policial que se junta a uma equipe de busca para encontrar um garoto desaparecido na floresta de Burkittsville.
A narrativa incorpora elementos psicol√≥gicos e sobrenaturais, explorando os medos e traumas do protagonista. O enredo se desenrola de maneira n√£o linear, mantendo os jogadores intrigados e ansiosos para descobrir a verdade por tr√°s dos eventos.
Atmosfera e Ambienta√ß√£o:

A floresta de Burkittsville √© recriada com detalhes impressionantes, criando uma atmosfera densa e opressiva. O uso de luz e sombras contribui para a sensa√ß√£o de isolamento e tens√£o.
O jogo utiliza a escurid√£o e a limita√ß√£o de visibilidade de forma eficaz, aumentando a ansiedade do jogador. A c√¢mera encontrada pelo personagem principal, inspirada no filme original, adiciona uma camada adicional de imers√£o.
Elementos de Terror:

"Blair Witch" explora o terror psicol√≥gico, brincando com a percep√ß√£o do jogador e incorporando elementos sobrenaturais. A presen√ßa constante da Bruxa de Blair mant√©m uma sensa√ß√£o de amea√ßa persistente.
A utiliza√ß√£o de fen√¥menos inexplic√°veis, como mudan√ßas s√∫bitas no ambiente, cria um ambiente de suspense e surpresa. Os sustos s√£o bem cronometrados, aumentando a intensidade do jogo.
Jogabilidade e Mec√¢nicas:

O jogo combina explora√ß√£o, resolu√ß√£o de quebra-cabe√ßas e encontros com inimigos. A intera√ß√£o com a c√¢mera √© crucial para a progress√£o, adicionando um elemento estrat√©gico e de imers√£o √† jogabilidade.
O relacionamento entre Ellis e seu cachorro Bullet √© um destaque, n√£o apenas como companheiro, mas tamb√©m como elemento de jogabilidade, ajudando na busca por pistas e enfrentando amea√ßas.
Aspectos T√©cnicos:

Gr√°ficos s√≥lidos e uma trilha sonora envolvente contribuem para a experi√™ncia. A ambienta√ß√£o sonora desempenha um papel significativo na constru√ß√£o da atmosfera de terror.
Algumas cr√≠ticas podem ser direcionadas √† performance em algumas plataformas, mas, em geral, o jogo entrega uma experi√™ncia satisfat√≥ria do ponto de vista t√©cnico.
Em resumo, "Blair Witch" √© uma experi√™ncia de terror envolvente que respeita e expande o universo estabelecido pelos filmes. Com uma narrativa intrigante, uma atmosfera densa e mec√¢nicas de jogabilidade bem executadas, o jogo oferece uma imers√£o arrepiante para os f√£s do g√™nero de horror.
buen juego

No geral √© um bom game, n√£o √© aquele tipo que te assusta muito, mas em certos momentos voc√™ se surpreende muito. O que deixou a desejar mesmo pelo menos no meu ponto de vista foi o final.

column8: Banque

Walking-Horror im Wald mit vielen guten Ideen, aber auch mit zu viel Leerlauf. Das Spiel hat so viele gute Ideen, wie den Hund als Begleiter, das Handy, die Videokamera und so weiter, aber setzt diese nur begrenzt ein. Die Atmosph√§re ist gut, jedoch ist der Film The Blair Witch Project nur die Rahmenhandlung. Das h√§tte man sich also auch schenken k√∂nnen und einen x-beliebigen Titel nehmen k√∂nnen. Manche Sachen werden leider auch nur einmalig verwendet. [spoiler] Man steht in einer Ecke und darf sich nicht umdrehen, w√§hrend man hinter einem Stimmen h√∂rt und sich langsam automatisch umdreht. Guter, aber auch seltener Moment im Spiel.[/spoiler] Daf√ºr dass das Spiel viel zu kurz ist, f√ºhlt  es sich gerade am Ende sehr in die L√§nge gezogen an, wo man durch endlos wirkende Passagen l√§uft. Der Hund als Begleiter ist das Beste mit am Spiel, weil es gerade als Horrorspiel dann doch sehr durchschnittlich ist. Es ist okay, h√§tte aber so viel mehr sein k√∂nnen. Es ist so ein bisschen zwischen Geheimtipp und Trash. Es ist nicht wirklich schlecht, aber auch nicht wirklich gut. Von der Qualit√§t ist es gut, jedoch spielerisch etwas mau. 6/10

De "Blair Witch" solo tiene el nombre y la ambientaci√≥n, el juego consiste en ir de un lado a otro CASI en circulos por todo el bosque para completar X objetivo para despues echar tu progreso a la basura para poder seguir dando vueltas por el bosque para contar su historia tan mediocre y aburrida.

column8: Uhhh it really just isn't particularly good in any way. Looks solid, but not great. It's a walking sim, but it is not a well put together one. Opening inventory and interacting with certain inventory items makes you stop moving. The dog's mechanics were a good idea but in practice another thing that makes you stop moving and just lock into 10 second long animations as you watch you character pet dog or feed dog. Not really any fluidity or flow to any of it. You're either walking doing nothing or you are locked into an animation, doesn't feel good at all. On top of that the story is extremely predictable: [spoiler] within an hour (I think as soon as I saw the second tape that informs you that Peter has been kidnapped.) It was obvious that the guy who kidnapped the kid was the player character. It was obvious watching a video of the sheriff being killed that you did it. Bad ending is perpetuating the cycle of your trauma/actions by being manipulated by the Blair Witch. This ending is of course the easiest to get, and designed to make you play a second time (of what I must point out is a fucking 6 hour long boring af walking sim). You use the flashlight to banish/kill monsters that are in the trees. Perhaps the implication is it is a gun and you are killing people hunting you or looking for Peter? Because killing any monsters gives the bad ending. Good ending requires basically walking through the game doing even fucking less (don't kill monsters, don't interact with wooden dolls, don't destroy totems.) [/spoiler] So it has an uninteresting story, the game is clunky to play, and it isn't even all that pretty. What's the point?

And yet the greatest mystery is how this game ever got some good reviews...

- Graphics are fugly
- Your dog is apeshit stupid
- You cant walk over a rock, branch or leaf if its not on scripted path
- You keep screaming at your girlfriend in the phone (immersion points lost)
- You stick your nose to missing person search where local police dont want you to (manapoints lost)
GOTY 2019??

In fact, the original BW-game series 23 years back where more atmospheric and scarier than this.

The ending horror sequences are exceptionally well-crafted, consistently keeping me on the edge throughout. The design and execution are incredibly clever, making it a game worth sticking until the very end. While there may be moments of confusion, unsure of what to do or where to go, rest assured that you will eventually navigate your way through. CAn be a bore at times when you keep walking through the same places but if you're a "horror experience" lover I can say that you won't get frustrated. Achieving the good ending can be challenging, as I personally ended up with the bad ending, but it was a delightful experience. The overall gameplay induces a sense of madness, earning it a solid positive rating. I highly recommend this game to those who appreciate psychological horrors, occasional scares, and bear in mind that it leans more towards an exploratory gaming experience. PS: I love you Bullet.

I don't get the hate for the game as it was a lot of fun! It's not quite a horror game in a "traditional" sense, which just goes with the motion and theme of how the Blair Witch Project wasn't a "traditional" horror movie. It's a game about solving past trauma in a horror setting, either letting yourself be victim to a repeating cycle of trauma after trauma or finding yourself and mending your relationship with people that you have once hurt. And with that, I feel like that's what people aren't getting despite that fact it was the main focus of the game. Most people were focused on getting scared and where the next jumpscare would be rather than trying to understand where the characters came from and what we can do to get them a better ending.

It is a horror through and through, and it focuses on the horror of trauma and whenever you pick healing or falling apart.

It has a scary atmosphere and the story is interesting. I like figuring it out as I go. I like that kind of storytelling. There are some parts of the game that overstay their welcome, like walking around in the house and the carrying the dog sequence, but overall I would still recommend this game. Let me preface this by saying that I just played through the game because I wanted to get know Bloober Teams way of making games before getting into the Silent Hill 2 Remake. 

Since theres a lot of backlash about Bloober online I was quite sceptical at first and wanted to make up my own mind. Since I'm a fan of the original 1999 Blair Witch Project I started with this one.

Let me tell you that after playing Blair Witch I do not carry a single doubt in Bloobers abilities to make a good Silent Hill 2 remake. The Game gets criticised a lot for the overarching storyline of the main protagonist, Ellis (which is a solid psychological horror in my opinion) and the way it handles the Blair Witch franchise. In my opinion it combines both of these things really well.
Gameplaywise there were some minor flaws and bugs regarding the AI of the dog, Bullet, but nothing major that took away the fun and suspense I felt when playing this.

I'm normally not one to write reviews for the games I played but I feel that this game deserves my praise and I honestly don't get why people tend to hate on it.
Thanks Bloober Team, I'm excited to try The Medium next and I honestly can't wait for your take on the Silent Hill 2 remake.

After playing for a few hours, I have now lost interest in playing any further, and have regrets of purchasing this game. Here are my reasons why.

To me, the game is not scary, and butchers the whole concept of the film The Blair Witch Project. The biggest thing that made the film scary to me is the unexplainable and uncanny events that happen. For example, the 'cackling noises' at night in the film could really be anything. It can't be animals, and it can't be humans. What in the world could it be? Later on, ofcourse, you can hear children and other events happen, and it becomes truly disturbing. You realize that the legend of the Blair Witch is true. The witch herself, though, is never shown on camera.

Compare this to the story itself, the storytelling, and the atmosphere of the game, and you can clearly see the big differences. Whenever the main character experiences anything, whether he is finding a corpse, or finding anything that should be absolutely terrifying, the character is nothing more than surprised, and carries on as if nothing has happened. Also, this one 'white tree' that you encounter after a while, has black goo and tendrils on it. This has nothing to do with the story, and is purely used as a cheap way to add 'scariness' to the game (which does not mean that it IS scary!). To summarize, it is the smaller details that ruin the game. It is a good looking game, it's just the story and how it's being told that is totally crap.

I don't understand why these big media companies rated this game so high. Everything in the game just doesn't make sense. The main character has no good reason to go into the woods, his girlfriend doesn't add anything interesting to the story, he derails the search party and annoys them and me and I cringe hearing him tell the search party about certain gameplaying techniques.

column8: bel gioco

They really nailed the atmosphere in this game, an immersive experience as you're stumbling through the endless forest, always winding up back at the same spot. The first couple of hours of the game to a great job of building tension and creating such a spooky atmosphere, however I did feel somewhat disappointed as the game went on. For me, there was a lack of threat to keep me on the edge of my seat. The first time the "enemies" showed up I was surprised to learn I had actually killed one due to an achievement telling me so. Seeing how easily they could be dealt with really blew the tension for me and I was hoping for something more challenging later on which never really came. (Although, I have since learned there is a pacifist run you can do so maybe that would provide more of a challenge?) The story was intriguing enough, although I felt the flashbacks really broke the immersion for me. 

Oh, and the doggo. 10/10 best thing about the game, he gets all the treats and scritches <3

Overall not a bad game at all, I got it on sale for a fiver so pretty happy with experience vs price. I'd have liked something a bit scarier myself, but I get that's maybe not what the devs were going for.

column8:
Eternity is long. Especially near the end.

First thing first, game is having a lot of issues and bugs. 
Following the install, it won't start without having to set up one environment variable to your Windows system by yourself.
Then it will still crash a couple of times. Till completely freezing the computer and requiring an hard reboot.

Then, a couple of times, I had to restart the game to be able to continue it. First time was really disappointing. I spent an hour to look at what to do or where to go. I finally left the game. Coming back to it, an element became actionable while it was not before the restart.
It happened again later. But this time, I got an hard doubt based on the previous experience and immediately rebooted the game. It was this. Problem solved. I could then normally continue.

The game itself is close to a walk sim. However, it is not always true and the sequences in the woods comes with a very good atmosphere.
The interactions with the dog are excellent.
The two combined made it a memorable moment that made me continuing to play.
Also, thanks to the narrative during that time, that is pretty good.
It is scary, stressful, without using too much jump scares. I counted one during that time. And this time is most of the game.

Many of the achievements makes no sense. I won't recommend to look for them. Finding all little things in a wood and most of the time with a torch light because it is by night does not make sense or is even not fun. You are supposed to be lost in this wood and to look for something important. Why chasing barely visible plastic wastes... Dull. Another artificial lengthening attempt but not yet the worst.

Then comes the real pain. A big hour repeating the same thing over and over. Being told the same story over and over. 
The final chapters. 
Every time I was crossing a door and after 10mn doing so, I was hopping for it to be the last time.
It is so uninteresting and so repetitive. So boring. I saw myself a couple of times abandoning there and watching the end on an online video... So painful.
The game is good at transforming the map when you just passed somewhere. You turn back, it is different. Or the path is blocked. And in the same time, it repeats itself by passing again where you have been. You may have seen the first movie. Lost kids turn around repeatedly in the forest. This impression is well rendered in the game and during the wood times.
However the last chapters over abuse it just for the sake of lasting the game longer. So lazy.
The game would have been much much better without that pain.

Conclusion is, the game should have been much shorter. This despite an excellent beginning and probably the first 75% of the game. It would also have permit to avoid repeating the trick with the torch light that fails to work. First time came without surprise. The next ones...
The loads of boring bugs and these painful ever lasting final chapters makes it very difficult to recommend. They ruins the experience. The last chapters ruins everything by themselves.

And in the same time, it repeats itself by passing again where you have been. You may have seen the first movie. Lost kids turn around repeatedly in the forest. This impression is well rendered in the game and during the wood times.
However the last chapters over abuse it just for the sake of lasting the game longer. So lazy.
The game would have been much much better without that pain.

Conclusion is, the game should have been much shorter. This despite an excellent beginning and probably the first 75% of the game. It would also have permit to avoid repeating the trick with the torch light that fails to work. First time came without surprise. The next ones...
The loads of boring bugs and these painful ever lasting final chapters makes it very difficult to recommend. They ruins the experience. The last chapters ruins everything by themselves.

column8:
I'll start by saying that the story isn't really that much related to the movies. Besides the forest and the existence of a witch, everything else is entirely different. But I have no issues with that.
The first two quarters of the game are awesome. The forest and the environment is beautifully haunting, and makes you feel the desperation of walking around in circles. Everything feels oppressive and mysterious. The gameplay with Bullet fits perfectly. He feels like a real companion that helps us navigate the haunted forest.
And then comes the last quarter of the game, and the experience turns into Layers of Fear: a never ending sequence of tightly packed jumpscares, doors closing in your face, corridors changing position, a lot of screaming, more jumpscares and so on. This part is so long and repetitive that I honestly became bored. 
There's nothing wrong with Layers of Fear, I enjoyed the game. But having this here felt completely out of space. I wish they would have kept the same style of gameplay through until the end.
But well, still a nice game.

column8:
First of, I want to say that I really enjoyed the game. The mechanics with the dog and the camera were very clever and well executed and I think they work perfectly for a game like this.
Although this game didn't have a lot of jump scares, it was still freaky and it has it's moments that will keep you on your toes.
Strangely, you gain a strong connection with the characters, for example you can feel sympathetic for Ellis and you can really feel the bond between Bullet and Ellis.
One this that I would consider an issue (more of a personal issue than anything else) is that I didn't expect this game to be what it is. I haven't watched the movies, however, I've seen tons of videos on "The Blair Witch Project" and it was almost nothing like this. I would have really loved the game to just been a full found footage experience but I still love the different approach they took for this game. 
Overall, loved this game and I'd give it a solid 8/10, highly recommend it.

Alors ! Me revoil√† assez vite car il y a beaucoup √† dire.

Bonsoir √† tous il est 02:04 et je viens de finir ce jeu. Alors que dire parce qu‚Äôil y a beaucoup de choses, positives mais surtout N√âGATIVES. D'avance je m'excuse je viens de finir le jeu, et cette √©valuation risque de comporter quelques fautes, et d√©sol√© pour certains spoiler.

Donc Blair Witch, ayant ador√© le premier film, et ayant vu les √©valuations ainsi que le prix, je n'ai pu m‚Äôemp√™cher de m'empresser de l'acheter pendant les soldes d'hivers Steam (Thanks gros Gabe).

Je lance donc le jeu, et premier probl√®me : IMPOSSIBLE DE CHANGER LES TOUCHES, je chipote mais honn√™tement pour un jeu r√©cent ne pas pouvoir le faire c'est un peu du foutage de gueule, sinon on s'habitue vite au touche clavier.

Apr√®s quelques minutes de jeu, honn√™tement j'√©tais tr√®s optimiste, graphismes sympa, gameplay sympa gr√¢ce au t√©l√©phone et talkie mais sinon rien de transcendant. Sinon tout au long du jeu vous aurez votre compagnon le petit siensien qui vous aide √† chercher (franchement cela n'ajoute rien au gameplay, peut-√™tre un peu √† l'histoire mais on pourrait s'en passer).

Comme dirait le JDG "ils ont patoun√©" Blaire Witch, c'est √† dire qu'on passe beaucoup plus son temps √† r√©cup√©rer des collectibles sans r√©el int√©r√™t que de profiter de l'histoire. Pour √™tre franc arriv√© un moment on arr√™te de chercher et on profite de l'histoire, du moins on essaye. Sur la fin et sur quelques moments, on a bien compris qu'il avait des soucis psychologiques, c'est d'ailleurs √ßa le probl√®me ! La quasi totalit√© du jeu se base sur √ßa, tout comme beaucoup de jeu depuis les premiers Silent Hill (et surement avant). Aujourd'hui vous faites un jeu d'horreur, 90% du temps le protagoniste √† un probl√®me psychologique, et √ßa, c'est vraiment chiant.

L'histoire tiens, franchement pour √™tre positif, il y a quelques surprises bien pens√©. Le cam√©scope est sympa mais pas assez exploit√©. Le probl√®me c'est que compar√© √† Outlast, C√â NUL !!

Je n'ai pas fais beaucoup de jeu de la Bloober team, mais je comprend pourquoi maintenant. Quand vous jouez √† un de leurs jeux, il n'y aucun enjeux justement. Les premiers mobs rencontr√© sont dignes d'un Alan Wake, et le reste ils sont juste la pour faire office de pr√©sence.

Pour r√©sumer et je pourrais encore en dire pendant un moment : Blair Witch est un jeu tr√®s lin√©aire, avec quelques surprises mais il ne faut pas s'attendre √† plus.

column8: Unheimlicher Wald lotst einen durch t√∂dliche Kreaturen w√§hrend man nach missing Teenager Peter sucht. Dabei versucht die Hexe den Protagonisten mit Halluzinationen, rituelle Totems und seinem indoktrinierten Psychokiller Angst einzujagen.  Nach dem man den ersten Waldabschnitt erreicht hat ist man in einer unendlichen Matrix gefangen und man kehrt immer zum ersten Punkt zur√ºck bis man Ereignisse getriggert hat. Dabei leistet der Hund saubere Arbeit und w√§chst einem ans Herz bis er K.O gemacht wird. Der letzte Teil im Haus ist mit einem LSD Trip zu vergleichen und ein Spiel f√ºr sich. Der Spieler wird langsam wahnsinnig da das Haus unendlich lange durchquert wird um an D√§monen hautnah vorbeizuschleichen und der Hexe und ihren Halluzinationen zu widerstehen. Es gibt mehrere Enden , merkt man aber nicht.l
scariest game ever, very good

Blair Witch

[h3]Ich habe es mir - trotz vieler negativer Rezensionen - doch geholt und es nach 2 Std. wieder zur√ºck gegeben.[/h3] 
Aber aus anderen Gr√ºnden, als von den meisten hier beschriebenen, denn es ist mir egal, wie nah ein Spiel am Film ist oder nicht. Ich betrachte das Game immer als eigenst√§ndiges Werk, und so h√§tten mir diese zwei Stunden auch durchaus Spa√ü machen k√∂nnen, wenn, ja wenn da nicht dieser fade Geschmack w√§re, dass man mich verschaukelt hat..

Das Spiel sieht richtig gut aus, ein richtig sch√∂ner und geheimnisvoller Wald - so wie ich mir einen unheimlichen Wald vorstelle - perfekt in Szene gesetzt und l√§dt f√∂rmlich dazu ein, ihn zu erkunden.

Und da sind wir beim Problem. Ich kann den Wald n√§mlich nicht erkunden, denn er ist nur Kulisse.

Anfangs dachte ich noch - gut, ist vielleicht so gewollt, damit man erstmal den Parkplatz gr√ºndlich abcheckt, auf dem man startet - aber nein, das Game ist durchgehend so. Ich kann nicht vom Weg abweichen und werde nur durch Schlauchlevel geleitet. Nach 2m-3m links und rechts vom Weg, ist n√§mlich Schluss und langsam d√§mmert es, dass mir die ganze Kulisse nur vorgegaukelt wird.

Eine, wenigstens teilweise, erkundbare Welt erhofft man sich und wird schnell von der Realit√§t eingeholt. Das Game ist entzaubert, denn die tollen Screenshots auf der Shop-Seite sind nichts weiter als Blendwerk. 

H√§tte ich das vorab gewusst, w√§re es zu keinem "Kauf" gekommen, aber die vielen Rezensenten, haben das f√ºr mich eigentlich Wichtige mit keinem Wort erw√§hnt. Vielmehr lie√üen sich Viele, die negativ rezensiert haben, ausschlie√ülich nur dar√ºber aus, dass das Spiel keinen echten Bezug zum Film hat und der Film viel besser war - also nur Game vs Film... 

Ganz ehrlich? Wen interessiert das?! Wenn ich spiele, interessiert mich das Spiel und zwar NUR das Spiel und nicht der Film! Wenn ihr den Film besser fandet, dann solltet ihr vielleicht doch lieber das passende Buch zum Film lesen, denn B√ºcher sind auch immer besser, als der entsprechende Film...

R√ºckerstattung war erfolgreich. Danke.

Ponto Positivo:
Atmosfera e Tens√£o: O jogo captura efetivamente a atmosfera tensa e aterrorizante, utilizando escurid√£o, efeitos sonoros e uma floresta densa para criar uma boa experi√™ncia.

Ponto Negativo:
Repeti√ß√£o nos cap√≠tulos Finais: As √∫ltimas fases do jogo podem ser repetitivas e frustrantes, diminuindo a satisfa√ß√£o do jogador durante o desfecho da historia.

Bom demais! N√£o dava nada pra esse jogo: comprei porque assisti aos filmes e gostei da lenda da Bruxa de Blair, mas me surpreendi e gostei muito! Jogo autoexplicativo em quase tudo. Lore bem trabalhada, cen√°rio muito bonito, personagem intrigante com seus pr√≥prios conflitos e mist√©rios que vamos descobrindo ao longo da gameplay e tem o cachorro que al√©m de ser uma fofura tem skin personaliz√°vel. Walking Simulators assim nesse estilo me trazem muita nostalgia da minha inf√¢ncia, porque eu gostava muito do jogo do Slender Man. Perfeito, recomendo muito, e pelo pre√ßo que √© vale super a pena!

tiene algunos bugs que traban al personaje en una sola posici√≥n.

column8:
This game sucks. I usually do not write negative reviews but this one deserves for that. What the shit is this. The game started strongly and for the first hour or two it seems great, very atmospheric and unique mechanics. However, it soon got boring or even cumbersome - Just running around the forest again and again and again. Easily gets lost and no system help as to where the player should go. AND, at worse, close to the ending you will be required to keep running in a same house for an hour or more, which seemed to me endless. What the fxck was that...

Sorry but I cannot recommend this game. My first negative review.

10/10 because bullet is best boi. Only regret is I had 4 treats left.

On a more critical note this note deserves more credit then it got, there were only two issues with the game I found and its just some moment that were for dramatic effect were a bit too long. Game is beautiful and creepy, Sounds are good and do a great job at creating unease. The game's shining quality is it, like the character, makes you really second guess EVERYTHING. I had so many moments of 'oh f**k, what if I did this and it lead to that' and ' oh wait maybe that was there for a reason' and it also understands pacing and doesn't overstay its welcome. 

The last thing I will comment on is the video camera. ABSOLUTELY BRILLIANT. This concept was so unique and really engaged me as a player and teased me to think outside the box. 

All around fantastic, I would love to see the studio do another horror genre along these lines, they understood the assignment

Einfach miserabler Schrott! Si einen langweiligen Spiel habe ich kaum im Leben gespielt! Ich dachte "Wow, das ist ein Bruder von Outlast", aber keinesfalls, steht sogar √ºber nicht nah! 100% des Spiels, alle Sachen gefunden und gemacht. 

Ergebnis:

0% Interesse am allen, was passiert, da ich das vom Anfang vorhersehen konnte
100% √Ñrger wegen des Selbstverlustes im Wald auf dem Wege, besonders am Ende in diesem Haus, von dem ich satt war!

Meine Bewertung 1/10 (nur wegen der Grafik 1 Stern)

[h1]First-person footage: A one-way expedition to the Black Hills Forest[/h1]

It isn‚Äôt necessary for a horror game to give jump scares to shock its spectators. It‚Äôs enough to proposal a mysterious storyline buried in a profuse mist, while you go through a depressing forest that appears to have no end. The fear it provides is supernatural without being able to understand or spot who or what causes it. We‚Äôre stunned witnesses of the terrifying.

As I fathom it, the story of the game takes as its allusion Black Hills Forest in Burkittsville, Maryland. I could say that it‚Äôs a neoteric plot within the same history of the woodland. Former police officer and soldier named Ellis Lynch, with the companionship of his dog Bullet, join the search for the missing youth named Peter Shannon. Local stories tell about the cursed place. Those who stay at night never come out again. Ellis follows Peter's trail, while his surroundings transmute, revealing fragments of his past as night creatures crisscross his path. His ending, like a traumatic loop, is unforeseen.

The game is profoundly influenced by Myrick and S√°nchez's first footage, [i]The Blair Witch Project[/i]; and also Adam Wingard's version. We‚Äôll sight this mainly in its happening of the character's plot and in the setting/ambience. Although the game takes it to another direction, where upshot of the plot and the entire understanding of the story is carried out through breaking out of a loop. This is with the desire to achieve (cope with character trauma) a solid but at the same time tragic ending. The game shows a firm conclusion to blur its gruesome ambiguity and whodunit.

Just like in the footage I never saw the witch. Only I noticed the pitiless acts of her human marionette. Or I also glimpsed nocturnal creatures lurking and prowling in some parts of the forest. The witch, like an evil spirit, lives in the woodland, through which it feels like I‚Äôm being stalked all the time. Malevolence is omnipresent, her absence of which accomplishes psychological terror. Which achieves an atmosphere of uncertainty.

[h1]The beckon of the forest of the many eyes and whispers[/h1]

Like every horror story in the 90's, the plot develops without eradicating its ambiguity or loopholes. In the game, only the story is revealed as we intertwine the character's flashbacks as a horrid hallucinations (his traumas from the war and his relationship with his wife) with what we unearth (the character's memories and Peter's clues), that in the enchanted forest are appearing.

The whole story is veiled in the undergrowth of the forest. In our hiking to search for Peter, the place gradually discloses us its (hi)story. At first glance it looks like a walking simulator. But in reality the places contain symbolism of the character, pop-culture and the mythology of the witch. The forest is narrative, where the things secreted among the trees tell the context. Great interest has been presented in the script, because it reveals Ellis' mental problem, while the cutscenes express his past. The plot is woven between past and present, but always with the desire to indicate Ellis' possible end. All this is performed without loss of spontaneity and without shedding light on haziness.

The actors' voices are emotional, they manage to convey any feeling of anxiety, worry or concern. While the soundtrack is dark ambient, drone and some violin pieces to emphasize some parts, but always permitting the atmosphere (ambient, environmental and voice sounds) to intensify the trepidation. This makes the sounds encircle. It‚Äôs preferable to use headphones since the sound is binaural, namely, the sounds surround us. The game immerses the player, as it makes its way to the heart of the nightmare. The human voice and the witch's voice play an important role when Ellis suffers from delusions. So everything is well woven to give an envelopingly sinister story.

[h1]The forest of totems[/h1]

The way of playing is subordinated to the narrative and the setting. On the one hand, the forest is beautifully created. As the story progresses, an atmosphere with its colour palette presents itself to us differently. It always preponderates from clarity to opacity, from light to shadow and fog. If you see that everything is monotonous and repetitive, well, what did you anticipate? The forest is detailed; if you don't comprehend the woodland and its narrative, as well as being inside a Forest, then the developers haven't achieved their goal yet. Almost the entire time I stood envisaging the dusky and ominous beauty of the trees, bushes, rivers and the rarefied air.

Something that was accomplished well was the feeling of being in the forest without knowing where to go. There‚Äôre paths and routes as signs to mark our route. Some clues are revealed in conversations during the story. Our friend Bullet can also sniff to find the way. The game suggests attention to details. However, when I felt lost, I wanted to explore. Like the film, the game realizes the experience of walking in circles. I experienced that the forest has no end. It does this by looping, as in [i]Silent Hills P.T.[/i], you travel through the same place infinitely. To get out of there, following the trail of Peter's search, like a puzzle in moments, you break the loop to move forward. This loop structure is important to discover the true ending. The entire plot, each moment between the trees, are mini-loops that join the larger circle, the entire game.

In many places there‚Äôre collectibles that amalgamate the symbolic and psychological narrative of the story. The environment will play with our mind. Depending on certain actions ‚ÄîI‚Äôd say esoteric actions so that the player can figure out how to get out of there and break the circle‚Äî they lead to an end. It isn‚Äôt easy to realize, it‚Äôs not at first glance. On the other hand, the game combines a walking simulator with the interaction of the dog and with certain objects. Bullet can follow evidences and hints with his sense of smell, such as detecting enemies. You can interact with him (like giving him cookies or petting him) so that it‚Äôs not just a tool. Nevertheless, there‚Äôre dark places, so we rely on a flashlight and a video camera (escape or damage them). This one has night vision. Also in the game, since it has different rhythms, there‚Äôre tapes that can alter some element of the setting.

The character can run but without going fast. Also if he‚Äôs alone for a long time, he‚Äôll feel faint. It corresponds to just how to lose sanity. Hinge on the scene, it‚Äôll be one way to proceed (walk, sneak or run). He also carries a walkie-talkie and a cell phone with which he interacts with some characters. We have a backpack to know what we‚Äôve collected. There doesn't seem to be much to do and that's the point in the game. Be determined by how you interact with the game, it‚Äôll guide to an ending. Pay attention to every detail, to what the characters, documents or collectibles say, to know where to go. They‚Äôre like the compass in the game.

[h1]Trailing the breadcrumbs to the corner and don't look at her [/h1]

I realized the influence of the film. The game manages to immerse the player and give them the experience of psychological terror. I felt afraid at every moment, of being stalked, defenceless and vulnerable to an unknown and supernatural force. The places where they scared me were the fog and the house. It‚Äôs a remarkable adventure, where the proposal is how many times are necessary to get out of the forest. That's where its re-playability comes from. I highly recommend it, it‚Äôs a complete game without the need for a DLC. The design, art and footage are excellent.

[h1]Recommendation: 8/10[/h1]
column9:

column8:
Psychologischer Horror vom feinsten!!

Die gruselige Atmosph√§re untermalt mit dem hervorragenden Sounddesign ist einfach gro√üartig und nimmt im Laufe des Spiels immer mehr an Fahrt auf. Die Story ist von Anfang bis Ende sehr spannend und von der Grafik bin ich einfach blo√ü hin und weg. Der Wald ist so wundersch√∂n gemacht! Das Erkunden hat so doppelt viel Spa√ü gemacht. Die Gameplay Mechanik dass man mit dem Hund agieren kann wurde sehr gut umgesetzt. Bullet ist auf jeden Fall eines der besten Hunde im Spiel! Er war so oft eine gro√üe Hilfe gewesen und er ist soooo niedlich!! <3 Man merkt wirklich die Verbindung und Liebe vom Protagonisten zu Bullet was wirklich sehr herzerw√§rmend war. Auch die Animationen von Bullet sind wirklich sehr sch√∂n und niedlich gemacht worden. 

Alles in allem kann ich dieses Spiel nur weiterempfehlen. Einfach super! 10/10

Se voc√™ est√° procurando um terror com Jumpscare, esse jogo n√£o √© pra voc√™.
√â um terror investigativo, sua progress√£o √© lenta, a hist√≥ria √© fragmentada e voc√™ tem que juntar as pistas e montar um storytelling mental pra tentar entender o enredo.
Bullet √© um parceiro muito esperto, se voc√™ souber usa-lo corretamente, ele √© um excelente guia.
Dica: o Celular de Ellis tem muitas informa√ß√µes e dicas uteis, consulte-o sempre que puder.
Agora.. Se voc√™ busca o 100%, vai ter que fazer a conquista de Pacifista, na qual voc√™ n√£o pode usar a lanterna, apenas a c√¢mera digital para se guiar.
Eu acho bom sua vis√£o e seu senso de localiza√ß√£o estar MUITO afiados, sem auxilio da lanterna o jogo fica extremamente escuro, a vis√£o noturna da c√¢mera n√£o ajuda tanto quanto deveria e aliado ao fato que a floresta √© muito densa e sem muitos pontos de refer√™ncia, √© muito f√°cil se perder, ou deixar passar algum colet√°vel, o que vai frustrar muito jogador.
Mas na d√∫vida, confie no Bullet que √© sucesso!

column8: odporuƒçam

[h2] Thank You Blair Witch [/h2]
I'm writing this review because I wanted to tell you guys that I played this game 2 times with complete ending.
1st time I played this game on my friends PS4
2nd time I played this on my pc.
and believe me I never get disappoint with bloober team because I know they delivered the best haunted environment out in the market even if its layers of fear or blair witch.
This game pretty much scary if you dive deep into the forest and realise that you are not alone, because bloober team decided to give you a pet named "Bullet" its a dog which help you a lot in forest exploring and finding clues, and you can also pet your dog which I really liked it in game.
Thats my view on this game and I totally recommend to those who are looking for a simple horror not for jump scares, because I saw many negative review just because they are lost in woods and walking clueless. Its not about walking cluelessly as far as i think its about finding clues in open & clueless forest about a missing boy and a mysterious thing you just encounter in a haunted forest.

[h3] Rated 9/10 [/h3]

column8:
[h1]Spoiler free TLDR[/h1]
I think it's a decent title, not too long and has some really good and fun moments. 

[h2]Pros[/h2]
+ Great ambiance and atmosphere, you feel lost
+ The game has EXCELLENT sections
+ Doggie

[h2]Cons[/h2]
- Bugs
- The story is overwritten
- It doesn't stick the landing
- Voice acting is very inconsistent. Some sections are, some aren't
- The multiple endings are irrelevant as you won't find em without guides

[h1]Spoilers Rant[/h1]
[spoiler]The game started strong enough with our main guy going to the forest to join up with a search party with their dog. U can fully customize the dog, get a phone call on the way, and the parking lot has a bunch of cool tidbits to find left around. After which you officially begin and learn you rely on the doggo to find you clues in what honestly feels a very well designed forest. It feels similar but different in that real way where you are lost one second, and then see something you remember. The game however really instilled this fear of not letting the doggo go too far away, and the doggo has the bad habit of just darting of in full speed.

After chasing while sprinting I fell down a hill and learned that running is a bad call, and just had to wrangle the doggo constantly towards me as it does not just "lead", it will sprint to the target or waddle behind you. The tapes mechanic was cool, the phonecalls and radio were cool and heck even the recorder was very interesting. However the dog commands of praise/scold and treat felt very awkward and just led to animations you can't cancel. So if you accidentally press scold? Oops.

The game then started to show that it will put you in set locations that loop into itself until you find the thing it wants you to find, but also will introduce a enemy which is very neatly done imo as you don't see em until its too late and fighting them off is scary as well as you frantically search the treeline for anything out of place. However here I encountered my first big bug as Bullet did not want to show me the thing i needed, and instead just ran the same loop at full sprint over and over. This is also where the PTSD stuff starts to creep in...

The blair witch premise can be so simple. Normal goons getting absolutely lost in the woods by forces beyond their understanding. Maybe sprinkle some backstory in the horrors or past events. But the game instead starts layering in these 6 story-lines which are totally unnecessary, except maybe the sheriff one and missing kid. The Sheriff being worried about you but enabling you to cowboy it up can be ENOUGH character development. The kid being lost is also enough of a plot-device to go into the woods. But the Wife being abused at home and calling you every so often to reminisce is just messy. The war PTSD is wildly messy aswell and just leads to very jarring unrelated sections. The lost people pictures, totally unsolved or needed. Whats the deal with them? No answers. The lost kid being linked to a ptsd victim you murdered? The war leading up to you killing your squad by mistake and a random civilian woman??? Its so much random stuff that did not need to be here. Focus on the sherrif. Discovering people being gone. Maybe some loon that is behind it all? The sheriff. Have them try to escape but fail. Maybe force em to the house by bad weather...

My second bug was when the dog would get stuck at the sawmill and refuse to move. This section was fine and scary enough with having to explore through dark via car. The abandoned mill was outstanding aswell and really started to creep me out esp with the drawings. However the meeting with the loon completely threw me. The underground section was confusing. Him accepting and following along with the loon is completely insane. The mist section was amazing but it all leading up to your dog dying no matter what you do was just ... mean? They make it out as if you have a choice but you just dont.

The ending was amazing for 30% the beginning and exploring of the house was really fun but it then starts looping and goes to stress levels 110% and doesn't really come down for like 30-40minutes. All storylines are thrown in your face. There are some REALLY cool visual moments such as the room tilting or rotting away, the controls being taken over lightly at times to "steer you" in the wrong directions is really stressinducing in the best ways. But stuff just KEEPS. HAPPENING. AND. IT. DOESNT. STOP. It loops and loops and loops and loops, throwing cool visuals mixed with really boring exposition, mixed with this awkward silly stealth that requirsed you to stare at your own feet (looking up kills(?) you) so you don't see anything and the floor is honestly really not worth looking at. Only at 1 point was i tempted to do something (follow a blood trail) but as it was in the danger area, I just skipped. And then suddenly without a big fanfare, it ends.

So many weird storylines, interactables, collectables, locations and a doggo? You can already in your mind see how there must be a good ending if you collect everything and the doggo lives etc etc, or a super bad ending maybe, and then some endings where depending on which choices/interactables more info gets revealed. But AFAIK: The sherrif just dies no matter what. The kid's fate is out of your hands. Your dog's fate is somewhat in your hands maybe, but it has to die for the plot. The war, family, hospital plot is just flung at you no matter what, same with the loon. And the only ending that is different requires you to collect NO collectibles and not defend yourself from the monsters... Like how is this organically conveyed??? Its not like the first time you find a totem your char goes "Prolly shouldn't mess with this" and give you the option of putting it back down. Or carry the doggo past the scary effigies. Or even signal that the monsters dying is a bad thing. This is as if you discover a secret ending to Mario if you break no blocks, and collect 0 coins during the playthrough, and only kill bosses. HOW IS THIS ORGANICALLY CONVEYED.

The game is loops on loops on loops, the building, the forrest, the gameplay, even the game's story itself is a loop. (don't think about it because you kidnapped the kid but then also went to search for the kid but spend days weeks months in there but the kid was back after 3 days?) With a story way more complex than need be with too many threads. Gameplay that is just too long at the end that I cannot imagine myself replaying it. However. This game has some really cool moments, and I think the dog mechanic is a thing that could be improved and did add something interesting to a horror experience. Being alone is scary, being with something you care for and want to protect is even scarier. The phone and collectibles influencing your end could be a VERY cool, but instead its a binary "normal gameplay"vs "hyper specific quota" ending. [/spoiler]

It feels like as if the writer wanted a different IP. The level designer had too many ideas and didnt wanna cut any. And the gameplay vision just wasn't there 100% I Like this game. I truly do. But this is a cake with chunks of raw dough, 10 different frostings and a theme that just makes you go "but why?".

Pick it up on a sale if u love horror.
