column8:
[h1]Atmospheric Thriller[/h1]

	Bloober Team's Blair Witch is a deeply atmospheric psychological thriller game. It's not invasively scary, as the focus is placed on building the environement of uncertainity and dread. The grim, dark, moody forrest is a background for exploration of our protagonist's troubled past and traumas. That's why the pace of the game is rather slow. Action oriented players might be deterred from it. Also, the ending unfortunately drags, falling into tedium as it relies on too many overused horror cliches.

	The game makes continuous references towards the first movie. Not only through story remarks but also through it's gameplay. Reviewing lost footage on camera allows player to interact with the world in an innovative way.

	Blair Witch exploration relies heavily on our trusted companion ‚Äì a dog named Bullet. Even though his pathing sometimes glitches, the dog is an essential part of gameplay.

	This is a nieche title. Intended for people interested in exploring more advanced themes of human psychology. It's also a rewarding experience for the fans of the original film. And to those people...

	I recommend this game

If you are interested in a longer, more in-depth video review then check out my youtube channel: https://youtu.be/M62yvTLGHDA

The grim, dark, moody forrest is a background for exploration of our protagonist's troubled past and traumas. That's why the pace of the game is rather slow. Action oriented players might be deterred from it. Also, the ending unfortunately drags, falling into tedium as it relies on too many overused horror cliches.

	The game makes continuous references towards the first movie. Not only through story remarks but also through it's gameplay. Reviewing lost footage on camera allows player to interact with the world in an innovative way.

	Blair Witch exploration relies heavily on our trusted companion ‚Äì a dog named Bullet. Even though his pathing sometimes glitches, the dog is an essential part of gameplay.

	This is a nieche title. Intended for people interested in exploring more advanced themes of human psychology. It's also a rewarding experience for the fans of the original film. And to those people...

	I recommend this game

If you are interested in a longer, more in-depth video review then check out my youtube channel: https://youtu.be/M62yvTLGHDA

column8:
Semplicemente mozzafiato.

Il bosco, allo stesso tempo cos√¨ grande e claustrofobico, persino quando inondato dalla rara luce del mattino comunica una sensazione di spaesamento e malinconia; il nostro eroe ha un passato burrascoso che pian piano che avanziamo con la storia viene svelato; un tizio della pizza che ammattir√† solo grazie al nostro zelo e alla nostra determinazione. Solo per questa aggiunta si dovrebbe amare codesto prodotto.

Non ho mai visto il film da cui √® tratto il gioco, ho troppa strizza, ma forse tra qualche millennio trover√≤ il coraggio. Nel frattempo, continuer√≤ a guardare Spongebob.

E magari mi far√≤ un'altra run del gioco. Forse due.

Blair Witch si concentra sull‚Äôatmosfera horror e sulla psicologia del protagonista, che deve affrontare le sue paure e il suo passato mentre cerca di sopravvivere alle minacce della foresta e della strega, √® un gioco che consiglio agli amanti del genere horror e ai fan dei film della saga. Il gioco si svolge in un mondo semi-aperto, che richiede al giocatore di esplorare diverse aree della foresta, a volte imbattendosi in strutture abbandonate, campeggi o anfratti accessibili solo al cane di Ellis, Bullet. Offre una storia avvincente e coinvolgente, una gameplay vario e originale, una grafica spettacolare e un suono immersivo. Riesce a trasmettere la sensazione di paura e angoscia che caratterizza i film della strega di Blair, ma anche a farci empatizzare con il protagonista e il suo fedele compagno a quattro zampe.

Allora c'√® da dire che √® un bel gioco horror, sia per la storia e per la grafica. Per√≤ forse, secondo me, l'unica cosa bisognava mettere pi√π jumpscare e pi√π difficolt√† tecnica, come ad esempio enigmi.

Cara, o jogo ta sempre no quase, como tudo √© premeditado e clich√™, tu ta sempre esperando um momento de climax, mas nunca chega esse momento, sempre para no meio do caminho, quando tu pensa que a hist√≥ria vai engatar, algo interrompe, os inimigos s√£o toscos, os sustos s√£o premeditados, o cen√°rio √© incr√≠vel, a gameplay √© 98% polida, alguns bugs afetam, mas nada cr√≠tico. Esse jogo podia ser excelente, mas nem tentou, se satisfez em dar uma meia duzia de sustinhos, e contar uma historinha meia boca, apresentando v√°rios finais sendo que nenhum traz uma real sensa√ß√£o de conclus√£o. √â o famoso n√£o f#de mas tamb√©m n√£o sai de cima.
Para platinar √© necess√°rio zerar umas 3 vezes, al√©m de um guia para os colecion√°veis.
This game keeps me wondering what is going to happen next. I really like it. I do recommend it to other players.

One of the worst horror games I played:
- Graphic issues everywhere, especially with AMD cards. Intense flickering of lights, shadows, and water only stopped when I turned off everything/set it to lowest.
- Had an issue where the video camera overlaps the game, couldn't use other objects anymore, couldn't unequip the video cam.
- Glichting into ditches, through trees/stones. 
- Motion sickness, there's an option to turn it off, but guess what - the games camera movements is so bad it won't even matter. Got headaches after playing for 10 minutes.
- You can chose how your dog looks but this isn't carried over into past cut scenes.

was boring from time to time but overall, especially with the end, a psychological horror masterpiece. 8/10

The Blair Witch game is a first-person horror game that puts players in the shoes of Ellis, a former cop who joins the search for a missing boy in the Black Hills Forest. As Ellis and his trusty dog Bullet delve deeper into the forest, strange things start happening, and it becomes clear that the Blair Witch may be behind the boy's disappearance.

One of the game's strongest aspects is its atmosphere. The dense forest and limited visibility create a sense of tension and unease, and the sound design is top-notch. The use of a dog as a companion is also a unique and effective mechanic, as Bullet can help sniff out clues and warn Ellis of danger.

The story is engaging with with multiple possible endings based on the player's choices. The game also does a great job of incorporating elements of the original Blair Witch movie, with stick figures and haunting whispers adding to the sense of dread.

The game does have some drawbacks. The controls can be clunky at times, especially when navigating through the forest, and the puzzles can be a bit tedious. Additionally, the game can be quite short, with the main story clocking in at around four to five hours.

The Blair Witch game is a solid horror experience that is worth checking out for fans of the movie or the genre in general. The atmosphere and story make up for the occasional clunkiness, and the use of a dog companion adds an interesting twist to the gameplay.

column8:
The Blair Witch game is an absolute thrill ride that offers players a truly terrifying and exhilarating horror experience. From the moment you enter the dark and foreboding Black Hills Forest, you'll be on the edge of your seat, waiting for the next scare to jump out at you.

One of the most impressive things about this game is the way it creates a sense of claustrophobia and paranoia. As you navigate through the dense forest, the trees seem to close in around you, and you can never quite shake the feeling that you're being watched. The game does an excellent job of building tension and suspense, using sound effects, lighting, and other techniques to keep you constantly on edge.

But it's not just the atmosphere that makes the Blair Witch game so terrifying. The game also features some genuinely frightening supernatural creatures that will have you jumping out of your seat. Whether it's the eerie ghostly figures that appear in the mist, or the twisted and distorted monsters that stalk you through the forest, every encounter with these creatures is a heart-pounding experience.

One of the most innovative and thrilling aspects of the game is the way it uses your own fears against you. The game is full of psychological tricks and mind games that will make you question your own sanity. For example, there are moments when the game will make you doubt whether you're really alone in the forest, or whether there's something watching you from the shadows.

Overall, the Blair Witch game is a masterclass in horror gaming. It's an intense and thrilling experience that will have you on the edge of your seat from start to finish. If you're a fan of horror games, or just looking for an exciting and terrifying experience, then this game is an absolute must-play.

This game is absolutely amazing! its got everything a horror fan wants, first of all its affordable. 2nd there are tons of scary sections, followed by not so scary sections ,and it appears this was designed in such a way, your never actually fully relaxed, cause 1-2 minutes after your last scary section, another one will pick up. 3rd you get a dog, which you can feed snacks when hes a good boy, you can pet him, hes an emotional support/tracker dog, whose very important to your story, the best part about the dog though imo, the dog is loyal to you, and you have the option to NOT leave him behind, you can return the loyalty which alot of ppl will love. plus you can customize you doggy, a bit, his fur color, his eye color, his collar color. The fights are nice to, once again relying on your good old dog, without him you have no chance. plus you dont need a beefy pc to run and enjoy this game.

This game is just...very bad. I want my money back.

PROS: Reasonably atmospheric, interesting use of the video camera, you can pet the dog as much as you want. [spoiler] And you don't have to leave him behind.[/spoiler]


CONS: No clear instructions or path, no clear story. 

SPOILERS
[spoiler] The forest section of the game is interesting, with plenty of items to grab and spooky moments. Using Bullet (the dog) as your waypoint/pathfinder is interesting but utterly broken. The dog would sometimes just circle an object he was supposed to pick up for me, or not respond to my Seek command.
The house section of the game was a slog. Everything was absolutely derivative as if the devs just had no original ideas, and it lasted way too long for what it was.

Also, huge con: The Good Ending requires you to NOT pick up carvings or destroy talismans, even thought the game feeds them to you in the beginning. 
 [/spoiler]

column8: Fajna gierka do wychilowania

I had seen the movie "The Blair Witch Project" and I thought it was an interesting movie so I thought the game would be better, but the game has a very slow start to it making it where I almost never got interested into it, but then when I got to around chapter 4 or something where the main "hero" Ellis has memories of his past it was very interesting and I think that you have to get deep into it for it to be like the movie good. I like how Bullet can change how your story ends. If Bloober Team made the beginning more interesting then it being super slow it would be a 10/10 for me but it's a 8/10.

column8: Beautiful graphics with the forest, Game play is solid. Story wise I'm not to fond of the Main character maybe because I can't relate. The only beef I have is once you get to the house chapter. Its sooooo long, repetitive, and it makes me want to just keep running through to get it over with instead of soaking it in. Also with the military flashbacks, beating that dead horse. Over all it was a positive experience. Like I said well done on the graphics.

column9: nice!

column8:
[i]Welcome to my 100th review! ^^[/i]

[u]The Intro[/u]

I've heard some pretty bad things about this game, so my expectations were lowered. To my surprise though, i actually really enjoyed this game. 

I've seen and really enjoyed both Blair Witch movies, and this title isn't much different.

[u]The good stuff[/u]

You can clearly see that this is graphically a really pretty game. A higher budget on this title, which helped a ton. The whole forest and flashlight effects are just absolutely stunning and come very very close to reality.

The game has good dialogue, good voice acting, graphics, atmosphere, sound. So much about this game is really good.
The mechanics are also fun, you have a backpack, flashlight, walktie-talkie, phone you can call people on and receive texts, you have a dog companion with you that you can pet and give commands to, a camera you can watch tapes on and alter reality to progress, there's tons of cool collectibles. It's all well done.

The story is pretty decent with a nice plot-twist at the end that i didn't see coming.

[u]The bad stuff[/u]

The only part where the game somewhat sucked in my opinion was at the end when you're in the [spoiler]house[/spoiler] location. You get a ton of layers of fear like madness that just ceases to be scary and just continues to drag on and on.
The game also starts to drag on very mildly at around the 75% mark.

Also what is unfortunate is that the game occasionally throws at you these enemies encounters and you can actually defeat them. Don't get me wrong it's pretty cool, but it unfortunately takes away from the scary unsettling atmosphere when it happens, you don't feel as vulnerable.

Other than the Blair Witch, the story also focuses on the past of the main character. While this isn't a huge deal, it definitely is a less interesting story than that of the Blair Witch. Fortunately the game somewhat recognizes that and most of the time it's focused on the Blair Witch. 

[u]Final Thoughts[/u]

Overall I'd say this game is definitely worth a try if you like unsettling walking simulators with a great atmosphere and sound design! Plus this one comes with a high budget, which is very welcomed! :)

I will definitely play this game more times!

[b]My rating: 5/5[/b]

Ser√© breve, seg√∫n mi experiencia con el juego, voy a dividirlo en tres partes:
1. Primera y segunda parte del juego: buena, entretenida, con sentido, cosas para buscar, historias para leer, cosas por hacer.
2. Tercera parte del juego: muy bizarra, innecesariamente larga, redundante, muy fumada, no hay nada que buscar ni hacer, sin sentido.
3. Finales: dicen que tiene 4, para mi solo tiene dos, y es un mismo momento que cambia, no hay caminos diferentes para llegar a ellos, final muy pobre para el juego.

En cuanto a gr√°ficos: buenos | Jugabilidad: bastante bien | Historia: la dos primeras partes: bastante bien

No es el gran juego, y la √∫ltima parte si se hace muy densa, me pareci√≥ que no supieron como seguirlo, y te quedas casi una hora atorado dando vueltas innecesarias y sin sentido, esa parte decepciona, esperaba m√°s del final, mucho m√°s contenido.

Al juego global de acuerdo a mi experiencia con el le pongo 7, no m√°s.

[i]"Inspiriert von der kinematischen Legende von Blair Witch erlebst du mit dieser neuen Geschichte ein Psychohorror-Spiel, das deine Reaktionen auf Angst und Stress beobachtet"[/i]

So steht es dort droben geschrieben, allein ich kann es nicht nachvollziehen.
"Inspiriert" sein mag es durchaus, wenn man Wald + Wackelkamera + komische Ger√§usche als "Inspiration durch einen genialen Film" bezeichnen mag. Naja.

Das es meine Reaktionen auf Angst und Stress beobachtet, hm... Ich hatte keine Angst bisher. Stress schon, in Mengen. Den aber nicht wegen des spieltechnischen Inhalts, sondern wegen L√ºcken, Unlogik, sinnlosem Herumrennen, Steuerung die mal eben nicht mehr funktioniert und der immerw√§hrenden Frage "was zum Teufel will der Entwickler jetzt von mir?!"
Ja das war Stress...und kein positiver.

Grafik ist okay und die Story vielleicht auch. Kann ich nicht gro√ü beurteilen, weil ich nach 5 Stunden in Kapitel 7 endlos genervt das Handtuch geworfen habe. Ich habe mich bem√ºht, aber das Spielkonzept ist (f√ºr mich) undurchsichtig und alles andere als intuitiv.

Die Steuerung kann man nicht anpassen und sie hakt hinten und vorne. Mal geht's, mal nicht. (Tastatur verwendet).

Als ex Soldat mit starkem PTBS klinkt sich unser Protagonist in die Suche nach einem vermissten Kind ein. Unterwegs begleitet wird er durch seinen Hund, sowie ein Handy mit dem hin und wieder telefoniert oder SMSen empfangen werden k√∂nnen, und einem Funkger√§t, dass meistens eh nicht funktioniert.
Soweit, so gut.

Im Wald angekommen wird es aber schnell nervig. Das Fadenkreuz, eigentlich nur ein winziger Punkt, ist stellenweise nur sehr schlecht auszumachen oder verschwindet mal eben komplett. Gegenst√§nde die hilfreich sein k√∂nnten oder f√ºr Errungenschaften z√§hlen, sind nur m√ºhsam zu entdecken. Und wenn der Hund nicht jedesmal vor Angst kl√§ffen oder winseln w√ºrde, wenn irgendwo so ein Gegenstand rumgammelt, dann h√§tte ich die allesamt locker √ºbersehen.

Nachts ist es wahrlich stockfinster, die Taschenlampe funktioniert kurze Zeit, dann flackert sie ohne ersichtlichen Grund, und geht auch gerne mal aus. Realismus wegen Batterien? K√∂nnte man vermuten, allerdings funktioniert die Lampe beim n√§chsten Mal wieder normal, also sind das dann wohl sich selbst aufladende Batterien. 

Den Hund kann man als Wegfinder vorausschicken, das ist auch gar nicht mal schlecht - nur der Weganzeiger des Hundes ist im Wald mitunter echt schlecht zu erkennen. Dreht man sich dann mal ein wenig um sich selbst, hat man den Salat, dann muss man sich echt anstrengen, den eigentlichen Weg auch wiederzufinden.

Macht man mal genervt eine Pause, oha, dann gibt es Spass - denn die Speicherpunkte sind so rar ges√§t, dass man ziemlich sicher das ganze Kapitel von vorne anfangen darf. Nervig. Zumal man nicht weiss, wann man ein Kapitel verlassen und das n√§chste betreten hat. Ja, es gibt da so ein kleines Zeichen das rotiert wenn es speichert, aber wenn man auf den Wald, den Hund, merkw√ºrdige Ger√§usche, noch merkw√ºrdigere Dinger die umherhuschen und die zu suchenden Hinweise achtet, √ºbersieht man das schnell mal.

Apropos umherhuschende Dinger. Es gibt irgendwelche Gegner im Wald, deren Bek√§mpfung nur Fragezeichen hervorgerufen hat. Man soll sich wehren, aber so wirklich klappt das nicht. Also sich auf den Hund verlassen, der auch nicht wirklich weiss was er tun soll und dann sterben. Und wieder sterben. Und nochmal. Und gerade wenn man denkt, man wie soll ich dieses Sterben denn verhindern????? steht man wieder und es geht weiter. Hm ja, also irgendwie sinnfrei das alles.

Aktuell stecke ich in einem brennenden Teil des Waldes, muss von Steininsel zu Steininsel rennen um nicht angez√ºndet zu werden, der Hund weiss nicht was er tun soll, Gegner kommen die ich nicht bek√§mpfen kann und schwupps lande ich in einer Flashbackszene aus einem Krieg in dem ich mal aktiv war, in brennenden Ruinen und mit Soldaten, die mir sagen ich soll ihnen helfen und nichts geht mehr. Nach rund einer Stunde voll genervtem Rumgerenne und Gerate was ich jetzt tun soll, habe ich dem Spiel eine Pause geg√∂nnt. 
Nach dieser Pause, mit frischem Mut wieder hinein in den Wald, musste ich feststellen, dass ich das komplette Kapitel noch mal von vorne anfangen muss und das war dann der Punkt, an dem ich das Handtuch geworfen habe.
Ja, ein bi√üchen mitdenken und knobeln und auch auf sich allein gestellt sein ist okay, in solchen Spielen. Aber so unterirdisch...nein danke.

Den Hund fand ich gut und auch die Idee, mit der Kamera, die (wenn man es denn mal verstanden hat) irgendwie die Vergangenheit anzeigen kann. H√§tte man aber deutlich mehr draus machen k√∂nnen.
Bloober hat mit Layers of Fear was Starkes abgeliefert, aber Blairwitch hat den Hype meiner Meinung nach nicht wirklich verdient.

Wenn es im Sale ist, f√ºr einen Appel und ein Ei, kann man es sich getrost mal kaufen. Aber generell kann ich es einfach nicht empfehlen.
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAZZZZZZZZZZZZZ GOOD

[b] Blair Witch: un`esperienza immersiva sulla discesa in un incubo. [/b]

Se cercate un gioco horror in grado di tenervi col fiato sospeso e di farvi provare un esperienza di gioco immersiva e graficamente appagante, Blair Witch √® il titolo che fa per voi. Basato sul celebre film horror degli anni 90, il titolo riesce a riproporre l`atmosfera claustrofobica e inquietante della foresta di Burkittsville, dove il protagonista, un ex poliziotto di nome Ellis, cerca di trovare un bambino scomparso.

Uno dei punti di forza di Blair Witch √® senza dubbio la grafica. I dettagli degli alberi, delle foglie e delle radici, la resa degli effetti di luce e ombra, il cambiamento del tempo, tutto contribuisce a creare un ambientazione credibile e coinvolgente. L`utilizzo di una telecamera a infrarossi e di una torcia che illumina solo una piccola porzione dello schermo aiuta a creare un senso di claustrofobia e di insicurezza, aspetti che uniti ad ottimi sonori binaurali contribuiscono a creare un clima di tensione costante con picchi e discese frequenti.

Tuttavia, il gioco presenta anche alcuni difetti. In particolare, i puzzle risultano troppo semplici e poco impegnativi, cosa che potrebbe deludere i giocatori alla ricerca di difficolt√†. Inoltre, la presenza costante di collezionabili, potrebbe risultare fastidiosa per chi cerca un`esperienza di gioco pi√π immersiva in quanto riporta costantemente alla condizione di realt√† rompendo l`atmosfera e spesso lasciando il giocatore girovagare in cerca di questi ultimi anzich√® eventualmente per osservare dettagli utili ai fini della trama.

In definitiva, Blair Witch √® un ottimo titolo a multifinale della durata di circa 6/7 che merita di essere giocato per la sua capacit√† di creare un ambientazione credibile e coinvolgente, capace di tenere il giocatore col fiato sospeso dall`inizio alla fine. Nonostante la semplicit√† dei puzzle e la presenza eccessiva di collezionabili, il titolo √® in grado di offrire un`esperienza di gioco appagante e avvincente, a patto di sfruttare degnamente la capacit√† grafica che offre creando un ambiente adeguato alla fruizione, molto consigliato a tutti gli amanti del genere horror.
Very, I mean, VERY good game! It was pretty scary.

column8:
Honestly, I blew through this game faster than intended. Maybe it was due to the constant avoiding of the dark or trying to quickly get out of combat situations, but I sort of which it had been a longer experience. Overall, I definitely recommend it for lovers of the Blair Witch franchise. All of the easter eggs and nods to the lore made me smile.

My biggest COMPLAINT is that the house portion of end game drug on for far too long in my opinion. After awhile the scares were no longer effective because it became a little predictable, and running through the same hallway again and again is great in PT but not this exact scenario. Good game, not great game for that simple fact, and this is based solely on how much emphasis I put on a good ending gameplay and cut scene.

Overall, cool story, amazing atmosphere, beautiful level design, and overall fun experience.

column8:
Lo acabo de terminar. 
resumen: si queres jugarlo porque te gusto la pelicula original, no le da la nafta para llegar a dar la sensacion que te da la pelicula en lo absoluto. Pero... Si lo queres jugar porque te llama la atencion el juego en si, pues si te lo recomiendo, ta bueno.

Yo vi que un perro acompa√±aba al prota y por eso compre el juego, por el perro: ¬øValio la pena? Si, me encari√±e con Bullet. Dicen que hay distintos finales, tal vez el que me toco a mi no estuvo tan bien, pero yo intente dentro de todo ser fiel a lo que haria en la vida real (bueno, eso teniendo en cuenta que yo jamas iria solo a un bosque... aunque si escon Bullet tal vez si). Las primeras horas de juego son entretenidas, luego se pone un poco delirante el juego, donde no sabes que pasa, donde o cuando estas, el juego te confunde y te hace perder la linea general del argumento. 
Por otra parte, obviamente no tiene mucho de la esencia de la pelicula original, pero aun asi tiene partes que si me dieron miedo. De hecho, gracias a este juego entendi varias cosas sobre el miedo. Hay una parte en la que estas en la oscuridad noctuna del bosque y de la nada se escuchan ruidos, pasos acercandose, acechandote, y tu perro ladrando para todas partes, pero vos ni sabes que mierda es, porque al parecer nada te ataca. Bueno, esa es la parte de mas terror legitimo que tiene este juego, porque la parte final mas que miedo me dio tension y luego hasta me llego a hartar las bolas. Creo que sin saberlo, en aquella parte en la que se escuchan ruidos pero nada mas, captaron mejor la esencia original del filme que en el resto del juego. 
En conclusion parece Layers of Fear en medio del bosque pero con un poco mas de interactividad. No se si recomendarlo demasiado porque la ultima parte en serio que me molesto que sea tan larga y repetitiva (a lo layers of fear). 

Tambien me gusto esa reflexion acerca de como en el odio y la ira somos manipulados por el mal, crean o no en Dios, creo que tiene mucho de verdad esto, a veces nos corrompemos al dejarnos llevar por los sentimientos, como animales comiendose una carnada. Y cuando ya somos algo irreconocible, hasta nuestros seres mas queridos nos abandonan, ya no nos reconocen. Bueno, no es el mejor juego que jugue en mi vida, pero tampoco el peor. 
6/10

Sehr intensives und spannendes Horrorspiel.
08/10

Ormana bƒ±rakƒ±yor oyun bir de karanlƒ±k her yer bir harita vb de olmadƒ±ƒüƒ± i√ßin akmadƒ± oyun. Tƒ±kandƒ± kaldƒ±, daha iyi olabilirmi≈ü.
Me gusto, aunque hubiera sido bueno que hubieran cocina un poco mas el suspenso antes de mostrar a los enemigos.

I liked the Blair witch movies, all three of them. And I think if this game was more grounded, and took more examples from the movies pacing, script and vibe it would definitely be a better experience. 

The premise is simple and great, you go search for a missing boy in a creepy forest. The atmosphere is the strongest part of this game. The graphics are amazing and realistic-looking. And although I liked the addition of having a dog compainion, I am not exactly dog crazy, like most players I read about. But the implementation of the dog works well and its A.I. is pretty great, so it's nice to have him around mostly all the time. 

The problem with the game is that it soon start to feel like a mega mess. There was way too much emphasis on the protagonist past traumas from war, that turned the whole witch story into a hallucinogenic-like PTSD experience. 

Over all I was pretty disappointed also because the last level was awful to paly through, with still a great atmosphere, mind you. The creepy abandoned house was spot on, and it could be a great level if it were just a normal abandoned house to explore, but mixed with the character's insanity it does build a pretty tedious experience that I don't feel like replaying to get a different ending. 

And last but not least I was pretty disappointed with the bad ending I got. In my opinion the story was really bad and they could've done it much more satisfying for the player's experience. The game of course also had its moments, and I won't thumb it down, cause it was worth to play through at least once just for the atmosphere.

column8:
10/10

Review: If you didn‚Äôt know, this game is inspired by the found footage film ‚ÄòThe Blair Witch Project‚Äô. The game takes this concept and adds many interesting new elements to its story. Our main character is a very unreliable narrator and suffers from PTSD. The game starts with him driving to a forest to assist in a public search for a missing kid with his dog.  He starts out late though so he has to catch up with the search party in the forest and that‚Äôs when things take a turn for the worst. The game provides you with a walkie talkie, a phone, a camcorder and our good ol‚Äô trusty flashlight. The game does a pretty good job of exploring his past through phone calls and conversations with the sheriff through the walkie talkie. But they do use flashbacks to explore his story in detail. The game has a very interesting mechanic where you can watch tapes scattered across the forest to rewind through events that will affect the environment. It‚Äôs a very creative mechanic which services the story all while making you question whether any of this is actually happening. I don‚Äôt want to say too much and spoil the plot but I can say that the plot is solid and the game still holds up pretty well even though it‚Äôs a bit old. It‚Äôs a fun addition to the Blair Witch lore and is a scary experience for fans and newcomers alike.

column8: Blair Witch √® un gioco horror davvero spaventoso che tratta la leggendaria storia da un punto di vista completamente nuovo. Il gioco √® ambientato nella Black Hills Forest, dove il giocatore √® chiamato a scoprire i segreti della strega di Blair. L'atmosfera √® davvero inquietante, con una trama avvincente e alcuni momenti di suspense davvero terrificanti. La grafica √® davvero spettacolare, con un'ottima illuminazione che contribuisce all'atmosfera. La trama √® costruita molto bene e ci sono alcune sfide divertenti per mantenere il giocatore impegnato. Inoltre, il gioco offre anche una modalit√† in realt√† virtuale che rende l'esperienza ancora pi√π coinvolgente. In sintesi, Blair Witch √® un'avventura horror di prim'ordine che vi terr√† incollati al monitor e vi far√† vivere un'esperienza spaventosa ed emozionante.

A veeer, lo recomiendo pura y exclusivamente porque la historia es moderadamente interesante, y porque te acompa√±a un perro que lo podes acariciar cuantas veces quieras.
Por el resto esta medio meh el juego. Tenia todas las cartas para ser un gran juego de terror pero se queda en un juego de "suspenso" y misterio zafable

[h1] A game about PTSD [/h1]

It's a good horror game, but I'm not into 1st person games too much.
got lost and do not know what to do next.

Edit: After 8 hours, I finally finished this game and can now review it. 
Its strongest point is in the final act, when the game becomes more linear, it has great effects  and sound design together with the voice acting and the story progresses much faster and events become sequential, making the game more enjoyable. 

But I do have a few gripes. It's easy to lose your way in the forest really easily. Another would be that some areas are too dark or blurry gray, making it harder to see and choose the right directions to walk. Puzzles were OK, some hard to follow, some jumpscares were lost when you had to use the camera to navigate, I had to use a walkthrough because i cannot stress enough how easy it was to get lost.


Overall, personally, I give it a 7/10.

It's a great story, but the gray blur and getting lost a lot was very frustrating and uncomfortable.

column8: War nicht gut.

Even though this is not the strongest Bloober offering in my estimation and the last act is a bit weaker than the rest of the game, it's still a very good game and showcases how Bloober are masters at achieving oppressive, dark atmosphere and keeping the tension thick without too many jumpscares or chase scenes. If you prefer more adrenaline driven chase sequences, this might not be all too impressive to you. If you prefer sampling from the platter of terror in your own time, get this! Worthy of playing.

column8:
TLDR: An overpriced, visually beautiful, atmospheric, sometimes spooky game that starts out wonderfully and slowly grinds to a miserable halt.

The game starts off well with wonderful atmosphere and what, to me, seemed to be promises of interesting game mechanics. You've got your video camera, your phone, your walkie talkie, and your dog. All of which seem like really fun tools that I can  use to interact with the world and solve puzzles. By the end of the game though, they all fall pretty flat. The camera allows for some cool visuals and few good puzzles but that's about it. the phone and walkie talkie are only used for exposition dumps or the occasional scare and I was pretty disappointed with how pointless your dog, bullet is. He makes for good company and is useful for the few "combat" sequences but there isn't much else. The segments where you scare the monsters away with your flashlight and bullet's help are the best sequences. But it happens like three times. 

None of that would matter much to me if the game had two things. Horror and a good story. But it doesn't. Not to me at least. I understand horror is quite subjective, but other than a few brief sequences, I wasn't scared. The somber atmosphere was the scariest part. The feeling of isolation was wonderfully creepy but by the end, it just became a haunted house. Going from room to room, jumpscare to jumpscare. Most bloober games are like this its why I struggle with liking them. I love 'The Medium' because it feels like the only bloober game that rises above this horribly stale formula.

As for the story... It has no reason to be a blair witch game. The story is just 'Layers Of Fear' recycled with PTSD and the blair witch lore pasted on top. The final hour and a half where this all became clear to me was a miserable slog because I just didn't care. I didn't care about Ellis' past because all these people he hurt were just names, not even close to being characters. And the ending. Just an hour of nonsense. Maybe it went over my head but I sure doubt there was anything to go over my head at all. Bloober teams claims that this was a passion project of their but I'm not feeling it. To be terribly honest it feels very thrown together in terms of story. 

Final remarks: The game is beautiful, has great atmosphere, some good music, a few good spooks, and cute doggi but that isn't enough to hold it up. It just becomes too awful by the end for me to care unfortunately. The game is also pretty short. I only got 6 hours out of it for 30 bucks. I'd maybe suggest it for 10 or 15$ but with how aggravated I was when I beat it, I wouldn't get it for free.

Nah,

They used the Blair Witch name as a cash grab.

Tedious, boring, uninspired... and WHAT THE HECK DOES THIS GAME HAVE TO DO WITH THE BLAIR WITCH!!!?!?!?!?!?  This could have been a game called "ShellShock: The Terrifying Journey of PTSD", but no... its this crap.

I love Bloober.  The presentation is immaculate.  The game has some creep factor.  Its actually an elaborate walking simulator THAT DOESNT SEEM TO HAVE ANYTHING TO DO WITH THE WITCH!!!

I did not complete this game.  I have too many games than to force myself to push through a game to see if it gets better.  It lost my attention, and when a game does that, I cant recommend it.  The game is alright and its typical Bloober changing environments, but meh...  didnt interest me...  

More Witch please...  4/10

Nah,

They used the Blair Witch name as a cash grab.

Tedious, boring, uninspired... and WHAT THE HECK DOES THIS GAME HAVE TO DO WITH THE BLAIR WITCH!!!?!?!?!?!?  This could have been a game called "ShellShock: The Terrifying Journey of PTSD", but no... its this crap.

I love Bloober.  The presentation is immaculate.  The game has some creep factor.  Its actually an elaborate walking simulator THAT DOESNT SEEM TO HAVE ANYTHING TO DO WITH THE WITCH!!!

I did not complete this game.  I have too many games than to force myself to push through a game to see if it gets better.  It lost my attention, and when a game does that, I cant recommend it.  The game is alright and its typical Bloober changing environments, but meh...  didnt interest me...  

More Witch please...  4/10

column8:
[h1]A Great Opportunity Wasted[/h1] 
Blair Witch is a survival horror video game developed by Bloober Team based on the Blair Witch series of horror films. The game follows former police officer Ellis Lynch as he joins the search in Black Hills Forest for a missing boy.
 
[url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/ATReviews]Follow My Review Group Here![/url]

[table]
    [tr]
        [th]About[/th]
        [th]Description[/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]üíæGraphics[/td]
        [td]If I can think of one thing Blair Witch does right, it's the atmosphere and graphics. The game is absolutely stunning here. The forest is terrifying and makes you feel so immersed. The lighting is incredible and the environments tell a great story of isolation and abandonment. A great take on environmental story telling.[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]üéÆGameplay[/td]
        [td]The gameplay is okay I guess. I do like the interactions you can do when grabbing objects and examining them. The dog mechanics are also well thought out and are pretty good. Having to interact with your phone, radio, and camera is such a great mechanic I don‚Äôt see well implemented in games that often and Blair Witch does it really well. Finding clues and using Bullet (the dog's name) to help you discover items was really fun and made Bullet seem useful and fun to interact with. You can also give Bullet snacks and pet him so that's pretty cool. There‚Äôs little to no sneaking in this game, and the monsters are pretty comedic and wasted potential. They are just so boring to go against in this game. I don‚Äôt want to spoil them but for the most part it‚Äôs mostly the same creature that all you have to do is flash your light on it, that‚Äôs it! The scare factor in this game dies down pretty quick once you realize that you mostly just walk in the woods and flash your light on the monster (don‚Äôt segments are so far and between, also really short). That you don‚Äôt have a sense of fear after nearly getting halfway through the game. Great gameplay mechanics, just poor enemies and little to no scare factor here.[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]üìúStory[/td]
        [td]The story is trash. I‚Äôm just gonna say it how it is. I was extremely disappointed with this game. Probably more than I should. The first two hours were so interesting and intense. Once the PTSD flashbacks came into the game, I was getting frustrated. The flashbacks take you out of the experience a lot. The main character is so boring and not interesting at all. Even his flashbacks were not that interesting. The ‚Äúvillain‚Äù is a complete clown in this game. I will now be talking about spoilers so you are warned. [spoiler]The main danger was a forestman in the woods that had gone insane. Such a stupid villain. Oh and the "Witch" is not a threat at all! You don't learn much at all about the Black Forest or the Blair Witch. Yeah they bring in some comments about the people from the original movie, but that's just to please the fans. The final fight was all cutscenes too. For a game called [b]"Blair Witch"[/b] you never see the Witch or feel her presence or danger.[/spoiler] If I had to add a positive, it‚Äôs that choices in the game do have an impact on the story and there are multiple endings. In conclusion, as there are some great things the story has in terms of choices and mechanics, It still felt like a waste of potential. They could have picked many different ideas that would have been way better here, and this is what they decided to do. An underwhelming story and a waste of time. 

[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]üïõPlaytime[/td]
        [td]The story is like 5 hours long on average. Getting 100% will probably take around 15-20+ hours for all achievements.[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]üéßSound[/td]
        [td]The sound design is pretty good. The noises in the woods add to the atmosphere, and the voice acting is pretty solid. The dog can get annoying with all the crying, barking, and growing which gets old really quick (like in the first  hour). The forest doesn‚Äôt feel empty and you have this feeling of something watching you which show‚Äôs they did a great job on the sound design and ambiance.[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]‚ùóBugs‚ùó[/td]
        [td]I have encountered several bugs here. The camera would sometimes glitch and take me out of the main characters body for a few seconds, I would get clipped in some areas, the dog would get stuck, and the weather would change almost instant at times.[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]üîÖPerformance[/td]
        [td]The performance was not the best here. Most of the time it was okay. I would drop around 40fps in some areas so this game does have a bit of a performance issues (in some areas), but most of the time it was pretty good.[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]‚úîÔ∏èPro‚Äôs[/td]
        [td][list]
[*]Gorgeous visuals
[*]Good voice acting
[*]Dynamic interaction with items
[*]Dense and scary atmosphere
[*]Multiple Endings
[/list]
[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]‚ùåCon‚Äôs[/td]
        [td][list]
[*]Buggy experience at times
[*]Dog gets stuck in the environment
[*]Story in the second half is a waste of time
[*]Constant loops through some sections
[*]Navigation can be confusing in some areas
[*]PTSD flashbacks are annoying and take you out of the experience
[/list]
[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]üèÜRating[/td]
        [td]3.5/10
Buy this game for around 50-75% off. [/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]üîóConclusion[/td]
        [td]A game with great mechanics suffers from a terrible and lackluster story. Some sections were pretty good in the early stage, but suffered greatly in the second half. I was expecting a spooky and interesting story the deeper you go, but turns into a comedic piece of trash later on with a terrible/cheesy villain with constant loops. It‚Äôs fascinating to see how they screwed up like this. The story is not the worst in the world, but they could have done this better in so many different ways, especially with the Blair Witch lore.[/td]
    [/tr]
[/table]
 
https://store.steampowered.com/app/1092660/Blair_Witch/

me encant√≥!! üíïüíï
Tienes un perro 10/10

This game is hard to recommend. It starts off almost normal enough, and gets more and more weird as the game goes on, although you do partly expect that from something called Blair Witch.

There are some very interesting game mechanics, such as what you can do with the video recorder and the tapes, and I do like the way the level changes dynamically around you as you progress.

I did find the ending part of the game a bit too tedious, by that point I just wanted to get to the end and hopefully get more of an explanation as to what's going on.

The graphics are also very nice, although I'm not sure how much HDR helps matters. The game also sues Corsair ICUE, where if you have a compatible keyboard and mouse it will change the lights on your devices, although I feel that could have been used to grater effect

If you like psychological horrors then you may enjoy this. It's interesting but not one I could personally play again.

column8:
Blair Witch Project (1999) is one of my favorite movies, and being able to immerse myself in the forests of Burkittsville through this game was an incredible experience.

The game has decent visuals, outstanding ambience and a simple yet passable gameplay loop.

The latter parts of this game genuinely creeped me out, and I was just hoping for the game to end as it was getting creepier and creepier.

Blair Witch takes around 5 hours to complete, which is the perfect length for this type of game. If you're a horror fan looking for an immersive and short experience, do not hesitate and get this game - just don't tell me you weren't warned when you go inside the Witch House.

column8:
Dicho en corto, otra maravilla m√°s de Blooper Team. Blair Witch es un t√≠tulo de g√©nero terror que combina con aventura gr√°fica, una f√≥rmula que ya hemos visto bastantes veces en gran parte de las creaciones de Blooper Team. 

La historia de este juego al inicio del   juego es bastante confusa, haci√©ndote sentir desorientado en todo momento obligandote el propio juego a dar tumbos de un punto a otro cual alma en pena, una mec√°nica que ya hemos visto en otros juegos como en la saga de Layers of Fear. En este caso nos pondremos en la piel de un polic√≠a que tiene varios traumas que tratar adem√°s de verse envuelto en una serie de desdichas. El lore de este t√≠tulo da a entender que lo ocurrido en este videojuego es posterior a lo ocurrido en la pel√≠cula.

Los personajes son pocos. Ante todo brillan Ellis y su compa√±ero de aventuras Bullet. A medida que progresamos en la historia podemos ver como el personaje de Ellis se va haciendo cada vez m√°s profundo y oscuro, lleno de dudas, incertidumbres y cicatrices resultantes de experiencias pasadas un tanto traum√°ticas. En todo momento nos centramos en Ellis y lo que parece ser su constante lucha por mantener un estado mental aceptable a medida que lucha con sus propios miedos y alucinaciones al mismo tiempo que est√° resisti√©ndose con los juegos mentales de la bruja de Blair. 

La m√∫sica es bastante buena. Las pistas de audio incitan a una ambientaci√≥n l√∫gubre, terror√≠fica en la que predomina la desesperanza y soledad. 

La ambientaci√≥n es una de las estrellas de este t√≠tulo. El bosque est√° dise√±ado de manera que te sientas perdido en todo momento, hacaciendote sentir desorientado y peque√±o ante las largas extensiones de senderos, √°rboles y matojos que parecen haber visto tiempos mejores. El d√≠a aboga a la calma y tranquilidad, haci√©ndote seguir seguro bajo la luz del sol. Sin embargo, a medida que ves caer este, sientes como un escalofr√≠o recorre tu espalda y un sudor fr√≠o cubre tu frente ante la ineludible certeza de saber lo que est√° a punto de ocurrir... y no ser√° bueno. La noche es perfecta, oscuridad por todas partes acompa√±ada de un silencio que se ve interrumpido por los pasos de Ellis y alg√∫n que otro sonido causado por seres que te vigilan en todo momento a cada paso que das.

El gameplay es bastante simple: camina, investiga, se sigiloso y lucha por tu supervivencia. No tendr√°s que preocuparte por ser acechado en todo momento, sin embargo, cuando el juego te pida que seas sigiloso, debes de serlo. Adem√°s de eso, el procedimiento es el mismo que en Layers of Fear. En un par de ocasiones, habr√°n escenas de acci√≥n en las que, con linterna en mano como si de una pistola se tratara (Alan Wake, ¬øEres t√∫?), debes de encargarte de ahuyentar los seres que amenazan con poner fin a tu estad√≠a en el bosque.

En conclusi√≥n, ¬øRecomendar√≠a este t√≠tulo? Si eres un jugador que le encanta una buena historia con tem√°tica de terror y que ha visto la pel√≠cula de la Bruja de Blair, un rotundo s√≠. El doblaje original, la el soundtrack, los efectos de sonido, los escenarios, ambientaci√≥n e historias son pr√°cticamente perfectos. Hecho de menos el que una vez que hayas terminado de jugar la historia por primera vez te den la capacidad de seleccionar el cap√≠tulo que quieras para poder platinar con cierta comodidad el juego aunque tampoco es muy extenso el juego ya que en cinco horas lo completas. Dicho esto, recomendar√≠a encarecidamente ver antes la pel√≠cula de Blair Witch ya que hay una gran cantidad de elementos que te ayudan a ponerte en situaci√≥n adem√°s de entender el modus operandi de la bruja de Blair. Ten cuidado a la hora de entrar al bosque ya que puedes no salir de el... ella se encargar√° de impedirlo por todos los medios.

Ja, cool aber langweilig weil es sich zieht und dann auf einmal aufh√∂rt.

good, but sad ending

This game was truly extroadinary and I haven't even gotten all of the endings yet, in my one playthrough I was able to observe the great ambiance and suspense that this game has to offer. The jumpscares are short and sweet but I wouldn't care because nothing mattered more to me than little old Bullet. Literally 90% of my gameplay was petting him again and again, for those of you who are monsters and don't care, there is not a requirement to treat Bullet well. If you want to get a good ending you still may have to. I got this as a Christmas gift and I couldn't have asked for something better, I HIGHLY recommend this game and it would not disappoint you if you played it.

column8:
Blair witch is based off the movie I am guessing. I haven‚Äôt watched them so I‚Äôm playing this game and reviewing it at face value.

The story is about a kidnapped boy and you as a police officer set out with a crew to locate him. The story itself was decent and had a lot to do with suffering from PTSD. As a horror game it‚Äôs not really scary but more psychological horror which it‚Äôs good at. The story isn‚Äôt confusing to follow and was told well, tho towards the end I was kind of hoping the ending was coming, as the last hour of the game really stretched on.

Graphically the game looked great. It had good atmosphere and really good voice acting. But I did find some annoyances that really bothered me‚Ä¶‚Ä¶

The dog - while it was nice to have a companion in the game you can interact with, have them fetch item, and help lead you in the right direction, it never stops barking. It started to drive me insane how much the dog barked and whined. It made my own dog start barking, so now I have 2 annoying dogs around me lmao.

The Forrest - the main part of the game is somewhat frustrating to navigate as it all looks the same and you need to find progression items which can involve some slight back tracking, all the while getting lost and going in circles. You will eventually learn the areas a bit but you never stay in those spots for too long.

Over all the game is decent and while it did have some annoying issues I enjoyed playing it. Just wish the dog would stfu.

This game plays terrible on steam deck and barely holds 30 fps so I ended up playing it on my pc.

7.5/10

column8:
Another game that deserves a neutral rating.

It's not bad. It has some good moments, and we can see that work and care has been delivered into the game by the developers: The atmosphere is good, and the forest is a bit scary (initially).

However after the first half an hour, you realize that the game is not that scary. It's just a haunted forest walking simulator, full of loops. Some loops are part of the story, but others is the player walking in circles, because he didn't find the correct object or clue. And in neither case, walking in circles/loops is fun.

I understand that the Blair Witch lore, can just take a game so far. It's the tale of the evil spirit of a dead witch, haunting a forest and making people trapped in it go crazy. And it's a tale with almost 20 years, I guess it's not possible to teach this old dog new tricks.

Or maybe the game is a masterpiece. Its so realistic and faithful to his source material, that indeed accurately portraits being lost in a forest. And just like in real life, it's not a fun experience.

If you are a fan of the Blair Witch movie and lore, give it at try. Its doesn't present anything truly new but at some points the game can be really good and a little scary.

At least the dog Bullet is fun.

column8:
I cannot recommend this game unless it's on sale. There were several very frustrating decision made in regards to game play that sucked the fun of it. I honestly feel that it could have been just as impactful but 1/2 as long. 

The Good:
- Great Atmosphere and creepy, situational music. 
- Impressive level design and seamless methods of making you run in circles in non linear ways. A+
- A very good boi that you can pet and give treats!

The Bad
- It just keeps droning on and on to little point or purpose. The last 1 hour is an endless cycle of corridors and jump scares, mixed with teleportation back at the start of the map, where the theme of 'LE TRAUMA' is stupidly hammered home like it wasn't the sole focus of every frame for the past 1 hour. For the love of God, yes we get it. LE TRAUMA
- Game mechanics are set up from the start to lead you the 'bad ending' forcing a replay.
- See above, you have entire sections of your inventory dedicated to collecting statues, but if you collect a single one you are doomed to the 'bad ending'.

Get it on sale and temper your patience.

column8: Blair Witch tries to be a psychological horror experience and manages to capture some of the genre's charms but unlike giving a unique experience, it fails in struggling to keep its fingers away from the genre's cliches at the same time. In its last minutes,this time game tries to increase the tension by intense pacing but finds itself in an endless loop of boring sequences that resemble each other and ends up being a psychological harm inducing phenomenon rather than a pyschological horror experience.Still it's a decent horror game and worth a shot tho.

If you're looking for something scary, this isn't really it at all. If you're looking for a dark game with puzzles, this also is not the game for you. However, if you just wanna see a generally dark story about a guy going into the forest with his dog, then this would be an okay game to get. The game is "On rails", so your hand will be held every step of the way. All you have to do is hold down forward on your control stick for 6 hours and you will be done with the game. But even then, the story isn't that compelling either.  If you really wanna try this game, get it on sale when you have nothing else to play.

column8:
The little gameplay that's here isn't enough for this game to escape the walking simulator moniker. Combat is just pointing your flashlight in the right direction, and any interesting events are completely scripted. The only goal of navigating the forest is to reach the next scripted event. I can get the same experience watching a playthrough on YouTube as I can actually playing it.

The only positive is the excellent atmosphere, but a game can't stand on that alone. The fact that this team is working on the Silent Hill 2 Remake just makes me sad.

Although this title had a bitter start, it plays pretty well nowadays.

Since it has been so long since i have watched the movie.. And i won't go see it again. It somehow is a 'cult' classic. You don't have to see the movie for playing and understanding the story of the game though.

After WB, Lionsgate has this immersive horror movie type of play. I won't tell too much but you have to solve puzzles, find random objects and a dog as your sidekick. All this and more will help you to unravel the dent story.

Going into the woods won't be the same anymore...

Little add-in; although UE which is being used and thus concentrated on use of controller instead of keyboard.. This game also allows you to make use of a regular keyboard, however you are 'locked' to WASD instead of the arrow-keys.

Achtung: In einigen Szenen gibt es starke Kameraschwankungen. Wer wie ich leicht zu "Motion Sickness" neigt, sollte das eventuell ber√ºcksichtigen.

Jetzt ist das Spiel schon einige Jahre drau√üen, aber ich bin geflasht! Die Umgebung ist so atmosph√§risch in Szene gesetzt, dass man sich glatt wie in einem echten Wald f√ºhlt. Die Kombination aus Horrorelementen und Psycho Thriller passt sehr gut zusammen. Ich habe bisher noch nicht den Film zu Blair Witch gesehen, aber auch ohne kann man problemlos in die Geschichte eintauchen. 
Das Gameplay ist simpel, tut der Spannung aber keinen Abbruch. Mehr Komplexit√§t w√§re vielleicht sogar √ºberfordernd. 
Alles in allem hatte ich sehr viel Spa√ü mit Blair Witch und trotz der kurzen Durchspielzeit w√ºrde ich es Horror- und Thrillerfans in jedem Fall empfehlen.

Overall the game is nice, but there are a lot of lenghs. The game start to be dynamic at the end, the end's choices is very noisy but I assume it's a choice that you have to take during the game that affects everything after it.

I'd recommend this game for amateurs but the story is still really weird and I couldn't understand the game's end.

column8:
Questo gioco e' davvero un'immersione totale in una foresta notturna, un viaggio suggestivo e pieno di suoni ed effetti spettacolari, oserei dire molto meglio anche del film originario e ben piu' inquietante.
Un immancabile gioco per gli appassionati della saga e delle ambientazioni naturali. Usate le cuffie, per un'esperienza di gioco ancora piu' autentica!

Prima di parlare nello specifico di Blair Witch, √® necessario fare un salto indietro nel tempo al lontano 1999, anno in cui sbanc√≤ al botteghino The Blair Witch Project, film che possiamo definire "rivoluzionario" in quanto non solo ha dato il via a un filone di opere derivate ambientate nello stesso universo in cui prende luogo la pellicola, ma anche ai cosiddetti horror che sfruttano la tecnica "found footage". Al gioco in questione hanno lavorato gli ormai esperti e blasonati sviluppatori di Bloober Team, e il risultato finale √® un autentico gioiellino nel panorama degli horror psicologici con forte impronta narrativa.

Burkittsville, 1996. Il giovane Peter Shannon, un ragazzino di 9 anni, scompare nel bosco di Black Hills, tristemente noto per la sua storia intrisa di sangue e mistero. Lo sceriffo locale organizza delle squadre di soccorso per ritrovare Peter, e alla spedizione si unisce Ellis, un ex poliziotto e veterano di guerra dal passato turbolento, spinto da motivazioni personali e alla ricerca di redenzione. Al suo fianco Bullet, un pastore belga dell'unit√† cinofila, dal fiuto infallibile e addestrato a seguire tracce. Come in ogni horror che si rispetti, quella che sembra un'indagine come le altre ben presto si rivela anticamera di un mistero molto pi√π fitto e torbido...
Evitando spoiler, quella di Ellis √® una discesa nella pazzia cadenzata, scandita da episodi di follia che dapprima possono essere attribuiti al PTSD di cui soffre il protagonista, ma che poi cominciano a divenire sempre pi√π terrificanti e sovrannaturali. Blair Witch si identifica quindi con le storie a cui i ragazzi di Bloober sono avvezzi: racconti di follia, nei quali i drammi personali si fondono con un clima permeato da eventi inspiegabili.

Blair Witch non abbatte i canoni in cui sono specializzati i creatori di Layers of Fear, Observer, eccetera, ma si differenzia dalle altre creazioni del team in quanto porta in dote un gameplay un po' pi√π vario, fornendo al protagonista un set di strumenti che consente di interagire con l'ambiente in modi diversi: una torcia elettrica, un walkie-talkie, un cellulare e una videocamera molto "speciale", ma qui ci arriviamo dopo. Infine, al fianco del nostro equipaggiamento c'√® Bullet, che pi√π che mero "strumento" possiamo definire "amico", di fatto la relazione tra Ellis e il suo fedele compagno √® ben pi√π di un semplice rapporto utilitaristico: l'ex poliziotto √® un uomo solo, dilaniato dai sensi di colpa e da un passato tormentato, e trova nel suo compare canino un'ancora di salvezza per non sprofondare nell'abisso. Oltre ai consueti ordini, √® possibile interagire con Bullet coccolandolo, sgridandolo (se lo fate siete delle me*de) e premiandolo con degli snack per cani. Queste azioni, apparentemente estetiche, in realt√† contribuiscono a incrementare il rapporto tra i due e a influenzare i molteplici finali del gioco, influenzati tra le altre cose anche dall'utilizzo del cellulare, che potremo usare, campo permettendo, per parlare con Jess, ex moglie di Ellis, tutto sommato ancora affezionata a lui e viceversa. Prima dell'inizio del gioco ci viene detto che ogni nostra azione √® "osservata", ma non sapremo nell'immediato se una scelta appena compiuta (o non compiuta) si rivela giusta o sbagliata: lo sapremo solo proseguendo nell'avventura della durata complessiva di 5-6 ore, un tempo non certo longevo ma abbastanza esiguo da impedire di annoiarsi.

La presenza di Bullet, caratterizzato in modo molto curato e realistico, e il discreto numero di strumenti hanno lo scopo di creare una sorta di clima di sicurezza all'interno della lugubre foresta. Tuttavia la sensazione di mantenere il controllo √® del tutto illusoria, e questo si paleser√† soprattutto durante l'esplorazione: gli sviluppatori, infatti, ingannano costantemente gli occhi e la percezione di Ellis (e del giocatore) dandogli l'illusione di rivedere costantemente gli stessi posti, di girare in tondo, un trucchetto non certo originale ma perfettamente in linea con quanto si vede nei film della saga.
Una menzione speciale va data alla videocamera, probabilmente lo strumento pi√π utile in dotazione. Sparse per gli ambienti di gioco si trovano delle cassette, grazie alle quali √® possibile manipolare attivamente la realt√†: per passare oltre una porta ostruita potrebbe essere dunque necessario fermare la registrazione in un frame specifico, lo stesso per far apparire dal nulla particolari oggetti. Ovviamente non mancheranno pericoli da affrontare (o evitare), ma lascio a voi il "piacere" della scoperta, dandovi un unico, vago consiglio: la luce li tiene lontani...

Il comparto audio, poi, √® terrificante. Ovviamente in senso positivo. E' fortemente consigliato l'utilizzo delle cuffie, data la componente binaurale del sonoro, e cos√¨ facendo il gioco vi tiene letteralmente in tensione dal primo all'ultimo minuto.

Per concludere, consiglio Blair Witch a un pubblico molteplice: i fan dei film, gli amanti dei giochi horror e chi ormai, come il sottoscritto, nutre piena fiducia nei confronti di Bloober Team, che ancora una volta dimostra il proprio talento sfornando un titolo intrigante, pregno di trovate orrorifiche gi√† viste e sperimentate, certo, ma di pregevole fattura e intelligentemente contestualizzate all'interno dell'intera esperienza.
Keep gaming, folks!
ESPECTACULAR EXPERIENCIA

La verdad es que me esperaba bastante mas de este Blair Witch.

Es una aventura interactiva (casi podr√≠a catalogarlo de un walking simulator) bastante corta y que a mi personalmente 0 miedo me ha dado. La historia es llevadera pero bastante previsible.

Graficamente y de ambientaci√≥n considero que esta bien, pero sin alardes al igual que en el aspecto sonoro.
En contra, la parte final se me ha hecho muy cuesta arriba dada la reiteraci√≥n de algunos elementos jugables.

Se juega bien y se acaba y ya esta. Se pasa al siguiente juego sin que realmente el juego te deje ning√∫n poso o recuerdo destacable, al menos en mi caso.

"Not great, not terrible" is how I would describe this game. Being set in such a spooky setting and with 20+ years worth of lore and films to draw from this experience winds up being very... mixed. While the game isn't outright terrible it's more 'meh' than anything else with some potentially cool ideas with the dog being an integral part of the game guiding you through the woods (and your own issues) and helping you on this seemingly typical investigation of a missing young boy. 

However the game pretty much tosses that plot point aside after a short while for a more personal, psychological approach and while I appreciate the attempt at being more than a spooky monsters in the woods game it unfortunately ends up being... a boring walking sim with a few spooky monsters in the woods game with a dog who's AI may or may not make your life a living hell for a few hours. Have fun wondering aimlessly in the dark for long stretches with not much attempt in atmosphere or tension to make those stretches of wandering at least somewhat scary or nerve wracking. It's a shame because there's potential for a better game here given the source material.

If you're a fan of the Blair Witch then give it a shot, it's fairly short in length. I'd wait for a deep sale though. If not, there's much better on offer in the genre.

column8: I've had this game in my library for a couple of years and never got round to playing it so thought I'd have a go. I've got to say halfway through playing it I was so looking forward to getting through it and not having to play it again lol its very WEIRD, a few times a few bits did make me jump but I quickly grew tired of the forest and the old cabin, the dog, the colouring and surroundings were really getting on my nerves and I can honestly say I'm looking forward to playing anything else other than this lol its not a bad game and definitely worth playing, I'm glad I've completed it but I won't be playing it again 6/10.

I have questions for the people who left this game a positive review. For all the people that claim to have been really scared by this game and who claim this game is so good, did we play a different game? I'm not trying to be mean or rude, really, but this game was just not good in any particular sense of the word. And for the life of me I can't see how it has "mostly positive" reviews on here. Unless they are legit all for the dog. In which case you paid $30 to pet a virtual dog and that left you satisfied somehow.

This is gonna be long winded, so the tldr: Not scary, story was flat, too many mechanics for no reason.

Okay long version now. First this game lacks anything approaching horror. As someone who was legitimately scared of The Blair Witch Project, I went into this game expecting to be really frightened. And there were moments where the potential for a really scary game was evident. There could have been a really terrifying experience here. Instead you get half baked jumpscares, some shadow men that pop out at you every now and then, and a dark forest. I guess if you're really scared of the dark and/or the woods, then maybe this resonates with you a bit more. Or maybe if you don't normally play horror games this might be just scary enough to get you sweating. But as someone who regularly plays really scary games....this game was really weak in the scares. More often than not, even the jumpscares failed to make me flinch. Only once in the whole game did I legitimately not want to go down the dark scary path. It took me about 8 hours to complete. 1 decent scene in 8 hours isn't enough. The game could have much more effectively played on the fear of being ALONE in the woods. There could have been some really good atmosphere building. Instead you get to pet the dog every few seconds so you never really feel alone. I'll come back to that.

The story was hallmark movie grade bad. The main character isn't really relatable in any way, unless you happen to be a veteran of the Iraq War with severe PTSD. In which case my condolences. But aside from that...I don't care about Ellis. I'm not given a real reason to care. You are clearly supposed to give a damn about Ellis, his ex wife, the kid lost in the woods, the sheriff, etc but they don't actually bother to try and make you care. The biggest emotional moment is with the dog and frankly it doesn't feel earned. They're just using people's instinct to love animals to invoke an emotional response instead of building that feeling from the ground up. Frankly if the playtime devoted to emotional bs was redirected towards just building a scary game I would have been much happier. Also the dialogue and voice acting were lacking, further adding to the feeling of "I just don't care".

And finally, the mechanics, the actual gameplay. Here's the problem, there's too many mechanics. None of them are inherently bad or poorly implemented, but none of them are fleshed out or particularly interesting. The cellphone that you occasionally get to use to try and patch things up with your ex wife or receive creepy texts on, the radio you use sometimes to talk to a whole 2 people, the magic camcorder, the flashlight to kill shadow monsters, the backpack full of things, most of which get no explanation, the dog treats that are literally never even pointed out to you and thus you could miss them entirely, and of course the dog itself with the 5 different interactions, of which you mainly use "pet". There are so many different little bits and bobs and none of them actually amount to much if anything. You wanna get the best ending? Boy you better know ahead of time to call your ex incessantly. And how would you know that? No clue, game doesn't make that clear. Want to get the "kill no enemies" achievement? Well they don't explain that there's an alternative until it's far too late. Guess you better play it a second time then. You don't usually even know to use the dog to look for something unless the game specifically tells you to, because it's only really used a couple times. This game suffers from trying to have too many "unique" mechanics and as a result none of them are fleshed out properly or even really seem that useful. Ditch it all except the camcorder and the flashlight and now we have a decent game.

And yes, I am implying that the dog takes away from the game. Because it does. It's a cheap way to get you invested in one part of the game just so they can then get a cheap emotional reaction out of you later. It doesn't add to the experience. Feeling alone is a great way to make someone feel scared. You spend the bulk of the game with literal guard dog. So why would you feel scared? From a gameplay standpoint, the dog adds nothing. I'm sorry, but it's true. 

This game had potential. But the overly ambitious dev team didn't have what it takes to push it over the finish line. Nothing about this game was outright good. None of it was really bad either. It was bland. It's a really bland way to spend 8 hours and $30. Do yourself a favor and go watch someone else play it. You will be more entertained.

El juego esta bueno........ pero el final no, muy malo en realidad. Todo el juego sigue una muy buena tematica, con una muy buena ambientacion en el bosque, usando las camaras y siguiendo al asesino. El ultimo cap, el 17, arruina todo el jugo. Super larga la secuncia de la casa, de forma totalmente innecesaria, super anticlimatica, tediosa y molesta, no logra causar temor siquiera y esta esa sangre super mal animada que te quita totalmente el miedo y las ganas de seguir. LA verdad venia muy bien hasta el final. 6/10

Not a bad game, the story is pretty good and gripping, I think if you fear being alone in a dark forest with strange noises then this game will scare you. I love how they have blended everything together like the hallucinations and PTSD and the end house was pretty scary too. 

Overall I would give this game 8/10. 

Things it could improve on, harder to defeat monsters for sure.

Gut!!!

SPOILERS

This is a game with a decision based ending, but you don't really get to decide anything and end up getting the worst ending no matter what. Because the game tricks you into doing all the bad decisions and those include the simple gaming stuff you do in every game like collecting stuff and beating enemies. So you shouldn't do those things, you shouldn't collect the collectibles and fight the enemies etc. to get the good ending at your first playthrough. Which is impossible since playing a game is almost always exploring the entire environment, collect everything and stand against your enemies. So it's bullshit. It doesn't make any sense. I really liked Layers of Fear. This isn't even close to it. In Layers of Fear your humanity really gets judged and you get the ending you deserve at your first playthrough. This isn't like that at all. 

Other than that, the game isn't really about Blair Witch at all but it's about the inner demons of an ex-cop and a vet who has a severe PTSD. It just sets in the woods and has this general "witch in the woods" theme. There's really no Blair Witch in the game. Which is another bullshit. It's like the developers used a popular culture element to get their game sell more. 

The gameplay has a lot of problems and it's not smooth like Layers of Fear. Also the atmosphere is not as good as it was in Observer and Layers of Fear as well. So if you liked those games and looking for another one, this isn't it. Don't waste your money on this.

WOW!!!! DAVVERO WOW!!!!

Premetto che non mi sento di dare il voto pieno a questo gioco, ma di certo √® uno dei MIGLIORI che abbia mai giocato del suo genere!!!!
Avendo gi√† visto i relativi film a cui il gioco di √® ispirato, non ho potuto fare a meno di giocarlo vivendolo come uno dei protagonisti del film.
La Lore inventata √® davvero ben fatta.
I rumori, le figure improvvise che appaiono nell'ambiente per un secondo e poi spariscono (che ti fanno credere a te giocatore di stare davvero impazzendo).
Il gameplay....Il gameplay √® qualcosa di mai visto in un gioco!!!! 
Apparentemente uguale a molti altri, ma pi√π si prosegue nella storia e nelle diverse ambientazioni e pi√π ti sembra davvero ti impazzire, con oggetti che si modificano da soli nell'inventario, Jumpscare casuali e ben messi ed oggetti che sembrano avere un normale uso ma si riveleranno utili per altre cose paranormali <3
Da giocare al buio o comunque alla sera, come fosse un film al cinema.
Da viverlo in ogni singolo momento :)

column8:
This game has so much potential.

I like this game but failed to scare as much as I'd like it to. I understand it wanted to go into more of a Lore atmosphere but failed to scare. Each time the main character's past was brought up and you hear other people's voices I felt zero fear anymore.

To improve this game I would recommend the following: (SPOILERS) If more areas were introduced that involve bullet actively running away from you and the further away from him you are. The more terrifying things you see. The plot is good but drawn out too much as if very easy to see after 5 minutes into the witch house. The witch house is also too long and drawn out and over time loses any feeling of being scary. Dead silence and your footsteps do a lot to scare someone. The blair witch project movie had 0 jumpscares and never showed the witch. Having ambient sounds and footsteps drives someone to insane amounts of fear. I love the stare at corner scene at the end but you could have made it even better where the main character must find peter and anytime the witch enters a room you have to run to the corner with the symbol on it to avoid her killing you. You don't show her and in fact just have a silhouette on the camera and if you fail to go to a corner, from the darkness hands come and snap your neck maybe. Many fear causing and intense gameplay moments could have been done to make the whole game so much better. I would personally say to focus more on gameplay than the lore for the next game. Look to **witch hunt** for inspiration for a way more terrifying approach as the ambiance and curiosity make that game amazing. I wish bloober team the best and would love to see them fix things and make the game 10 time more scary.

Thank you,
