5Â∞èÊó∂Â∑¶Âè≥‰∏ÄÂë®ÁõÆÊµÅÁ®ãÈÄöÂÖ≥„ÄÇËøôÊòØ‰∏ÄÊ¨æÂØπÈ¢òÊùêÂíåËÆæÂÆöÁöÑÊääÊè°ÂáÜÁ°ÆÔºå‰ª•ÂâßÊÉÖÊµÅÁ®ã‰∏∫‰∏ªÁöÑÊÅêÊÄñÊÉäÊÇöÊ∏∏Êàè„ÄÇÊµÅÁ®ã‰∏≠‰º¥ÈöèÂ∞ëÈáèËß£ÂØÜÔºå‰ΩÜÊåâÁÖßÊïôÁ®ãÂú®‰∏çÂêåÂú∫ÂêàÊê≠ÈÖç‰ΩøÁî®Áõ∏ÂÖ≥ËÆæÂ§áÔºåÂπ∂ÈÄÇÊó∂Ë∑üÈöèÈÅìÂÖ∑Á∫øÁ¥¢ÊåáÂºïÔºåÂü∫Êú¨ÈöæÂ∫¶‰∏çÂ§ß„ÄÇÊ∏∏Êàè‰∏≠ÁöÑjump scare‰∏çÂ§öÔºåÂπ∂‰∏îÊÅêÊÄñÂà∫ÊøÄÊÄßÁîªÈù¢ËæÉÂ∞ëÔºå‰ΩÜÂú∫ÊôØÊ∞õÂõ¥ÔºåÊÅêÊÄñËäÇÂ•èÊéåÊè°ÁöÑÊÅ∞Âà∞Â•ΩÂ§ÑÔºåÊØîËæÉÈÄÇÂêàÂàùÊ¨°Â∞ùËØïÊÅêÊÄñÊ∏∏ÊàèÁöÑÁé©ÂÆ∂„ÄÇÁæé‰∏≠‰∏çË∂≥ÁöÑÊòØÂØπ‰∫éÊÅêÊÄñÊ∏∏ÊàèËÄÅÁé©ÂÆ∂Êù•ËØ¥ÂèØËÉΩ‰∏çÂ§üÂ∞ΩÂÖ¥ÔºåËææÊàêÂ•ΩÁªìÂ±ÄÁöÑÊù°‰ª∂ÊØîËæÉËãõÂàªÔºåÊ∏∏ÊàèÁé©Ê≥ïÊ¨†‰∏∞ÂØå„ÄÇ‰ΩÜÂèçËøáÊù•ÊÉ≥ÔºåÂÆö‰ΩçÂáÜÁ°ÆÊ≠£ÊòØËøôÈÉ®‰ΩúÂìÅÁöÑ‰ºòÂäø‰πã‰∏ÄÔºå‰ΩúËÄÖÂØπ‰ΩúÂìÅÁöÑÈ¢òÊùê„ÄÅÁé©Ê≥ïÔºåËÆæÂÆöÊääÊè°Âà∞‰ΩçÔºåÂØπÂâßÊÉÖÂèäÁªìÂ±ÄÁöÑÂÆâÊéí‰πüÂú®ÊÉÖÁêÜ‰πã‰∏≠ÔºåÁî®ÊúâÈôêÁöÑËµÑÊ∫êÂÅöÊúÄÂ•ΩÁöÑ‰ΩúÂìÅÔºåÊàëÊÉ≥‰ªñ‰ª¨ÂÅöÂà∞‰∫Ü„ÄÇÊÄª‰πãÊòØ‰∏ÄÊ¨æÁü≠Â∞èÁ≤æÊÇçÁöÑÊ∏∏ÊàèÔºåÂéü‰ª∑ÂÖ•ÂÅèÈ´òÔºåËã•ÊúâÊäòÊâ£ÔºåÂÄºÂæó‰∏ÄËØï„ÄÇ
:D

Ein Horrorspiel, wahrlich.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2879372510
[b]Geschichte[/b]

Wir spielen einen ehem. Soldaten (glaube ich), der unter PTBS leidet. Als ein Kind im Wald verschwindet, f√§hrt er dort hin, um sich an der Suche zu beteiligen. Da er die anderen nicht sieht, macht er sich, nur von seinem treuen Hund Bullet begleitet, allein auf die Suche.

Wir finden ab und an Hinweise, meist mit Hilfe des Hundes, die uns tiefer in den Wald f√ºhren, der von irgendwelchen b√∂sen M√§chten bev√∂lkert zu sein scheint. Die Realit√§t wird immer mehr von seltsamen Ereignissen √ºberlagert.

Die Geschichte lehnt sich lose an den Horrorfilm von 1999, Blair Witch Project an, den ich nicht kenne. Aber m.E. ist dies eher egal, da es angeblich sehr lose ist und Freunde des Filmes wohl keine "Verfilmung" erwarten sollten.

Gef√§llt mir die Geschichte? Ich wei√ü nicht, soweit bin ich nicht gekommen, um es beurteilen zu k√∂nnen. Das Setting ist relativ typisch. Wald als Umgebung ist nachts angsteinfl√∂√üend (man gehe mal selbst Nachts in einen fremden Wald).

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2879372626
[b]Gameplay[/b]

Ein ungew√∂hnliches Gameplayelement ist sicherlich der Hund an unserer Seite, der uns hilft, der aber auch ein paar Belobigungen gern hat, um nicht durchzudrehen. Aber am Durchdrehen sind auch wir selbst, also bleiben wir auch sch√∂n bei Bullet.

In der Praxis fand ich das Gameplay aber derma√üen anstrengend sich hinziehend. Wir laufen st√§ndig den Wald ab, fragen Hundi, ob er eine Spur hat oder gehen der Nase lang. Wobei wir meist im Kreis laufen, was nicht ungew√∂hnlich ist, aber auch nervig. Nach was suchen wir? Keine Ahnung, irgendwas, was uns weiterbringt.

Wenn man genau dorthin und so geht, wie der Entwickler dies vermutet, dann st√∂sst man sicher auf die entsprechenden Trigger, aber wehe, man verpasst etwas oder wollte sich nur mal kurz umschauen, da verl√§uft man sich und kann lange herumr√§tseln, was denn nun zu tun w√§re.

Nachdem ich eine Spielpause gemacht habe, leicht gefrustet, musste ich den Abschnitt nochmal beginnen, weil die Checkpoints etwas sp√§rlich gesetzt sind, und ja dann ging gar nichts voran. Ich konnte das Ding, das ich letztens noch fand, nicht mehr wiederfinden.

Also alles noch mal von ganz vorne. Ich kam etwas weiter, bis irgendwelche √ºblen Waldm√§chte mich attackierten. Was man zu tun hat, um dem zu entgehen? Keine Ahnung. Ich blieb sch√∂n brav bei Bullet, war dann aber doch tot. Und nochmal. Tot. Also echt, das Gameplay fand ich geradezu horrorm√§√üig √ºbel.

Mir fehlte eindeutig etwas mehr Klarheit einerseits beim Voirankommen in der Handlung als auch bei den M√∂glichkeiten, sich gegen die Wesen des Waldes zu wehren (oder wie man sie los wird).

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2879372112
[b]Technik[/b]

Ganz OK. Der Wald wirkt tats√§chlich wie ein echter Wald. Interessant wie sie das gemacht haben mit den Wegen, die letztlich im Kreis verlaufen. Ich habe keine Ahnung, ob das echte Kreise waren oder ob da gut getrickst wurde.

Auch der Hund war Klasse. Selten einen so lebensecht animierten Hund gesehen.

Der Sound ist OK. Horrorm√§√üig halt. Mit Surroundtechnik, so dass man einen Kopfh√∂rer nutzen mag, um dies auszukosten. Die Dialoge (unser Held hat ab und an Funk-/Telefonkontakt) sind auf Englisch.

Die Steuerung mit Controller funktionierte gut.

[b]Sonstiges[/b]

Ich habe nach 3h aufgegeben, noch l√§nger durch den Wald zu irren.

Es gibt viele Errungenschaften.

[code][b]In Zahlen f√ºr mich pers√∂nlich ein Unterhaltungswert von 4/10.[/b][/code]

Ein Horrospiel, das mich sehr frustriert hat durch zu unklares Gameplay.

Ich werde mit Schauder an das Spiel zur√ºckdenken. Vielleicht hat es damit seinen Horroranspruch doch erf√ºllt?

[hr][/hr]
[i]Dies ist mein subjektiver Spieleindruck. F√ºr meine Wertung z√§hlt, wie gut es mich unterhalten hat. Entsprechend der Daumen nach oben oder unten, abh√§ngig davon, ob ich es einem √§hnlich gesinnten Spieler weiterempfehle. Der Spieleindruck eines anderen Spielers kann aber durchaus stark davon abweichen.[/i]

Eine andere Sicht auf das Spiel findet man beispielsweise [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/atix303/recommended/1092660/]hier[/url].

Not a bad story line although missing lots of explanations for things that happen. The controls are way to sensitive even on lowest settings. Some chapters are very repetitive and seem like they are just reusing assets to make the game drag out. Has some "scary" moments but if you are looking for something truly immersive and scary, this is not the game. Having to scroll through messages on your phone and check in with your dog really take you out of feeling scared and are more of a hassle than anything.

Game has a strong beginning and middle but a tedious, boring end. The puzzles throughout the game are fun and rewarding and so is the combat. However once you get to the point where you meet a certain character the game becomes too complex. Pacing becomes painfully slow ruining the moment of the beginning and end. Instead of focusing on the mystery of where the missing child has gone, we focus more on the main character and get little to no new information until the final minutes of the game about him.

Really wanted to like the game. And it could have been a great one.

 But here's bugs in the game, it's difficult to understand what you are supposed to do at some points and at the end you are just walking and running around in a phukkin house for one and a half hours. I'm actually proud to say that I actually had the energy to finish the damn game.

What is good is the graphics, great atmosphere and having the dog running around with you is a nice touch. Hopefully they make some drastic changes if they make another Blair witch game, because there is potential to make a great one..

column8: This is one of the most dull horror games I have ever played. And that's saying something since they're regularly dull. The contrived story of someone struggling with PTSD, the schizophrenic episodes trying to copy Layers of Fear, and the overall lack of creativity killed this game. The ending was a hellish experience wandering around an abandoned house for longer than most of the rest of the game took. If you want to torture yourself, go ahead and play this.

Ich liebe Horrorspiele und war ziemlich hei√ü auf das Game. Vor allem wegen der Masse an positiven Bewertungen. 
Muss aber ehrlich gestehen, dass ich nach 2,5h √ºberlegt habe es zu beenden und zu deinstallieren. An sich ist der vibe der Filme gut eingefangen, die R√§tsel waren nett und der Hund ein Sahneh√§ubchen, ABER dieses herumirren und nach irgendwelchen Triggern suchen (von denen man eigentlich keine Ahnung hat was genau sie sind), um das Spiel voranzutreiben, war brutal nervenaufreibend und hat sich zum Teil so auf die lange Bank gezogen, dass ich das Gef√ºhl hatte einen walkingsimulator runtergeladen zu haben..
Ich hab das Game trotzdem bis zum Ende durchgezogen. Mein Fazit bleibt aber, dass die Entwickler das Ganze nicht so in die L√§nge h√§tten ziehen sollen. Auf 3-4h runtergek√ºrzt w√§re das Spiel eine warme Empfehlung gewesen.

A little over three hours played at the time of writing this. I can be a bit of a completionist, so I might go on to finish the game, but I'm not having fun. Players are dropped into this game with little context on who Eli is, why he's looking for Peter in the woods, and why the cops got started without him. As we plod ponderously through a maze-like forest with faithful Bullet by our side and world's worst flashlight, we slowly learn more about Eli and what drives him. The problem is that neither Eli nor the ponderous plodding are very interesting, and Bullet can't carry this entire game on his back.

The reviewers calling this a walking sim are correct. You spend 90% of your time walking through the woods, sometimes backtracking, looking for clues and using video tapes to rewind time in specific areas to clear obstacles/find objects with only the ambiance to entertain you. The ambiance isn't bad, but once you realize enemies are sparse (and Bullet will warn you if they appear) the ambiance loses a lot of its bite. Feel free to sprint around the map, ignoring whispers and snapping twigs. Combat is more frustrating/boring than frightening (since when did the Witch have minions?), and the two enemies I've encountered so far are dealt with thusly:
- ents/tree monsters are killed once they are hit by the flashlight beam a few times, and Bullet will signal where they are (unless his AI gets confused and he just decides not to)
- leaf monsters are easily avoided by just not walking into them

My main gripe with the game and what might keep me from completing it despite the boring gameplay is the plot. Eli is a veteran with PTSD, on some sort of redemption mission (haven't learned all the details of that yet), and whenever the game wants to amp up the tension and spooks, it does so by yanking you out of the forest and into one of Eli's hallucinations about his time in some ambiguous Middle Eastern country. So the most intense, "scariest" parts of the game involve you LEAVING THE FOREST AND BEING FRIGHTENED OF SOMETHING UNRELATED TO THE BLAIR WITCH. This is bafflingly stupid. This is a game about the Blair Witch, not veteran PTSD awareness. I do not care about Eli's time in the military, I do not care about his squad, I do not care about his vague redemption agenda, sorry. And because the game focuses on that instead of the missing kids, I don't care about them either.

The sound design is good. The voice acting is fine. Bullet's charming but controlling him is jank. The graphics are mediocre. I've heard you can get a good or bad ending depending not only on your treatment of Bullet but on whether or not you destroy the witch's dreamcatchers or pick up her totems, which I can say the game definitely did NOT warn me not to do. Might not ever pick this up again, we'll see.

column8:
[h1]A chatice de Blair[/h1]

Em Blair Witch, voc√™ assume o papel de Ellis, um cara que resolve se embrenhar na floresta amaldi√ßoada do filme junto com seu pastor alem√£o em busca de um rapaz desaparecido. Claro que coisas sinistras come√ßam a acontecer e, para piorar, Ellis tamb√©m sofre de traumas que v√£o sendo revelados √† medida que a trama se desenrola.

O problema de Blair Witch √© a crise de identidade. Ele tenta ser adventure, walking simulator e survival horror, sem fazer nenhuma das coisas particularmente bem. A maioria dos puzzles √© bem gen√©rica, do tipo "encontre/combine/use o item certo para consertar/destrancar/etc". Algumas vezes, voc√™ encontrar√° fitas amaldi√ßoadas, devendo assisti-las e paus√°-las no momento certo para alterar a realidade. Outras vezes, seu c√£o ir√° farejar um item, te levar ao pr√≥ximo ponto, encontrar outro item, farej√°-lo de novo, te levar ao ponto seguinte etc. Repita isso algumas vezes e perceber√° que boa parte do jogo √© quase um simulador de passeio de cachorro.

O jogo ainda tenta apimentar essa modorra com a presen√ßa de monstros que dever√£o ser combatidos a la Alan Wake, isto √©, apontando a lanterna para destru√≠-los. Como eles s√£o dif√≠ceis de enxergar, voc√™ dever√° prestar aten√ß√£o ao seu cachorro para localiz√°-los. Embora isso possa passar algum clima de tens√£o, o fato √© que os combates parecem acontecer apenas em momentos pr√©-determinados, o que faz ficar perdido na floresta bem menos amea√ßador do que seria se eles pudessem atacar a qualquer hora

Como se n√£o bastasse, Blair Witch ainda trabalha com salvamento autom√°tico, for√ßando o jogador a aturar a aporrinha√ß√£o at√© o pr√≥ximo checkpoint sob pena de perder o progresso feito at√© ent√£o. A √∫ltima vez que joguei, fiz uma boa explora√ß√£o, coletei itens, entrei numa luta, venci, mas meu personagem bugou, ficando preso num dos objetos do cen√°rio. N√£o conseguia sair do lugar, e descobri que o √∫ltimo save tinha sido uns 20 minutos antes. Desisti e desinstalei. Jogo chato e nada assustador. V√° dormir que √© melhor.

The pacing is pretty good. I blazed through the Chapters faster than I thought I would. There are a couple sections in the game where the instructions are unclear and you have to wander for a bit to find the next objective. I have TERRIBLE sense of direction but was able to manage through the seemingly large map just fine. Requires SOME amount of paying attention to context clues and remembering small details, but not too demanding.

You grow attached to your best boy Bullet (a dog) since he's the only one to keep you company through all the crazy things going on.

Cool experience, spooky atmosphere, decent jumpscares. You can pet and feed the doge. Solid 9/10

Se potessi metterei tasto neutro. Si poteva  e si doveva fare decisamente di pi√π. Se ci sono riusciti ormai ventidue anni f√† con quei tre capitoli  , nonostante i limiti dell' epoca , non vedo il perch√© non ci si possa riuscire oggi. La maggior parte del tempo √® : Porta il cane a passeggio nel bosco. Stop.  Seriamente ,non f√† paura questo gioco , neanche lontanamente. Non ti tiene in ansia perenne col dire che succeder√† qualcosa quando meno te lo aspetti. 
Graficamente non √® male , ma la maggior parte del tempo si svolge di notte , quindi anche avesse avuto la grafica brutta state certi che non ve ne sareste accorti. Trama dimenticabile. E cosa pi√π importante , non mi ha invogliato a proseguire. Non mi ha incuriosito , ne fatto venire voglia di arrivare alla fine per vedere il finale. Il protagonista .... Ha pi√π carisma il cane che lui.
bien que je n'aie pas termin√© le jeu, je le recommande vivement

column8: Honestly this game is amazing. Even though it's pretty much just a walking sim the story is enough to captivate you into continuing to play. The combination of Blair Witch elements and PTSD based psychological horror is amazing, and the puzzles are always a fun to solve, and all the games mind-fuck ish moments never cease to amaze. This is definitely one of the best horror games to come out in a while. The Bloober team did an amazing job.

column8:
[h1]Pues la verdad, no est√° nada mal.[/h1]

Se deja notar a la legua que es un juego de Bloober Team, y quien haya jugado a [i]Layers of Fear 2[/i] se habr√° percatado. No es el mejor juego habido y por haber, pero tampoco decepciona. Su punto m√°s fuerte es su notoria capacidad inmersiva y el b√°rbaro apartado art√≠stico, no obstante, jugabil√≠sticamente flaquea un poco m√°s a m√≠ parecer. 

Asimismo, desde mi punto de vista, cabe decir que los √∫ltimos t√≠tulos del g√©nero que ha sacado Bloober, parecen tender a sacrificar el terror o a relegarlo casi a algo secundario, priorizando la narraci√≥n de la historia que tienen en mente, y [i]Blair Witch[/i] no es excepci√≥n. Dicho en una palabra: pese a que el juego cuenta con momentos de tensi√≥n y de terror, no son lo m√°s abundante del juego, y con frecuencia estos son tan solo el tel√≥n del fondo para el [i]plot[/i] de la trama.

En conclusi√≥n, como ferviente admiradora de la bruja de Blair que soy, debo decir que he disfrutado bastante el juego, si bien tengo algunas reservas con determinadas decisiones relativas a la jugabilidad y a cierta parte del [i]storytelling[/i]; de modo que, aun reconociendo algunas de sus carencias, me parece una experiencia grata y lo recomiendo.

column8: Went into this game with mixed thoughts. Hearing only mostly negative aspects of the game. But I was pleasantly surprised. Walking through the forest invoked some sort of fear in me that I couldn't explain. Every path started feeling the same and I really felt like I was lost going through these haunted woods. I found Ellis' character really interesting and I wanted to learn more and more about him. I think his character progression (and regression, depending on the ending) is really great and well paced. The enviroment in the game is gloom and I think the stage progression is well structured, going from  the forest and then ending up in the iconic "blair witch" house. Bullet was hands down the best part of the game, I could not stop petting him, definitely the best boy to ever exist and the cutest companion in a video game. This game is not for everyone, a lot of people don't like it because its boring, not scary and its a walking simulator. But I think that works out for this game, going through a forest should be a walking simulator and I really like these kinds of games. The game wasn't the scariest thing ever but the dark forest was enough to make me feel uneasy and disoriented. The scare is definitely the enviroment and not the monster the game throws at you. I've only seen the original Blair Witch movie, and I believe this game was based on the 2016 version of the film, but it was still very recognisible and I could definitely see it as a Blair Witch product. I definitely recommend the game if you enjoy good story and don't mind minimal gameplay.

Pros-

best doggo
nice enough graphics
great atmosphere

more than one ending

I am a a huge fan of the original BWP movie, but this game is worth maybe ¬£5 at most

best doggo

great atmosphere

cons-

column8:
[h1]Une nuit de chien[/h1]

Heureusement que tu es l√†, Bullet. On se sent tr√®s vite seul dans la for√™t. Sans toi, je crois que je deviendrais fou. Je le suis peut-√™tre d√©j√† un peu, qui sait ? Mais quand je t'ai √† mes c√¥t√©s, j'ai l'impression que tout va bien.

Depuis que je me suis mis en t√™te de retrouver ce gamin disparu, je sais que je ne pouvais pas r√™ver trouver meilleur partenaire. On dit que les bergers allemands sont loyaux et fid√®les √† leur ma√Ætre, et c'est vrai. Tu es toujours l√† quand la nuit tombe. Tu pleures quand le danger arrive, mais tu ne m'abandonnes jamais. On raconte qu'une sorci√®re vit dans la for√™t de Black Hills, o√π elle aurait enlev√© des dizaines d'enfants. C'est l√† que Peter, neuf ans, a √©t√© aper√ßu pour la derni√®re fois. Ces histoires de sorcellerie, c'est des conneries, mais je ne suis quand m√™me pas tr√®s serein. Partout o√π je vais, il y a des totems √©tranges, des objets abandonn√©s, des photos d'enfants et des poup√©es en bois. Plus √ßa va, plus je me demande ce que je fous l√†. L'√©quipe de policiers en charge de l'enqu√™te m'a dissuad√© de venir, et mon ex-petite amie Jesse aussi. Je ne sais pas trop quoi faire d'autre, alors je continue. C'est comme si j'avais quelque chose √† me prouver. J'ai beau m'enfoncer dans la for√™t sans savoir o√π tout √ßa me m√®nera, tu restes aupr√®s de moi. Et quand je me perds dans les marais embrum√©s, je n'ai qu'√† √©couter tes aboiements pour me rep√©rer.

Je ne sais pas de quoi j'ai le plus peur, Bullet. La nuit j'entends des cr√©atures r√¥der. Je re√ßois des messages mena√ßants sur mon t√©l√©phone, alors qu'il n'y a pas de r√©seau. J'ai retrouv√© une cam√©ra, m√™me si je ne sais pas trop quoi en faire pour le moment. Tout √† l'heure j'aurais jur√© entendre des voix. J'ai l'impression que nous ne sommes pas tout seuls ici, et plus j'avance, plus j'ai peur qu'on ne retrouve jamais cet enfant. Tu es ma constante dans ce monde incertain Bullet. Tu es toujours l√† quand je t'appelle, toujours partant pour une caresse. Je crois que je le sais, maintenant. Ce qui me fait le plus peur, c'est qu'il t'arrive quelque chose et que je me retrouve tout seul ici.

column8: From having experience watching and playing other horror games, this game surpassed all of my expectations. The game developers did an amazing job on this game. The story was beautiful although sad, and dove into dark pasts of the main character. The thrill was exhilarating and suspenseful, and I even had the guts to play this in the dark. If you do play this game, be aware of jump-scares. To anyone out there that loves to dive into horror games with a jump-scares and a twisted story behind it, this is that game.

Do I highly recommend playing Blair Witch? Yes, I do.  I say "play" but Blair Witch is sort of an interactive movie. This is a VERY cinematic experience. The graphics look amazing and appropriate for the subject matter at hand. It's not a long play but the pacing is logical. 

Bullet The Wonder Dog really adds a new and worthwhile element to the game play. The trick I think lies in his various functions that you can have him do, on the one hand, but on the other, Bullet can become a liability if you get separated. A suggestion; Play the game as though Bullet is the real protagonist, or at least, your objective should be to keep bullet alive. Never chastise Bullet, feed him cookies at the end of dramatic events, pet him often and keep him close. You still get to be evil if you want, there's no reason to be nasty to Bullet.

At the time of this writing, many reviewers here on Steam have already said that the character you play as, Ellis, cannot ultimately be salvaged. It's true, and saying so ahead of time is NOT spoiling anything. As so many other reviews will also tell you, don't expect a happy ending. Ellis' gradual unraveling may proceed along several different paths, and may even result in more than one outcome, but just enjoy the ride. Ellis is a rather tragic figure, despite being a bit hackneyed, alas Ellis is a timely and relatable character. When we talk about the divorce rate, PTSD, the challenges faced by combat veterans, life in a post industrial society, all that. Ellis is a believable and sorta sympathetic character. Perhaps he's a bit dry and uninteresting. But I feel bad for him. You may find as you play this game that his tortures feel somehow familiar. 

The VVitch herself manifests as a sneering voice whispering at you from within your own skull. Her characterization really benefits from both a skilled voice actress and the game's use of binaural audio. She stops in early on to set you off on the dark path, and then she returns to ride you mercilessly for the final third of the game. Mainly, she appears as terrible endless mazes of memory. We come damn close to seeing her once, but not quite, for to actually see her means instant defeat. I found her attempts at a dark seduction rather soothing.  
My advice, don't resist the VVitch, embrace her voice, embrace the horror cliche. Blair Witch does not tread new ground as far as its story is concerned but I find it to be a worthy jaunt along a familiar, well worn and much beloved path.

The one thing that consistently annoyed me throughout and by far my greatest gripe with this game; the inventory system is terrible. Badly designed, cumbersome, slow and it totally trips up my finger work. There are enough action sequences where a degree of multitasking is required that this is sorta a major flaw. Points off. Some sequences are confusing and it's not always clear what we're being asked to do or how to pull off the task at hand. Such moments are not frequent, but they are annoying when they do occur. These are not minor issues, but they are the only two issues and there is no perfect game, so........pay full price, a lot of reviews here are saying that the game is not worth full price, but snag it at a discount when it goes on sale. That's really tacky and crass. The game is well worth the money for the right player, even if it isn't literally perfect. 

Another issue I see being discussed a lot is; who is this game for? Is it for horror fans? Is it for adventure survival fans? Is it an over the top walking simulator? It's all of the above. Don't play it if you aren't a fan of horror. Maybe by now we are all desensitized to jumpscares, but this game is compelling, even if it isn't terribly original. 

This game reminds me a lot of Amnesia: Rebirth. Much like the ghuuls in that game, the wood sprites are more of an occasional hindrance than a major challenge. Both Blair Witch and Amnesia: Rebirth are boldly demolishing the boundary between video games and movies through their broad scope, excellent pacing, quality story telling, wonderful effects and good voice acting. Interesting times to be a gamer and a horror fan. Blair Witch is a game for anyone who falls into either of those categories.

Id describe Blair Witch as a first person Silent Hill game.

You go to the woods with your dog in search of a missing kid. Meanwhile you are slowly being manipulated by the Blair Witch. 

You can end up continuing the Witch‚Äôs cycle of manipulation or you can end it. 
But dont expect a happy ending either way.

My biggest complaint is I find the conditions to get the "good" ending to be BS.

Also game developers seriously stop taking fov for granted. 80 degrees is not enough. 90 should be minimum. Always give players the option to increase fov between 90 and 110. The player shouldn't have to use external tools to increase the fov.

Good game. Too bad it's mostly a linear experience, but the graphics are amazing. The story is good, but not amazing and as far as I can tell it sticks to the original film material quite faithfully and even expands upon it in a nice way.

It's scary, while still remaining quite gorgeous and stunning, enough to keep your eyes glued to the screen for a jumpscare xd.

I definetly will try out the VR experience in the near future. Who knows, we'll see. Glad this game is out for an affordable price as well. Not many games like this come out at a decent price while being very high quality and not broken like so many other releases in the last four years because of you know what (Starts with a C and ends with a D if it's not obvious what I'm talking about).

column8:
[h1]6.5/10[/h1]

It does a really good job at simulating the feeling of being lost in the woods just like the characters in the movie.

It's a short game (around 7-8 hours) and you are going to spend most of it just wondering around in circles so, at least for me, it gets tedious and repetitive. If you are looking for jumpscares or something really intense you are defenitely not going to find it here, as the game tries to build up tension and explores the protagonist's mind.


[b]Is a decent game to finish in a couple of nights playing 1 or 2 hours at a time so it doesn't feel as dense.[/b]

column8: The game excels in creating a captivating atmosphere with an interesting story, beautiful graphics, and effective creepy effects. While acknowledging that the controls could be improved, I managed to complete the game without encountering bugs in approximately 15.8 hours. Despite its short length, I found it to be perfectly suited to the story, believing that a longer duration might have diminished its value. The forest setting was a standout feature for me, and I appreciated the good and fitting sound effects. Overall, it was an enjoyable experience, making it a great horror game for casual play.

column8:
I spent about 8 hours on the game. It looks like there could be multiple endings too. Graphics are good and the sound is ok. I think it is just in stereo, but I played it with a Sound Blaster sound card and it synthesized 5 channels. Good realism overall.

There are parts of the game where you get lost and wander around, and it can be a bit frustrating. I ended up going to youtube and a walk through on a few spots where I got stuck, but I didnt need a lot of help.

The story is good. It is about a war vet that is suffering PTSD. He is with his german shepard, and thats a great combo here. I recommend this game if you like psychological horror. I think its well worth $20 or so, so I would recommend waiting for a sale if you are frugal. I have no desire to go back and play again to try for a different ending because the game was a bit tedious at some points and I dont see a lot of value in me spending another 8 hours just to see a different ending. So I dont think there is a lot of replayability here.

column8:
This game was very fun, though at times it got stagnant when I got lost or wasnt quite sure what to do. Having a dog companion was a new thing for me and I thoroughly loved that about it. It had a very good slow build of tension and unease. 

The very last act in the house/cabin really floored me, I was on edge the whole time and honestly felt like I was going crazy myself, while watching the character lose it. It was beautifully done in an artistic way, going on long enough to bring a player to madness themselves. Well done, bloober team.

column8:
I have been playing A LOT of horror games lately. Even with a single play-through taking about 6 hours (no walkthrough or prior knowledge), i HIGHLY RECOMMEND this game! There are unique and very well-implemented mechanics and other aspects of this game that I have yet to see from other games.

I understand the production cost and value of this caliber of game, but the standard price is a little steep for the amount of gameplay.

BUT, I HIGHLY RECOMMEND EITHER WAY!

column8:
Like playing through an actual nightmare.

One of the best depictions of being lost in the forest I've ever seen.

Also a convincing and respectful commentary on post-traumatic stress disorder.

Multiple endings based on your choices.

Also a solid sequel to the film.

Yes, there are monsters. Good ones.

It can be extremely linear at times, which might disappoint some.

If you are a fan of Amnesia or similar games, this is a must-play.

column8:
This game should be called Tony Blair Witch, because it‚Äôs more about war and PTSD than it is any creepy witch (for the young‚Äôuns who don‚Äôt know who Tony Blair is, he was British Prime Minister from 1997-2007, who, in his first six years in office, ordered British troops into combat five times, more than any other prime minister in British history.) 

That or Blair Glitch, considering the amount of glitches many people seem to have with it.

You play as Ellis, an ex-solider/ex-cop, who, wanting to make peace with his demons, joins the search for a missing boy. Ellis rocks up late to the party though, so has to go into the infamous Burkittsville woods alone (and woefully under-prepared ‚Äì all he has on his person is his wallet and dog treats lol).  Long story short, he and his trusty canine Bullet end up getting lost in those woods, and so begins five hours of strenuous walking in dimly lit circles. The atmosphere of the woods is great, but that‚Äôs about it. Because the game is 95% walking, I think the developers felt it necessary to include scenes of action to keep the audience engaged. So we get to do stuff like talk and play on our phone, on our walkie-talkie, watch some videos on a camcorder. These add to the atmosphere in a minimal way though, as their primary function is rather to add to the back-story, which is a mess, and frankly, bares no relevance to the actual story at hand. The woods turn into Iraq a few times as you battle through Ellis‚Äô PTSD. It‚Äôs a very important issue that doesn‚Äôt get enough attention as it should, but it is one totally inappropriate and unnecessary for this game.  It breaks the immersion from the woods, which is the heart of the game (and the whole Blair Witch franchise), and where the horror is meant to be. Halfway through I was thinking ‚ÄòMaybe they‚Äôre being clever, and the horrors of the woods and the witch are actually products of Ellis‚Äô PTSD etc‚Äô but no. It was just some character-development add-on, and the story got much worse. The introduction of a secondary antagonist again took away much of the horror of the witch herself and relegated her to a vague but never-eventuating threat, and what we ended up with after hours of laborious meandering was really just some clich√© trope made even more cringey by the bad voice acting/dialogue.

What it does do well though is that it rewrites the laws of time. For a five-hour game, it dragggggged on for what felt like ten (perhaps that‚Äôs why the price is so high ‚Äì thank god I got in in a sale). The last act was simply ridiculous, and again, is why this game should be called Tony Blair Witch. It added nothing to the Blair Witch universe whatsoever. It felt totally unrelated to Blair Witch in fact. There was no impending horror of running into the witch, ever. There was no horror at all really. A few menacing shadows and satyrs growling at you from the darkness, but nothing to keep you up at night. All in all, this game was a huge missed opportunity. I think we should all leave the witch alone and stop trashing her woods with sub-par stuff like this, maybe then she‚Äôll stop stealing and eating our children.

It is certainly worth playing through once, as it is a genuinely scary, engaging story with some good puzzles and gameplay. However, it gets REPETITIVE FAST and you will spend hours just walking around into circles frustrated. I know this is meant to contribute to the atmosphere of the game but it makes things go so slowly.

I clocked it in just under eight hours and even though it has replay bonuses I am certainly in no hurry to play it again. I would recommend getting it if there is a Steam sale and the game is at least fifty per cent off.

Don't pay full price for it though, at the price it sells at it is just not worth it.

column8:
[h1]Nous n'irons plus au bois... [/h1]

A la recherche d'un jeune gar√ßon perdu en pleine for√™t, nous partons avec notre fid√®le alli√©, notre chien Bullet, √† sa recherche.

Sauf que ce n'est pas dans n'importe quelle for√™t: nous nous trouvons dans celle de Black Hills, √† la r√©putation mal√©fique depuis quelques si√®cles. On dit m√™me que les Indiens du d√©but du XVII √®me si√®cle √©vitaient soigneusement de passer par ici, sous pr√©texte que Black Hills √©tait source de mal√©diction.

Et la r√©putation de cet endroit va s'accentuer avec la terrible histoire d'Ellie Kedward, une jeune fille accus√©e de sorcellerie en 1785. Bannie du village, elle va se retrouver attach√©e √† une charrette et abandonn√©e en pleine for√™t, en plein hiver.
La l√©gende dit que trois jours apr√®s, trois  gar√ßons vont recevoir la t√¢che de v√©rifier si la pr√©tendue sorci√®re est bien d√©c√©d√©e. Et l√†, stupeur, ils constatent qu'Ellie est toujours vivante et d√©cident de mettre fin √† l'existence de cette pauvre malheureuse. Ils l√¢chent leurs chiens sur elle, frappent √† coup de branches pointues et d√®s que son sang se mis √† couler, ils la pendirent. La sorci√®re est bel et bien morte, cette fois-ci.

Et c'est √† partir de cet instant que la r√©putation mal√©fique de la for√™t de Black Hills va s'accentuer, car peu de temps apr√®s, ces trois gar√ßons et les accusateurs d'Ellie vont dispara√Ætre soudainement, et ce, sans explication. Les villageois vont m√™me fuir, un temps.

Depuis, cet endroit est le th√©√¢tre de malheureux √©v√©nements report√©s (des bruits √©tranges la nuit, des enfants disparus, des personnes perdues et qui auraient retrouv√© leur chemin des jours apr√®s pour les plus chanceux,  des meurtres atroces sous fond de rituel satanique, parfois l'apparition d'une silhouette f√©minine... ). La l√©gende dit aussi que la sorci√®re b√©n√©ficie d'un contr√¥le total de la for√™t, et donc de la faune et de la flore.

C'est avec cette histoire en t√™te que nous nous aventurons dans ces bois maudits pour retrouver ce jeune gar√ßon port√© disparu. Cependant, les choses vont vite mal tourn√©es et nous allons nous rendre compte que les Indiens avaient raison de fuir cet endroit malsain... Allons-nous retrouver cet enfant et sortir vivants de l√† ?


Le contexte et le but du jeu pos√©s, je propose maintenant, sans trop de spoils (du moins je vais essayer) les √©l√©ments forts du jeu qui m'ont pouss√©e √† recommander fortement ce jeu:

- Le fait d'avoir un chien comme co√©quipier est l'atout fort de ce jeu. Bullet est tr√®s attachant. Ce n'est pas pour rien qu'on dit que le chien est le meilleur ami de l'homme. Celui-ci nous aide √† nous rep√©rer (et oui, vous allez vite vous perdre, et vite avoir la sensation que vous √™tes d√©j√† pass√© par l√†, de tourner en rond), √† trouver les indices √©galement, √† r√©cup√©rer des objets vus mais impossible d'acc√®s pour vous et surtout Bullet nous apporte une aide pr√©cieuse en combat.

- Pour les combats, c'est le m√™me fonctionnement que le jeu Alan Wake, en gros votre arme, c'est votre lampe torche. 
D√©j√† que vous avez tr√®s tr√®s peu de visibilit√©, imaginez l'√©tat d'angoisse o√π vous pouvez vous trouver quand il y a une ombre/ un monstre qui vous attaque. Et c'est l√† que le r√¥le de Bullet est primordial: c'est gr√¢ce √† lui que vous allez savoir o√π se cachent ces ombres et donc o√π projeter votre lumi√®re pour les √©loigner. Bullet, fortement agit√©, vous pr√©viens √† coups d'aboiements et la position de l'ombre est indiqu√©e par la direction o√π Bullet regarde. Le seul point n√©gatif dans cette p√©riode de combat est la difficult√© parfois d'illuminer l'ombre, puis de reposer son regard sur le chien car il est tellement agit√© qu'il tourne autour de vous. De plus, la musique bien intense et stressante accentue bien la sensation de danger.

- La possibilit√© d'interagir avec l'environnement en visualisant et en rembobinant les cassettes √† un endroit pr√©cis est une id√©e originale, et renforce l'aspect surnaturel de cet endroit.

- Il y a un super travail sur l'esth√©tique de la for√™t et niveau ambiance: c'est lourd, oppressant,  malsain, tr√®s peu de visibilit√©. Des bruits √©tranges, l'impression de faire toujours le m√™me chemin et de revenir au m√™me endroit de d√©part, des r√©ceptions de messages d'un num√©ro inconnu sur votre t√©l√©phone alors que vous n'avez aucun r√©seau, la voix de la sorci√®re qui se moque parfois de vous ou vous donne des ordres... Tout est fait pour vous d√©stabiliser et vous procurer quelques bonnes frayeurs.

- Ce jeu a r√©ussi √† me rendre dans un √©tat de stress pas possible et √† m'en faire pleurer √† un endroit pr√©cis du jeu ([spoiler] quand Bullet se blesse, qu'on le porte et qu'on tourne en rond, toujours le m√™me endroit, avec √©crit sur le mur et la voix nous disant: laisse le chien. Moi, laisser le chien ???? Va te faire voir la sorci√®re !" [/spoiler]

Pour ma part, et ce avec tous les points √©nonc√©s ci-dessus, je ne peux que recommander ce jeu qui est pour moi une tr√®s belle r√©ussite. J'ai v√©cu vraiment une exp√©rience √† part et dommage que je n'ai pas de VR, car j'imagine que les effets angoissants du jeu doivent √™tre d√©cupl√©s.

O jogo tem um bom gr√°fico e as vezes d√° uns sustos legais. Por√©m, tudo isso √© dentro de uma jogabilidade ruim e com diversos bugs em pontos importantes do jogo, onde n√£o devia existir. H√° muita coisa que pode ser melhorada e que renderia um jogo maravilhoso como o Outlast. O criador da hist√≥ria desse jogo usou direitinho o ch√° de cogumelo XD, mas √© de se esperar j√° que o mesmo √© baseado nos filmes. Sem d√∫vida, a parte mais interessante desse jogo √© o final. N√£o recomendo pelos bugs irritantes, jogabilidade ruim e al√©m de ser um jogo bastante curto que s√≥ vale a pena comprar se for na promo√ß√£o.

column8:
While far from perfect, I think Blair Witch is a solid horror experience.

It's a case of the game in question having plenty of quality of great ideas, but not all of them are executed on the same level.

I do heavily appreciate the games attempt at representing mental health, PTSD and such. I think its important to discuss this topics and there's tons of artistic potential for such themes in the horror space.

I think Ellis, the main character is one which fits the Blair Witch universe very well and is prime bait for the witch herself. That being said, the game certainly doesn't have an even split in its focus.

It honestly feels like a spooky forest game for most of the time, with the witch only truly having a massive noticeable impact in the last few chapters. The ending does kinda explain that this was the whole point, but I couldn't help but feel like the story could've been spread more evenly.

That being said, game play wise I really liked the ending chapter and I think it caps off the game well. Although the actual plot ending itself isn't exactly stellar. Without spoiling anything, this game wants you to re-play it and try for different endings.

The issue here is that while the game is short, its a linear and heavily scripted experience that I doubt will lend itself well to numerous playthrough's, but keep in mind this is a surface level assessment.

When its all said and done, this is a decent horror game with many minor problems that stack up by the end.
I do hope more games come from the Blair Witch license, as there is a ton of potential here.
With a bit more creativity in game play design and a more balanced plot, this could've been horror GOTY material.

Still, its solid for what it is and I'd recommend it if you can get it on sale.

This game is awesome. There's not a lot of jumpscares which I love, everything is in the atmosphere and is very creepy (maybe like 2 jumpscares while in the woods and a bit more at the end when you're in a specific place, you'll know which one once you're there). I always wanted to play this game in VR bnut now that I've done my first playthrough on PC I'll probably try it in VR. 

There are multiples types of ending depending on what you do during the game. Also the dog is so cute, I love him. 

Definitely worth playing if you're a fan of horror cause this is a good one.

Auf den ersten Blick macht Blair Witch eine Menge her, die Grafik ist sch√∂n, die Steuerung nicht schwer. Lineares Gameplay, manchmal denkt man, dass man verr√ºckt wird. Besonders das Ende bescherte mir wundersch√∂ne Kopfschmerzen, da die Lichtimpulse schon derbe auf die Augen gehen. Das Ende fand ich auch nicht sonderlich berauschend. Wobei ich schon sagen muss, dass man ein anderes Ende erwartet. Versteht mich nicht falsch, ich finde es gut wenn der Spieler √ºberrascht wird, aber mein Ende fand ich irgendwie, doof. Man kann das Ende wohl beeinflussen und ein halbwegs "gutes" Ende erreichen, aber das werde ich wohl nicht erleben, da ich es kein zweites mal durchspielen werde. Daher bekommt dieses Game von mir lediglich 2 Kartoffeln.

Im dalej w las, tym zaczyna byƒá mroczniej i straszniej, a gra dawkuje strach bardzo rozsƒÖdnie lawirujƒÖc na skraju naszych emocji. Z biegiem czasu siƒô ≈õciemnia, a my kluczƒÖc po lesie szukamy nowych wskaz√≥wek z latarkƒÖ w rƒôku. Sporo os√≥b w≈Ça≈õnie w tym momencie odpada z rozgrywki, bo poza mrocznym i ciƒô≈ºkim klimatem, w lesie ≈Çatwo siƒô zgubiƒá ( pomimo niewidzialnych ≈õcian), wiƒôc je≈õli masz problem z odnajdywaniem drogi w lesie w rzeczywisto≈õci, to tutaj prawdopodobnie te≈º bƒôdziesz mia≈Ç problem. W moim wypadku problemem to nie by≈Ço, bo wychowa≈Çem siƒô w lesie, ale napotka≈Çem za to na inny szkopu≈Ç. Mianowicie od pewnego momentu naszego bohatera nawiedzajƒÖ wizje z przesz≈Ço≈õci i tutaj tw√≥rcy moim zdaniem pojechali  czasami za bardzo. Przyk≈Çadowo wielka polana z poruszajƒÖcymi siƒô li≈õƒámi mnie nie przekonuje, a ca≈Çy klimat poszed≈Ç w diab≈Çy i horror zamieni≈Ç siƒô odrobinƒô w komediƒô, podobnie wizje "pola bitwy". Na szczƒô≈õcie p√≥≈∫niejsze fazy gry wr√≥ci≈Çy na w≈Ça≈õciwy trop i ≈ÇƒÖcznie ze s≈Çawetnym domem, dawa≈Çy odczuƒá psychozƒô strachu. (m√≥wiƒÖc w skr√≥cie: wizje z przesz≈Ço≈õci bohatera mnie nie ujƒô≈Çy za serce, ale reszta rozgrywki owszem:))

[h1]Mechanika strachu...[/h1]
Podczas rozgrywki w nasze rƒôce oddano kilka ciekawych mechanik. Na szczeg√≥lnƒÖ uwagƒô zas≈Çuguje oczywi≈õcie pies Bullet, z kt√≥rym to podczas tych kilku godzin rozgrywki mo≈ºna siƒô faktycznie z≈ºyƒá. Nasz piesio poza szukaniem oczywistych trop√≥w, potrafi te≈º odnajdywaƒá ≈õmieci ( dos≈Çownie ≈õmieci i jest za to osiƒÖgniƒôcie:)), mo≈ºemy go te≈º g≈Çaskaƒá i karmiƒá smako≈Çykami. KolejnƒÖ mechanikƒÖ jest kamera oraz zwiƒÖzane z niƒÖ zagadki w cofanie czasu, a dodatkowo dziƒôki latarce w kamerze, roz≈õwietlimy ciemno≈õƒá przed nami. Tutaj ma≈Ça uwaga, mi kamera nie dzia≈Ça≈Ça na poczƒÖtku i musia≈Çem szukaƒá pomocy na forach, ale da≈Ço siƒô to ≈Çatwo naprawiƒá i potem ju≈º wszystko dzia≈Ça≈Ço bez zarzut√≥w. Pytanie tylko, skoro problem jest znany, to czemu jeszcze nie zosta≈Ç za≈Çatany?  Z innych oczywistych mechanik sƒÖ znajd≈∫ki w postaci zapisk√≥w i innych przedmiot√≥w powiƒÖzanych ze ≈õledztwem. Jest te≈º kilka ukrytych mechanik, a dodatkowo gra nie jeden raz puszcza oczko do os√≥b znajƒÖcych oryginalny film ( kilka miejsc√≥wek, specyficzne drzewo, uk≈Çad rƒÖk na ≈õcianie i wiele wiƒôcej). Wszystko to sprawia, ≈ºe nie jest to zwyk≈Çy symulator chodzenia i pomimo braku walki, jest co robiƒá i gra siƒô ciekawie.

[h1]PODSUMOWANIE:[/h1]
Nowa ods≈Çona Blair Witch nie jest mo≈ºe horrorem wybitnym i ma swoje za uszami, a mimo to gra≈Ço mi siƒô w niego ≈õwietnie. Bardzo dobrze odwzorowany las nadaje rozgrywce specyficzny klimat znany z orygina≈Çu, a mƒÖdre mechaniki takie jak pies czy te≈º kamera z noktowizjƒÖ, fajnie urozmaicajƒÖ rozgrywkƒô. Pomimo kilku dziwnych moment√≥w  jak te "kupki wƒôdrujƒÖcych li≈õci", gra pozwoli≈Ça mi poczuƒá ciarki na plecach. Polecam!

[b][u]PLUSY:[/u]
+ Klimat Black Forest
+ Pies Bullet
+ ≈Åadna graficznie (zw≈Çaszcza las:))
+ Potrafi wystraszyƒá te≈º odg≈Çosami

[u]MINUSY:[/u]
- Psychowizje bohatera to najs≈Çabszy element gry
- Niedzia≈ÇajƒÖca kamera
-  Bywa, ≈ºe wyrywa z klimatu (s≈Çawetne "kupki li≈õci")[/b]

[h1]BONUS:[/h1]
Blair Witch od Bloober Team, to nie pierwsza gra z tego uniwersum. Wszystko zaczƒô≈Ço siƒô od s≈Çawnego filmu Blair Witch Project z 1999r. Kasetƒô z nagraniem podobno kto≈õ znalaz≈Ç przypadkiem, a film by≈Ç stylizowany na "zwyk≈Çe" nagranie student√≥w z wypadu za miasto. Pobudza≈Ço to wyobra≈∫niƒô w tamtych latach, bo nie by≈Ço jeszcze YT i innych portali z amatorskimi filmami ( zresztƒÖ nawet jak ju≈º jakie≈õ by≈Çy, to transfer w okolicach 128kb i tak nie pozwala≈Ç nic oglƒÖdaƒá na bie≈ºƒÖco:)). Razem z kumplami po obejrzeniu tego hitu tamtych lat, odbyli≈õmy nie jednƒÖ dyskusjƒô ile w tym prawdy itp. By≈Ço ciekawie, a las zyska≈Ç nowy wymiar (zw≈Çaszcza na obozowiskach, gdy dla ≈ºartu robi≈Ço siƒô z ga≈ÇƒÖzek symbole znane z filmu i wiesza≈Ço przy latrynach dziewczyn:)). Jaki≈õ czas p√≥≈∫niej wysz≈Ça gra o tytule [url=https://www.gry-online.pl/gry/blair-witch-volume-one-rustin-parr/z0a78][b]Blair Witch, czƒô≈õƒá pierwsza: Rustin Parr[/b][/url] ( nawet ogra≈Çem, bo by≈Ça dodawana do CDA jako pe≈Çniak ). Dzisiaj ten klasyk jest ju≈º ≈õrednio grywalny, bo grafika mocno siƒô zestarza≈Ça, ale jak kto≈õ ma mo≈ºliwo≈õƒá, to polecam ograƒá, bo w swoich czasach nie≈∫le straszy≈Ç.

column8:
For starters, the game catches the essence of the Blair Witch franchise almost perfectly, the vast amount of land and forest that sometimes overwhelms you and you constantly need to explore, the detailed visuals and haunting scenery, shifting between day and night and with little tools to advance makes it a somewhat unique 'walking' simulator.

Plenty of unique gameplay aspects that kept puzzles and fetch quests more engaging.
It's story and execution is rather ambitious but in certain moments it tends to overstay its welcome, personally even if the idea is to make some levels/chapters feel like a loop/never ending, it could be more useful if in certains could get straight to the point faster since sometimes the feeling or impact a scene lands, lingers for too long.

There's a bit of choice making and hidden items for you to find as you make progress, these ones are rather unclear and can force a specific outcome without you realizing what you did. And I could only figure this out once I completed the game. The game at first warns you about this but on a far too subtle note.
And since it doesn't feel too replayable, I don't feel encouraged to try a different path. Yet I'm satisfied with the ending I got

This experience is unique and something you can do in one sitting and probably one of the most accurate experiences related to the Blair Witch Project

column8: grafisch mooi en goede gameplay

[h1] [b] [i] "Atmosph√§risches Horror-Erlebnis mit schwacher zweiten H√§lfte" [/i] [/b] [/h1]

In der heutigen Review nehme ich mir Blair Witch vor, ein Spiel welches ich mir damals einige Wochen nach dem Release gekauft, aber erst in diesem Jahr durchgespielt habe.

Bei Blair Witch handelt es sich um ein Horrorspiel aus der First Person Sicht, entwickelt von Bloober Team, den Machern von Meisterwerken wie Layers of Fear und Observer, welches einen tollen Start in den ersten Stunden hat, aber in der zweiten H√§lfte in der Story nachl√§sst. Trotz der zweiten H√§lfte und technischen Unstimmigkeiten mochte ich das Spiel aber irgendwie. Immerhin habe ich noch vor, es auf 100% Achievements zu vervollst√§ndigen.

[h1] [b] Die Story [/b] [/h1]
Blair Witch steckt uns in die Rolle von Ellis, einem ehemaligen Soldaten mit PTSD, welcher mit seinem treuen Sch√§ferhund Bullet an der Suchaktion eines vermissten Jungen teilnimmt und sich dabei irgendwann mit seinen ganz eigenen Problemen auseinandersetzen muss.

Die Spur des vermissten Jungen f√ºhrt in einen dichten Wald, in dem die namensgebende "Blair Witch" ihr Unwesen treibt. Der Weg f√ºhrt immer weiter in den Wald, aber von dem Jungen gibt es weder eine wirklich hilfreiche Spur, noch ein Lebenszeichen. Die Suche beginnt, entwickelt sich jedoch im weiteren Verlauf zu einem Albtraum ohne ersichtlichen Ausweg. Werden es Ellis und Bullet schaffen, den Jungen zu finden und als Helden nach Hause zur√ºckzukehren?

Blair Witch f√§ngt mit einer wirklich guten H√§lfte an, l√§sst aber im zweiten Teil in der Story nach, was das Spiel aus meiner Sicht runterzieht. Gerade die letzten Kapitel bis zum Ende hin kamen mir einfach richtig langgezogen und mit ganz viel Backpulver gestreckt vor, als w√ºrde man das Unvermeidliche immer mehr vor sich herschieben, anstatt den Schlussstrich zu ziehen, wenn es n√∂tig ist. Macht das Spiel schlechter als es wirklich ist.

[h1] [b] Das Gameplay [/b] [/h1]
Blair Witch bietet teilweise sehr weitl√§ufige Level, die durch den Einsatz der Unreal Engine 4 wirklich schick aussehen. In der Spielwelt selber kann man viele Collectibles finden, darunter auch einige, die zur Story beitragen.

Im Spiel l√∂sen wir R√§tsel, welche nicht allzu schwierig sind, daf√ºr aber mit interessanten Mechaniken verkn√ºpft sind. Die erste Spielmechanik ist (wer h√§tte es gedacht) der Hund, der uns w√§hrend des Spiels begleitet. Bullet ist nicht nur unglaublich s√º√ü, sondern hilft uns auch beim L√∂sen von R√§tseln und warnt uns vor kommenden Gefahren. Damit es ihm aber gut geht, braucht Bullet uns als Spieler. Er sollte immer in unserer N√§he sein und ab und zu mal gestreichelt und mit Snacks gef√ºttert werden. Und bei manchen Situtionen, in denen er uns helfen k√∂nnte, sollten wir ihn nicht nach vorne schicken, sondern einfach nichts tun und weitergehen.

Ich finde den Hund eine wirklich gute Sache im Spiel und w√ºrde mir w√ºnschen, dass es mehr Horrorspiele mit einem Hund als Begleiter geben w√ºrde. Eine wirklich interessante Idee.

Die zweite Mechanik ist die der Videokassetten. Jedes gute Horrorspiel muss ja irgendwie einen Camcorder mit an Bord haben, daher besitzt Blair Witch ebenfalls einen. Das Interessante hierbei ist, dass wir mit dem Camcorder und verschiedenen Kassetten, die wir in der Spielwelt finden, durch spulen und pausieren die Ereignisse der Vergangenheit r√ºckg√§ngig machen und zu unserem Vorteil nutzen k√∂nnen, um vorw√§rts zu kommen. Das hat mich an die Mechanik aus Layers of Fear erinnert, in der man durch eine T√ºr in einen Raum gegangen ist, sich danach umgedreht hat und auf einmal war die T√ºr spurlos verschwunden.

Die Gegnerauswahl ist recht bescheiden und sobald man mal einen von ihnen gesehen hat, sind sie nicht mehr gruselig. Quasi wie beim Slenderman. Dazu sind die Gegner nicht wirklich herausfordernd, wobei der Fokus beim Gameplay also sehr auf der Atmosph√§re und dem L√∂sen der R√§tsel liegt.

[h1] [b] Grafik und Technik [/b] [/h1]
Blair Witch l√§uft wie oben schon einmal erw√§hnt auf der Unreal Engine 4, kommt aber mit einigen technischen Problemen daher. Die Grafik vom Spiel m√∂chte ich gar nicht schlecht reden, die W√§lder und vor allem die Lichteffekte sehen sehr gut aus. Aus meiner Sicht ein wirklich h√ºbsches Spiel.

Allerdings habe ich schon Unreal Engine 4 Spiele gespielt, die besser aussahen und vor allem deutlich besser liefen. Blair Witch hat selbst auf einem halbwegs aktuellen Rechner an vielen Stellen Performance-Einbr√ºche, obwohl es keinen sichtbaren Grund daf√ºr gibt. Ich spiele mit einem i7-8700K, 32GB DDR4-3200 RAM und einer RTX 3070 Ti und habe auf 1080p im Extremfall FPS-Einbr√ºche von 144 (locked) auf 60-70.

Wenn es mal nicht ruckelt, dann l√§uft das Spiel auf Ultra mit 120-144FPS im Schnitt. Und das ist ein wirklich guter Wert.

Warum ich das Spiel aber erst Jahre nach dem Release spielen konnte ist der Fakt, dass das Spiel (zumindest bei mir) so ziemlich jedes Mal beim Starten abgest√ºrzt ist. Und zu dem Zeitpunkt war meine Hardware mehr als ausreichend f√ºr Blair Witch. Immerhin l√§uft jetzt alles ohne gro√üe Probleme, wor√ºber ich sehr froh bin.

Was den Rest angeht, st√∂rt mich eigentlich nur die Tatsache, dass man die Steuerung der Tastatur nicht anpassen kann. Ich musste deswegen zum Controller greifen, da damit die Steuerung aus meiner Sicht wesentlich angenehmer ist. Was ist so schwer daran, eine frei anpassbare Tastenbelegung einzubauen, immerhin hat man es hier ja auch geschafft, einen FOV-Slider ins Spiel zu integrieren, wor√ºber ich sehr dankbar bin.

Daher ein kleiner Tipp: Wenn ihr ein Spiel entwickelt, dann gebt dem Spieler doch bitte die Freiheit, die Steuerung nach eigenen W√ºnschen anzupassen. Jeder Mensch ist unterschiedlich, auch was die Tastaturbelegung in Videospielen angeht.  

[h1] [b] Fazit [/b] [/h1]
Am Ende ist Blair Witch kein perfektes Spiel, aber alles in allem ein Spiel, mit dem ich durchaus Spa√ü hatte. Klar ist die erste H√§lfte deutlich besser als die zweite und dem Ende, aber das hat die wirklich gute Atmosph√§re f√ºr mich wieder halbwegs ausgeglichen. Die Optik ist stimmig und die Soundkulisse sowie der Soundtrack gro√üartig. Als w√§re man direkt mittendrin statt nur dabei.

Dennoch empfehle ich euch Blair Witch nicht zum Vollpreis. Wartet lieber auf einen Sale, wenn ihr an dem Spiel interessiert seid. Aus meiner Sicht ist Blair Witch aber definitiv mal einen Blick wert.

Blair Witch bekommt von mir 7 von 10 m√∂glichen Punkten.
polecam

This one is a bit weak in my opinion. Though it deals with very deep subject matter I dont think they do enough with it in the game. The use of the blair witch as a manifestation of guilt and trauma was interesting and could do well with more development. However, this game seemed to make its point early on and never develop it.

I think some of the creative decisions were cool and with some deeper looks into the mechanics of the game and collectables and whatnot, I think I could get more enjoyment out of this. However, Blair Witch just doesnt feel too special. If anything this game just reminds me of outlast 2. Has similar themes and concepts strewn throughout the games story. So, while I don't not like this game, I do think it could have been better. 

Id say if you like outlast 2 for its story, you may like this game. IDK Kinda MID.

column8:
First and foremost, this is not a game for those who deal with motion sickness or photo sensitivity. Quite a few times I did get motion sick, but I pushed through it.

I also want to preface, I'm a horror fan. I enjoy horror games, movies, thrills, you name it. So my review might be a bit harsh.

Overall, the game isn't bad. It isn't the greatest. The story was lacking. I wasn't immediately drawn in. The character seemed rough. The ambiance was lacking. The horror was very lacking. I may have got one jump scare during the fog chapter and that was it. I felt like I was mostly running around trying to get through things because I wanted to just get the game completed. Some of the chapters seemed drawn out. (Mostly referring to the last few chapters.) 

The best part was the dog. And the ability to be able to use the cell phone when you had signal, that was a nice touch. Keeping in touch with people. 

Would I recommend it? Yeah, of course. I love supporting indie developers. And overall, it is a decent game. I just enjoy it when horror games that terrify the holy shit out of me. And this one really failed to deliver on that front. And that's okay. For those looking to get their toes wet, this may be a good stepping stone.

column8:
All Bloober team games are awesome, this one in particular. It's similar to the Amnesia, and has a focus on story telling, environment, and art.

Excellent graphics (although to run it in 4K 60fps max settings you need a 3080ti).

Some parts of the game are nearly pitch black, and it can be difficult to understand the objective or even the direction since there aren't quest markers or quests. However, part of the fun is being enveloped in confusion and disorientation, which, if you've watched the original Blair Witch movies, would stick true to that tradition.

column8:
Well, I just finished Blair Witch. I don't know. For the first time after finishing a video game I have no idea what to rate it. It was interesting, I will say that. It had elements of other EXCELLENT quality horror games. But, I think I just finished the game wondering WTF did I just play? I also will say, I've had friends with PTSD, from what they've described I'd say parts of Blair Witch hit it right on the head. All I can do from this point is weigh out the pros and cons and after I finish that list, I'll decide if this game is worth the buy. 

Pros:
* If you liked Layers of Fear 1 and 2, it's made by the same people. So you'll probably like Blair Witch as well.
* Had me on the edge of my computer chair. Many jump scares and just down right spooky and eerie things to see.
* Sound effects REALLY knocked it out of the park, walking around in the forest made you want to piss your pants at times. 
* Good graphics, no real issues, no studdering nothing like that
* Great story I THINK! I say that because, I really don't know what the heck was happening I was just along for the ride
* You have a dog companion who you can pet =)
* It's a psychological horror game, it will 100% screw with your mind. I have to say, I don't think I've played a game quite like this except maybe Layers of Fear 

Cons
* Frustrating at times because you simply don't know WTH is happening or where to go (that's probably the point but still frustrating)
* Towards the end of the game, the last chapter we will call it, goes on for FAR TOO LONG. I just wanted it to end after about 10 minutes of the same thing over and over again.
* When it does end, it leaves you with a big old ? mark floating in your brain. It was not a satisfying ending IMO 
* Getting your dog (Bullet) to find and fetch things is sort of a challenge. I'm not sure how it works, because sometimes he will find an item and other times he wouldn't. Yet, I'd find an item seconds later that I would have assumed Bullet would have found
* Being prompted to do things like check your cell phone, use your walkie talkie and use other items is cool, but sometimes you just don't know when or even why you should use said items
* I think the game is designed for multiple play throughs, but I don't think there's enough for me to want to go back and play it again especially because at times certain segments were too long
* Getting lost, that's sorta the first thing I mentioned on the cons list but I was being more general about the game. But now, I'm referring to as you are playing certain chapters you just have no real understanding as to where you are going. That's a pretty big turn off for me. Wondering around in a game like this isn't exactly that exciting. A couple of times, I had to use a walk-through to figure what to do next. I do not like doing that, but it was a last ditch effort. 

Well there's the pros and cons list, read it and decide for yourself, but because I don't think this game or the team deserves negative criticism I'm going to give Blair Witch a thumbs up. If you like these types of games, you will probably be on the border of good/bad just like I am. So why not give it a shot? Take my thumbs up!

This game is a mixed bag for me. The mechanics are similar to those of most other survival horror games. Resource management is weird and "fighting" enemies is a twist. The game is short and the pacing is WAY too slow at some points. However, the atmosphere in this game is absolutely incredible. Sound design is also top-notch. The video camera time thing is a cool mechanic. If you enjoy the survival horror genre, then you'll enjoy this game (even though it's short). Overall 7.5/10 (wait for a sale).

I WAS SO WRONG!

The second half of the game was completely mindblowing and in the end it was one of the best horror games I played in a long time!
Pleaaaaaaaaase I want more of it! Layers of Fear 3, Blair Witch 2 whatever....please don't stop making such great games :)

Blairwitch... rien qu'au titre, vous savez d√©j√† que ce ne sera pas un jeu champ√™tre, joyeux et color√© !
Il s'agit donc √©videmment d'un jeu d'horreur, par les d√©veloppeurs de Layers of Fear, autre bijou de jeu horrifique, dont on retrouvera quelques m√©caniques de jeu.
Une horreur qui, comme il se doit, s'installe petit √† petit et dans laquelle on s'enfonce tout doucement. Tout commence dans les bois, o√π nous partons √† la recherche d'un gamin disparu, accompagn√© de notre fid√®le toutou Bullet. Je vous laisse d√©couvrir la suite.
Une ambiance au top, tr√®s bonne sensation d'√™tre paum√© dans les bois, excellents effets (d'absence) de lumi√®re, du tout bon ! Et pour les plus courageux, il y a m√™me une version VR !
Ah oui un truc √©tonnant que je n'ai encore jamais vu, le jeu exploite l'√©clairage de mon clavier ! Rouge en cas de danger, intensit√© et clignotement blanc li√© √† la torche etc. Chouette id√©e... s'ils restauraient la configuration d'√©clairage clavier en sortie de jeu ! L√† c'est un peu casse c*uille du coup : / Au chapitre du "peut mieux faire", on √©pinglera √©galement l'impossibilit√© de red√©finir les touches, il faudra donc passer en qwerty pour utiliser wsad au lieu du zsqd fran√ßais.

Still on Chapter 4, and it's an eerie game, albeit a little confusing. The environment is nice and the low intensity of the flashlight creates a good setting for scares. Don't play this game in the daytime, it's not as scary or eerie, unless you can close blinds and make your home or apartment as dark as possible. Highly recommend hooking your computer up to a large TV via HDMI cable to create a better setting. 

Complete - Amazing game to play, and essentially is a game on what soldiers feel like after the war, with PTSD and especially if they took peoples lives, they live with it, doesn't matter what nation or country, PTSD is shared throughout the world by soldiers.

I'm done with the last part. You spend more than half of gameplay time on last chapter I mean WTF. It's too sick but the game is great as Psychological Horror.
----- Pros -----
1. I don't want to spoil but the game really good job trick the player to alternate ending
2. As the Psychological Horror The scene, Puzzle and Story is Really Great
3. Control pet companion to get through the witch wood is kinda new mechanic.
----- Cons -----
1. Some scenes are greatly wasting your time if you want to get alternate ending there should be another options other than wasting more time on the same scene (keep walking in circle/waiting) about 10 - 20 minutes to get to difference story.
2. Spoils Alert !!!  Do not Read Spoils if you gonna try the game first !!!!!
       ***       [spoiler] You can never save the kid, also all bad endings [/spoiler]       ***
Anyway the game is not bad, you can give it a try if you love Psychological Horror game.

column8:
‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ 6/10

6 is the minimum star points I give to a game I would put my thumbs up. But I wouldn't recommend it to people who have plenty of other horror games to explore. This one should be for horror game junkies. Very crucial part of the game glitches at about 70% progression point. Leaving to main menu and then reloading the game would fix the issue but that means starting back from the checkpoint. So if that was your first time playing, there's a high chance you'd be rolling back quite a few minutes of your time, due to all the searching and wandering for puzzles. Actually, in my case, I didn't even know it was a glitch. I thought that's just how it was, given the situation.

Blair Witch is an interesting comment on experiences of people with PTSD. On that level it reminded me another game dealing with mental health issues, Hellblade: Senua's Sacrifice.

I agree with other reviews that the last part happening in the house was a bit repetitive thus tiring but all in all I really enjoyed it and finished in one weekend. Very interesting story, amazing music and the brilliant idea of a dog companion.

column8:
One of the best psychological horror games I have played in a while. I got the bad ending on my first playthrough but it didn‚Äôt make me hate the game or anything. I didn‚Äôt care much about the finale because the process leading to it was a complete blast.  I‚Äôm a fan of the original Blair Witch project film (1999) and I even liked the reboot (2016) although it is clearly inferior to its predecessor. What I find especially fascinating about this game is (obviously) the omnipresent atmosphere of the forest and the constant feel of something watching you through the pitch black of the night. Paranoia is a major thing during your first time in the game. Partly because you have no idea what is waiting for you in the woods.
But, without a doubt, the best thing in Blair Witch is your faithful companion Bullet. This dog was an MVP and I would have never finished the game without his helping paw. This canine genius always knows what‚Äôs up and where to go. It is also worth mentioning that it is impossible to fight monsters without him due to their supernatural ability to move at the speed of light. 
The plot is okay-ish. It is predictable in some ways, but still decent. The characters are all right as well, but, frankly speaking, I could not care less about Ellis, Peter and others. My main objective was to make sure that Bullet survived, others didn‚Äôt matter in that regard. 
What I did not like about the game is the pacing and replayability aspect. Do not get me wrong, the experience you get from your first journey is something that cannot be described with words but the game takes a sudden nosedive as soon as you play it the second time. During my second playthrough, I basically knew everything and thus the horror aspect along with uncertainty, tension and uncanny atmosphere of the forest were gone. The game is super scripted and monsters usually spawn at the same places. It is good for achievement hunting but bad for the replays. Also, the game is packed with various bugs and glitches. Petting Bullet is surprisingly dangerous ‚Äì your camera can stuck in the unmovable animation. You can also get stuck between rocks or trees. Sometimes the ground beneath your feet can disappear, making you fall into the never ending abyss (Definitely witchcraft!) and many-many more.
Nevertheless, this game is like a perfect mixture of Outlast, Alan Wake and Firewatch (Outlast mainly because of the camera, AW has similar forest vibes). Solid 8/10, definitely worth a buy.

My favorite aspects of this game were the dog Bullet because I wouldn't have been able to complete this game without him and the fact that the game can and should be played multiple times.  Otherwise, I wouldn't recommend this game to anyone.  I know nothing of the Blair Witch franchise but I have played a large amount of horror games.  My main frustrations stemmed from the fact that getting lost in the game was a common occurrence.  The game allows you to stray from the main path to possibly add to the craziness of the forest and hide collectibles.  However, without Bullet I would have spent countless more hours being lost and frustrated.  The use of the camera and torch as a tool adds to the atmosphere and is a great homage to the iconic filming style of the movies.
I wish the game mechanics during the second half weren't so nit picky and stringent.  You lost any chance to enjoy the scenery that I am sure many employees spent tons of time on.  Plus dodging monsters became more luck based than actually following the rules the game provided you.  The check points in the fog were brutal and infuriating.  I can't begin to detail how long I spent during the final chapters in that horrid house being slaughtered over and over again even when I followed the white markers.  
The game has glitches that have never been worked out even 2 years after I played it when it first came out.  I had to constantly quit out of the game when I would pet Bullet and get stuck in a spinning animation that wouldn't let me move.  I understand some glitches when it first came out but these have gotten worse and hinders the overall game play that is specific to achievements.  
This game went from interesting and splattered with jump scares to a chore.  I played through this 3 times specifically for the achievements and will never play it ever again.
If you like the franchise and enjoy horror games, purchase at your own risk.  Otherwise, there are hundreds of other horror/thriller games that are much better.

First of all, I went into this because I enjoyed Song of Horror previous to this and thought it might be nice to check it out, considering it's exactly what I like in a game.
Turns out I might have had too high expectations because I was pretty disappointed.
The beginning- no, the first two thirds were alright although sometimes a bit frustrating but the last third got really tiresome.
I loved the concept of having a dog as your companion (although I kept losing sight of him which could be blamed on my hopeless disorientation) and the tension was nice. However, sometimes I felt the game was a bit unclear in what you're supposed to do, but that also might be blamed on me.
Now to the tiresome part: the last thrid and finale. I found the incorporation of PTSD throughout the game quite interesting and I was on the edge of my seat for the climax but when nothing kept happening and kind of leaning more towards being repetitive, I got bored. In the end I was glad it was over because I felt the end just fell flat, because it kept dragging on and on, although it could have been executed so much better.

column8: I was so looking forward to this game. I love horror games and Blair Witch haunted me as a child when it first came out. However, this game doesn't accomplish this for me. It was very slow to get going on the scary, confusing parts with a ton of running in circles at points, and the ending was extremely disappointing. I will say, the last 1 - 1.5hrs were great (before the ending) and I wish the whole game was like that. But out of 7.5hrs I only enjoyed 1.5hrs of it. If you get the game on a big sale then go for it. Otherwise, find something else to play.

I'v never wanted a dog to die in a game before now. What an utterly annoying mechanism; walk through a repetitive maze with a dog barking the whole time. Headache inducing and boring. After 30 min, a game should hook me, not make me reconsider whether or not it is worth my time to slog onward. The graphics are good, the voice acting is average, the writing is somewhat sub-par at this early stage (and not likely to improve) and the dog (Bullet) is a huge negative that could have been a fantastic addition.
I'm also still waiting for it to get creepy or scary, but nothing of note so far; not even a cheap jump-scare.

The graphics are good, the voice acting is average, the writing is somewhat sub-par at this early stage (and not likely to improve) and the dog (Bullet) is a huge negative that could have been a fantastic addition.

column8:
Just finished the game, and like pretty much everyone else, I got the "bad" ending. That said, I think the experience was good enough that I'll play it again for a better ending.

I'm a huge fan of the original film (not the 2016 reboot), and there's something special about traveling through the woods in the pitch black night. Like the film, the forest feels like a giant, terrible abyss, and the atmosphere is usually very effective. IMO, the best horror games are about atmosphere, not silly jumpscares, and Blair Witch mostly pulls this off well.

Having a dog as your companion was a brilliant move by the developers. Bullet acts as an emotional anchor, and when he's in danger, you really feel invested. It's also useful that you're usually able to follow him through forest environments that would otherwise be difficult to navigate (especially when there's no clear path). Nevertheless, I still found myself getting lost or going in circles more than once. At first, it added to the game's atmospheric dread, but eventually it got frustrating.

This is more of an interactive linear experience and less of a "game." Drawing inspiration from Silent Hill and Outlast and marrying them with the Blair Witch lore, I think it mostly works well. Another reviewer mentioned that the first two-thirds of the game are good, but things fall apart during the last third, and I agree. The final third of the game is a seemingly endless loop that drags on and on and on and on. The game already suffered from pacing issues, and the final third of the game is definitely the worst in this regard. The developers don't seem to realize that timing is a big part of effective horror; the longer you stay in a "scary" place, going through room after room after room, the less scary it becomes. We get the story about Ellis's past, we didn't need to see it dragged out like this.

That said, I think it's a worthwhile enough experience that I'll be playing a second time. Worth a buy at sale price.

Blair Witch meets Alan Wake on Flashlight Hero Mod! 

Bem, quase isso mas no fundo, a realidade √© outra.

 Blair Witch tenta evocar o sensacionalismo do pseudocument√°rio de 1999 em uma sequ√™ncia desafiadora, ap√≥s suas duas adapta√ß√µes Book of Shadows de 2000 e The Woods de 2016 serem o ritmo de dose baixa e desenfreada que seu primeiro percurso tentou passar. 

Sejamos francos: a primeira vers√£o √© um manto ritualist√≠co do genero pseudo e como sabemos o efeito hollywoodyano tenta sempre cuspir no mesmo prato com semelhan√ßas abruptas e desparelhas de remakes mal projetados apenas por um mero din din da sorte a calhar para os mercenautas da modernidade. Temos colunas de se admirar na s√©tima arte nos dias de hoje, mas s√£o quase dificeis de se notar e muitas vezes necessitam o olhar perdido de apenas uma paisagem de se admirar. 

E eis que retornamos a este game, que trocou as r√©deas e todo o percurso da carro√ßa para algo not√°vel de se expor. Ap√≥s ter jogado Layers of Fear e Observer da desenvolvedora Bloober Team, posso dizer que este tomou recusas de ser uma adapta√ß√£o merecedora. Um dos temas que me agradou foi a ideia de ter um Mad Max Doggo para te acomponhar e te auxiliar na jornada. Todo momento voce deve se preocupar com ele e isso podendo afetar o desenrolar do desfecho. Apesar de reprimir no final dos cr√©ditos como um projeto amador pela paix√£o inescusavel do filme, deveria ter sido melhor temperado como seus games anteriores, se tornando uma trilha de migalhas de jo√£o e maria para uma tenebrosa Haunted House of Hill P.T version Without Vincent Price.

[h1][b]"Blair Witch" to pierwszoosobowa gra przygodowa w klimacie horroru, korzystajƒÖca z koncepcji popularnej serii film√≥w grozy o tym samym tytule wydana 30 sierpnia 2019r. na PC oraz XBOX One, 3 grudnia tego samego roku na PS4 i finalnie te≈º 25 czerwca na Nintendo Switch. Projekt opracowa≈Ço polskie studio Bloober Team, majƒÖce na koncie takie projekty jak Observer, czy seriƒô Layers of Fear oraz od niedawna tak≈ºe The Medium.
Historia zaczyna siƒô od tajemniczego zaginiƒôcia pewnego ch≈Çopca w lesie Black Hills nieopodal Burkittsville w stanie Maryland w USA w 1996r.
Gracz wciela siƒô by≈Çego glinƒô - Ellisa z nie≈ÇatwƒÖ przesz≈Ço≈õciƒÖ, kt√≥ry do≈ÇƒÖcza do poszukiwa≈Ñ dziecka mimo zakaz√≥w ze strony prze≈Ço≈ºonych. ChcƒÖc odnale≈∫ƒá ch≈Çopca, bohater musi zmierzyƒá siƒô nie tylko z w≈Çasnymi lƒôkami, ale r√≥wnie≈º wied≈∫mƒÖ z Blair, kt√≥ra wed≈Çug legend nawiedza las Black Hills. Pomo≈ºe mu w tym wierny przyjaciel - pies Bullet.
W "Blair Witch" akcjƒô obserwujemy z perspektywy pierwszoosobowej, a rozgrywka koncentruje siƒô na eksploracji i odkrywaniu fabu≈Çy. Podczas zabawy wraz z Bulletem przeczesujemy ponury las, gdzie czas oraz przestrze≈Ñ ulegajƒÖ zniekszta≈Çceniu i zakrzywieniu. Zabawƒô urozmaicajƒÖ okazjonalne zagadki, kt√≥re rozwiƒÖzujemy za pomocƒÖ manipulacji czasem i przestrzeniƒÖ dziƒôki kamerze. Co pewien czas pojawiajƒÖ siƒô r√≥wnie≈º wyzwania zrƒôczno≈õciowe, takie jak sekwencje ucieczki. IstotnƒÖ rolƒô w rozgrywce odgrywa pies. Mo≈ºna mu wydawaƒá proste komendy, ale czƒôsto reaguje on r√≥wnie≈º samodzielnie, np. informujƒÖc nas o wa≈ºnych rzeczach. Grƒô opracowano w taki spos√≥b, ≈ºe podczas jednorazowego przej≈õcia nie do≈õwiadczymy wszystkiego co produkcja ma do zaoferowania, gdy≈º gra przewiduje 4 mo≈ºliwe zako≈Ñczenia, a ≈ºeby je poznaƒá nale≈ºy przej≈õƒá grƒô kilkukrotnie. 
Na plus jest te≈º zdecydowanie grafika. Jest bardzo dobra, przyjemna dla oka. Eksploruje siƒô z zaciekawieniem podziwiajƒÖc otoczenie, kt√≥re te≈º odgrywa wa≈ºnƒÖ rolƒô w fabule. Tw√≥rcy stworzyli w pe≈Çni tr√≥jwymiarowe lokacje.
D≈∫wiƒôk tak≈ºe jest niczego sobie. Dodaje klimatu, dajƒÖc poczucie zaszczucia, ciƒÖg≈Çego zagro≈ºenia i niepewno≈õci. 
Chocia≈º najbardziej i tak jest ciekawa mechanika wsp√≥≈Çpracy z psem.
Grƒô mo≈ºna znale≈∫ƒá na przecenach ju≈º za 30z≈Ç, ale nawet za 50z≈Ç op≈Çaca siƒô ograƒá. Nie mam ≈ºadnych zastrze≈ºe≈Ñ, poniewa≈º optymalizacja te≈º jest dobrze zrobiona. Nie ma ≈ºadnych spadk√≥w, a gra utrzymuje sta≈Çe 60 klatek.
BiorƒÖc pod uwagƒô te≈º to, ≈ºe gierka ma 4 zako≈Ñczenia na kilka godzin ka≈ºda(chyba ≈ºe znajƒÖc grƒô leci siƒô na speedrunie), co daje wiƒôcej czasu zabawy to oceniam jƒÖ z czystym sumieniem 10/10 :)

The game is great. Graphics, audio, and events handling are all superb compared to other horror games in the same year. Still, I do need to say a few things. First, the whole game from start to finish is cinematic oriented. Do not expect a lot of gameplay like shooting, jumping, or even climbing. Second, the shadow enemies sometimes look like they are stuck behind trees but I'm still not sure because of their horrific animations. Third, I encountered a single bug in my whole walkthrough looking for the kid in the basement where I opened one of the doors and got stuck inside of it, just before watching my clone staring at the corner in a cutscene.
