This game was simply amazing! While linear, it let's you explore enough to let you think you can do what you want. I learned towards the end that the decisions you make DO impact the story/ending, and I can't wait to try for an alternative ending. This was definitely a nonstop insanely, genuinely fun yet horrifying experience. 
As a side note, the graphics & lighting is AMAZING, however just a bit unoptimized due to having some very low FPS during certain cutscenes or when I hit a big trigger for an event on a 6600XT. But this was only noticeable maybe 4 times throughout the game, no no points against them on that. Definitely something I'd recommend to friends to play.

column8: Better than I thought it would be. There wasn't quite as much Witch as I would've liked, but there were lots of good jumpscares and fantastic atmosphere. Also, they really emphasized the getting lost part of the films because they do not hold your hand at all. Like at all. I don't normally need any hand-holding, but I was lost for at least 20 minutes out of my playthrough. Bullet is the best though, and a very good dog. I honestly didn't care what happened to me as long as Bullet lived at the end. I was not disappointed in this regard. 7.5/10 overall

pero el punto mas flaco de este juego es el final (cualquiera de los 4).

En cuanto al "terror", el juego no es la gran cosa, pero tampoco es mon√≥tono. Tiene algunos jump scare que te van a sacar unos sustos. 
El punto mas fuerte ac√° sin duda es la ambientaci√≥n, la cual muy buena, logra mantenerte tenso todo el tiempo. El bosque parece estar vivo.

WOW, The ‚ÄúBlair Witch‚Äù forest is a really really scary place to be, and even more scarier when the sun goes down.  You play a man with PTSD, together with his dog (so you‚Äôre not alone) who all get lost in the forest where things just start getting out of control. The mind plays tricks and it messes you up as the player. Best part was the scary forest, the road down into total madness and desolation, the evil one cannot see and the destruction of self. Only down side is low FPS on high end PCs and bad porting. Besides that it‚Äôs a 10/10 and makes the Blair Witch movies a fun Sunday afternoon walk compared to this mother of a nightmare of a game. (Yes, this game is better than the movies)
column9: WOW, The ‚ÄúBlair Witch‚Äù forest is a really really scary place to be, and even more scarier when the sun goes down.  You play a man with PTSD, together with his dog (so you‚Äôre not alone) who all get lost in the forest where things just start getting out of control. The mind plays tricks and it messes you up as the player. Best part was the scary forest, the road down into total madness and desolation, the evil one cannot see and the destruction of self. Only down side is low FPS on high end PCs and bad porting. Besides that it‚Äôs a 10/10 and makes the Blair Witch movies a fun Sunday afternoon walk compared to this mother of a nightmare of a game. (Yes, this game is better than the movies)

column8:
If you like the Outlast games then you'll definitely love this game, the game has a lot of similarities with the Outlast games with one very distinct feature, your pet dog/companion Bullet. 
At the start I was a bit cautious and critical about the whole having a companion thing, thinking that he might slow me down and ruin my "immersive horror experience" but I was I quickly proven wrong by how life-like and charming he was, Bloober Team did an absolutely incredible job with him and his AI, and if anything he definitely enhanced my whole "whole immersive horror experience." 
I'm no game reviewer but Bloober Team SA's Blair Witch the game gets a 9/10 from me.

Such an incredibly immersive game. It stayed true to the fact that you never see anything, but as a game it incorporated the fact that you had to be aware of hostiles. Honestly, I'm speechless. This game had amazing graphics, story, and gameplay. The dimensional rifts, the voice acting, the ambience, all amazing. I definitely would recommend this game. It's so fucking good honestly and the multiple ending system makes it really ambiguous and caters to each player giving a unique reflection of themselves. Honestly don't get the bad reviews because this game gives the whole Blair Witch lore justice with a touch of Silent Hill in it.

ASIDE FROM THE SUPER IMMERSIVE GAMEPLAY, THERE'S A DOG AND HE'S THE BEST.

column8:
Honest review, I thought the game was a bit frustrating. Lots of mindlessly walking in circles in order to trigger game dialogue in order for more things to happen. I know this added a lot to the psychological aspect of the game but i feel like it was too much. A couple jump scares but nothing too bad. Loved the story and graphics, would play again just for the fact that there are a few options that can change the game a bit, different ending etc.

Worst part for me was the dog, i was TERRIFIED the dog was going to get attacked the entire game.

I absolutely love the original Blair Witch Project movie, and that alone inspired me to play this game. Upon first playing, I was excited and curious as to what was to come... And of course, withing an hour of playing, I was severely bored. All you do is walk... Walk... And... Once again walk. Now I don't personally mind walking simulators, especially if there's some horror mixed in there. But with this game, you cannot see a damn thing. You spend soo much time just wandering around in the dark until you finally find something that's useful towards your progression. I was also unable to continue the game as a bug came through and took a big-fat juicy steaming pile of shit right on me... Yes... Right on me. Don't play this game, go watch the movie instead... Oh and don't be fooled by my playtime, i played this on the XBOX.

This game was pretty interesting, and it definitely does a good job of keeping you in a sense of unease, which is good and rare to find in "horror" games. This story was simple, yet very complex in its own ways. Also, the style of gameplay keeps you intrigued to keep going. I would definitely recommend this to a friend. The company definitely deserves a pat on the back for this, because its been quite some time since i found a good horror game to play. Kudos

No el mejor juego, pero una apuesta bastante interesante para amantes del g√©nero.

This game pretty much had what I expected from a Blair Witch game. Being lost in a creepy forest and the subtle witch myst that left you in the dark whether the witch was real or "only in your head". It's mostly a walking simulator with very few *cough* "action" moments, and that's exactly what I wanted from it.

Blair Witch had a nice start. We join the search of a missing boy and eventually get lost in the deep forest all alone with our loyal (and cute!) dog. The more we walk on, the more we are facing visions of horror. The gorgeous forest becomes darker and creepier and at some point we're wondering: what's real? What's just in our head?

It's an intersting trip for the most part. However, most everything that I liked about Blair Witch poofed in the last part. To make it worse, the last part even felt endlessly stretched and tedious. Partially even so annoying that I just wanted the game to end. 

And the ending was bad. Like, real bad. Okay, my Doggy survived, that's the only good thing about it. Like in Layers of Fear 2, Bloober Team didn't give you any hints on what to do in order to achive the more-or-less good ending. Playing by instinct will most probably reward your 6 hours playtime with the bad ending. And Blair Witch - at least for me - is not the type of game to replay over and over to see which playstyle leads to what ending. 

All in all, Blair Witch to me was a bit better than neutral. Not worth the full price, but a nice little horror treat when on sale.

People love and hate this game. The graphics are excellent, but a 2070S isn't enough to handle full 4K without 50% resolution scaling or other significant compromises. But it's the most convincing woodlands I've seen. While it still has some mildly annoying aspects that give away its Indie status, it doesn't get much better than this for indie horror games with AAA graphics. Great voice actors, great immersion, so-so story, and one exceptionally terrifying environment that's too scary to explore. I haven't felt this way in a long time. More of the game should've been like the logging camp. 

It's a walking sim, but it keeps players busy. The Medium bored me to death with its barrage of nonsensical reading and watching and blathering between bits of play time. Parts of this game are way closer to Silent Hill than The Medium. For me, it's Bloober's best. I got it for free on Epic and liked it enough to buy it here on Steam.

Do come√ßo ao fim este game me fez sentir como se estivesse sendo arrastado para o inferno aos poucos; causando tens√£o, pavor e uma ansiedade fodid* (E o √°pice dessas emo√ß√µes se deu no final) m√©rito principal a sonoplastia e demais recursos audiovisuais que este game implementou com maestria.

Se voc√™ √© f√£ deste tipo de game, provavelmente j√° sabe que a gameplay ser√° melhor experienciada em um ambiente escuro e com fones de ouvido. Sussurros amedrontadores, galhos secos quebrando, o canto dos corvos na floresta que popularmente √© interpretado como um sinal de mau press√°gio, morte e azar; al√©m da melodia pavorosa e a respira√ß√£o ofegante: cada barulho serviu minuciosamente para me deixar totalmente imerso no dom√≠nio amaldi√ßoado da bruxa na floresta.

Tamb√©m gostei da rever√™ncia baseada no enredo original do filme de 1999, n√£o alterando absolutamente nada dos acontecimentos da franquia, mantendo-se respeitosa com as premissas principais, como por exemplo: O fato da Bruxa em si existir apenas na imagina√ß√£o como uma representa√ß√£o do mau e n√£o uma figura explicitamente caracterizada.

column8:
Blair Witch es un juego que debes tener en cuenta la paciencia y no caer en la paranoia con los lugares del bosque maldito por la misma bruja. Blair Witch es un juego tan interesante que puedes acariciar a t√∫ perrito y puedes personalizarlo a t√∫ gusto. Ya podr√≠an haber traducido los logros que consigues a medida vas caminando en el bosque(est√°n al portugu√©s). Los controles no me terminaron de convencer mucho pero tampoco son tan malos despu√©s de todo. Los personajes cumplen con su funci√≥n de contar sus tramas aparte. La historia tienes que pegarte mucho para que puedas entender el contexto de la trama, pero me termin√≥ de divertir e indagar m√°s acerca del lore de la Bruja de Blair. En l√≠neas generales: Blair Witch es un juego entretenido que lo puedes terminar en aproximadamente 4 a 6 horas como fue m√≠ caso. Recomendado comprarlo en rebajas si gustan. 
M√≠ puntaje: 70/100.

No bo owszem - sƒÖ momenty, w kt√≥rych za pomocƒÖ latarki walczymy z potworami przemykajƒÖcymi miƒôdzy drzewami, ale sporadyczne. Nieprzypadkowo gra jest pierwszoosobowa, bo gdyby≈õmy patrzyli na Ellisa z boku, nie da≈Çoby siƒô tak dobrze oddaƒá jego narastajƒÖcej paranoi, lƒôku i wewnƒôtrznego b√≥lu. Nieprzypadkowo w niekt√≥rych sekwencjach chodzimy w k√≥≈Çko po zapƒôtlonej ≈õcie≈ºce - w lesie, w wƒÖwozie czy nawet w finale, w domu znanym z filmu - co niekt√≥rzy gracze mogƒÖ uznaƒá za nudne i frustrujƒÖce (historio, rusz siƒô w ko≈Ñcu!), ale znowu - bez tego trudno by≈Çoby nam uwierzyƒá, ≈ºe postaƒá, kt√≥rej oczami patrzymy na to, co siƒô dzieje, z przera≈ºenia i niezrozumienia zdarze≈Ñ z jej udzia≈Çem, stopniowo popada w szale≈Ñstwo. Bo to w≈Ça≈õnie jest w tej historii najwa≈ºniejsze. NarastajƒÖca psychoza Ellisa, kt√≥ra ma r√≥wnie≈º udzielaƒá siƒô nam. Wczucie siƒô w jego sytuacjƒô. To my zab≈ÇƒÖdzili≈õmy w nawiedzonym lesie, nie bohater, na kt√≥rego patrzymy z boku. To my potrzebujemy towarzystwa psa, aby czuƒá siƒô komfortowo. I z tego, co czytam w innych opiniach, tw√≥rcom uda≈Ço siƒô to osiƒÖgnƒÖƒá, bo wiƒôkszo≈õƒá graczy, nawet tych krytycznych, poczu≈Ça najpierw du≈ºƒÖ sympatiƒô do Bulleta, a potem du≈ºe emocje w zwiƒÖzku z tym, jak poprowadzono tƒô postaƒá. Bardzo ciekawie pod kƒÖtem storytellingu rozwiƒÖzano r√≥wnie≈º to, co musimy zrobiƒá, aby historia mia≈Ça szczƒô≈õliwe zako≈Ñczenie (bo jest kilka). To zagadka, kt√≥rej rozwiƒÖzanie jest w pe≈Çni sp√≥jne z tym, co widzimy i s≈Çyszymy na ekranie, ale mo≈ºemy mylnie interpretowaƒá. Tak - od poczƒÖtku mamy tutaj wskaz√≥wki co do ko≈Ñcowych twist√≥w. I o ile pierwszego raczej ≈Çatwo siƒô domy≈õliƒá, o tyle drugiego - jak dali≈õmy siƒô oszukaƒá wied≈∫mie z Blair i sami, w≈Çasnymi decyzjami dali≈õmy siƒô poprowadziƒá do z≈Çego fina≈Çu - przewidzieƒá nie spos√≥b. 

Jako ≈ºe sam param siƒô wymy≈õlaniem r√≥≈ºnych rzeczy, nie mogƒô nie zwr√≥ciƒá uwagi, ≈ºe z tej gry wrƒôcz bije artystyczna pasja. Widaƒá, ≈ºe stworzyli jƒÖ zapale≈Ñcy, fani gatunku, kt√≥rzy chcieli stworzyƒá co≈õ osobistego i oryginalnego. Doceniam to, podziwiam i bƒôdƒô chwaliƒá. 
Siƒôgnijcie po "Blair Witch". Zosta≈Ñcie sami w domu. Odpalcie jƒÖ p√≥≈∫nym wieczorem, przy zgaszonym ≈õwietle, ze s≈Çuchawkami na uszach. Zawsze mo≈ºna doszukaƒá siƒô pozytyw√≥w tej sytuacji - chyba jeszcze nigdy test psychologiczny na typ osobowo≈õci nie by≈Ç tak przyjemny! üôÇ

ùöéùö°ùöäùöåùöùùöïùö¢ ùöíùöú ùöùùöëùöé ùöôùöûùöõùöôùöòùöúùöé ùöòùöè ùöùùöëùöé ùô±ùöïùöäùöíùöõ ùöÜùöíùöùùöåùöë ùöíùöú ùöäùöóùöç ùöëùöòùö† ùö¢ùöòùöû ùöñùöíùöêùöëùöù ùöãùöé ùöòùöüùöéùöõùöïùöòùöòùöîùöíùöóùöê ùöëùöéùöõ ùöíùöóùöèùöïùöûùöéùöóùöåùöé.

ùô∞ùöú ùöäùöó ùöäùöúùöíùöçùöé, ùô±ùöïùöäùöíùöõ ùöÜùöíùöùùöåùöë ùöäùöïùöúùöò ùöôùöäùö¢ùöú ùöêùöòùöòùöç ùöäùöùùöùùöéùöóùöùùöíùöòùöó ùöùùöò ùöçùöéùöùùöäùöíùöï. ùöÉùöëùöé ‚Äòùöïùöòùöòùöôùöíùöóùöê‚Äô ùöïùöéùöüùöéùöï ùöçùöéùöúùöíùöêùöó ùöçùöòùöéùöú ùöóùöòùöù ùöëùöíùöóùöçùöéùöõ ùöùùöëùöíùöú ùöêùöäùöñùöé‚Äôùöú ùöäùöãùöíùöïùöíùöùùö¢ ùöùùöò ùöôùöõùöéùöúùöéùöóùöù ùöûùöú ùö†ùöíùöùùöë ùöíùöóùöùùöéùöõùöéùöúùöùùöíùöóùöê ùöäùöóùöç ùöûùöóùöíùööùöûùöé ùöúùöéùöù ùöïùöòùöåùöäùöùùöíùöòùöóùöú, ùöäùöóùöç ùöùùöëùöéùö¢ ùöäùöõùöé ùöäùöïùöï ùöóùöòùöù ùöïùöíùöñùöíùöùùöéùöç ùöùùöò ùöìùöûùöúùöù ùöùùöëùöé ùöèùöòùöõùöéùöúùöù ùöéùöíùöùùöëùöéùöõ. ùô∏ ùöéùöóùöìùöòùö¢ùöéùöç ùöäùöïùöï ùöùùöëùöé ùöçùöòùöåùöûùöñùöéùöóùöùùöú ùö¢ùöòùöû ùöåùöòùöïùöïùöéùöåùöù ùöùùöëùöõùöòùöûùöêùöëùöòùöûùöù ùöùùöëùöé ùö†ùöäùö¢ ùöäùöú ùö†ùöéùöïùöï ‚Äì ùöùùöëùöéùö¢ ùöäùöõùöé ùöõùöéùöïùöéùöüùöäùöóùöù ùöùùöò ùöùùöëùöé ùöúùöùùöòùöõùö¢, ùöåùöòùöñùöé ùöèùöõùöòùöñ ùöüùöäùöõùöíùöéùöç ùöúùöòùöûùöõùöåùöéùöú, ùöôùöõùöòùöüùöíùöçùöé ùöíùöóùöùùöéùöõùöéùöúùöùùöíùöóùöê ùöãùöäùöåùöîùöêùöõùöòùöûùöóùöç, ùöäùöóùöç ùöäùöõùöé ùööùöûùöíùöåùöî ùöùùöò ùöõùöéùöäùöç. ùô¥ùöïùöïùöíùöú ùöäùöïùöúùöò ùöëùöäùöú ùöä ùöåùöéùöïùöïùöôùöëùöòùöóùöé ùöùùöëùöäùöù ùöíùöú ùöèùöûùöïùöï ùö†ùöíùöùùöë ùöèùöûùöó ùöñùöíùöóùöí-ùöêùöäùöñùöé ùöçùöíùöüùöéùöõùöúùöíùöòùöóùöú, ùöúùöíùöçùöé ùööùöûùöéùöúùöùùöú, ùöäùöóùöç ùöåùöûùöõùöíùöòùöûùöú ùöäùöåùöëùöíùöéùöüùöéùöñùöéùöóùöùùöú.

ùöÉùöëùöé ùöúùöùùöòùöõùö¢ ùöòùöè ùô±ùöïùöäùöíùöõ ùöÜùöíùöùùöåùöë ùöîùöíùöåùöîùöú ùöòùöèùöè ùö†ùöíùöùùöë ùöòùöûùöõ ùöôùöõùöòùöùùöäùöêùöòùöóùöíùöúùöù, ùô¥ùöïùöïùöíùöú, ùö†ùöëùöò ùöìùöòùöíùöóùöú ùöä ùöúùöéùöäùöõùöåùöë ùöôùöäùöõùöùùö¢ ùö†ùöíùöùùöë ùöùùöëùöé ùöïùöòùöåùöäùöï ùöÇùöëùöéùöõùöíùöèùöè‚Äôùöú ùöçùöéùöôùöäùöõùöùùöñùöéùöóùöù ùöùùöò ùöèùöíùöóùöç ùôøùöéùöùùöéùöõ, ùöä ùö¢ùöòùöûùöóùöê ùöãùöòùö¢ ùö†ùöëùöò ùöúùöûùöçùöçùöéùöóùöïùö¢ ùöçùöíùöúùöäùöôùöôùöéùöäùöõùöéùöç. ùô∞ùöú ùö†ùöíùöùùöë ùöñùöòùöúùöù ùöëùöòùöõùöõùöòùöõ ùöúùöùùöòùöõùöíùöéùöú ‚Äì ùöäùöïùöï ùöíùöú ùöóùöòùöù ùö†ùöëùöäùöù ùöíùöù ùöúùöéùöéùöñùöú. ùô¥ùöïùöïùöíùöú ùöíùöú ùöä ùöùùöõùöòùöûùöãùöïùöéùöç ùöñùöäùöó ùö†ùöíùöùùöë ùöêùöòùöòùöç ùöíùöóùöùùöéùöóùöùùöíùöòùöóùöú. ùôøùöäùöúùöù ùöñùöíùöúùöùùöäùöîùöéùöú ùöíùöó ùöùùöëùöé ùöïùöíùöóùöé ùöòùöè ùöçùöûùöùùö¢ ùöëùöäùöüùöé ùöôùöïùöäùöêùöûùöéùöç ùöëùöíùöú ùöôùöúùö¢ùöåùöëùöé ùöèùöòùöõ ùö¢ùöéùöäùöõùöú ‚Äì ùöäùöóùöç ùöèùöíùöóùöçùöíùöóùöê ùöùùöëùöíùöú ùöñùöíùöúùöúùöíùöóùöê ùöãùöòùö¢ ùöñùöíùöêùöëùöù ùöãùöé ùöëùöíùöú ùöïùöäùöúùöù ùöéùöèùöèùöòùöõùöù ùöùùöò ùöñùöäùöîùöé ùöäùöñùöéùöóùöçùöú.

column8: Without a map its pretty challenging figuring out where you are and where to go.  Lucky that I have Bullet for a companion in such a terrifying forest.  The story itself was confusing to me and the cabin in the wood chapter was the most tough to go thru.  Overall it was an experience that was satisfying and scary.  Thrilling with suspenseful moments.

Gra jest swietna. Bez dwoch zdan. Studio bardzo sie postaralo by zapewnic niewiarygodnie mocny klimat. Gra przeraza juz na samym wejsciu.
Blooper Team nigdy mnie nie zawiodlo. Ale tym razem przeszli samych siebie i stworzyli dla mnie MAJSTERSZTYK!
Fabula zapowiada sie niewinnie. A otoczenie jak i dzwieki wprawiaja nas w oslupienie i przerazaja.
Dzieki pomocnikowi (psu) latwiej jest nam sie odnalezc w tym wielkim swiecie, pomimo jego liniowosci. A eksploracje poza wytyczonymi sciezkami sa przerazajace dla nas jak i naszego bohatera.

Hello I am Tom Poe and I love to play story rich horror games mainly and I would say that I loved your game.  I found myself fully immersed in this story of Ellis and having a companion like Bullet was a very nice feature you don't get often in a survival horror game.  I enjoyed that the game did not leave me wandering around a huge map for hours trying to navigate my way towards POI's or having to solve too complicated puzzles.  By being able to solve the puzzles and deal with enemies within an average amount of time it let the game move in a very steady pace and i was never bored.  The end sequence in the house to me was the best part and I will play it again in VR mainly because of that.  Also the red video tape feature was amazing and unique I has a lot of fun using that.  I hope the future titles are equally if not greater than this one, thank you for providing me with an awesome game experience that i will remember forever.

Great Game. Took me 5 hours to finish.

I play very few horror games, no jump scares.Blair Witch has some mild scary moments, totally acceptable.

I haven't watched the film with the same title. This game is great, with a well-developed story and stick to the point. The protagonist, Ellis has PTSD, during the gameplay he fights the carve man and fights himself. I am not familiar with this term but after seeing Ellis struggle through shattered memories, jump between old times and the current forest, taking the enemies as the carve man, blaming himself for mistakes he made in wartime - I understand it in a good way.

You also make important choices in the game. I like it when you make big decisions on Bullet. If you give up the exit is simple and right in front of you, but if you insist, the way can be painfully long but eventually you will get what you want and it is rewarding.

This game has multiple endings and I like the one I reached in the first play. It is a bad ending they say, but feels so real. The biggest problem of this game is it has glitches. Good thing is you can reload the near autosaves.

I tried playing this game when it first came out but was plagued with sound issues, to the standard and adamant response of "It's your PC, we can never do wrong" So I literally uninstalled it for 2 years and forgot about it.

Sadly I came back....

Very pretty but very bland horror game. This is the first time I haven't been satisfied by Bloober Team. The plot and overarching themes are so very overplayed in my own opinion. Add to that a handful of weird bugs, wonky controls (looking down or up makes the camera move slower side-to-side?) and a feeling of being generally underwhelmed, I really can't recommend this game at it's full price.

That said, the flashlight was extremely well implemented - probably the best flashlight in any video game. Also, Bullet <3

column8: The Blair Witch is a horror game based on the similarly named movie 'The Blair Witch Project'. The protagonist of the story is a police officer named Ellis. After the mysterious dissapearance of a young boy in the woods of Black Hill forest near Burkittsville, Maryland, Ellis joins the search party. Soon after entering the forest, things start to change and you realize that there is more going on that initially anticipated. Reality starts to blend with fantasy. Ellis' troubled past fuels the hallucinations which are virtually indistinguishable from the real world. Although the gameplay seems linear, there are important choices to be made which eventually result in a different outcome. Moreover, the game seems to anticipate specific choices and influences the decicions you make as a player. The game can be played multiple times where, each time, you can discover something new. Another unique addition to the gameplay is that you have a companion, a dog named Bullet. As a player you can use the abilities of Bullet to find clues and discover relevant items. The way the player is interacting with Bullet also changes his behavior and eventually the outcome of the game. Overall, the graphics of the game are outstanding. The game designers managed to get the eerie feeling of walking alone in a forest at night just right. The Blair Witch is a game that is definately higly reccomended for players who want a slow, but in depth psychological horror experience.

column8:
6/10

I really wanted to love this game, but it was pretty disappointing.  
If you have never played other games in this genera such as Outlast, layers of fear or amnesia then this game would probably be pretty good, if not great.  But If you are familiar with the aforementioned games and are hoping for something new, this is not it.

The story was relatively unremarkable and the gameplay felt like the same old routine that I have come to expect from games in the survival, psychological horror genera.  It seems they wanted to make a game like PT or Layers of fear, but the execution left much to be desired and had very little originality.  The puzzles were simple and few. The constant hallucinations, flashbacks and messages from a girlfriend that seemed to have no relevance to the story got old quick.  There were very few jump scares, at least unexpected ones. The enemies were predictable and not very scary, you cant run from them and you cant hide, so this means once you figure out their behaviors and patterns they become all to easy to avoid.  With the exception of a dog named bullet and the one original game mechanic with a video camera that can inexplicably rewind time for specific objects, this game was nothing we haven't seen before.

Well, in all honesty, it's not that great of a game, but neither is it anything that bad really. The thing is, i wanted to love this game, because the first few hours were absolutely amazing! (not that the whole game is that long anyway, it took me 6 hours to beat and i finished it in one sitting, yeah i know, i have no life, but that's beyond the point...). But what can i say without spoiling too much. Well, okay, firstly, let's talk about the story a bit here, because that's the most important factor for me in a story-based single player game (why could that be...), and that's where this game falls flat too. It's just a bunch of generic bs really. Or well, mainly the war parts are what bothered me. They weren't necessary at all in here imo. It's like, this isn't F.E.A.R. or anything like that, you know? They didn't fit this game at all if you ask me, but well, that's as far as my complaints about this game go. 

So, in conclusion, the game is okay, gameplay is pretty fun, and it has a DOGGO companion, that you can pet : ) So, in that sense, it's the best game ever made. However, as i said, the story just makes it a little worse than it could be, and depending on the ending you get, the dog might die too, so that's shitty too. But, all in all, i'd still recommend this for the gameplay aspects alone. Just don't expect anything groundbreaking and you'll have fun with it. I just wish it was a little longer and that the story was better. Get it on sale, and you probably won't be too disappointed. 

It's worth it for the woof woofs alone!

Me he llevado sustos, he pasado por lugares que dan miedo, me he  enfrentado a situaciones que me hac√≠an entrar en p√°nico. He podido sentir cari√±o hacia el perro y hasta preocuparme de √©l. En definitiva, un juego de terror psicol√≥gico que te consiga atrapar mientras lo juegas y ponerte los pelos de punta es un juegazo.

Cosas que veo que se podr√≠an mejorar: algunas partes del juego donde tienes que buscar lugares en el mapa son un poco confusas y hacen que te pierdas. Literal me quede 1 o 2 horas atascado por no saber adonde ir. A√∫n as√≠ es bueno conseguir que te pierdas en un lugar tan horrible.

Quiero rejugar este juego varias veces para entender todos sus secretos.

column8:
Blair Witch es un juego que propone cosas interesantes pero se queda a medias en casi todas, sumado a que me toco una experiencia llena de bugs.
No me considero un fan√°tico de los juegos de terror o en este caso "Thriller" si es que se le puede llamar as√≠, pero desde que vi este juego me llamo la atenci√≥n, ya que se ve√≠a como un juego prometedor, pero al momento de jugarlo no es nada mas que una decepci√≥n tras decepci√≥n, comenzando por lo molesto que es depender de un npc que es el perro para poder avanzar, muchas veces estaba caminando por el bosque y el perro se quedaba quieto o simplemente el perro se iba tan r√°pido que era imposible seguirle el rastro, el principal problema con este ultimo comentario es que si el personaje no tiene cerca al perro, se comienza a volver el loco y no tengo problema con que sea una mec√°nica, pero el problema es que aunque llame al perro, aveces se atascaba o simplemente no venia hacia mi, por lo que la experiencia de juego de por si esta rota, ademas de que el juego no te deja ni siquiera disfrutar de los momentos de "tensi√≥n" por que tiene la maldita necesidad de cortar esos momentos sin mayor raz√≥n, sumado a que se siente tan decepcionante cuanto estas en tu primer encuentro con los "fantasmas" y literal la mec√°nica del juego es la mec√°nica del juego Alan Wake pero sin el elemento clave que serian las pilas de la linterna, por lo que al final asumo que el resto de enfrentamientos pierden la gracia al tener una luz infinita, por ende no podr√≠a decir que este juego fuera ni siquiera un thriller, ya que los momentos de terror se limitan a generar un poco de "tensi√≥n" para despu√©s quitarte esa atm√≥sfera o los enfrentamientos lamentables, que se sienten como si fueran un tramite y algo que se puso a la fuerza. En s√≠ntesis este juego ademas de bugeado, mas que hacerme sentir terror, fue un desperdicio de tiempo que encima esta mal optimizado.

column8:
[h1] Rese√±a: Blair Witch [/h1]

[h1] Resumen [/h1]
Blair Witch es un juego de terror psicol√≥gico en primera persona donde tomas el rol de un ex-polic√≠a llamado Ellis, quien se adentra en el oscuro bosque de Black Hills para buscar a un ni√±o desaparecido. Durante su traves√≠a, cuenta con la ayuda de su perro Bullet, quien lo gu√≠a y lo protege mientras explora el bosque, enfrent√°ndose a misteriosas y aterradoras entidades. El juego combina exploraci√≥n, acertijos y una narrativa que se desarrolla lentamente a lo largo del tiempo.

[h1] Gr√°ficos 8/10 [/h1]
Los gr√°ficos de Blair Witch son s√≥lidos, con un dise√±o detallado del bosque oscuro y sombr√≠o, que contribuye a la atm√≥sfera general del juego. Sin embargo, presenta problemas de optimizaci√≥n para altas resoluciones, lo que puede afectar la experiencia en algunas configuraciones. A pesar de esto, en resoluci√≥n 1080p el juego se ve bien y cumple con su objetivo de generar una sensaci√≥n de claustrofobia y desconcierto mientras exploras los entornos sombr√≠os.

[h1] Terror 7/10 [/h1]
Blair Witch no se basa tanto en el terror directo, sino en el suspenso y la tensi√≥n. El uso de efectos sonoros, la presencia de lo desconocido y la relaci√≥n con Bullet crean una sensaci√≥n constante de inquietud. Aunque hay momentos de sorpresa y apariciones de entidades, el terror est√° m√°s enfocado en el ambiente psicol√≥gico que en sustos repentinos. El ritmo del juego al principio puede hacer que algunos jugadores se desconecten, pero a medida que avanzas, el juego mejora y la atm√≥sfera se vuelve m√°s opresiva.

[h1] Conclusion 7.5/10 [/h1]
Blair Witch es un juego de terror psicol√≥gico con una atm√≥sfera tensa y una narrativa intrigante, apoyada por su fiel compa√±ero Bullet. Aunque tiene problemas de optimizaci√≥n en resoluciones m√°s altas y un comienzo algo lento, la experiencia mejora a medida que avanza. Su enfoque en el suspenso y no tanto en el terror directo lo hace destacar en ese aspecto. Si te gustan los juegos de misterio y suspenso, es una opci√≥n interesante para probar, pero no ofrece una gran rejugabilidad a mi parecer, solo para platinarlo.

column8:
As a Blair Witch Project fan, having seen it in the cinema as a kid (and part 2, and also I saw the more recent one), this game was welcome. For people who do not know about the movies it might be a confusing but interesting experience anyway. I'm not sure if I should recommend you watch the movies first or not. I think either way can work. But if you haven't seen them, the Blair Witch Project was a groundbreaking classic, but obviously highly niche and not to everyone's taste. The sequels were decent too as far as I can remember. This studio have a unique style that is narrative driven and heavy on special effects which was the perfect match for Blair Witch. They really captured how the movies felt, it definitely felt like being in one of them.

I won't spoiler it by commenting further, but it was definitely a worthwhile experience on sale; especially if you're a horror fan and definitely if you liked the Blair Witch movies. That said, I'm not sure how I would have reacted if it wasn't Blair Witch franchise.

column8:
4/10, gay walking simulator

This game is a fucking lost in the woods simulator, where 80% of the game is spent stumbling around in circles with little indication on what to do, and the game generates the terrain so that you constantly walk in fucking circles. There is nothing more frustrating than when you're trying to figure out what to do, exploring, and end up going to the same god damned place 10+ times times. It's a shame as the rest of the game, when I'm not wandering, is relatively enjoyable, the forest looks beautiful, and it keeps you feeling isolated. However I'm not going to play a walking simulator for the good parts.

this game is already short, and i feel like they try to extend the length by forcing you into 20 min sections where you have to walk around in circles, and lot of the game sound isnt mixed very well by the time i was done the game i had a massive headache and had to step away from my computer this is the only game to have done this to me.

It was really difficult to get this game to run. At first it wouldn't open at all, then it wouldn't work on my widescreen, and finally it only work in 1920x1080. Once I started playing though, I almost abandoned the game early in. The first 1-2 hours are pretty boring, very slow paced, and tedious. It does improve the further into the game you go however, and the final two chapters are pretty good and have some genuine spookiness to them.

I got this for $8 and that's about the right price.

It was really difficult to get this game to run. At first it wouldn't open at all, then it wouldn't work on my widescreen, and finally it only work in 1920x1080. Once I started playing though, I almost abandoned the game early in. The first 1-2 hours are pretty boring, very slow paced, and tedious. It does improve the further into the game you go however, and the final two chapters are pretty good and have some genuine spookiness to them.

I got this for $8 and that's about the right price.

column8: The reason I'm writing this review is that this game is only missing one element which is a continuation-aspect that sets interest into a more abstract niche. The game has unreal engine forest bug - but I can deal with that and the newer UHD spectacle bag although this is my machine more than the game (I prefer it to nvidia in an 'unpleasant to be around' sense). The films characteristically attract 'interest' which then bounces obscure or deep connections into abstract confinement. The dog tags your character finds don't quite do the same thing. All it really had to do was have the swirly-tree puzzle it seems to suggests allows the swirly-tree preciousness. It's not bad - irritating to me though. Chumps say thumbs!!

column8: Do you want to know how long you can run through a series of looping corridors with minor differences before you start to feel like you yourself are going through hell?  I don't know either, but I can tell you it's less than half the amount of time you spend doing it in this game's final chapter.  It's too bad, because it was ok up until the last third... not great, but it wasn't making me regret spending my time on it.  Basically it just steals from a million horror movies that all do their bits better, and The Blair Witch Project is honestly the movie I feel it steals from the least.

What ..... a .... Great Story.
Absolutely an awesome psychic horror story if you read the letters and listen to everything. 

But about the game:
The begin starts good until you stuck in the forest and also in a loop. But dont worry you need to use your dog and keep looking around everywhere and think about it when you back at the center of the loop look around and think which way did i missed.

Also the video tapes will help you or the phone.

This is not a horror survival game, you need to do your job to find the missing boy and looking for evidence.
But the memories/flashbacks of your character makes me psycho, everything changes in the wood and that is so weird and when you get deeper in the game how more it will be come.
Your dog is you pall and you need him to stay close agains that monster. Also that dog gave me flashbackes to my dog who i have to sleep because he was old, this is coming emotional in this game. The dog if your FRIEND!
And the Dark or fog in the forests makes it also scary and make me alert agains that creature... walking slow.. looking more around and use camera with night stand.

Overall the game got 3 ends, i had the bad 1 :(

I can only give a 10 for this game because of:

-Good story
-Great soundtrack, perfect combined with the locations where you walk or the moments when you are in danger.
-Great graphics and atmosphere in the Forest.
-And not boring, you need to keep pushing.

10+

column8:
So this will be mainly spoiler free assuming you watched the OG movie.  If not just know this game is very much as if you were playing in the movie.  With that lets dive into this shit.


First and foremost this game is basically a walking Horror Sim.  So think of like MYST but scary shit happens.  There is a ton of walking essentially in circles waiting for something to trigger so you can progress.

PROS:  Really good graphics (turn of motion blur as its kinda a bit much) 
What really shines in this game is the atmosphere created by the use of light (getting dark vision tunneling in etc)  but the music builds with crazy cresendos and its pretty crazy immersive.

Cons: I used a controller and the controls were pretty janky for the Bullet comands and inventory.  You hold say LB hit the thumbstick where you want and release the bumper.  If you release the stick it almost always does the wrong action.  Which is fine for the inventory but try punishing your dog when you meant to praise him type deal and that sucks.

The only other Con is the game gets really repetitive towards the end.  Like I figured out the story and the twist (for the most part) and it was kinda just me playing on stream for like 20-30 mins just to finish the game.

There are 2 endings and I got one of them. the other is a bit of a challenge.  

Overall: The game is pretty amazing for a first time play through I doubt I will ever play it again.  The controller support was a bit janky and KBM was kinda fucked.  What really makes this game is the use of found footage and just the level of Atmosphere created by visual and audio.  Honestly for what it is this game is a master piece GJ Bloober Team I look forward to more games in your catalogue.  I would say like 9/10 just the ending with the house after watching Blair With and the Remake just lasted a bit long in my opinion.

column8: If you prefer 9/10 of Blumhouse releases, but don't care for Ari Aster's style, this game is not for you. It's not loaded with jump scares (though there are plenty), and the game is more about gradually building atmosphere and tension than startling you. There are some bits near the end that feel drawn out and tedious, but overall I would not hesitate to recommend this game to fans of the genre.
column9: If you prefer 9/10 of Blumhouse releases, but don't care for Ari Aster's style, this game is not for you. column8: s

[i]A cursed woods awaits those brave enough to confront their worst‚Ä¶[/i]

[u]Blair Witch[/u] is an enjoyable adaptation of the classic found footage films of the same title. I have never seen the films despite loving the horror genre ‚Äì but then again you do not have to have seen them either. The game adaptation is based on the movie‚Äôs events and lore, but in the end, the game is its own self-contained plot. This entry is simple to play and offers a lot of rich stories to take part in. It also features a powerful emotional core ‚Äì your trusted buddy [i]Bullet[/i] ‚Äì that effortlessly keeps the player invested in the story‚Äôs development and outcome. Additionally, you are also treated to a video recorder that can manipulate reality. Investigating the different tapes you find to extract clues from them was immersive and fun. The camera also is required to navigate certain dangerous levels. These were tense moments that required stealth and offered new perspectives to keep the game progress unique and refreshing.

[i]We are being watched, stay close, Bullet![/i]

The story of [u]Blair Witch[/u] kicks off with our protagonist, Ellis, who joins a search party with the local Sheriff‚Äôs department to find Peter, a young boy who suddenly disappeared. As with most horror stories ‚Äì all is not what it seems. Ellis is a troubled man with good intentions. Past mistakes in the line of duty have plagued his psyche for years ‚Äì and finding this missing boy might be his last effort to make amends.

However, the forest is watching, and it wants to exploit Ellis‚Äô vulnerability for Evil. Luckily, Ellis is not alone. He has the best partner any man in his situation could have ‚Äì a dog! Bullet quickly steals the spotlight. He is at the front and center of Ellis‚Äô chance at redemption, and an overall emotional powerhouse that kept me invested in the story and its outcome. You have a lot of freedom with how you interact with Bullet, but be warned, your morality will be tested. Do not let desperation overcome.

[i]Stuck in a loop, will you break the cycle of violence, or surrender to your rage‚Ä¶[/i]

An interesting aspect of [u]Blair Witch[/u] that surprised me was its level design and layout. It tricks the player. The player explores semi-open areas as they hike deeper and deeper into the forest. At first, these areas seem frustratingly large and hard to decipher. The truth however is quite different and clever. You are stuck in an area loop until you complete a set of story-related tasks that allow you to progress into the next area. This made for an anxious and confusing walkthrough. Even when I knew my next move, there was an uncertain feeling I could not shake off. I never felt completely safe from the Witch's grasp.

This idea of a loop, or cycle, ‚Äì is present too in the game‚Äôs thematic storytelling. Ellis is a man seemingly stuck in a cycle of violence despite his best efforts to help others. There is also a deeper misdirection here. You are being watched, but your actions are also being manipulated. This game muddles your decision-making and very easily tricks you into an ending you might not have wished from the very beginning. If you care about this sort of stuff, make sure you're paying attention to what exactly is the purpose of the Blair Witch is and how you might be overlooking her influence.

As an aside, [u]Blair Witch[/u] also pays good attention to detail. The ‚Äòlooping‚Äô level design does not hinder this game‚Äôs ability to present us with interesting and unique set locations, and they are all not limited to just the forest either. I enjoyed all the documents you collect throughout the way as well ‚Äì they are relevant to the story, come from varied sources, provide interesting background, and are quick to read. Ellis also has a cellphone that is full with fun mini-game diversions, side quests, and curious achievements.

Fabu≈Ça gry jest klarowna i nie ma problemu z jej zrozumieniem. Mimo wszystko elementy nadprzyrodzone wydajƒÖ siƒô zbytnio przekoloryzowane i zbyt nierealne, a reakcja na nie g≈Ç√≥wnego bohatera jakby mo≈ºe nie tyle co by≈Çy naturalne jak nie by≈Çy mu obce sprawia ≈ºe najzwyczajniej po prostu nie czuje siƒô efektu zdziwienia czy zaskoczenia pojawiajƒÖcymi siƒô wydarzeniami o adekwatnym dla nich poziomie. 


[h1]Plusy:[/h1]
- Ciekawie zapowiadajƒÖca siƒô fabu≈Ça
- ≈Åadna, chocia≈º nie wybitna grafika
- Implementacja psiego towarzysza o bardzo oryginalnej mechanice i cechach kluczowych dla przebiegu fabu≈Çy
- Zastosowanie ciekawych mechanik rozgrywki jak na przyk≈Çad mo≈ºliwo≈õƒá jazdy drezynkƒÖ

[h1]Minusy:[/h1]
- Przesadzone elementy zwiƒÖzane z wydarzeniami paranormalnymi oraz zbyt naturalne reakcje na nie g≈Ç√≥wnego bohatera
- Krytyczne b≈Çƒôdy gry kt√≥re kilkakrotnie pojawi≈Çy siƒô podczas przechodzenia fabu≈Çy skutkujƒÖce wyrzucaniem gry do pulpitu niezwiƒÖzane z wydajno≈õciƒÖ podzespo≈Ç√≥w, poniewa≈º by≈Çy rozgrywane na sprzƒôcie o wysokiej wydajno≈õci
- Optymalizacja gry w przypadku wydajnego sprzƒôtu na stabilnym poziomie, jednak mo≈ºna by oczekiwaƒá lepszego jej dopracowania, tym bardziej ≈ºe na dobrym sprzƒôcie otrzymujemy "jedynie" pogranicze dobrej wydajno≈õci w postaci niewielu powy≈ºej 60 kl/s


[h1]Podsumowanie:[/h1]
Dla ka≈ºdego mi≈Ço≈õnika gier przygodowych jest to produkcja godna polecenia. Chocia≈º nie spos√≥b pominƒÖƒá jej wad, wy≈Çania siƒô obraz ciekawej mieszanki wielu gier przygodowych po≈ÇƒÖczonych ze ≈õwie≈ºymi mechanikami. W wielu miejscach pojawia siƒô odczucie powtarzalno≈õci, ale prze≈ÇamujƒÖ jƒÖ absorbujƒÖce posuniƒôcia fabularne. Nie spos√≥b wydaƒá tutaj innej oceny ni≈º pozytywna, jednak do idea≈Çu jeszcze du≈ºo brakuje.

[b][u]Moja ocena:[/u]

Jako≈õƒá grafiki: 8/10
D≈∫wiƒôki: 7/10
Optymalizacja: 8/10
Cena: 8/10

Ocena ko≈Ñcowa: 8/10

column8: Emotional train set for a quicksand hole you cant escape from. Lots of "what was that?" and "shhhh be quiet" and "cry your heart out". Easy playing game with rich story. Highly recommend for any type of player. Loved it!
column9: Emotional train set for a quicksand hole you cant escape from. Lots of "what was that?" and "shhhh be quiet" and "cry your heart out". Easy playing game with rich story. Highly recommend for any type of player. Loved it!

column8: Walking Sim with a couple of interesting mechanics/ideas but I feel like they missed an opportunity. The woods are lovely and creepy with superb sounds and atmosphere, the story is OK,but the game itself is dull. I got it on sale, and pleased I did as I'd have been disappointed otherwise.
column9: Walking Sim with a couple of interesting mechanics/ideas but I feel like they missed an opportunity. The woods are lovely and creepy with superb sounds and atmosphere, the story is OK,but the game itself is dull. I got it on sale, and pleased I did as I'd have been disappointed otherwise.

column8:
Une grande r√©ussite ! 
Ce jeu as parfaitement compris ce qui fait la particularit√© de la foret de Blair Witch, une foret hant√©e par une sorci√®re manipulatrice qui joue avec vos nerfs en permanence. Le jeu entier est donc con√ßu pour pi√©ger le joueur et l'ambiance est vraiment efficace.

I'm not good at reviews but will share with you my thoughts. :3 I'm a big horror game fan and will almost always play these kinds of games. Although I like this game, it's never perfect. It has both great points and imperfections. For this game, I'm not comparing it with other horror games, but judging it as itself: For the visual QUALITY rating, I would give it a 10/10 due to it's realism and immersive experience. 10/10 for the story. I thought it was great in a psychological sense and loved how some twists were thrown in as well. But I'm also going to give it only a 5/10 for its inconsistent camera motions and effects.....

The graphics were very nice and the woods felt realistic and dark. It was both original and interesting that we can have a dog companion that helps lead us through sections of the game. However, there were a lot of sections that made me dizzy and gave me a headache. This is not the game's fault, as I have some health issues that are triggered by this game. The game does warn us about these things at the very beginning though, so I'm not slamming the game in anyway for not warning us. My review is my own opinion on the game experience. Also, as I've said before, it would be inconsistent and could be smooth one minute and then make me feel uncomfortable the very next. Some scenes trick me in a way. I could start a chapter thinking it's playable and have to stop midway in middle of chapter. I felt like some parts were a bit too much. Especially the end chapters with looping and distortions. I almost threw up a few times and it wasn't just a minute or two event. It literally would last for 10 to 15 minutes...

Definitely recommend the game for MOST players. If you have sensitivity to sounds, lights, flashing, distortions, etc, do not, I repeat DO NOT play this game.

(this was edited with help my english only third language. please simple english in comments)

Played quite some horrorgames in the past and thought Blair Witch would be fun to try out. Oh boy, was I wrong.
Spoilers ahead.

The game itself feels like a walking-simulator through all kinds of spooky woods (Which are indeed very atmospheric and well designed just from the pure looks.) with random PTSD-flashbacks and random monsters attacking you once or twice in between.
Here begins the trap maker's art of the devs: One of the first instincts you have in a horrogame which takes place in very, very dark gloomy woods, is to whip out a flashlight that also kills monsters. You destroy the evil witch's totems and collect strange figurines along the way. After you have done all this you realise in the final chapter that you turned batshit crazy and kill everyone while your mental illness wrecks your brain because you killed all the monsters, destroyed her totems and picked up the fricking collectables the game shoves in your face.

As a matter of fact, the devs decided that this glorious ending should take place in a very special enviroment: You wander through an abandoned house in the woods. For. Fricking. Hours. 
I quit halfway through. This kind of gameplay is neither funny, nor entertaining, nor spooky or whatever the devs were thinking it was supposed to be.

I am mighty dissapointed in the game. If you want a mediocore spoopy game with occasional jumpscares and stereotypic "that one guy with the mental health issue went insane and killed everyone", buy it.
For everyone else: Be happy that you didn't waste your time on this one.

I don't know if maybe I didn't play it long enough or not, but this wasn't scary or fun at all. It's just walking around in the woods with PTSD flashbacks and shining a flashlight at Monsters. I didn't find it scary or appealing. 
I'm a sucker for spooky games, but this one just ain't it boss.

column8:
Overall I enjoyed the game.

The Good: Very atmospheric. The feeling of being lost in the woods is done very well. It is faithful to the feeling of the Blair Witch. The Dog Mechanic works well. Some of the locations, like the house at the end, look gorgeous.

The Bad: Sometimes there is not much player agency or gameplay, especially at the end of the game. It started to just feel like a scary theme park ride where you were on the rails with scares being thrown at you one after the other. The PTSD part of the story was overdone a little bit.

Still it is a good addition to the Blair Witch mythos and a high quality horror game.

OK SO! this game is like an adventure in the woods where you connect with your doggy and IMHO its rather slow start since it doesnt get spooky untill the last hour of the game but maybe thats just me, i also think the "puzzles" in this game are very poorly executed since they dont really tell you what to do so sometimes it feels a tad hopeless to even play but maybe thats the point i donno the ting go skrrrrrrrrra a pidipapapo.

nah but tbh its a good game and pretty well done,  not sure if i would recommend it tho

[h1] BLAIR WITCH - AN√ÅLISIS [/H1]

Una gran carta de amor por parte de Bloober Team al gran cl√°sico cinematogr√°fico del g√©nero de terror found footage estrenado en 1999. Han sabido crear una muy buena atm√≥sfera aderezada con unas pinceladas de conceptos jugables muy acertados. tanto para el tipo de juego que es, como para el universo donde cierne sus bases. Entramos de lleno en una historia de b√∫squeda, tanto literal como personal, en la que no faltar√°n buenas raciones de momentos para notar tu piel de gallina. Ojal√° que no os spoileen los truquitos que tiene el juego para ponerte un poco nervioso.

Agradezco de una manera infinita que para el desarrollo del t√≠tulo se haya optado por un mayor uso del terror psicol√≥gico, del que hac√≠a gala la obra original, frente a los cl√°sicos y manidos jumpscares. Esto le da much√≠sima personalidad y resulta muy interesante para quienes gustamos m√°s de este tipo de experiencias.

Para nuestra suerte no estaremos solos, ya que nos acompa√±a nuestro fiel perrete ayud√°ndonos a encontrar el camino, pistas y por qu√© no, la posibilidad de interactuar con √©l d√°ndole las gracias e incluso rega√±arlo. Este, entre otros, tambi√©n supone una pieza clave que desembocar√° en un final u otro dependiendo de nuestro comportamiento y acciones. Tambi√©n contaremos con un inventario (con el cual volver a ver items, releer notas recogidas...) y, para no desvelar sorpresas, varios objetos que nos ayudar√°n a comunicarnos e iluminar el camino. Para conocedores de la pel√≠cula, sab√©is de lo que hablo.

A nivel gr√°fico cumple pero sigue sin estar mejor optimizado a d√≠a de hoy. C√≥mo dije, al final el apartado art√≠stico ostenta un mayor escalaf√≥n, por lo que estaremos m√°s concentrados en las espesas y pesadas arboledas que nos rodean, y los diferentes sonidos que nos envuelven. La m√∫sica, por otro lado, cumple y es elegante, siendo el main theme una pieza magn√≠fica que casa a la perfecci√≥n con el t√≠tulo.

Bas√°ndose de igual forma en la obra original y la secuela estrenada en 2016, tampoco faltar√°n multitud de referencias y homenajes. Todos sabemos c√≥mo empieza y c√≥mo acaba. Y sabemos que la cinta original tiene un plano final que hiela la sangre. Y por supuesto, Bloober sabe esto y han utilizado el concepto de una manera super divertida, inteligente y terror√≠fica. 

Con un buen ritmo, es cierto que en alg√∫n momento concreto para seg√∫n qu√© jugadores puede tener fallas de cohesi√≥n o tempo, adem√°s de lo posiblemente aburrido de sus enemigos y mec√°nicas de lucha, pero consigue remontar de una manera tit√°nica en la √∫ltima hora, donde se pone toda la carne en el asador mostrando todas sus cartas. A nuestro protagonista, y a nosotros mismos.

Compra muy recomendada para fans de la pel√≠cula y amantes del g√©nero de terror en videojuegos que quieran una experiencia un tanto distinta y peculiar, sin distanciarse de las normas establecidas. Un plus importante es que lo terminas y queda claro que este equipo puede hacer, como m√≠nimo, un trabajo interesante con Silent Hill.

column8: me ha enganchado

[h1]Really great and scary game with a cool concept and good looking environments[/h1]

Really good game with an incredible atmosphere and environments. As someone whose favorite game is Alan Wake and who has a similar looking dog whom I go in to the forest at nights, this game was a perfect match.

I've had this game in my radar for over 2 years, but after reading some negativish reviews and being played so many games where the "mechanics" are basically watching micro cutscenes inside the gameplay, after pressing a "use" button and hearing that "it's a walking simulator, where you press a button every now and then" I didn't even bother to buy it with -50% discount and later on took it off from my wishlist.

For some reason a year later or so I stumbled upon it again in Steam and while having an urge to play some atmospheric single player game, I gave it a chance (I'm super picky about games and easilly refund most of them after 20 minutes of gameplay).

Pretty much during the opening cutscene I was already hooked, and after seeing that you can actually customize your dog's fur etc. to your liking before starting the game, I thought that was goddamn cool. The interacting with the dog was so satisfying and the game felt less scary when he was with you. You protect him and he protects you. Such a cool concept.

Really enjoyable game and spent around 6 hours finishing it. Now I do have one thing to complain about. I don't get why these atmospheric story driven games always have to put some boring sub-plots about the protagonist's personal life to make the game more interesting.
To be honest I couldn't give a fuck about the main character's ex-girlfriend and even less what happened to him in the army. Why can't it be about the forest, the witch, the missing kid that we're trying to rescue and the main character and his dog.
Honestly I felt that the relationship with the dog and me was way more interesting and that was what kept me going forward. I didn't care to know what happened in the army, I just cared about that the dog would survive. (to be honest I didn't even care about the kid. I just cared about the damn dog.)

The ending sequence in the house was unnecessary long. I was excited first going in there and 5-20 minutes would have been enough, but for some reason it felt like an hour or two. Way too long and repetitive.

Regards these few negative things I'd say it's totally worth the original price and I give it an 8/10.

[spoiler]Now I do feel happy that before the credits rolled I was informed that the dog survived and was rescued, but I would have wanted to actually see him in the end and being united with him.[/spoiler]https://store.steampowered.com/app/1092660/Blair_Witch/#

An incredible experience. Bloober Team are still the monarchs of punishment and self-hate. What makes their games so memorable, bar the outstanding visuals, is definitely their understanding of certain horror as everlasting guilt, self-hate and psychological pain. In this case, they built their own brand of horror and suffering with American pop culture and contemporary history. Just like In "The Medium", real history plays an indispensible part (US's in Blair Witch, Polish's in "The Medium"). It's amazing how ambitious and successful this company has become. Bloober games never fail to frighten me. They are definitely "auteur games", in the sense that there's definitely a specific way of understanding interpersonal relationships that permeate every single story and environment, no matter if it's 19th century painting, a cyberpunk dystopia or post-Irak PTSD, And I'm really glad to be able to experience and enjoy the sense of loss, dread, mourning, they convey so perfectly well. In the case of "Blair Witch", the whole scenery and the main concept are so huge that they had to get rid of some variety . I cannot but feel that "Observer" or both Layers of fear are more densely woven. In here the different layers and trauma are a bit, may I say shallow? Or not as surprising? But equally successful nonetheless. Besides, there's always a playful side to their horror stories, and that's what makes them enjoyable, despite being utterly terrifying. All in all, a very satisfying addition to the Bloober cannon..

The game is very cool with very nice mechanics for example the videotapes got also pretty nice graphics everything looked good. The best thing was obviously the dog and that you can actually pet him and give him treats. What was honestly bad was that there were some bugs that set you back some time nothing major but you sometimes got stuck and had to reload the game and it would set you back a few min or that you couldnt pick something up and wasted a lot of time looking around for other stuff even tho you found it already. Also the game doesnt have that much replay value imo you only got 2 different endings +2 additional ones where the dog just acts differently but they arent really that special honestly. I would max replay the game once. Its defintely a game worth playing tho just look for a sale otherwise its not really that worth it

column8: Bloober Team you guys are badass, best psychological horror game I've played so far. Grade 10

As per usual, the Bloober Team spun a really good story. Another strong aspect of the game was the beautiful environment you find yourself in. They didn‚Äôt pull any punches when it came to designing the forest. Of course, the forest was beautiful in the daylight, but really creepy when night fell. Their soundscape was on point. At times, it sounded like something was out there breaking sticks/stepping on leaves, and my whole body was tense waiting for something to pounce out at me. If you watched the original movie, you‚Äôll recognize some of the sounds, which added an extra layer to everything. Beyond that you also find those stick idols and see some extra creepy things in those woods. Needless to say, I liked the ways they incorporated and expanded upon the Blair Witch lore.

I loved their attention to the time setting as well. Your phone looks like an old Nokia, it can play Snake, you can choose to call whoever you want in your phonebook ‚Äì I ended up annoying the pizza guy‚Ä¶ The video camera speaks to the found-footage style of the original movie and you‚Äôll even find polaroids of the Witch‚Äôs victims throughout the forest.

On the other hand, I think the biggest short-coming is the shortness. $30 can seem a bit steep for only seven hours, but the game does have multiple endings, meaning you can play it a few more times and get a new experience out of it. I‚Äôm just not the type of player to go back and do that.

Another gameplay aspect that pulled me out of immersement was when Ellis got caught in ‚Äúloops‚Äù. For example, you fall into a small crevasse and walk and walk and walk and walk. As you do, words slowly, very slowly, take form on the walls. I could see the effect the Bloober Team was trying to achieve, but it just dragged on too long. It lost any effect on me. I wasn‚Äôt nervous or afraid or anxious. I was just waiting until it was over so I could get on with the story. This happens quite a few times in the process of the game and every time it was done to death, pulling me straight out of sense of unease into a sense of annoyance while I plodded through the levels, waiting to get to the next section of the story.

6/10

I hate to have only give this game a 6 since I was so looking forward to it, but I honestly liked >observer_ more. The story-line, graphics, attention to detail, and Bullet were amazing aspects of the game ‚Äì but the looping sections and shortness really hurt the experience for me. In short, the looping parts seemed like a cheap way to extend the amount of play time.

As you do, words slowly, very slowly, take form on the walls. I could see the effect the Bloober Team was trying to achieve, but it just dragged on too long. It lost any effect on me. I wasn‚Äôt nervous or afraid or anxious. I was just waiting until it was over so I could get on with the story. This happens quite a few times in the process of the game and every time it was done to death, pulling me straight out of sense of unease into a sense of annoyance while I plodded through the levels, waiting to get to the next section of the story.

6/10

I hate to have only give this game a 6 since I was so looking forward to it, but I honestly liked >observer_ more. The story-line, graphics, attention to detail, and Bullet were amazing aspects of the game ‚Äì but the looping sections and shortness really hurt the experience for me. In short, the looping parts seemed like a cheap way to extend the amount of play time.

column8:
Eines der besten Horrorgames der letzten Jahre. Und ich bin kein Fan der Filmreihe. Grafisch einfach super. So einen Sch√∂nen Wald habe ich zuvor in noch keinem Spiel gesehen. Auch atmosph√§risch ist das ganz gro√ües Kino. Die Mensch und Hund Beziehung ist auch ganz nett gemacht, auch wenn ich sie stellenweise etwas anstrengend finde.
Ein echter Leckerbissen f√ºr Horrorfans!

[h1]This guy needed to go to a mental institution not forest. This is what happens when you don't take your medication.[/h1] 

I personally am very picky for horror games, I either want it to be scary as hell with some nice gameplay like Silent Hill or have some really nice terrifying story like Fran Bow. I couldn't find neither in this game. I would rather prefer giving this a neutral rating.

Blair Witch is a horror game from Makers of Layers of Fear. I did not enjoy that game but I enjoyed Blair Witch a little more.
The game starts quite nicely and the story seems nice and in the beginning everything seems nice. I haven't watched the movie, i've tried but found it boring after 15 minutes so I don't know if this is related to the movie or any witch or something but i don't think it has any relation. It's quite similar to Layers of Fear (in both gameplay and the story) where you imagining things but for some reason they can kill you.

The story is about a man who's suffering from ptsd and can't forget the stuff he's done. So he starts hallucinating in the forest and the whole gameplay is walking through his hallucinations which doesn't make any sense.
The forest is scary but after couple of scares that feeling is completely gone. The character starts remembering more stuff from his past and hallucinations intensify. The forest is really boring. The game is linear but still has few paths to go, only if you take the wrong path you're start going in a loop and end up at the same place until you take the right path.

There are monster who can kill you and you kill them in the same way as in Alan Wake ‚Äì by shining a flashlight onto them. There's also camera which lets you see the monsters and trails. You can also watch tapes on it which sometimes is needed to shift the reality or maybe turn back the time so you could enter somewhere. You gather items, run, get tired after 20 meters, then walk slowly through same boring woods. So you get the items which are needed to either fix something or open something and move on to another section. While first half of the game was decent, the second half was tedious. Walking in loops over and over again for countless times while the story makes less and less sense. although the idea of the story is quite good but it was executed poorly.
Oh there's a dog. You can take care of him and ask him to get some items for you. He also supposed to show you the way where to go but that doesn't work, he only finds the obvious items. Still having a pet dog is always great.

It's not an action game, it's not a walking sim completely although you mostly walk but since there are puzzles and you can die it's kind of neither.
The main character is a cripple who can't move even light objects or climb over something. That wouldn't be an issue if the places you can't go would have some realistic obstacles which would make sense, not some branch or fallen door. I'm a cripple and i can move the damn doors or smash windows. And this guy is an ex soldier and a cop.

The game is very short although it felt too long. It took me a year to beat it, I just couldn't play for more than 30 minutes and uninstalled it several times until I decided to just finish it.

Save system is non existent, there are only autosaves so you can't end the game whenever you like and some sections may be quite long and tiring.

There are collectibles and multiple endings but no chapter select. It's so annoying because if you miss something you must replay the whole game which is very slow, especially boring when you know everything from the start.

Graphically it looks ok'ish. Some scenes are good but mostly it looks average. There's insane amount of blur all over the screen so you can't see anything and performance is terrible with fps dipping to 45 or lower at times. Runs even worse on max settings. Optimization is terrible. Played on 5800x, 2070s, 32gb @3440x1440. Ultrawide works out of the box.
Graphics options screen is constantly glitching. When you go there it asks to save changes, why? You click ok then it lets you to change the graphics.

Sound is what makes this game more scary. Sound design is great and it creates that creepy atmosphere. Like all horror games it has those extremely loud sounds scaring you sometimes but like I mentioned after and hour or so you get used to it and just want to go your way casually.

I guess it's a decent game for those who only play horror games and don't have high requirements but for me it was boring. The idea of the story is quite good but poorly executed and it would've been an awesome narrative horror game. I really did not enjoy this.

[b]Pros[/b]
[list]
[*]Creepy
[*]Dog
[*]Good sounds
[/list]

[b]Cons[/b]
[list]
[*]Terrible performance
[*]Average graphics
[*]Tedious and boring gameplay
[*]Illogical
[*]No manual save
[*]No chapter select
[/list]

column8:
[b] WOW. [/b] This game is my #1 favorite sleeper hit.. of all time. No kidding. I loved both Layers of Fear, though I haven't finished 2. I loved the design and detail in both. Observer was ambitious at the time, and you got to be Rutger mf'n Hauer. How cool is that? Then there was The Medium.. kinda janky for me but only because of my disability and mental illness, not because of poor design. I respect that they try new things. I originally posted Not Recommended for The Medium, but soon rescinded it because I love Bloober Team and I really want to see them be successful. They deserve it. 

This game is the spookiest and most fun to play Horror game for me since Outlast. I know, I know.. but I have played a lot of horror.. and I'm tellin' ya.. this game performs the hat trick deftly and confidently. Engrossing, Immersive, Gorgeously rendered in realistic detail, creepy AF.. I love it. I would have finished it in one sitting if my body hadn't collapsed from insomnia-induced hallucinations and malnutrition. But coupla winks and I was back at it.. red-eyed, knuckles white on the controller.. gaunt face illuminated only by the glowy 4k UHD wonder screen.. 

Wandered there for a sec.. seriously, if you like horror even a little, this is IT right here. A pleasantly surprised 10/10.

Blair Witch is definitely a mixed bag situation. 

pros!

it's got a lot of cool ideas (tapes, dog being a living objective pointer and threat detector) and little tidbits (e.g. the phone having a proper UI of a classic nokia brick phone).

using tapes in a camcorder to proceed to parts of puzzles and manipulate the environment is pretty dang cool, even if it's a bit limited and somewhat sparse.

the dog is pretty cool, and the game is pretty atmospheric!

cons!

a lot of the cool ideas presented aren't used enough or polished well.

some people have mentioned this but some of the kills during "combat" feel entirely accidental at points even if you're following cues

animation can be really stiff and weird looking, and i don't think the people responsible for the interaction have ever seen a dog, or any domesticated animal, given the dogs expressions showing intense stress while you shake his brains out when activating the "pet" prompt.

this review sucks thank you

column8: not really too engaging, nice ideas with the tapes but way too much walking in between. the most forgiving way to describe the "combat" encounters in this game would be odd in the sense that most of my kills were accidental. not much else here except for a moderately engaging story with some fun concepts that wraps up abruptly and forgets to even mention the motivating factor from the beginning of the game. the main factor contributing to the negative outcome is the odd design of the ending paths that beg the player to not interact with anything that is remotely interesting including the totems and the carvings resulting in an almost inevitable bad ending, which practically begs for a replay if it wasn't for the tedious walking portions and solutions to some puzzles. not insanely terrible or insulting to the player as the medium was, so that is a positive ig

column8: ‰∏∫‰ªÄ‰πàÂú®‰∏Ä‰∏™Âú∞Êñπ‰∏ÄÁõ¥Âá∫‰∏çÂéª

Grunds√§tzlich kann ich Blair Witch allen empfehlen, die auf leichten, atmosph√§rischen Horror ohne Jump Scares stehen.
Besonders gefallen haben mir die Grafik, Musik und Sounds und nat√ºrlich Bullet, unser tierischer Gef√§hrte. Zu Beginn des Spiel wirkt alles noch sehr harmlos, auch wenn diverse Konversationen unseres Protagonisten mit anderen Personen - wie Jess oder dem Sheriff - diskrete Hinweise darauf geben, was wir f√ºr ein Problem haben k√∂nnten. Und warum es keine gute Idee ist, bei der Suche nach dem vermissten Jungen zu helfen. St√ºck f√ºr St√ºck werden wir an die Thematik PTBS herangef√ºhrt und erfahren in Flashbacks mehr √ºber Ellis Vergangenheit, w√§hrend wir uns immer weiter im Wald verlieren.
Die Idee mit den realit√§tsver√§ndernden Tapes gefiel mir an sich sehr gut. Die h√§tten ruhig noch √∂fter Anwendung im Spiel finden k√∂nnen.

Ein bisschen zu kurz gekommen ist generell die Story, die mit der Blair Witch zusammenh√§ngt. Man trifft nur am Ende auf sie, sonst bekommt man hier und da Besuch von Wald- und Laubmonstern, die zugegebenerma√üen auf Dauer eher l√§stig statt gruselig sind. Auch einzelne Abschnitte f√ºhlten sich unendlich lang an [spoiler] - bspw. als wir Bullet durch die Schlucht tragen mussten, im vernebelten Wald den Monstern aus dem Weg gehen sollten oder so ziemlich der komplette letzte Abschnitt, der sich im Haus abspielte[/spoiler].
Je n√§her man dem Ende kam, umso repetitiver f√ºhlte es sich an, was mich im letzten Kapitel einfach nur noch nervte.

Und so sehr ich es begr√º√üe, Themen wie Angstzust√§nde, PTBS und Suizid in Spielen zu behandeln, so fand ich die Flashbacks, die auf Ellis Milit√§r- und Polizeidienst hinweisen, irgendwie sehr unpassend in diesem Genre. 

Zusammenfassend w√ºrde ich sagen, f√ºr Freunde des seichten Grusels mit Erkundungsdrang und Atmosph√§renfans kann ich dieses Spiel empfehlen. F√ºr alle, die auf harten Horror stehen und eher ungeduldige Spieler sind, nicht.

column8: I played the game only because in the last days I binge watched the two movies ( The Blair witch project, Blair ), those act as a introduction for the game, so more or less I knew what was happening during the gameplay, I played the game in one run just 4.5 hours I got the game with a huge discount, and I ended up paying 1 euro for every hour, and that's ok for me, overall though, I don't feel to recommend to others. you get a few jump scares but that's it. Don't get the game on it's own, I suggest, to whoever will read this review to do like me, go through the movies first and then play the game.

Que tiro foi esse veado? 

Vento batendo nas oreia, cachorro latindo por que viu demonio, objeto caindo e n√£o tem objeto, caminho sumindo, vozes e uma floresta que consegue prender e envolver o jogador mais acostumado com o terror. 
Como em Sillents hill teremos uma esp√©cie de mundo alternativo, n√£o t√£o amplo e nem t√£o complexo; pois esse mundo alternativo √© a mente conturbada de nosso personagem Ellis; Ellis √© um ex veterano de guerra que passou por muita atrocidades na guerra e para completar, teve uma trag√©dia em sua volta a vida normal. 

Nesse tempo que Ellis v√™ no desaparecimento de Peter a chance de retomar os dias de gl√≥ria a sua vida, mais √© ai que o inferno come√ßa e sua jornada ira tomar um rumo sem volta. 

Bruxa de Blair o game √© uma grata Surpresa do mundo do Horror, imagine voc√™ ver um game na E3 com data de lan√ßamento e na data de lan√ßamento ele lan√ßar e ser bom, sem Alardes e sem complica√ß√£o; anunciado e lan√ßado. 
Da para ver que a Bloober team veio forte e n√£o quis saber de brincadeira. 

O game √© muito bem feito, s√£o muitos detalhes valorizados e muita coisa levada em conta; exemplos que se destacam: 
_ Celular de Ellie- Podemos jogar o joguinho da Cobrinha ( antigo e cl√°ssico nos Nokia), ler SMS e fazer liga√ß√µes. 
_ As arvores rangindo e barulho de mata √© raro voc√™ ver repetido, parece que gravaram horas e horas o som da penumbra de alguma floresta, e isso aterroriza nos momentos que tem que andar pela mata. 
_ Forma do cachorro agir; ele rola pelo mapa e corre e fareja e age como um c√£o ( Diferente do game Call of duty ghosts que o c√£o √© um tijolo m√≥vel).

As refer√™ncias ao filme foram bem feitas e colocadas em game, al√©m da grande floresta; temos a casa da bruxa, a filmadora, lanterna e todo clima que os f√£s dos filmes conheceram. 

Outro ponto destaque √© a forma como a Linearidade do jogo ganha outra forma, √© comum voc√™ se prender por que esta perdido na mata ou por que n√£o encontro uma fita para assistir e saber o que fazer; e com isso voc√™ fica caminhando por longos tempos, n√£o acontece daquelas paredes invisiveis te trancar, voc√™ simplismente n√£o sabe para onde esta indo pois √© uma floresta e ela pode ou n√£o ter um fim naquela dire√ß√£o.

Bruxa de blair √© um √≥timo game de terror e com certeza merece ser jogado por f√£s de terror !!
Nele n√£o temos combate e a atmosfera vai fazer voc√™ tomar alguns sustos. 
Tem alguns bugs no jogo e isso tem em todos, mais aqui eles n√£o merecem destaque pois n√£o atrapalham a campanha e nem s√£o t√£o relevantes assim. 

>>>>>Ap√≥s zerar o game, jogue novamente at√© a entrada da Mina para usar o item novo e descobrir mais um trecho escondido da hist√≥ria <<<<
El juego mola.... hasta la √∫ltima hora m√°s o menos, que se vuelve insufrible..

column8:
Revising this to a thumbs up because I gave the game another shot. 

In regards to atmosphere, Blair Witch nails the idea of being stuck in the middle of no where. The feeling of being lost in the woods seems pretty accurate. I can honestly say there was many times where I found myself saying: "Where the fuck am I supposed to go?" or "What the fuck am I supposed to do now?" The game also has a certain degree of creepiness. There is something about being isolated and wandering around in the pitch black dead of night with a crappy flashlight.

In terms of gameplay, this is where I think the game has its biggest flaws. The combat, for example, is fucking shit. It's like a crappy version of the flashlight mechanic from Alan Wake. The enemies bolt around really fast and you find yourself spinning in circles like a fucking asshole before they kill you. It sucks and I don't think that it really has any place in the game. It felt strange because I don't really like many "walking simulators", but I think that this game would have been much better without the enemies. They added barely anything to the experience. 

Overall, I'd say that the game is relatively decent (except for the final chapter which is a load of shit and goes on for way too long). It's not perfect, it does have certain sections that feel a little repetitive (for example, the section where you need to clear cut trees from the tracks), but I'd say that it's worth playing through for someone looking for a time waster.

column8: This is how you make a survival horror game and write a fantastic chapter in the Blair Witch story. This will please found footage horror movie fans. If only the latest films were even half as good as this interactive game. Blair Witch movie fans should make sure this experience is played. It's foreboding, creepy as hell, and puts fear right in your path as you wander the forest inhabited by a supernatural force intent on driving you to shivers and madness. Not for the faint of heart, for sure. Scares are a mere few steps away at most points. Loved the dog, Bullet. Fantastic story telling and game play all in one.

column8: I love horror games, especially the types of games that blend their themes together to create a truly psychological experience. The Blair Witch at first appears to be 'just another survival horror game', but the themes slowly blend to create a truly epic ending. I found the camp a little ambiguous and frustrating at times as I tried to figure out what I had to do, but the way Ellis is tied to the plot of the Blair Witch knocked the game out of the park. There are some beautiful and haunting forest scenes in this game and graphically this game is a joy to look at. DEFINATELY wear headphones when playing this game too. You wont be disappointed by the sounds. At one point there was a very distinct voice that whispered directly into my ear that gave me all sorts of chills. I hated the Blair Witch movies, but this game is one of the best horror games I've played in years. Do yourself a favour and GET THIS GAME!!!

I recommend (most of) this game. Very fun take on the typical woods horror we're used to (there's even garbage collecting in addition to the usual page collecting!). The dog mechanic is helpful for immersion- you care about him regardless if you care about what happens to your character. The real problem is the last chapter of the game where [spoiler] it turns into yet another P.T. ripoff spitting in the face of everything it built so far. The worst of VR horror artifacts show up here, it's just like walking through a fun house where things pop up and go away. Nearly every scare/event is taken from a game you've already played or watched multiple times. [/spoiler]

Recommend on sale or in bundles, below $5.

column8:
The first few sections of this game are pretty badly designed which made me wander in circles aimlessly for way too long before finally stumbling upon how to progress and moving past it. These parts nearly made me lose interest in the game from the start however I'm glad I held on through them because the later sections of this game present you with an intriguing story, a fun environment to explore and an amazing atmosphere.

I think this game is definitely worth playing as even though the start feels like a complete drag, it definitely makes up for that if you persevere.
