column8:
To be honest, I do not recommend this game. It has some commendable parts, some nice detail, but ultimately fails at delivering a satisfying experience.

What I did like:
-The forest looked really realistic, nice textures, lighting
-The sound is really immersive
-Interacting with the doggy (petting him, following him, getting hints from him)
-The story really got me invested in the characters; I wanted to know what really happened
-Voice acting is good and well timed. 
-The puzzles with the camera were neat and novel.
-Cellphone was neat.

What I didn't like:
-Exploring felt pointless as finding photos and carvings are useless.
-Most of the time telling your dog to search does nothing.
-The ending was terrible and I have no idea why I got it. I called girlfriend. I pet the dog, saved it and didn't mistreat it. Why?
-The last part in the house was sooo tedious and repetitive, the scares mild and the whole experience just confusing and frustrating.
-Some interactions between the characters was cringe-inducingly bad. 
-Hardly any connection to the movie aside from the fact there's a forest, some twig totems, an old house and supposedly a witch.
-Left me feeling disturbed, confused, unsatisfied and disappointed.
-"Combat" is a little boring and frankly, not that scary at all.
-A lot of long, tedious segments that overstay their welcome. 

Why the bad ending though??? Bloober team that was just mean. :(
...and no I am NOT playing this game again.

column8:
This game felt like an authentic horror movie experience, complete with scary monsters, unexpected twists, and even some heart wrenching moments.  I was on edge the whole time playing this game, yet it was difficult to put it down. I felt myself thinking about the game and the story well past the time I was playing it, a testament to the fabulous story-telling and haunting moments of the game.  I recommend this game to any Blair Witch Project fans because it is very true to the lore of the series.  It explores themes from the movies (specifically the 2016 movie that the game is based off), while expanding them and further explaining how the forest and the witch control and engulf people.  

My only gripe is that you can get lost easily at certain sections because it is so dark. Some more dialogue from the character or Bullet leading the way could have helped point in the right direction.   

Loved every second of this one!

Blare Witch reminds me a lot of the cursed forest. I thoroughly enjoyed both the atmosphere and the environments of this game just as the cursed forest. One of the biggest complaints I have seen from other people is that this game does not follow the movie Blair Witch at all. To address this, I would like to first say that while this is accurate, it was not the purpose of this game to copy the movie Blair Witch in entirety. Instead, it was this games goal to use the movie as a guideline to create an entirely different, yet similar story. In relation to the movie Blare Witch, this game reminds me of the movie The Secret life of Walter Mitty. That movie was completely different than the book, however as in the game Blare Witch, the goal of that movie was not to copy the book, rather to reimagine some of the ideas in the book creating a new story from it. On another note, the navigation in this game is difficult. And this was another complaint from other reviewers. However, that is part of the challenge of the game, and the difficulty of navigating the environment is important for the story. If the navigation was as easy as just holding down W, as I believe some of these other reviewer‚Äôs desire, then 50% of the atmosphere of the game would be lost. So, I guess that is important to add, if you are looking for a game that you do not have to work for navigation wise, then this is not the game for you.  The user interface is relatively clean and simple to use so I have no complaints there. Overall, I would say that this game gets a B. While I did love the atmosphere and environmental design, I thought the story was lacking in some places. When playing the game, it is obvious that the developers want you to build a sympathetic connection with the main character, however, I did not feel any sympathy for the main character. And I believe the reason for this is poor story writing. Additionally, the game‚Äôs story has this fundamental premise that, if you stand up and fight against the witch and the other villain in the game, you are punished with the worst ending. But if you do not bother the witch and you remain obedient to the other villain in the game then you get the good ending. This is the aspect of this game that I disliked the most. I disliked the fact that rebellion or challenging authority, was met with severe punishment and obedience was met with reward. This overall idea that the storyline put forward left a bad taste in my mouth, as my personal motto is ‚Äústand up and question everything‚Äù, and I think overall, that greatly impacted my ability to connect with the main character. In summary, I would give this game an A for atmosphere and environmental design, A B+ for the user interface, and a C- for the overall story. Therefore, I would recommend this game to anyone looking for an atmospheric horror game, not necessarily a game that will scare them senseless or build a meaningful connection between the main character and the player.

[h1] "You see. Ellis? You do what you are told and everything is simple. Painless" [/h1]

[b] Lenda da Bruxa de Blair [/b]

A bruxa de Blair √© uma lenda de uma senhora idosa Elly Kedward que foi acusada de feiti√ßaria, e ap√≥s ser acusada, julgada, considera culpada, e evitada pelos moradores de Burkittsville, foi banida para a floresta Black Woods. Onde acreditam que ela foi executada. Seu corpo amarrado ao tronco de uma arvore e deixada para sucumbir aos elementos. 
O filme de terror lan√ßado no ano de 1999 e foi que definiu um g√™nero inteiro de filmes. o famoso Found Footage. Que s√£o filmes em que geralmente vemos o decorrer dele do ponto de vista do personagem gravando o que acontece como se fosse pra recorda√ß√£o pr√≥pria. ou o "Homemade".

[b] Ao jogo [/b]

Inspirado no folcore cinematogr√°fico de Blair Witch Project, O jogo conta a hist√≥ria de Ellis um ex-policial e veterano que conta com a ajuda de seu cachorro chamado bullet, se junta a um time de resgate devido o sumi√ßo de um garoto na floresta de Black Hills em Burkittsville, Maryland.

O jogo tem a explora√ß√£o como seu principal foco, intera√ß√£o com o cen√°rio e uma pitada de puzzles a maioria deles envolvendo fitas cassetes e voc√™ saber a que lugar ir. Um elemento crucial do gameplay √© o cachorro que te acompanha, Bullet. O jogador consegue interagir com seu cachorro por uma lista de comandos como, "Stay", "Stay close", "Reprimand", "Pet" e "Seek". E em diversas parte do jogo Bullet te ajuda farejando certas coisas, buscando outras e at√© mesmo te ajudando a chegar at√© o seu objetivo. Vendo que estamos falando de uma busca no meio da floresta. Ou seja voc√™ n√£o possui nenhum mapa ou qualquer ferramente de navega√ß√£o pra te guiar a onde ir.

Outro ponto que √© dito como importante por√©m que eu n√£o vi muita pesar no personagem √© o nivel de sanidade. √â dito que a sanidade √© um ponto importante tamb√©m entretanto √© algo que eu n√£o cheguei nem a sentir. √â claro que em determinados pontos da hist√≥ria seguindo o roteiro sim o personagem passa por isso porem em explora√ß√£o ou fora de "cutscenes" n√£o. Lembrando de como era toda o peso que isso trazia no personagem em Amnesia acho que foi uma fun√ß√£o n√£o muito explorada.

Entretanto, Apesar de eu ter gostado muito do jogo creio que alguns pontos eu devo mencionar pois achei que se arrastaram um pouco. O decorrer do jogo at√© o final √© tudo certo, a explora√ß√£o a intera√ß√£o com o Bullet. Tudo muito lindo. Por√©m perto do final do jogo ao chegar ali nos 1h restante ou 30 min restante o jogo se arrasta demais, em um cen√°rio onde vc anda e anda e anda e anda e anda por de novo 30 minutos a 1 hora e s√≥ a mesma coisa acontece... foi uma das partes desgastantes do jogo, a √∫nica, porem foi...

Ele tem uma dura√ß√£o bem baixa tamb√©m, na minha primeira gameplay demorei 5 horas e pouco pra terminar.

Fora isso creio que o jogo consegue passar bem o sentimento de terror psicol√≥gico. Fazia tempinho que eu n√£o jogava nenhum jogo de terror, mendo sendo f√£ do g√™nero, ent√£o pra mim foi bem aterrorizante.

Well, for me this game is really disappointing, its not scary at all, the story is completely nonsense and short, game design in general is pretty bad(especially in navigation), and the worst, it does not have NOTHING to do with Blair Witch.
The game starts pretty nice, can get you really hooked, but all that really starts to fall apart, specially on the end, the ending is really Awful, made me really think "why i am losing time playing this", when you reach the house(no spoilers)you start to basically walk in the same place over and over and over again, it was so dumb and boring, i just kept playing cause i knew that i was close to end, other else i would stop playing.

When this was announced i had high hopes, almost pre ordered, but now that i ended it im glad i didn't.

It is really impressive that this game have so many positive reviews.

Honestly, maybe if you REALLY like walking simulators this worth buying on sale, if not just stay away.

column8: A Bruxa de Blair, vive na floresta de Burkittsville em Maryland a mais de 200 anos. Quando ela precisa de algo, ela invoca. Sua magia causa confus√£o mental, ilus√µes e at√© possess√µes. A Bruxa, mant√©m a floresta protegida com um encanto que cria labirintos, evoca criaturas, por√©m fica mais fraca com a luz. Ela possui alguns fi√©is que vivem na floresta ou nas proximidades, eles obedecem ordens e at√© fazem sacrif√≠cios sob o comando dela. Eles parecem estar sobre o encanto de alguma magia. O que √© real e o que n√£o √©? Quando os EUA ainda era uma colonia da Inglaterra a regi√£o se chamava Blair, e haviam relatos de moradores da regi√£o dizendo que haviam visto uma velha nua a noite. Houve relato de madereiros dizendo que tamb√©m avistaram uma idosa nua cujos os p√©s n√£o tocavam o rio. Depois disso, varias crian√ßas ficaram desaparecidas e com rastros at√© a floresta. Grupos de busca foram enviados, encontrando marcas de runas, gravetos amarrados parecendo bonecos e esculturas em madeira. Realmente encontraram uma idosa cujo o nome era Elly Kedward, a mesma foi enforcada em 1880 como uma Bruxa. A floresta foi abandonada e mantida como assombrada. Ap√≥s isso, pessoas continuaram desaparecendo na floresta, entre alguns casos, houve um de maior destaque, onde foram encontrados 5 madeireiros mortos de forma ritual√≠stica. Nos anos 90, 7 crian√ßas ficaram desaparecidas no mesmo local e uma for√ßa tarefa policial foi feita, encontrando um homem, de aproximadamente 40 anos vivendo na floresta. O cujo dizia que o esp√≠rito de Elly Kedward, (a bruxa enforcada no s√©culo XVIII)  aterrorizava-o e prometera deix√°-lo em paz caso sacrificasse as crian√ßas. O homem foi acusado pela morte das crian√ßas e sentenciado com insanidade. Desde ent√£o, a velha lenda da Bruxa de Blair voltou a tona.

This game was a really good length for how many scares are in the game. The small game mechanics make it feel really immersive in every action. There are parts of this game that are psychologically tough and some go on for a while so those points had my anxiety up pretty high. Overall I loved this game and wouldn't give it more than one playthrough but would recommend it to any horror or Blair Witch fan.

column8:
I feel terrible about giving this game a negative review, but it couldn't be a positive one either. I find it VERY much like the 2016 Blair Witch (the modern film), which is bad because that one doesn't live up to the original 1999 film at all. That's exactly what I noticed: it didn't live up to the original film.

The setting is very good, it draws you into the woods, but it falls apart when it becomes a forced walking simulator and the parts dealing with Ellis's personal life begin. The different endings add some replayability, but in the end, you're playing more of a personal horror story than a horror story set in Blair Witch.

Blair Witch 

Wer gerne allein im Wald sein m√∂chte, ob Tag oder Nacht und dabei komische Ger√§usche nicht gleich im Panik verfallen wird f√ºr dem Spiel interessant.
Die Geschichte √§hnelt aus der Horrorfilmserie von ‚ÄûBlair Witch‚Äú 
Ein Junge wird vermisst und ihr wollt helfen.
Mit eurem treuen Hund geht ihr auf die Suche nach dem Jungen.
Dabei geschehen im Wald komische Sachen und ihr findet ein Cam-recorder der euch mit Hinweisen weiterhilft.
Ihr solltet im Spiel nach jedem Hinweise nachgehen da es entscheidet ist, wie das Ende wird.
Als kleiner Tipp: Die Fotos von den einzelnen Personen m√ºsst ihr alle finden.
Zum Schluss steht ihr vor einem Tisch wo alle Fotos h√§ngen und da fehlt eins, wird das Ende leider nicht gut ausgehen.
Ich selbst hatte 3 verschiedenen Ende es soll laut ‚Äûgoogle‚Äú 4 geben.

column8: Genuinely a good game, a little repetitive towards the end of the game but I believe this is used to build suspense. I ran into 2 bugs that caused me to have to reload a previous save but nothing game breaking. One common bug I found was that I was getting physically stuck on some of the assets in the woods, simply crouching and doing a 360 seemed to fix it every time but did break the immersion into the game. Overall I would recommend this to a friend 8.5/10.

column8: there's a great blair witch game waiting to be made, but this isn't it. instead you get a trite psychological thriller slapped onto what's essentially walking sim. the two main puzzle mechanics (your dog and the video tapes) aren't used nearly enough. wandering through the woods (the graphics are admittedly great) loses 's creepiness once you realize you're basically on a staight or nearly straight path. ellis's back story is predictable and so cliche it's difficutl to really indentify with, since it feels so contrived. it's so familiar that it detracts from the unique horror of the blair witch franchise, which capitalizes on the unknown of the wilderness.  seeing middle eastern highway signs blended with the trees, as ellis's mind blends his past and present, just doesn't feel on brand for blair witch.  overall, a disappointement.

Ich fand das Spiel anf√§nglich etwas schleppend. Vor allem da man teilweise nicht wusste wohin man gehen muss, man hatte immer das Gef√ºhl verloren zu sein. Dies trug jedoch auch zur beklemmenden Stimmung bei.
Mit der Zeit nahm die Story jedoch Fahrt auf und bald war ich mittendrin in Elli`s Alptraum.

Far from perfect, Blair Witch is probably best described as a "psychological horror walking simulator." Will take roughly 6 hours the first time to beat it (much of that time just wandering and being lost if we're being fair), much shorter playtime to get the other ending and see a few bonus scenes. Game is a bit buggy but overall I found it entertaining, and a fun story that expands on the movie lore. Pick it up when it's on sale, otherwise probably only get if you're super into walking sims or the Blair Witch series.

IF YOUR A FAN OF HORROR THEN THIS IS FOR YOU!

Ill try keep it short.

This game is probably the finest horror game ive ever played and ive pretty much tried them all. Its more story than action packed and you cant really make a wrong turn but decisions change the course of the game. I was sceptical about this title as the film is a favourite of mine and the mood and authenticity was something i really didn't want to tarnish. I also waited for the correct opportunity to play as i wanted to finish it in no more than 2 sittings to stay locked in . The Forrest is haunting from the get go and other than a few circles (Which added to the tension) is a stunning environment to just look around. The plot is thick and rich with unsettling story and really makes you uncomfortable at times.

Its a gem of a game if what your after is a slow paced story whilst sat with a glass of red in your pyjamas. Oh and its freaking scary aswell.

A very good game with a strong narrative and a genuinely creepy atmosphere. I thought it was very reminiscent of Hellblade: Senua's Sacrifice, with its mental illness/PTSD part of the story.

The gameplay is simplistic, and involves you just walking around exploring and solving some puzzles. For the most part this is fine, but I though the final part of the game dragged on for way too long. 

Overall, it is definitely worth a play through if you can get at a discount or as part of a bundle.

column8: As beautiful as the graphics are, and as compelling as the story can be, I can't recommend a game riddled with glitches. Sometimes controls won't work, or you'll do something out of order, and then you're stuck and have to load from the last save, which means the last autosave checkpoint you reached, so you can't even save frequently on your own to combat this. Being stuck rewatching cut scenes and wandering the same area over and over really kills the horror vibe the game is going for. My experience was less scary and more irritating.

column8:
First of all, this game was not really what I was expecting. It felt like an Outlast sequel, but the psychological aspects of the game were a bit surprising and completely took over the end game. I can't say it wasn't interesting, but there were times when holding shift to sprint wasn't going fast enough.

The first half of the game was extremely enjoyable, discovering things, interacting with objects (which is very easy and intuitive), same with the inventory. Then they introduced this video recorder mechanic where the action on the tapes controls reality, which I found super cool and I wish there was more of that throughout the game.

And then the second half hit, where you basically lose control of your character and all that's left is follow a story. It's walking in circles that doesn't require focus anymore. I don't say it's not immersive, but if I would've stopped playing, I don't think I would've booted the game again and just settled without finishing it.

It's hard to go into details of what felt good and what felt bad without spoiling it for the others. 
Overall, BlairWitch is enjoyable and once started, it can keep you hooked until the end.
It has some nice mechanics which would make me play some DLCs.
I personally won't play it again, just knowing there are some quite lengthy and boring parts at the end that can't be skipped.

It's pretty much like the tower of Pisa. Go there, see it with your own eyes once, move on.

It was an absolutely AMAZING game. However I felt the story was incredibly hard to follow and understand. I finished the game with hundreds of questions left unanswered. For example, who is "she" that Ellis and the Carver refer to? Was Ellis an ex military veteran with harsh PTSD? Did Ellis actually accidentally shoot the kid coming out of the convenience store? So where was Bullet during the whole ending scene when he was actually alive, presumed dead by the Carver? Was Ellis hearing his own voice inside his head the whole time, as depicted in the one scene where Ellis told himself to turn on the headlights as instructed to do in the beginning of the game? I have many more questions to talk about that I feel were not covered. However, the psychological aspect to it was phenomenal and the graphics were fantastic. Overall, I would give it a solid 9/10 but I really need more story knowledge for it to maintain that ranking. I will most likely watch youtube and search around for more details on the story.

Pretty good portrayal of the Blair witch series over all...game looks good and feels good mechanically, a definite uneasy feeling is real throughout the entire game. I do want to note that this game is very heavy and the developers even warn you b4 you start playing that this game is very heavy and has a great deal of portraying PTSD, I would hope that if you are a war vet and suffer from PTSD that you do not play this game as it could be very triggering and having beat the game I can say it certainly will not help you or make you feel good at best....for horror fans and Blair witch fans, great game, but definitely do not recommend for anyone dealing with psychological issues or PTSD...

column8: Un juego correcto, su fuerte como ya se espera es la historia de fondo, la ambientaci√≥n tanto sonora como visual esta bastante bien, pero personalmente hubieron dos puntos que me desconectaron bastante. Primero las partes de bosque donde tienes que buscar algo, no s√© si ser√© yo (es posible), pero perderse y dar vueltas sin saber que hacer o a donde ir se vuelve despu√©s de unos minutos bastante tedioso, se hecha en falta algo que te muestre que objetivo debes llevar a cabo o un mapa o br√∫jula que permita orientarte y no dar vueltas sin ton ni son. El otro punto es la ultima parte de la casa...estaba genial, pero me pareci√≥ larga en exceso y pas√≥ de tenerme en tensi√≥n a llevarme un poco al cansancio por lo repetitivo que se vuelve, eso hace que te canses y quieras que acabe ya. Salvo esos dos puntos un juego bastante interesante.
je le recommande fortement excellent jeu d'horreur j'ai ador√©

[h2](K)ein Waldspaziergang[/h2]
Ein Ermittler, der von seiner Vergangenheit heimgesucht wird, ein vermisster Junge und ein tiefer Wald, in dem etwas nicht mit rechten Dingen zuzugehen scheint. Was soll da blo√ü schief gehen?

Maryland, 1996 - wir schl√ºpfen in die Haut des ehemaligen Polizisten Ellis, der sich, begleitet von seinem treuen Hund Bullet, an der Suche nach einem vermissten Kind beteiligt. Was in seiner Vergangenheit passiert ist, warum ihm der Fall so wichtig ist und weshalb die Sache vielleicht doch keine so gute Idee war, das versucht uns Blair Witch w√§hrend seiner etwa sechs Stunden Spielzeit zu vermitteln. 
Wie von Entwickler Bloober Team gewohnt findet unser Abenteuer inszenatorisch wieder auf einem hohen Level statt. Aufgrund der nat√ºrlichen Eigenschaften eines Waldes wird es dieses Mal aber etwas weitl√§ufiger als zum Beispiel im Cyberpunk-Krimi Observer.

Diesen Freiraum nutzen die Entwickler unter anderem f√ºr eine gr√∂√üere R√§tselsequenz, au√üerdem gibt es recht viele Gespr√§che via Telefon und Funkger√§t. Wer durch die Pfadfinderausbildung gerasselt ist kann dabei auch mal Gefahr laufen sich zu verirren, doch in den meisten F√§llen zeigen subtile Hinweise doch recht zuverl√§ssig den Weg an. Sonst kann auch Hund Bullet gelegentlich helfen, dem wir einige Befehle geben k√∂nnen, etwa nach Spuren zu schn√ºffeln. Alles in allem ist der aber als narratives Element wichtiger als in spielmechanischer Hinsicht. Trotzdem ist es beruhigend, ihn in den dunkleren Momenten der Geschichte an unserer Seite zu wissen.

Von denen gibt es nat√ºrlich eine ganze Menge, schlie√ülich wird Blair Witch als psychologisches Horroradventure gelistet. Gerade in den letzten Stunden wird das Spiel geradliniger und n√§hert sich dem Stil der bisherigen Spiele von Bloober an. Generell schafft es Blair Witch durch kreative, √ºberraschende Elemente immer wieder, erinnerungsw√ºrdige und intensive Momente zu erschaffen, in denen das Spiel quasi mit dem Spieler spielt. In der allerh√∂chsten Gruselklasse bewegt sich das Adventure aber dennoch meistens eher nicht, was unter anderem am sch√ºtzenden tierischen Begleiter, den zu manchen Teilen etwas billigen Jumpscares und den recht schnell deutlich werdenden inneren Konflikten des Protagonisten liegen mag, die sich in der Spielwelt manifestieren. Ich sehe Blair Witch eher als Mysteryspiel, das mich in manchen Teilen an ein The Vanishing of Ethan Carter und Alan Wake erinnert hat - aber mit etwas deutlicherem Horroreinschlag.

[b]Da baut sich etwas auf[/b]
Diese Review klingt bisher vielleicht eher verhalten, aber wenn man nicht mit der Erwartung herangeht, gleich das gruseligste Horrorspiel des letzten Jahrtausends zu erleben, kann Blair Witch dennoch jede Menge Potenzial entfalten. Das Pacing zwischen stressigen Situationen und Verschnaufspausen stimmt meistens und sorgt zum einen daf√ºr, dass erstere nicht zu sehr an Wirkung verlieren, zum anderen bleibt aber auch genug Zeit, um die pers√∂nliche Story von Ellis und die Wirren des Mysteriums in diesem geheimnisvollen Wald weiterzutreiben.

Dank der gekonnten Inszenierung und einer oberfl√§chlichen aber coolen Mechanik, durch die wir Dinge in der Spielrealit√§t durch Vor- und Zur√ºckspulen eines Videotapes ver√§ndern k√∂nnen, l√§sst das Spiel Raum- und Zeitlinien verschwimmen. Blair Witch gelingt dabei meinem Gef√ºhl nach die richtige Dosis an Verwirrung, ohne zu sehr ins Absurde abzudriften oder den Spieler zu verlieren. 
Die Handlung bleibt so trotz der stetig gr√∂√üer werdenden Zahl an Fragezeichen bodenst√§ndig genug und schafft es dank teils klassischen, teils aber auch sehr frischen Kniffen, die √ºbernat√ºrlichen Elemente und psychischen Herausforderungen, mit denen Ellis zu k√§mpfen hat, f√ºhlbar zu machen.

Technisch kann das Spiel gerade in den dunkleren und nebligen Sequenzen und in den Innenr√§umen gl√§nzen. Auch tags√ºber wirkt der Wald grunds√§tzlich stimmig und glaubhaft, mir hat die sehr pr√§sent eingesetzte Tiefensch√§rfe aber nicht gefallen. 
Au√üerdem wirken die Animationen und die Wegfindung von Hund Bullet manchmal etwas hakelig. Alles in allem macht Blair Witch technisch aber einen soliden Eindruck. Auch die englische Synchronisation ist gut gelungen und wird zudem zumindest √ºber Kopfh√∂rer durch gelungen eingesetzte Raumklang-Effekte erg√§nzt.

[i]Pers√∂nliches Rating:[/i] [b]79[/b]/100

[i]Fazit:[/i]
[h3]Blair Witch geh√∂rt vielleicht nicht zu den gruseligsten Spielen der letzten Jahre, doch schafft es auf der Storyseite kontinuierlich, ein spannendes Mysterium aufzubauen und den Spieler mit oberfl√§chigen, aber gut umgesetzten Mechaniken die Wirren und die Gef√ºhlswelt des Protagonisten zu vermitteln.[/h3]

[i]Wenn dir mein Review gefallen hat, freue ich mich √ºber eine Bewertung.[/i]

column8:
‚ÄúI see why you like this video camera so much... It's not quite reality. It's like a totally filtered reality. It's like you can pretend everything's not quite the way it is.‚Äù

Every once in a while, one of those horror games comes along that gets mythologized as a harrowing experience best left alone by anyone without a taste for relentless, oppressive fear.
queue Blair Witch intro music.
Perhaps it's that I had no initial expectations or it's that I came into this game after playing a series of "Early-Access" titles, but the quality amazed me!
Not only in it's graphics, but in it's clever story-telling and tonal changes as your sanity slips deeper into the woods.
"Boy lost in the Woods" is a simple enough hook, although, our own mental instability, and personal flaws all driven by a morose desperation really add depth to our protagonist.
Blair Witch had so many opportunities where  it could have been lazy, or settled for simple. I can't voice enough appreciation for the detailed reverence they kept for the original Blair Witch 1999 film.

The "Filtered Realities" of the Video Camera were easily my favorite sections of the game. Puzzles hidden in the red tapes... brilliant.

Thank you Bullet.

column8:
The graphics:
First off the ok at best, not the best looking game, feels like a game that came out in 2015 graphics good. Although the light rays and where it does land is by far the best part of the graphics. I also do like the art style for the menu. trying to make it look like aselection creeen of a camecorter. along with that fikm grain from a 90s camra. Also my FPS tanks like crazy. I go from 135FPS durring the cutscenes and drops down to 25-30 FPS durring gameplay. Also I find the game weardly blury. Even with motion blur off and resetting my graphics to medim, its just blury as hell. Setting the graphics to average does boost the FPS but the graphics doesnt change a whole lot.
The game:
I do like the small stuff you can do in the game. like go threw the guys phone, play games, go threw his texts, call people. Also love bullet the dog idea where you can customize how he looks. dispite, having a pathedically small choice of options.  But so for it looks promising for the command feature for the dog. where you can command him and help you out durring gameplay. also the way you treat him effects the outcome of the game.
OMG I LOVED fighting the monsters with bullet! So their are sections where you need to fend off monsters in the forrest and bullet will bark and growel at them, and if you shine your light at them they disippear. Its a very tence moments and having bullet with you is a huge help

The story:
 So this is ment to take place after the events of the first movie in an unspecified ammount of time. Another child has gone missing. And your their with your dog to help search for him, and your a vet that needs to take his pills after that incident no one  talks about. Very fucking cheesey. Honesty it has to do more with the main character finding a serial killer who took a child, than the blair witch.

My random verdict:
It's an okay game inless you really love the blair witch. and even then its still meh. also theiur are about 6 different endings. I got the bad ending

Die ganz gro√üe Outlast-Anspannung bleibt hier aus, daf√ºr ist ein au√üerordentlich bedr√ºckendes Erlebnis entstanden, selten hat sich spielgewollte Orientierungslosigkeit und Isolation so authentisch angef√ºhlt. Dass die Regie es mit der L√§nge bestimmter Frustabschnitte √ºbertreibt, ist dem Wahnsinn tats√§chlich zutr√§glich; nach halbst√ºndigem Im-Kreis-Laufen und zehn mal wiederholten Halluzinationen stellt sich bald echte Verzweiflung ein. H√§tte man blo√ü auf die typischen Astmonster und l√§cherlichen Laub-Blobs verzichtet und uneindeutigere Gegner erdacht, h√§tte Blair Witch nachhaltig ver√§ngstigen k√∂nnen; wahrscheinlich muss man es dem Layers-of-Fear-Team anrechnen, dass sie √ºberhaupt Gegner eingebaut haben.
Die Probleme des Waldes im Videospiel bleiben trotz der pittoresken Route bestehen; manche √Ñste lassen sich √ºberklettern, andere markieren das Ende der Karte, im Dunkeln sind diese Abgrenzungen noch schwerer zu erkennen.
Die eing√§ngliche Warnung, Ellis' Handlungen w√ºrden beobachtet und das Spielende beeinflussen, kann man getrost ignorieren, braucht es doch einige spa√ülose Anstrengung um den positiven (und dabei nicht merklich positiveren) Ausgang zu erreichen. In der letzten Spielstunde im Blair Witch House schleichen wir wieder auf ganz bekannten LoF-Pfaden, das hei√üt, viel Freude an den visuellen Einf√§llen, aber wenig (An)Spannung. Gelungen ist wiederum, dass die Geschichte trotz vollkommen anderer Struktur und Narration den originalen Blair-Witch-Project-Geist so pr√§zise einf√§ngt und ein kleines Restmysterium um die W√§lder Marylands bewahrt.

As a fan of horror, including the Blair Witch franchise, this game does not disappoint as an added story to the collection. Play through was rather seamless and cinematic scenes were superb. It provided many challenges that did not get repetitive unlike those in Evil Within. It also feels as if Blair Witch took note from P.T. for their final chapter which was a pleasant surprise. 

I have only minor complaints for this game. First, the inconsistency of your dog in game versus cinematic scenes. The cinematic scenes depict the default color combos, which is fine if you kept the originally intended color palette. However, as someone who loves customizable content, there is a disconnect in empathy towards the dog depicted in the cinematic scenes since you spend most of your bonding time with the game play version. Suggestion would be to either remove the option entirely, or spend time making cut scenes for each customizable option. Second would be the replay value. As is often the pitfall of story driven games, such as the likes of Until Dawn, Heavy Rain, Beyond Two Souls, Murdered: Soul Suspect etc., unless someone were a completionist, I feel most would play this game once (maybe twice some time later if they really enjoyed the story). Please note, however, these are incredibly minor drawbacks.

Overall, this has been an extremely pleasurable game that I was able to complete from download to end of game in one sitting. It is a psychological horror game at its finest and I would highly recommend playing it at least once.

column8: Top!!

Pretty solid game if you have a few hours to kill. The story was decent however felt a bit short with the ending not really doing that much. The game overall has a few really solid moments and a couple of good jump scares but lacked in overall atmosphere due to either a part being dragged out for too long, being repetitive or the game just straight up bugging and having to reload the chapter. Like I said it's a pretty solid game but I'm glad I got this in a sale and not at full price.

column8: I think this is a great game, unfortunately I did run into a few bugs that halted my progress I also found the way in which the game saved cumbersome. Despite these setbacks I think the game captured the feeling of the movies perfectly and made me care about the core companion Bullet. I think anyone who hasn't seen the movie will still like this game, as it stands as a great horror experience.

column8: great game!

Ok, it's a great game BUT...

The developers should have at least given the players information of what effigies and totems do, should you break or leave them and such, should you decide to become aggressive, you will have a negative ending, should you become Passive, you will have a positive ending and so forth, but NO, no Direction, all that was explained was the way you treat your dog will determine his outcome, NOTHING ABOUT YOUR CHARACTER. Throughout my gameplay i defended my dog with my life, in the end i walked with him in my arms, i didn't neglect him, he survived and that's all that mattered to me.

I was utterly disgusted with the end because nothing was explained to me of the consequinces of destroying effigies and totems, murdering people in Ellis's broken beyond repair PTSD. (LOGICALLY He wouldn't be allowed to volunteer or even participate in such government business as he would be a liability, As we saw from the game! BUT i digress, this is a GAME)

The game isn't SCARY, it's more disturbing and disorientating than actual jumpscares & your common horror gameplay, it's a deep psychological & immersive story, but unfortunately online guides will be required to achieve the ending you wish to see.

I felt destroying the things that upset Bullet would give a positive outcome, sadly i was wrong. 

My dog lived, i call that a Victory.
column9:
Ok, it's a great game BUT...

The developers should have at least given the players information of what effigies and totems do, should you break or leave them and such, should you decide to become aggressive, you will have a negative ending, should you become Passive, you will have a positive ending and so forth, but NO, no Direction, all that was explained was the way you treat your dog will determine his outcome, NOTHING ABOUT YOUR CHARACTER. Throughout my gameplay i defended my dog with my life, in the end i walked with him in my arms, i didn't neglect him, he survived and that's all that mattered to me.

I was utterly disgusted with the end because nothing was explained to me of the consequinces of destroying effigies and totems, murdering people in Ellis's broken beyond repair PTSD. (LOGICALLY He wouldn't be allowed to volunteer or even participate in such government business as he would be a liability, As we saw from the game! BUT i digress, this is a GAME)

The game isn't SCARY, it's more disturbing and disorientating than actual jumpscares & your common horror gameplay, it's a deep psychological & immersive story, but unfortunately online guides will be required to achieve the ending you wish to see.

I felt destroying the things that upset Bullet would give a positive outcome, sadly i was wrong. 

My dog lived, i call that a Victory.

column8:
I wasn't going to write a review but the game ask us to write a review after we finish it.
If i knew it was based on a movie i would not even think about buying it.

Trailer is good, it makes you think this is a horror game and it will be awesome and mysterious thriller but it's nothing like that. I personally prefer watcing a movie instead of playing a game that has nothing of gaming elements and only walking through events like watching a movie.

No, this is not a good game.
No, this is not a horror game.
No, this is not a thriller.
Yes, this is my personal opinion.
Games like these, make me think that companies don't have any fantasy left in their mind to make an interesting story.

Good enviroment,good graphics,  but that's it, nothing special really.

column8: Tengo el problema de que al abrirlo se me queda en la pantalla de carga, que puedo hacer?

Phew! Am I GLAD it is over!! I just finished the game, and for the last hour only thing I was thinking, can't this be over already! The game is horrible!
Don't get me wrong, it is VERY well made game! The visuals especially. They did simulate the feeling of torture and ptsd's extremely well in this game. 

If you love jumpscares- this is for you. 
If you loved Blairwitch movies- this is for you.
If you love walking simulators with a horror twist- this is for you.
Go enjoy The Black Hills Forest.

column8:
[h1] Not even a scary walking simulator that cant decide what it wants to be. [/h1]

You might ask now: "But then why you gave it a positive rating?
‚Üí Simply because I enjoyed my Time. It's not that long and it kept my interest while not be the most innovative Game. But let me start from the beginning.

After playing the game for about 2+ hours it started to get rather stale. The game starts with a goal in mind but rather quickly drifts into other topics and mashes up elements of slender man, mental horror, slasher horror etc. to try to keep itself entertaining and fresh, but it makes you feel like your playing 5 different games at once.

The game itself is not the worst, it plays well despite lot of people saying it runs poorly. I myself found it running just fine without any noticeable issues besides a few fps drops here and there. the environment and graphics overall look decent and there are some smaller elements that really shine as a unique feature like the cellphone that includes games on it and i find this to be clever and unique element.

Pro Tip: Don't forget to play Snake on your cellphone lol.

The big problem of this game is its linear rather mundane story telling. All you really do is follow a dog around as it shows you the right path while solving simple puzzles and occasionally shining a light at potential danger to ward it off and that is really all it is. The game lacks any real potential of horror.

for 29,99$ I would say: HELL NAH BUDDY, but i would probably grab it on a sale for roundabout 10$ as it really does not offer anything new to the table of horror genres but is still an enjoyable ride once and only once.

I had fun. It is a lot of just walking around but a few chapters around the middle have you actually doing something. column8: Worst game I have ever played. It was beyond boring, there was no story, no action, or anything. it was just running around the woods doing boring stuff to get to some other place and having about 100 different flashbacks. I'm going to tell you the ending right now, the guy is literally just walking around a house in some kind of psych trip and then the game ends with him becoming the bad guy by killing the bad guy. Can't believe I paid full price for this. No setup of any horror elements. The main "demons" are just things that you point a flash light at and they go away......seriously. Don't buy this game if you value your time. It is such a waste of time.

column8: So boring ...

A great game to play, if you're into this genre (psychological/horror). 

Pros:
- Although the game isn't scary per se, it has a creepy atmosphere. There is the feeling of getting lost, as you wander into the woods. The game's graphics fully contribute to this. 
- Having a dog companion was a good idea (and the fact that he can help with the search, and you can pet him, give him a treat, etc).
- The recurring conversations between you and the sheriff through the walkie-talkie were nicely done.
- I liked how the flashbacks were introduced and sometimes blended with reality (especially the one where you run from one sand island to another, avoiding the "leaf monsters"). 

Cons:
- The last chapter was too long and got boring at times. 
- Looking back at the whole story, I expected a bit more (it felt somewhat unfinished).

column8:
It's very good and well made. Got fantastic art direction. Not just from a purely aesthetic stance, but there is a lot of great visual tricks that add a unique disorienting atmosphere to the game. The sound design follows this notion too. Overall it is an absolutely state of the art experience.

The story and sense of suspense is absolutely great. Very well managed, and even the high energy moments still manage to maintain the creepy atmosphere. The way the main character's distress from their mental ailments was extremely well implemented, and the subtle aspects of the story were never too on the nose.

Pacing was definitely an issue for me at some points, A few areas had this issue to a minor degree where they just felt like they went on for longer than the suspense actually held out. But there were two worst offenders very late in the game that really killed the suspense and pacing for me, and at crucial moments at that.

As for endings, I think it slipped. Without spoiling two much, there are two main endings, with a few smaller variations based on your actions. Don't feel bad for getting the "Bad" ending. It's actually kind of absurd what you have to do to prevent it. You literally have to avoid doing SO many things that the game is literally telling you to do.
I take issue with that, because you are basically forced into getting the bad ending if you go in blind. Your actions ultimately don't mean very much. When you've played through once, you can study online guides on how to uncover the exceptionally well hidden conditions for the standard "Good" ending. I think it would have been much better if a new player could lean either way based on their attitudes. Kind of like "Abe's Odyssey", in that game, there is a decent chance you could get the good or bad ending, just depending on how careless you are. This is very different though. But there is a Sub-ending, and those conditions were just right for me, and made perfect sense.

Mechanics wise, this game finds some really great ways to innovate, really playing into the mysterious time splitting nature of the game. The way that mental health factors into this does also feel really interesting. I feel they could have gone deeper with it by making more non-scripted aspects to the character's mental health, but this worked for me as a story driven game.

Price, wise, it has a fairly high price tag. If you plan on replaying it for all the secrets and achievements, you'll definitely get more out of it. But I do take issue with the idea that the Price you spend on a game is only worth it if you get x hours out of it, because the 4-5 hours you'll spend on one play-through, is VERY high quality moment to moment. A game could normally make you grind your hours away, but this game is totally just back to back, great moment to moment experiences that stand out and feel really powerful. It doesn't feel repetitive (Except for the mild exceptions I mentioned earlier). This is a game that will stick with me, and I will remember it. At the end of the day, that is worth the money, and it didn't have to get me to grind and replay content for hundreds of hours to prove that to me. If you like Strong story driven games, you should buy it.

Overall, really great. A few slip ups in terms of Story and Pacing, but it is ultimately a state of the art story experience. It is expensive, but it lives up to it's price tag, not in hours played, but as a high end, and extremely memorable story with some great innovation in terms of game design and stunning visuals that contends with the highest level.

column8:
Don't buy before sales! This game is worth max 5$!!

I wonder till now, how this game could have so much positive feedback at steam? Lack of games from Blair Witch universum? Dog? Forest? Idk. 

This game is horrible. Maybe not so much at beginning, but ending? I was so tired of walking inside of that damn house for infinite loops, that I almost quit the game. They didn't have time to put that miserable story before, so they did it in the end? Making this game looking even more stupid. Is it Blair Witch or PTSD simulator? Things totally not connected with Blair Witch. 

PROS:
- Blair Witch universum
- Dog (& interactions with him)
- Forest (it looks generaly good, but background color many times is bugged)

CONS:
- Boring walking simulator
- Infinite loops (walking 20x past same location, I got the idea of confusion but pls, ffs not that crap)
- Cheap story (at least that part about Ellis)
- Short 4/5h max (few more if you want to find all the things)
- Not scary at all
- Ultra bad jump scares 
- Many unused possibilities for the game to be a good horror
- Not a Horror game, even not more Psychological Horror
- Names of children sounds too much Eastern EU, like for US&A place
- Last chapter is a kind of misunderstanding, infinite loop in the house, explaining all the stories from before, because there was no possibility to do it before(?????), one BIG FAIL.

Short summary. I heard about Blair Witch, since I was a kid, and I really like to read stories, books and play games about it (sadly not many), and of course watching movies about it too. But that games, is  a huge disappointment, first because it don't focus on main story line, only at Ellis drama story, second it is not a horror game and third how you can make happy ending in Blair Witch universum?!?!?!?

column8:
I want to like this game. 

The idea is great, there are also creative ideas, music and graphics works good, even tho the graphics is sometimes too much on the effects and some props are getting into each other, but... it's not that big of a deal, but there are other problems with the game.

It starts promising, with the idea of searching a kid in the forest who went missing, and you quickly start notice the off things about the characters and the stories. There are creative scares and sometimes you are scared, even there are nothing on the map, just the forest... and it makes a scary enviroment. It works good... at first. Game builds it's fortress of success, one little brick to another, until around the 2/6-th of the game, it start add new things and make those too long or sometimes easily missable to progress in the story, but the worst when the devs except to understand certain things about the situation and they want you to do something exactly... which it makes no sense or you can't think with their heads. With these, the mid game will be annoying, because you will miss those important things or you won't understand the devs logic, and the late game will be tiring, because it will be overdone and too long to play with certain ideas.

I really want to like this game, but these problems make the experience bad. This is not a bad game, more like mediocre, but it had been executed wrongly in my opinion.

hace a√±os los juegos superaron a las peliculas causando terror, a dia de hoy solo los juegos de terror me asustan y puedo decir con total seguridad que Blair Witch es uno de los que mas me ha asustado, se podria criticar tal vez la corta durabilidad del titulo pero para lo que entrega esta perfecto para mi, corto y preciso

I'm looking for horror games. Enough to give me a good and proper spook, but not too much where it is unplayable. This game fits perfectly in that sweet spot. Bloober's Blair Witch is both atmospheric and engrossing, and over the course of two or so days, I reached the end. The story begins simple enough as a search and rescue for a missing boy, but soon devolves into a mission of survival, as the cursed woods warp reality... or, is it all in your head? 

There are a few jump scares, though the game does not use them often, and when it does, they are well executed.

One thing cool is how player death is handled, I havn't seen anything quite like it, though it is a minor detail overall, it does have lore implications.

I did have a few bugs where an item and an interaction did not spawn, but was easily fixed with a reload/restart.

column8:
Graphically great and atmospherically scary. Obviously taking inspiration from the 2016 movie version for the enemy models, which I have no problem with. Also quite cool that we don't (so far as I remember), see the actual witch, which shows loyalty to the original movie. 

I have no qualms with the whole psychological/conflict going on in the protagonist's head, and think it adds to what would be an otherwise one-dimensional plot, but I think it went a stage too far during the end scene in the house. I actually thought the tension and weather/rain effects upon entering the house were phenomenal, but the psychological scenes became dragged out.

On the whole, enjoyable game.

column8: I absolutely love this studio! Layers of Fear is my favorite horror game and this definitely holds up to their work. I'm not one for having to run and hide, this game has you sneak and it's about where you look, I really like that. It lets you feel fully scared without having the panic of "where do I go?!?" It's more just "oh my god, it's right in front of you." It also keeps up with the psychedelic aspect of the other games, especially when you get to the house. Nice story and great plot twist, this is a very good horror game!

column8: Great atmospherics but just too annoying gameplay.  I'm getting awards for treking around lost.   Exhausted my patience and moved on.  I'd go research the way forward and keep playing but then I'd have to endure more unrealistic dialog and voice acting.  That's the deal killer really, you can be looking around thinking, man, this is beautiful and scary (I work in MD) and then have a completely idiotic conversation which completely breaks the mood.  I'd only play further if I could find the rest of the stupid search party and beat them with my crappy flashlight.  And that dog needs more training.  A lot more.

So gerade durchgespielt und das Spiel fragt ein am Ende wirklich noch ob man ein Review bei Steam abgeben will.  Und ja was soll ich sagen? Ich habe ein Spiel rund um das Thema "Blair Witch" erwartet. Bekommen habe ich x beliebiges Horror Spiel was zwar hier und da seine Momente hat aber Blair Witch hat es wenig zu tun.  Ist das Spiel dadurch gleich schlecht? Nein es ist zwar kein 1A Horror Spiel (Layers of Fear gefiel mir besser) aber ich habe schon schlechteres gespielt.  Dennoch bleibe ich entt√§uscht zur√ºck.  Dazu kommt die Tatsache...das Spiel ist sau kurz (4-5 Stunden) und einige Spiel Elemente erinnern ein an Alan Wake *hust*   Die Story selber ist "ok" aber auch teils Konfus irgendwie.  

Kann ich das Spiel empfehlen? Wer hier wirklich ein Blair Witch Titel erwartet...nein. Das ist auch der Grund warum ich den Titel nicht empfehlen kann. Wen das egal ist der kann durchaus sein Spa√ü mit den Titel haben aber man sollte es im Sale nur kaufen. 

Fazit:
Schade Schade Schade...ich warte weiter auf ein w√ºrdiges Blair Witch Spiel.
If you like Horror games and really want to get a scare, this is your game.

column8:
No recomiendo que se compre este juego. Es un juego que me llam√≥ mucho la atenci√≥n por su tem√°tica. Pero todo cambi√≥ a la hora de empezar a jugar. 

Ha sido una experiencia completamente nefasta. Historia completamente desordenada y sin sentido. Desarrollo de personajes inexistente. Flashbacks de un trauma los cuales no tienen nada que ver con lo que se est√° contando en ese preciso momento.

B√°sicamente han juntado algo pasado con el presente. Sin venir a cuento.

Sobre la jugabilidad. No se pueden cambiar los controles. El perro no se calla, esta todo el juego ladrando y gimiendo. Varios bugs en el juego. El juego es completamente un simulador de apuntar con la linterna y decirle al perro por donde tengo que ir.

He de hacer un enfasis. En una gran parte del juego literalmente estas pasando por los mismos lugares una y otra y otra y otra y otra vez. Lo cual desemboca en frustraci√≥n y ganas completas de quitar el juego.

Al final, de los varios que tiene, entrelazan la historia pasada con lo que ocurre. Pero todo super forzado y la verdad, sin ningun sentido.

Starts very cool, but to be honest - get's annoying over time and towards the end it struggles not to get it's own parody for me even.

Graphics are great and the wood feels real at the beginning Just additional animals are missing for me somehow. Where are owls, wulfs, deers that make the noises that make you feel uncomfy in the real woods? Just some dead ones lying around sometimes...

Somehow that war stuff takes the authenticity away. I think the horror in blair witch works because of the real world setting - supported by VHS hand camera. Not because of wildest fantasies developing and blending into reality. The degree of that towards the ending feels like total randomness to me. Trapped in a movie that just won't end because it's so stretched - metropolis witch ^^

For people that don't know the other bloober team titles game might be interesting fx-wise - but here they just end in themselves for me at some point. PTBS - yeah - sickness caught well maybe - but who wants to be in that if it feels just like torture - but not in a good way ..

Was still worth the buy for me because of the first half hour where you just stroll through the dark woods without too much happening. That felt scary and close to blair witch to me at least

Get observer / layers of fear instead...

The story isn't very interesting and the gameplay is rather boring and repetitive. The end stretches eeeeeendlessly and it is virtually impossible to get the good ending on your first try. The game is set up in a way that you will first get the bad ending (you will pretty much trigger it in the first 10 minutes of your first run) and the conditions you must fulfill to get the good ending are rather ridiculous. Since the gameplay is so boring however the game doesn't have any replay value and the motivation to try to get the good ending is absent. Finally the game isn't very scary either. Definitely a VERY overrated game. 4/10 at most.

column8:
Big Plus: Cute doggo scenes : 3 

**********Heavy SPOILERS AHEAD, read at your own risk if you did not play the game yet**********

Walking Simulator with some good Jumpscares, good atmosphere, running around the forest hunting ghosts and a witch. Sometimes you feel lost in the environment, without twitch chat I would have been hardstucked several times, visual clues what to do next and where to go are often very minimal. 

It can be very tedious at times to actually figure out where to go next, or what to do *if* you want to proceed because map progression is hidden in a core mechanic which is not laid out clearly from the start. 

Personal story about main character, featuring posttraumatic stress disorder episodes, somehow forseeable in the long run, did not touch me mostly. Some generic "I cant cope with my times as a soldier" story blended into the Blair Witch/Forest scenario. 

Attention for fans about the Blair Witch mythos in general: this game does only feature small glimpses of the actual Blair Witch lore, most of the clues regarding the actual Witch and not the antagonist/protagonist WinkyFace are hidden in "read for yourself" scenes & documents, which is pretty sad. The last part of the game features the actual Witch House (?) as depicted in the original Blair Witch Project Movie of 1999. This part is pretty PogChamp as you finally get some "real" Blair experience. Wish this part would have been even longer, as it is by far the most impressive display of real horror elements combined with the Blair mythos in the game. Some very good jumpscares and clever game mechanics ahead. 

If the devs actually released a DLC that focussed more on the actual Blair Witch Lore this game has potential for a damn good 10 out of 10 horror game. In the current state its a good 7 out of 10. Big minus points for the topic focussed around the main character as its somewhat boring. Also BIG Minus for the doggo scene. If you can grab the game for less than 20 bucks its a very good deal for 6-8 hours of entertainment and some relpay value, if you know what you are looking for.

column8:
I'm 2/3rds of the way through Blair Witch. I tried giving it the benefit of the doubt however this game is simply annoying and boring. This might be the first Bloober release that I stop playing before the end. I should note I usually love horror games even ones considered "walking sims."

Most of the game is chasing/following your dog, Bullet, through endless loops in a dark spooky forest. I kept getting stuck in a loop not sure what event would cause the game to progress. In addition there are "battles" where you have to point your flashlight at the spooky branch monster otherwise you die. These didn't add any element of scariness to the game, instead they were cheesy and felt like a chore. The protagonist also has PTSD flashbacks that felt cliche and had nothing to do with Blair Witch lore. The video camera/VHS aspect was kinda cool but the fact that you have to interact with the camera at certain places in order to progress could've been omitted. Bloober seems intent on preventing natural gameplay progress with pointless obstacles in attempt to make the game somehow relate to the movie. 

I encountered a bug where I was supposed to put a fuse in a fusebox to turn on some lights but I was unable to interact with the fuse box and the fuse was missing from the it's location. I had to reload an earlier save to progress in the game. This is a pretty common bug (of many). 

I kept thinking "when does this game get good," and if it's not good more than halfway through you've lost me. Other reviews say the ending of the game is even worse, though I wonder how that's even possible. Sorry Bloober team, I loved your other games but I can't recommend this one. 

TLDR: Unless you really like petting virtual dogs, running around dark spooky forests in a loop, or are obsessed with Blair Witch lore you'd be better off avoiding this game and buying one of Bloober team's better releases.

column8: INCREIBLEMENTE INCREIBLE

O jogo pega as melhores partes de Silent Hill, Outlast e Alan Wake, e junta tudo criando um dos melhores games de terror que j√° joguei. Ele consegue transmitir o mesmo sentimento do filme original de 1999, ou seja muito medo, [spoiler] no final quando vamos para a casa foi um dos momentos mais assustadores que tive em um jogo de terror. [/spoiler]
A maior diferen√ßa dele comparada com outros jogos de terror em primeira pessoa, √© o fato de termos companhia praticamente o tempo todo, do nosso querido e fiel Bullet, gra√ßas a ele fica mais f√°cil encarar o clima de terror e seguir em frente, em pouco tempo de jogo j√° ficamos apegados a ele, querendo cuidar dele o tempo todo.
Quanto a historia ela √© √≥tima, nos prende do come√ßo ao fim, cada vez mais nos deixando intrigados para descobrir a verdade e o que esta acontecendo naquela floresta.

Recensione scritta per Nerdream.it https://www.nerdream.it/2020/09/02/blair-witch-recensione-pc-ps4-xbox-one-switch/

Ho recuperato grazie al Game Pass di Xbox per PC acquistato ad 1 euro, un titolo che gi√† avevo su Steam, sto parlando di Blair Witch, titolo del team polacco Bloober Team gi√† conosciuti per Layers of Fear e Observer. Questo omaggio ai film da parte del team polacco, parla di Ellis, un ex agente di polizia devastato dai sensi di colpa che per pareggiare i conti col passato decide di partecipare alle ricerche di un bambino scomparso, Peter Shannon. ATTENZIONE SPORADICI SPOILER SULLA TRAMA.

Ho giocato questo Blair Witch di sera molto tardi al buio e con le cuffie, vi assicuro che ogni piccolo suono naturale che ci si pu√≤ aspettare passeggiando per i boschi, sia di giorno che di notte, √® stato qualcosa di veramente realistico. Di notte poi, la sensazione costante di non essere mai soli, di essere osservati, seguiti, ogni piccolissimo rumore amplificato, insomma ho giocato questo titolo con l‚Äôansia costante che stesse per succedere qualcosa.

Come detto questa √® la storia di Ellis, ex agente di polizia che in passato ha commesso pi√π di un errore, non solo in servizio, ma anche durante la guerra del golfo (l‚Äôho capito a titolo finito, ops!), infatti durante la lunga passeggiata nel bosco in compagnia di Bullet, un pastore belga addestrato, con un passato nell‚Äôunit√† cinofila, il nostro protagonista ha frequenti flashback su diversi momenti del suo turbolento passato.

Gli strumenti che ci accompagnano durante la storia, oltre al fedele Bullet, sono una torcia per illuminare il cammino durante le notti, un cellulare con cui Ellis comunica con l‚Äôex moglie Jess, un walkie talkie per tenersi in contatto con la squadra di ricerca e una telecamera.

Bullet √® senza ombra di dubbio l‚Äôancora di salvezza di Ellis, infatti sin dall‚Äôinizio ci viene indicato dal gioco stesso di non allontanarci mai troppo dal nostro fedele amico se non vogliamo compromettere la sanit√† mentale del protagonista. Al nostro fedele amico possono essere impartiti diversi ordini tra cui: cerca, vieni qui, ecc.ecc. ma lo si pu√≤ anche rimproverare, o si pu√≤ premiarlo con un biscotto e un po‚Äô di sane coccole.

Il cellulare invece ci √® servito a comunicare con l‚Äôex moglie di Ellis, Jess, e a ricevere messaggi anche quando non c‚Äôera segnale, per un susseguirsi di eventi che non vi spiego nel dettaglio perch√® altrimenti vi levo la curiosit√† di giocarlo se mai ne aveste voglia!

Il walkie talkie ci ha tenuto in contatto fino ad un certo punto della storia con la squadra di ricerca del piccolo Peter, mentre la torcia ovviamente ci ha tenuti al ‚Äúsicuro‚Äù di notte.

La telecamera invece mi √® servita con le cassette di colore rosso che ho trovato sparse durante il gioco. Quelle di questo colore hanno infatti la particolarit√† (strana!) che nel riavvolgere il nastro ci consentono di manipolare il tempo! Mettendole in pausa ad esempio, in un determinato punto, ci permettono di aprire una porta chiusa, di alzare un tronco caduto che ci ostruisce il passaggio, e cos√¨ via. 

Nonostante il contesto suggestivo, con i suoni perfettamente ricreati, in un ambiente come il bosco riescono a trasmettere quel senso di smarrimento, ansia e incertezza ad ogni passo, la storia sul finale perde secondo me tanti punti.

Ovviamente come mi aspettavo questa √® una storia cupa, un percorso psicologico che invece di rendere il nostro Ellis libero da ogni senso di colpa che si porta dietro ormai da tempo, lo trascina sempre di pi√π in un turbine di pazzia dilagante, risucchiandolo in un vortice che finisce per farlo sprofondare in un‚Äôabisso senza ritorno.

Ho apprezzato molto la storia di base di questo titolo, avendo giocato sia Layers of Fear che Observer mi aspettavo tutto quello che √® successo, mi aspettavo che uscisse fuori la pazzia, che si andasse a scavare in profondit√† nella mente di un‚Äôuomo finito, distrutto dai terribili sensi di colpa, con un disturbo post traumatico, di conseguenza inaffidabile, fragile e disorientato.

Quello che mi ha un po‚Äô deluso e non mi aspettavo invece √® il finale, che si svolge tutto in una vecchia casa che continua a cambiare, un po‚Äô come le scale in Harry Potter (‚Äúalle scale piace cambiare‚Äù cit.), troppo lungo, tedioso fare e rifare lo stesso percorso anche se ad ogni passaggio la casa cambia, sicuramente quella parte va a sottolineare il punto di non ritorno di Ellis, la pazzia che prende il sopravvento e spegne ogni speranza di redenzione, allontanandolo dalla realt√† ad ogni passaggio. In ogni caso andava decisamente accorciata.

Brutti anche i bug che ho visto quando Bullet si metteva a cuccia con il tronco degli alberelli pi√π piccoli che compenetravano il cane.

Il titolo non mi √® dispiaciuto, perch√® ripeto, giocato in cuffia di notte al buio l‚Äôansia con tutti i suoni presenti nel bosco, ma anche nella casa (dove la pseudo strega si √® materializzata in un certo senso), mi hanno fatta giocare con una certa tensione, che in determinati momenti √® sfociata in veri e propri coccoloni da paura! Peccato per il finale troppo lungo e tedioso, girellare in una casa che cambia come le scale di HP per allungare un brodo che poteva sicuramente essere evitato e per i bug di compenetrazione che lo penalizzano un po‚Äô, ma nonostante tutto ve lo consiglio, magari lo potete recuperare con il Game Pass per PC a 1 euro per il primo mese, oppure acquistatelo su Steam.

column8:
I honestly can't say I would recommend this. It's fine, i guess, but boring. The scenery is a bit dull and they try to cover that up by showing very little of it. It left me with little to no desire to explore, which is usually my favorite part of a game. The story is the biggest draw, but it is so on rails and drip fed that it just isn't worth it. I knew very early on in the game how it would end, and boy, did we crawl all the way to that ending. The very worst part was the last...hour or so. I was so ready for it to be over, to finally "reveal" the "surprise" ending we had been slogging towards, only to find out I had to spend what felt like an eternity wandering around the same house again and again and again while the incredibly dense protagonist to catch up. The other strike against it was that I have never cared less about a main character in my life. A violent soldier turned into a violent and bad-at-his-job cop (who is emotionally abusive to his partner, because cop/veteran i guess) is suffering because of his own violent actions and poor decision-making? So sad. Honestly, if the first time he tripped in the woods and fell down a ravine had been followed by the camera panning out to reveal he had died, would have been fine. Maybe I could have played the rest of the game as the dog, who was the best part of the game. 
Anyway; I feel bad, because I can tell someone put a lot of work into this game, and it had a few concepts that were neat (camera being used to manipulate the world and see hidden things), but there was just not enough of it and I was just so very, very bored. Like reading comics any time a cinematic happened and deciding to finish that instead of get back to plating when it was done kind of bored.

column8:
I'll preface by saying, if the games on sale for the $7.50 I got it for, you might as well try it. 

That being said, the game is not even remotely worth the normal $30 asking price. I'm actually shocked by the amount of good reviews. The game is a walking simulator. There's no open world exploration aspect to it, you stick to a pretty linear route, and because of that the game's only about 6 hours long. No 6 hour game should ever charge $30. Saddest thing is probably 30-60 min of that is made up of endless loop areas where you simply have to keep moving at a snails pace until the game lets you advance. This does NOTHING to help the mood of the game and ruins any slight tension that may have built; twice I had to walk away from my PC in the middle of these parts just to break the monotony because I was bored out of my mind.

There's not many scares, there's not a good story, there's not even a mention of the Blair Witch through 99% of the game, so the game being titled that is pretty much 'clickbait' so-to-speak to try and lure in horror fans to buy this over other similar games available that are even more creepy and fun. Like I said, if the game is super discounted to $7 or below again, you might as well try since even if you dislike it like I did, you didn't waste too much money... but there's no way in a million years I could recommend this slow, short game for $30.

Amazing dark and creepy game. Finally a pc game about Blair Witch. The game has the scaryness from the movies. The mindfck, the fear, the horror. Simply walking in a dark forest. With your dog Bullet as a guide. Basic, but very effective. Imagine it to be real with all the noises and darkness. Finding you way. With the witches, a PTSD, a kidnapping and so on. All in the dark. Blair Witch is a classic horror concept. Aside the amazing movies with its own stories, this game has its own interesting story. The whole concept is disturbing, interesting and frightening. It leaves room for your own interpretation. For some the game might feel like slow, or boring. You need patience, finding and looking your way out, or going further. Find the tapes, have your flashlight and Bullet ready.  Its the way this game is built. It may not be for everyone. This game is for the true horror fans.  It tells all about PTSD, fear, mindcontrol, magic and ghosts. The Blair Witch!!

column8:
Really well done story. Some excellent jump scares, and real WTF moments. Very much enjoyed my first play through, and I can tell there is still a lot more to discover with the multiple endings alluded to by the achievements.

My only one criticism, is that late in the story it felt like some parts went on almost too long. I understand the game play & story mechanic they were going for but a couple moments still felt like a movie I was waiting on to get to the point.

Overall, as a huge fan of the original film, I believe this is an excellent take on a new story set in the Blair Witch universe.

Very well made game. It played nicely on my potato.

Pros :

1)Nice atmosphere
2)Good pace of events
3)Cryptic with a good reason
4)Although it has its fair share of jumpscares, it does not rely on them to build tension

Cons :

1)Relatively short
2)Visual effects can become annoying sometimes

Conclusion :
Buy this game if you like atmospheric horror games. Due to its short gameplay, i wouldn't recommend a full price, but definitely take it on sales.

GREAT GAME! no bugs, great framerate. I compliment you on a fine production! 10 outa 10

This is a horror game base on many other ones that defined this generation. It is a first person horror with interesting puzzles. The graphics and the atmosphere are the highlights of the game. I like very much how everything is done and the dog interactions. The story is a bit clich√© though, i know the game has multiple endings but i already saw this kind of plot in many other horror psychological games. Some parts of the game tend to be tedious because developers extend too long what the player have to do. Even with this minor flaws i find the game good and interesting enough to recommend it for people who like horror games. Had an overall good time playing this.
